description: Television networks love theme nights  crime-time Tuesdays, comedy Thursdays, cartoon Sundays. Beginning this week, the cable channel A&E joins the fun by packaging one of TVs most popular genres into serial-killer Mondays.

title: Russias Aggression
description: There was a lot to criticize about the way President Viktor Yanukovychs government was thrown out in Ukraine and hurriedly replaced with an interim team. The victorious opposition should have known how critical it was to reassure all groups in that country that their rights would be respected in any new order; instead, one of the Parliaments first actions was to abolish a law that ensured a legal status for Russian and other minority languages, thus raising fears among Russian speakers that Ukrainian nationalists were taking over.

title: In a Decadent Vienna, Constancy Is Shown the Doors
description: So many doors, each opening on to what God only knows. What do you think is behind, say, this one, with the grill? A treat or a trick? A lady or a tiger? Mercy or mortality?

title: Swan Song Scripted for Two
description: When dancers retire, most are still young, with much of their working lives only then beginning. Janie Taylor and Sbastien Marcovici, husband and wife, gave their farewell performance together on Saturday with New York City Ballet and have careers ahead of them. She is already a costume designer; on Thursday and Friday, performances by Tom Gold Dance will feature new costumes by her. He is becoming a ballet master with L.A. Dance Project. And yet from now on, many people will think of them as figures from the past, remembered chiefly from the lives they led onstage in City Ballets repertory.

title: The Philharmonic and Friends Go for a Ride in the Country
description: The New York Philharmonic is no honky-tonk band. On paper, that might make it an odd partner for Mary Chapin Carpenter, the singer and songwriter who won country music Grammys every year from 1992 to 1995, and who sang with the orchestra on Friday night at Avery Fisher Hall, in a concert repeated Saturday. But Ms. Carpenter has long since left behind the demands of country radio to write quiet, thoughtful songs that seek transcendence in the everyday.

title: Ukrainian Activists Work to Counter Russian Narrative on Social Networks
description: Faced with what they call misleading reports on Russian state television that ethnic-nationalist violence is sweeping Ukraine, Internet-savvy Ukrainian activists drew attention on Sunday to video and images posted online that showed street protests in support of the new government in Kiev, and acts of violence instigated by men waving the Russian flag.

title: Diana Ross to Lead Montreal Festival Lineup
description: Diana Ross will headline the 35th annual Montreal Jazz Festival this summer along with the singer-songwriters Rufus Wainwright and Bobby McFerrin and the Canadian crooner Michael Bubl. It will be Ms. Rosss first appearance at the festival, and in addition to performing, she will be the recipient of the Ella Fitzgerald Award, which celebrates the repertory, range and versatility of international jazz singers. Other acts include the pianist  Alain Lefvre, who will be accompanied by the Montreal Symphony Orchestra; and the singer-songwriter  Ben Harper with the blues harmonica player Charlie Musselwhite. The festival is to be held from June 26 to July 6. For a full lineup: montrealjazzfest.com.

title: Taliban Move Brings Halt to Airstrikes in Pakistan
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The Pakistani government on Sunday suspended its airstrike campaign against militants in the countrys northwestern tribal regions in response to a Taliban cease-fire, raising the prospect that peace talks between the two sides will be revived.

description: The chief creative officer of Pixar and Walt Disney Animation Studios discusses the Oscar-nominated film "Frozen."

title: Tibets Enduring Defiance
description: On Feb. 27, 2009, three days into the Tibetan New Year, a 24-year-old monk in his crimson and yellow robe emerged from the confines of the Kirti Monastery into the streets of Ngawa, in a the Tibetan area of southwestern China. There, in the shadow of a 98-foot-tall monument to the gods of longevity, the man burst into flames  thus sparking the first of many self-immolations that spread across the Tibetan regions of China.

title: Archie Comic Picks Film and TV Writer for Top Creative Post
description: The playwright Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa is adding a feather to his cap: chief creative officer of Archie Comic Publications. Mr. Aguirre-Sacasa, who has also written for film and television, will be working closely with the Archie team in Mamaroneck, N.Y., to figure out the best way to exploit the companys characters in comics, of course, but also in other media.

The Seattle Mariners, in need of a hitter, had picked up Jesus Montero, the Yankees top prospect at the time, who many felt was a certain All-Star. The Yankees received Michael Pineda, a big, hard-throwing starting pitcher who had made the All-Star team as a rookie in 2011.

title: Foreign Buyers Eyeing Forbes Magazine, a Chronicler of the Worlds Wealthiest
description: Growing up in the Midwest, my idea of rich was my dentist, who lived a few blocks away and had a split-level that was bigger than the rest of ours and a Cadillac in the driveway. Then I saw a copy of Forbes in his office and realized there was a different sort of wealth, a gossamer existence beyond my wildest imaginings.

title: A Reprieve for Bristol Bay
description: The Obama administration announced on Friday that it was putting the brakes on a massive gold and copper mine proposed for the headwaters of Alaskas Bristol Bay while it decides whether to prohibit it permanently. This sounds like the death knell for a project, known as the Pebble Mine, that by any measure is an environmental disaster waiting to happen. The mine would gravely threaten one of the richest salmon fisheries in the world and disrupt a delicate marine environment prized by conservationists, native tribes and commercial fishing interests alike.

title: After One Spouse Loses a Job, Finding a New Balance in a Marriage
description: Eliza Stoker breezed in from the office that evening in September, ready for a drink and a quiet dinner. Then she saw her husband slumped on the couch and she knew. She could see it in his face. She could feel it in the air.

title: Ultra-Orthodox Jews Clog Jerusalem Streets to Protest a Draft Bill
description: JERUSALEM  In a formidable show of force, at least 300,000 ultra-Orthodox Jewish men flooded the streets around the main entrance to Jerusalem on Sunday, bringing much of the city to a standstill with a protest against a government plan that aims to conscript more of their numbers for military service and holds out the threat of arrest for religious draft dodgers.

title: Tiny Digital Publisher to Put Newsweek Back in Print
description: The Graham family, longtime newspaper publishers, gave up and sold it for a dollar. The media mogul Barry Diller spent tens of millions trying to revive it, only to throw in the towel. Even Mr. Dillers star editor, Tina Brown, could not stop it from going out of print.

description: ATLANTA  The young man, weighed down by luggage and despair, was a first-time flier on his way to a funeral in Detroit. His fathers.

description: Set in the not-too-distant future, Spike Jonzes film Her explores the romantic relationship between Samantha, a computer program, and Theodore Twombly, a human being. Though Samantha is not human, she feels the pangs of heartbreak, intermittently longs for a body and is bewildered by her own evolution. She has a rich inner life, complete with experiences and sensations.

title: The Mets Future Strikes a Presence
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Early in spring training, as several pitchers lined up to throw bullpen sessions, the Mets top officials and several reporters all had their eyes on one in particular. At 6 feet 6 inches, 240 pounds, Noah Syndergaard stood out.

description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putin has left little doubt he intends to cripple Ukraines new government, forcing it to make concessions or face the de facto partition of areas populated predominantly by ethnic Russians, from the Crimea to Odessa to the industrial heartland in the east.

title: Military Sex Assault Trial Showcases 2 Approaches to Prosecution
description: As one major battle over sexual assault in the military plays out in North Carolina this week, another is set to unfold in Washington.

It was well after midnight, and Ms. Massenet, the founder of Net-a-Porter, was celebrating her companys new magazine, Porter.

title: McIlroy Falters, Woods Exits, and Henley Triumphs in Playoff
description: PALM BEACH GARDENS, Fla.  The Champions layout at PGA National is 7,140 yards of venom, a king cobra of a course that rises without warning to strike down the worlds best golfers. Snake charmers may have a better chance of taming it than the players at the Honda Classic.

title: Chips Ahoy! Campaign Brings Back a Familiar (Chocolate-Chipped) Face
description: EXECUTIVES at Mondelez International, encouraged by the response to ads introduced last spring for their flagship cookie, Oreo, are turning their attention to the companys, and countrys, No. 2 cookie in sales, Chips Ahoy!

description: WASHINGTON  As Russia dispatched more forces and tightened its grip on the Crimean Peninsula on Sunday, President Obama embarked on a strategy intended to isolate Moscow and prevent it from seizing more Ukrainian territory even as he was pressured at home to respond more forcefully.

description: This year, it's a horse race for the best foreign language Oscar. Most of the nominated films have not be widely seen and even late in the season, there was still not a clear favorite.

title: Action by Russia Divides Immigrants in New York
description: The confrontation between Russia and Ukraine reverberated on Sunday through New York Citys tight-knit ethnic enclaves, from southern Brooklyn to the pulpits of Ukrainian church services in the East Village to the Russian consulate on the Upper East Side, where protesters shouted their opposition to Russias military involvement in Ukraine at the four-story buildings drawn curtains and silent stone.

title: Frustrated With the Pace of Change, Rioters Storm Parliament Building in Libya
description: CAIRO  Dozens of armed rioters stormed into the Libyan Parliament in Tripoli on Sunday, setting fire to the grounds, looting furniture and wounding a prominent lawmaker in a spasm of anger at the clotted and chaotic transition after the ouster of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi.

title: Driven to Set a Record: Zero to 60, Plus 940

description: The year's best picture is one of the few places where David Carr and A.O. Scott differ in their picks. They present their cases for "Gravity" and "American Hustle."

title: With N.C.A.A.s Hands-Off Rule Change, Offenses Get More Room to Maneuver
description: When Duke point guard Quinn Cook bent at the waist and prepared to dribble against a Georgia Tech defender, there was something astonishing about the scene near the top of the key.

title: Home Fires Are Burning Out
description: An Army wife sings herself to the brink of a nervous breakdown in Arlington, a musical for solo voice and piano that opened on Sunday night at the Vineyard Theater. With book and lyrics by Victor Lodato, and music by Polly Pen, the show lasts just an hour as it charts the restless wandering of the heroines mind as she muses lightly on her past and more darkly on the war and its impact on her husband. But the long day of Sara Jane, flawlessly portrayed by the gifted singer Alexandra Silber, translates into a pretty long hour for the audience.

title: Theyre Carrying On as if Its in the Script
description: When I kissed you just now, did it feel like an actor kissing an actor or a person kissing a person? asks the heroine of Stage Kiss, Sarah Ruhls daffy comedy about the emotional pitfalls of the acting life. Because Ive kissed you so many times over the last few weeks, Im starting to not know the difference.

title: Sculpture of Paradox: Doctor as Hero and Villain
description: Along the upper reaches of Central Park, a half-dozen high school students walked south on Fifth Avenue, their shoulders hunched against the bitter cold. Dodging the wind and chunks of frozen snow, Ely Gonzalez stopped at 103rd Street, held up his phone and took a quick snapshot of a larger-than-life statue honoring James Marion Sims.

title: High-Interest Web Banks on the Rise in China
description: SHANGHAI  Last June, an affiliate of the Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba made an offer to its hundreds of millions of users: Give us your cash, and we will pay more than Chinese banks will.

description: CORAM, N.Y.  The story unfolds roughly the same way each time: A Latino immigrant is driving a car with out-of-state license plates, and a police officer pulls him over and asks for his drivers license.

title: In Crimeas Phantom War, Armed Men Face Unseen Foe
description: BALAKLAVA, Ukraine  Oleg and Irina Shevtsov, a proudly patriotic Russian couple, took their three young children on an outing Sunday morning to admire a long column of Russian troops and armor that, a day earlier, had secured their Crimean towns dusty main street. By the time the family got there, however, the Russians had all vanished, disappearing as quickly and mysteriously as they had appeared.

title: Ex-Clinton Aide Is Named Microsofts Chief Strategy Officer
description: SEATTLE  In the biggest shuffling of Microsofts executive ranks since the companys new chief executive, Satya Nadella, took over, Mark Penn, the former aide to the Clinton family, is becoming the companys chief strategy officer.

title: Democrats Try Wooing Ones Who Got Away: White Men
description: ROYAL OAK, Mich.  Frank Houston knows something about the longtime estrangement of white men from the Democratic Party. His family roots are in nearby Macomb County, the symbolic home of working-class Reagan Democrats who, distressed by economic and social tumult, decided a liberal Democratic Party had left them, not the other way around.

title: Deadly Attacks Tied to Islamist Militants Shake Nigeria
description: LAGOS, Nigeria  Dozens were killed, including many children watching a soccer match, in a series of deadly bomb blasts in the northern Nigerian city of Maiduguri on Saturday, officials said. The Islamist group Boko Haram was blamed for the attacks, which were the deadliest in months in the sects birthplace.

title: Paterson Is Praised as Portrait Is Unveiled
description: ALBANY  When former Gov. David A. Paterson invited one of his former aides to attend the hanging of his portrait at the Capitol, he offered a warning.

title: Rangers Fall to 3rd in Division and Brace for Trade Deadline
description: With a shaky performance on his 32nd birthday, Rangers goaltender Henrik Lundqvist endured his second defeat in two games since returning from the Sochi Olympics, a 6-3 loss to the Boston Bruins on Sunday at Madison Square Garden.

title: Jitters and Jeweled Armor on a Blessedly Dry Carpet
description: They sent over a raincoat yesterday! the E! host Ryan Seacrest said, referring to the luxury London house Burberry, which had also furnished his custard cream (a more luscious way of saying off-white) tuxedo. But that particular branding opportunity  yes, some still exist  was not to materialize on the red carpet, nor, alas, would there be any Cherbourg-esque display of colorful umbrellas. The sky above the Hollywood & Highland Center had efficiently cleared on Sunday, and the actresses would be free to bare their backs, breasts, shoulders and midriffs, if not yet their souls.

title: Popular Demand
description: Seven of the top 10 magazines so far this year are fashion titles. Interest peaks as Fashion Week progresses across the globe  it began in New York on Feb. 6 before moving to London and Milan.

title: News From the Advertising Industry
description: Accounts

title: North Korean Officials Expel Elderly Australian Evangelist
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea on Monday said it had decided to expel an Australian Christian missionary it arrested last month after he apologized for violating North Korean laws.

title: The Twitter-Centric Oscars
description: While the Academy Awards have traditionally been a movies show, this year, says David Carr and A.O. Scott, Oscars producers have made a television show using social media and an engaging host.

title: A Dilemma for Doctors
description: Complying with the mandates of the Affordable Care Act is a daunting task for many private practice physicians, and it is pushing some to go work for hospital systems.

title: New Laws Demands on Doctors Have Many Seeking a Network
description: TAYLORSVILLE, Ky.  Dr. Sven Jonsson, a primary care physician in this rural community, is seeing a steady tide of new patients under President Obamas health care law, the Affordable Care Act. And so far, it is working out for him. His employer, a big hospital system, provides expensive equipment, takes care of bureaucratic chores and has buffered him from the turmoil of his rapidly changing business.

title: Reviving a Rivalry, After Years on Ice
description: BARRYTOWN, N.Y.  The occasion called for Champagne on ice.

title: Lupita Nyong'o Wins Supporting Actress
description: After the grind of her first Oscar season, Lupita Nyongo won an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress. It wasnt a surprise for David Carr or A. O. Scott, but that doesnt mean its not cool.

title: Times Minute | Obama's Crimea Options
description: Also on the Minute, the Oscar Pistorius "trial of the century" begins and Samba as a form of therapy in Rio.

title: Who Will Win Best Picture?
description: Gravity has won many of the technical awards this evening, but will that translate to a win for best picture?

title: Photo Replay: Feb. 24-March 2
description: Training ground scenes: preparing for competition can offer interesting perspectives.

title: A Dessert That Tastes Like Home
description: Claudia Berroa grew up eating her grandmothers flan in Peru, an ethereal blend of eggs, sugar, and milk that was stirred by hand over a stove for hours.

title: Times Minute | Obamas Crimea Options
description: In the Video

title: Infant Sleep Machines at Maximum Volume Reported as Hearing Risk
description: Devices that produce soothing sounds in order to lull infants to sleep can be loud enough at maximum volume to damage their hearing, researchers reported Monday.

title: Documents Released on U.S. Wiretapping Since Sept. 11 Terrorist Attacks
description: WASHINGTON  Orders granted by the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court to allow the use of devices to secretly log the communications of suspected spies and terrorists underwent explosive growth after the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks, but leveled off and began dropping around the middle of the last decade, newly disclosed documents show.

title: The Perils of Toughing It Out
description: Into every life, a little pain must fall.

title: Trusting the Sharing Economy to Regulate Itself
description: Arun Sundararajan is a professor and NEC Faculty Fellow in the Stern School of Business at New York University,where his research studies how digital technologies transform business and society. His research has been supported by organizations that include Google, IBM, Microsoft and Yahoo.

title: E.P.A. Set to Reveal Tough New Sulfur Emissions Rule
description: WASHINGTON  The Environmental Protection Agency plans to unveil a major new regulation on Monday that forces oil refiners to strip out sulfur, a smog-forming pollutant linked to respiratory disease, from American gasoline blends, according to people familiar with the agencys plans.

title: New All-Digital Curriculums Hope to Ride High-Tech Push in Schoolrooms
description: English language curriculums built entirely on a digital platform  replacing written textbooks, worksheets or printed study guides  are about to enter the market from several companies, with promises that they will change the nature of classroom learning across the country.

title: Word of the Day | sate
description: sate \sat, sat\ verb

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 2, 2014
Eddie OBrien, Who Played for Pirates With His Twin, Dies at 83
description: Eddie OBrien and his twin, Johnny, were basketball and baseball stars at St. Marys High School in South Amboy, N.J., but when they graduated in 1948, their athletic careers seemed to be over. They were only 5 feet 9 inches tall, and no college program wanted them.

title: Whats on Monday
description: 6 P.M. (AMC) ROCKY (1976) Its all Rocky all night long, starting with this Oscar winner for best picture, written by and starring Sylvester Stallone (below) as Rocky Balboa, an amateur boxer in Philadelphia who gets a shot at fighting Apollo Creed (Carl Weathers), the world heavyweight champion. Rocky II (1979), in which Apollo seeks a rematch, follows at 8; Rocky III (1982), in which Rocky defends his title against the zealous Clubber Lang (Mr. T), at 11; Rocky IV (1985), in which he goes up against a Soviet boxer named Drago (Dolph Lundgren), at 1:30 a.m.; and Rocky V (1990), in which the former champion, now brain-damaged and broke, shows a young boxer (Tommy Morrison) the ways of the ring, at 3:30.

title: Staking a Claim on Social Causes
description: 12 Years a Slave won best picture, but for much of the evening, it was gay rights, not race, that held Hollywoods attention at the Oscars. Jared Leto dragged the real world into Sunday nights celebration of make-believe. After winning the best supporting actor for portraying a transgender AIDS patient in Dallas Buyers Club, Mr. Leto voiced support for protesters in Ukraine and Venezuela. He championed gay people. To those of you out there who have ever felt injustice because of who you are or who you love, tonight, I stand here in front of the world with you and for you. Hollywood is so righteous, suddenly, about gay rights, and thats a little puzzling because for so long, movies were part of the problem. Professional basketball has its first openly gay player, Jason Collins, but its still hard to think of romantic leads  male or female  who are A-list Hollywood movie stars and also openly gay.

title: The 86th Academy Awards
description: Gravity dominated the awards, winning seven Oscars, but 12 Years a Slave was named best picture.

title: Backstage at the 2014 Oscars
description: A look behind the scenes at the 86th Academy Awards.

title: Tennent H. Bagley, Who Aided, Then Mistrusted a Soviet Spy, Dies at 88
description: Tennent H. Bagley, a former C.I.A. officer who helped a mysterious Soviet spy betray his country, then tried for a half-century to prove that the defector was actually a Russian double agent, died on Feb. 20 at his home in Brussels. He was 88.

title: Oscars 2014: List of Winners
description: Best Picture 12 Years a Slave

title: Ralph Bahna, Travel Industry Innovator in Air and on Sea, Dies at 71
description: Ralph M. Bahna, who is credited with creating one of the first luxury business-class services on a major airline and later became chairman of Priceline.com, died on Feb. 24 in Manhattan. He was 71.

title: U.N. Security Council Condemns Terrorist Attack in Kunming
description: The United Nations Security Council has condemned as a terrorist attack the slashing rampage Saturday night in a train station in the southwestern city of Kunming, in which a group of black-clad assailants with knives and daggers killed at least 29 people and wounded 143. Hong Kong news outlets said about 75 of those may be severely injured.

title: No Great Surprises for Oscar Night
description: There were no big Oscar surprises, but this years Academy Awards show featured an engaging host and a best picture winner that even a critic can love.

title: Witness in Pistorius Trial Tells of Screams and Gunshots
description: PRETORIA, South Africa  The trial of Oscar Pistorius on murder charges began Monday, with a neighbor of the South African double-amputee track star saying that she heard bloodcurdling screams shortly before Mr. Pistoriuss girlfriend was shot and killed.

title: Fatal Attack Rattles Court Complex in Pakistani Capital
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  In a rare strike in the heart of Pakistans capital, Islamabad, militants killed at least 11 people at the district court complex on Monday, shaking the government just as prospects for talks with the Taliban seemed to be improving.

title: Report People From Xinjiang, Police Say After Deadly Attack
description: Chinese citizens should report any people from Xinjiang in their midst, reads a notice issued by a local police office on Sunday, a day after an attack in which knife-wielding assailants the government says were terrorists from the far western region of Xinjiang killed at least 29 people and wounded 143.

title: Do You Ever Eavesdrop?
description: We watch movies, read books and listen to music to take a break from our own lives and enter another world. But sometimes a quick escape is just within easy earshot.

title: Where Lush Beauty Conceals Dread
description: There was a moment, soon after  Andrea Bruce began photographing the widows of Indian farmers last fall, when she sensed the quiet menace that would become her main subject.

title: War Deaths Top 13,000 in Afghan Security Forces
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  More than 13,000 Afghan soldiers and police officers have been killed during the war here, far more than previously known, according to Afghan government statistics.

title: Hong Kong Businessman Found Guilty of Money Laundering
description: HONG KONG  A former Hong Kong hairstylist whose rapid rise to wealth culminated in the takeover of the British soccer team Birmingham City was convicted on Monday of five counts in the laundering of a total of nearly $100 million from entities including casinos and people the authorities have described as gang members.

title: New York Today: Slightly Snowy
description: Good Monday morning to you.

title: Video Said to Be of Kunming Attack Aftermath Appears Online
description: Video emerged on Youku, the Chinese video-sharing service, on Monday afternoon, apparently showing scenes from the knife attack in the Kunming train station on Saturday that left at least 29 people dead and 143 wounded.

title: Behind the Cover Story: Nathaniel Rich on the Truth About Corgis and Synthetic Biology
description: Nathaniel Rich, a contributing writer for the magazine, wrote this weeks cover story about efforts to bring animals like the passenger pigeon and the woolly mammoth back from extinction. Rich is the author, most recently, of the novel Odds Against Tomorrow. He last wrote for the magazine about hunting for the best goat stew in Los Angeles.

title: Markets Fall as Impasse in Ukraine Intensifies
description: The escalating crisis in Ukraine created turmoil in global markets on Monday, hitting stocks from Wall Street to Ukraine and causing a spike in oil and natural gas prices that could reach into consumers wallets.

title: 6 Qs About the News | The 2014 Academy Awards
description: In A Landmark Oscar Win for 12 Years a Slave, Michael Cieply and Brooks Barnes write about the 2014 Oscar winners and losers.

title: Putin's Crimean Crime
description: For Vladimir Putin the break-up of the Soviet Union was the greatest geopolitical catastrophe of the 20th century. Everyone has something that makes them tick. Putins obsession is the restoration of Russias pride through the restoration of its imperium.

title: Smashing Lenin Wont Save Ukraine
description: LOS ANGELES  As Ukraines president fled Kiev and protesters roamed his mansion and took over the capital, old statues of Vladimir Lenin were toppled and dragged through the streets in several Ukrainian cities.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | March 3, 2014
description: Update: March 4

title: The Mystery of Chinese New Year, Solved
description: In a recent post, I discussed an issue many Chinese companies cope with after New Years break: the loss of staff members. In 2012, my auction company, iPai, lost two staff members. In 2013, we lost three. In a small company, that can be a significant loss.

title: Daily Report: Lax Data Security a Problem for Many Start-Ups
description: While signing up users and raising money are big priorities for young technology companies, data security is often much further down the to-do list, Jenna Wortham and Nicole Perlroth report.

title: Kiev Cites Campaign of Pressure by Russia
description: KIEV, Ukraine  The embattled new government of Ukraine accused Russian forces of a major escalation in military pressure over control of the Crimean Peninsula on Monday, saying Russia had deployed 16,000 troops in the region over the last week and had demanded that Ukrainian forces there surrender within hours or face armed assault.

title: March 3 Updates on Ukraine Crisis
description: The Lede is following events in Ukraine and Russia on Monday, as military standoffs around Ukrainian bases continued in Russian-controlled Crimea after Russia dispatched more forces and tightened its grip on the peninsula. Updates below mix breaking news with dispatches from Times correspondents and firsthand accounts of events on the ground posted on social networks by bloggers and journalists in Crimea and other parts of Ukraine.

title: Carlyle Agrees to Buy Tycos South Korean Security Business
description: The private equity firm Carlyle Group said on Monday that it had agreed to acquire Tyco Internationals South Korean security business for about $1.9 billion in cash.

title: Deal May Be Near for Mens Wearhouse and Jos. A. Bank
description: Updated, 9:03 p.m. | The monthslong takeover battle between two of the countrys biggest suit sellers may be drawing to a close.

title: A Record Profit for Berkshire
description: Berkshire Hathaway, run by Warren E. Buffett, released its annual report on Saturday, disclosing a record profit in 2013 of $19.5 billion, a 32 percent increase from $14.8 billion in 2012. Berkshires book value per share  the measure Mr. Buffett uses to assess the companys performance  rose 18.2 percent in 2013, much less than the 32.4 percent rise in the Standard & Poors 500-stock index. But even as Berkshire posts handsome results, it remains to be seen whether it can continue to make large acquisitions that will help it sustain its reputation as the nations savviest investor, Peter Eavis and Rachel Abrams write in DealBook.

title: On Set | Indie's Stylish New Frontmen
description: Four stylish indie frontmen  Honor Titus, Kurt Vile, Zachary Cole Smith and Evian Christ  riff on their distinct looks and musical heroes in a behind-the-scenes video.

title: When a Bridge Falls
description: The collapse of the I-35W bridge in Minneapolis in 2007 killed 13 people and focused attention on the state of bridges across the nation.

title: A Disaster Brought Awareness but Little Action on Infrastructure
description: Like the weather, the need to repair Americas troubled bridges is something that everyone talks about, without doing a thing about it. Or at least they do not do nearly enough.

title: Test Yourself | E.L.L. Practice, March 3, 2014
description: Before you take the quiz below, look through these two slide shows to learn about fossils and the work of paleontologists:

title: Oil, Gas, and Rick Perry
description: Philip Longman has a very good article in the Washington Monthly debunking the hype about the Texas economy. Things I didnt know include the fact that net inward migration by native-born Americans is actually quite small.

title: Philadelphia to Sell Its Gas Works Utility for $1.9 Billion
description: Philadelphia agreed on Monday to sell its natural gas utility to the UIL Holdings Corporation, a publicly traded power company, for about $1.9 billion, in a deal that would put the countrys biggest city-owned gas works in private hands.

title: Etihad Airways Reports Jump in Profit as It Considers Stake in Alitalia
description: PARIS  Etihad Airways, the fast-growing Abu Dhabi-based carrier, reported on Monday a 48 percent jump in annual profit and reaffirmed its strong interest in gaining access to the European and trans-Atlantic networks of Alitalia, Italys money-losing flagship airline.

title: Stella McCartney: Fall 2014 RTW
description: Paris

title: Pump Up the Volume
description: A punk rocker, a hip-hop producer, a dream-pop frontman and a psychedelic singer-songwriter. Four musicians with distinct voices  and coifs  give new meaning to the term hair bands.

title: At U.N., Russia Points to Ultranationalist Threats in Ukraine
description: GENEVA  As Russian troops consolidated their hold on Ukraines Crimean peninsula, Russias foreign minister, Sergey V. Lavrov, said Monday that the troops were there to protect ethnic Russians from attacks by ultranationalists.

title: Sacai: Fall 2014 RTW
description: Paris

title: Citigroup Affiliates Troubles Multiply as Money-Laundering Subpoenas Follow Fraud
description: Updated, 9:16 p.m. | A headache is growing for Citigroup as a banking affiliate involved in money transfers across the Mexican border has become ensnared in a criminal investigation.

title: Jury Selection Begins at Trial of Bin Ladens Son-in-Law
description: In the days and weeks after the Sept. 11 attacks, a Kuwaiti-born cleric, Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, became a familiar figure in propaganda videos for Al Qaeda, appearing in some with Osama bin Laden, and other times alone, issuing blistering threats against the United States.

title: Accounts and People of Note in the Advertising Industry
description: Jose Andrade joined AbelsonTaylor, Chicago, as vice president and director for interactive technology. He succeeds Matt Collins, now vice president for creative technology at the Chicago office of Blast Radius, part of WPP. Mr. Andrade had been technology director at Publicis Life Brands Medicus, part of the Publicis Groupe.

title: Q. and A. With Stuart Elliott
description: Stuart Elliott, the advertising columnist, answers questions from readers each week. Questions can be sent to stuarte@nytimes.com.

title: McConnell Vows a Senate in Working Order, if He Is Given Control
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Mitch McConnell still has a few obstacles to overcome to become Senate majority leader next year. First, he has to win his own primary and general election back in Kentucky, where his popularity has suffered. Then his fellow Republicans have to pick up at least six seats for the party to take over the Senate for the first time since 2006.

title: Apollo Global Chief Earned $546 Million in 2013
description: Leon D. Black earned more than half a billion dollars in 2013, amid flush times for the private equity firm he runs, Apollo Global Management.

title: H&R Block Ads Suggest the Only Certainties Are Death, Taxes  and Hipsters
description: As April 15 nears, a leading tax preparer is bringing out a campaign that spoofs everyones favorite target these days for mockery, or second favorite, anyway, after cats: hipsters.

title: In Our Pages: March 4
description: 1889: Elections in Switzerland

title: At Rios Carnival, Samba Is Psychiatry
description: In Rio de Janeiro mental health workers and psychiatric patients organize a Carnival block to promote social integration and equality and raise awareness about mental health issues.

title: Birth by C-Section May Raise Obesity Risk
description: A large review of studies has found that birth by cesarean section is associated with being overweight and obese in adult life.

title: Giambattista Valli: Fall 2014 RTW
description: Paris

title: A Hidden Space for the Dreams, Lofty or Not, of Mayoral Kin
description: The spacious wooden-beamed attic of Gracie Mansion has served many purposes over the years: as a playroom, a workout room and a secret lair where a mayoral child experimented with cigarettes. But for Mitchel London, the gruff but affable restaurateur who these days runs the Fairway Caf on the Upper West Side and several other Manhattan eateries, it was home.

title: Undoing the Structural Damage to Potential Growth
description: Jared Bernstein is a senior fellow at the Center on Budget and Policy Priorities in Washington and a former chief economist to Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.

title: Roasted Winter Vegetable Medley
description: This is a sweet mixture of comforting winter vegetables that you can serve on its own as a side dish, or use as the component of a polenta, big bowl, frittata or omelet, or pasta. I roast the squash in one pan and the other vegetables together in another. If you have a small oven, roast the squash first, then the other vegetables. Or you can use two shelves and switch the trays top to bottom halfway through the roasting.

title: Roasted Root Vegetables With Polenta
description: In this comforting, perfect winter dinner I roast the vegetables and make the polenta in the oven at the same time. To accommodate the temperature requirements of each element of the dish, I use a slightly higher temperature than I usually use for polenta and I roast the vegetables at a lower temperature for longer. I top the polenta with a ladleful of marinara sauce, and spoon the vegetables on top. You could serve the polenta with only the roasted vegetables as well, so I have made the marinara sauce optional.

title: Omelets With Roasted Vegetables and Feta
description: If you have roasted vegetables on hand an omelet is a wonderful vehicle for them. Omelets are so quick to make, and so satisfying, whether you make them for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. You can cut up your roasted vegetables into slightly smaller pieces if you want a less chunky omelet.

title: Roasted Brussels Sprouts and Mushrooms With Gremolata and Quinoa
description: When I discovered how delicious Brussels sprouts are when the edges are lightly browned, whether by pan-roasting or oven-roasting, they became a top winter vegetable in my house. Both the Brussels sprouts and the mushrooms roast quickly in a hot oven. I roast them separately so that the juice from the mushrooms doesnt prevent the Brussels sprouts from browning properly. You can serve the roasted vegetables with quinoa but I also love them with polenta, pasta and other grains.

title: Roasted Carrot, Parsnip and Potato Soup
description: This is a creamy, comforting winter soup that is incredibly simple to make. All you need to do is blend together broth and roasted vegetables and heat through. You can make the soup with other roasted vegetables as well, but I love the sweet combination of the carrots and parsnips. If youve got roasted vegetables on hand, youll need about 4 cups.

title: Ashleigh Good Transforms Backstage at Givenchy
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures the transformations of the Fall 2014 Fashion Week in Paris. Here, the model Ashleigh Good (left) and after (right) makeup by Pat McGrath and hair by Luigi Murenu.

title: Today in Small Business: Hiring Freeze
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today?

title: Ad Targets House G.O.P. on Immigration
description: The Council for American Job Growth has a minute-long ad pushing House Republicans to pass an immigration overhaul.

title: Take Blood Pressure in Both Arms
description: It may be a good idea to get a blood pressure reading in both arms rather than just one. A difference in those readings, a new study suggests, is an independent risk factor for heart disease.

title: 2 Films Feature Fierce Women in Pink Saris, Confusing Viewers
description: NEW DELHI  As the leader of the Gulabi Gang, a crusading womens group in rural northern India, Sampat Pal is not one to back down from a fight, even if it means taking on a Bollywood star.

title: P.R. Agency Adds L.G.B.T. Practice
description: MWW, a leading independent public relations agency, will announce on Monday that it is acquiring a firm that specializes in reaching consumers who are lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender.

title: Britain Drops Plan to Tax Trading of Bitcoins
description: LONDON  British tax authorities said on Monday that they would not impose a tax on trading of the virtual currency Bitcoin.

title: Parts of Pompeii Crumble Under Heavy Rains
description: ROME  Heavy rains over the weekend provoked several collapses at the archaeological site of Pompeii, highlighting once again the fragility of one of the worlds most famous open-air museums.

title: Childrens Museum to Showcase Harlems Role in Jazz
description: Jazz  its history, its talents, its sounds  is the subject of a new exhibition at the Childrens Museum of Manhattan that will run May 23 through Oct. 19, in partnership with the National Jazz Museum in Harlem. Jazzed! The Changing Beat of 125th Street is an interactive, multimedia exhibition that will make use of jazz artifacts, music education workshops and live performances each day.

title: Henk Tijms and the Devils Penny
description: This weeks puzzle was suggested by Henk Tijms, a Dutch mathematician and emeritus professor at the VU University Amsterdam. The puzzle is based on Devils Penny, a game created by Dr. Tijms for a study on successful aging that showed older people recovered from an encounter with the Devils currency more easily than younger people did. (Read more in The Neurological Roots of Lingering Regret.)

title: N.B.A. Game of the Week: The Chase for a Top Seed
description: Every week, The New York Times chooses one essential game to watch, highlighting hot teams, winning and losing streaks, and statistical intrigue in the N.B.A.

title: Bitcoin Loss Highlights Elusive Paths of Regulation
description: Can nearly $450 million go missing without a crime taking place? That is only one of the questions stemming from the collapse of the Bitcoin exchange Mt. Gox that present a host of challenges for governments worldwide that are struggling to regulate virtual currencies.

title: Image of the Day: March 3
Buffetts Three Ts Open Up on CNBC
description: Ted Weschler first met Warren E. Buffett over dinner. A very, very expensive dinner.

title: The Best Investment Strategy? Getting Out of Our Own Way
description: Were still making the same old mistake of buying investments when prices are high and selling them once their prices have fallen.

title: In Rhode Island, a Celebration of Portugal
description: While bacalao may not be the first thing that comes to mind when planning a trip to Rhode Island, a Newport hotel is trying to change that with a weeks worth of Portuguese food and wine, aimed at promoting the heritage of the states large population of Portuguese descendants.

title: Emanuel Ungaro: Fall 2014 RTW
description: Paris

title: Times Minute | Ukraine in Context
description: A look at the situation in Ukraine. The current scene in Crimea, what's at stake in Ukraine for diplomats, and the relationship between the United States and Russia.

title: Andreessen Defends His Behavior on eBays Board
description: After enduring a week of attacks by Carl C. Icahn about his tenure on the board of eBay, the technology investor Marc Andreessen has delivered his most direct response yet to the hedge fund managers criticisms.

title: Times Minute | Ukraine in Context
description: In the Video

title: Paris Fashion Week: Kenzo Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Erin Baiano.

title: Caesars Entertainment Sells Casinos to Affiliate
description: The Caesars Entertainment Corporation said on Monday that it would sell four casinos to its spinoff, Caesars Growth Partners, for $2.2 billion.

title: Ad Attacks House Republicans on Immigration
description: A new, 60-second ad aimed squarely at Republican lawmakers seeks to compel them to push through a broad overhaul of the nations immigration laws. Adopting a sharper tone, the ad blames House Republicans for holding up the immigration legislation that has currently stalled in Congress.

title: New Director Named for Weeksville Heritage Center
description: The Weeksville Heritage Center in Crown Heights in Brooklyn, which preserves the documents, artifacts and houses that are the remnants of a free black community established in the area in 1838, has a new director,Tia Powell Harris. Ms. Harris, who was director of artistic affairs at the Duke Ellington School of the Arts in Washington, will take over on March 17, the centers board of directors is to announce on Tuesday.

title: The Read Around: Roddy Doyle
description: Roddy Doyle discusses how the daily humiliations of getting older inform the characters in his new book, The Guts.

title: Over Puccini, Diva Bonds With Conductor
description: ROME  Anna Netrebko, the Russian prima donna, treats her career like a contact sport, with a refreshing quantity of nerve. She has lately been adding to her repertory at a furious pace, but that alone might not have been providing enough excitement for her, and she raised the bar here last week. Her first performance in the title part of Puccinis Manon Lescaut on Thursday was a threefold debut: role, Rome and Riccardo.

title: The Read Around: Video of Roddy Doyle
description: In The Read Around, a weekly video feature, authors discuss the when, where and how behind their books. Above, Roddy Doyle talks about why he chose to revisit the character of Jimmy Rabbitte from The Commitments for his new novel, The Guts, and how the daily humiliations of getting older worked their way into the book.

title: Train Station Rampage Further Strains Ethnic Relations in China
description: KUNMING, China  Even with the objects of his ire in earshot, the landlord barely lowered his voice to describe his Uighur neighbors, who also happened to be his tenants.

title: Post-Oscars Diversity Downer
description: Sunday nights Academy Awards were a model of diversity. They were hosted by Ellen DeGeneres, a lesbian; Lupita Nyongo, who is black, won the best supporting actress category; and 12 Years a Slave won for best picture, marking the first time the top prize went to the work of a black director, Steve McQueen. Mr. McQueen did not win the best director prize, which was awarded instead to the Mexican filmmaker Alfonso Cuarn.

title: The Challenges of Hiring and Working With Developers
description: At the most recent She Owns It business group meeting, the owners discussed strategies for hiring technical staff and contractors.

title: Playwrights Horizons Season to Include New Bruce Norris Play
description: New plays by Bruce Norris (a Pulitzer Prize winner for Clybourne Park), Samuel D. Hunter (The Whale), Melissa James Gibson (This) and three others will make up the 2014-15 season at Playwrights Horizons, the Off Broadway theater announced on Monday.

title: A Successor to Sagan Reboots Cosmos
description: A poignant moment occurs near the end of the first episode of Cosmos: A Spacetime Odyssey, a rollicking 13-part tour of the universe to be broadcast on Fox starting on Sunday.

title: New York Public Library to Offer Lunch-Hour Readings
description: The average book club meeting or evening literary gathering may be a languorous affair carried along on a stream of wine and chatter. Now, a new free lunch-time reading series at the New York Public Library aims to give busy book lovers something of an espresso-bar option.

title: Climbing Mt. Everest? Nepal Says Bring Back Garbage
description: NEW DELHI  Hoping to clean a trash-strewn pathway to the worlds highest peak, Nepals tourism authority declared Monday that those climbing Mount Everest must return from the trip with an extra 18 pounds of garbage.

title: Weekend Gun Report: February 28-March 2, 2014
description: A man who fatally shot and killed an elderly man on his property in rural Georgia last fall will not face charges. After wandering the Chickamauga area for hours, Ronald Westbrook, 72, who had Alzheimers disease, walked onto the property of Joe Hendrix at around 2:30 a.m. on Nov. 27. Hendrixs fiance called 911, but before police arrived, Hendrix, 35, grabbed his .40-caliber handgun and fired several shots at Westbrook, one of which hit him in the chest.

title: Supreme Court Agrees to Weigh an Inmates Right to Grow a Beard for Religious Reasons
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to decide whether prison officials in Arkansas may prohibit inmates from growing beards in accordance with their religious beliefs.

title: Bookshelf | A Poets Ode to His Late Father
description: On the jacket cover of Kevin Youngs forthcoming collection of poems Book of Hours (Alfred A. Knopf, out tomorrow), tears fall from the all-seeing eye; inside, in a piece called Rosetta, he writes that The grammar of grief gets written each day. This is just what Young conveys in these new pages, where no sorrow is spared.

title: Springtime for Ticks
description: Q. Five deer roamed my snow-covered front yard. Will there be ticks there when the snow melts this spring?

title: U.S. Uniform at the World Cup: Red, Mostly White and Blue
description: Perhaps it is appropriate that the United States mens national soccer team headed for the World Cup in Brazil in June has adopted the unmistakable look of one of the most famous teams of the 1950s and 1960s and its renowned player Pel. Not to mention that Brazil was the site of the most famous World Cup win in American soccer history.

title: Scenes From the Governors Ball
description: Images from the annual post-Oscars celebration.

title: Recently Attributed Leonardo Painting Was Sold Privately for Over $75 Million
description: LONDON  A Leonardo da Vinci painting discovered by a dealer at an American estate sale was sold last year in a private transaction for more than $75 million.

title: Egyptian Graft Investigator Accuses Officials of Retribution
description: CAIRO  An Egyptian corruption investigator said Monday that he had filed a complaint charging that the government had demoted him in retribution for raising accusations of cronyism and self-dealing by Egypts chief spy and other senior officials.

title: Envy Versus Anger
description: Suddenly, or so it seems, inequality has surged into public consciousness  and neither the one percent nor its reliable defenders seems to know how to cope.

title: Holder and Republicans Unite to Soften Sentencing Laws
description: WASHINGTON  Shortly after Senator Rand Paul filed suit last month against the Obama administration to stop its electronic dragnet of American phone records, he sat down for lunch with Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. in his private dining room at the Justice Department.

title: Buffett and Icahn: Birds of a Feather?
description: Warren E. Buffett and Carl C. Icahn are inverse investors who correlate in more ways than one. In recently released letters to shareholders, the two billionaires talk up their returns and approaches to deploying capital. Their styles couldnt be more different, but both beat the market by betting on America, playing hardball and trading on personal brands. Yet their greatest common bond is that neither can be easily replicated.

title: French Cable Operator May Make $20 Billion Bid for Vivendi Mobile Unit
description: LONDON  Deal makers are once again circling Europes telecommunications industry looking for big buys.

title: Pro-Russia Forces Storm Ukraine Offices
description: Protesters supporting Russia rallied outside Ukraines government buildings in Odessa and Donetsk.

title: Carmakers Say Sales Were Sluggish in Chilly February
description: Severe cold weather across much of the country stalled new-vehicle sales in February, even as sales of some trucks and sport utility vehicles remained strong, automakers reported on Monday.

title: Top British Prize for Grand Theft Auto Makers
description: Rockstar Games, the studio behind the hugely successful Grand Theft Auto video game series, is to be awarded a British Academy of Film and Television Arts Academy Fellowship Award next week. This lifetime achievement award is the academys highest honor, presented for outstanding achievement in film, television or games. Bafta said that Rockstar had earned the award for its revolutionary approach to game development.

title: Pro-Russia Protesters Storm Odessa
description: Protesters supporting Russia rallied outside of Ukraine's government buildings in Odessa and Donetsk.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Giambattista Valli Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: At Audis Party, Ducati Unveils a Redesigned Diavel
description: GENEVA  When the German carmaker Audi acquired the Italian motorcycle manufacturer Ducati for about $1 billion in 2012, many in the auto industry wondered how Ducati might fit into Audis business plans.

title: Lupita Nyongo Dancing With Bill Murray and Other Party Memories
description: WEST HOLLYWOOD, Calif.  The annual Vanity Fair afterparty retains its status as a must-stop for Oscar winners and nominees and plain old ultra-famous, ultra-beautiful people. But in a crowd that included gold medal winners (the ice dancers Charlie White and Meryl Davis), worlds richest artists (Jeff Koons) and Lady Gaga, there was no mistaking who was the queen of the night.

title: Big Data Means Big Questions on How That Information Is Used
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  With the success of its free open online course system, called MITx, the Massachusetts Institute of Technology finds itself sitting on a wealth of student data that researchers might use to compare the efficacy of virtual teaching methods, and perhaps advance the field of Web-based instruction.

title: Excerpt: 'The Open House'
description: A scene from Will Enos new play at the Signature Center.

title: On GrubHub and Seamless, Restaurants Pay for Placement
description: Controversies about Internet search results are probably as old as the first Internet search. Google competitors Microsoft and Expedia, for example, have long accused the search giant of anticompetitive behavior. Now comes news that the food delivery services GrubHub and Seamless place restaurants that pay them bigger commissions higher in search results without making this fact clear to users.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Sacai Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Louise Damgaard.

title: Bypassing a Credit Card Requirement for Apps
description: Shopping for Apps

title: Weekly News Quiz | Feb. 25-March 3, 2014
description: Ukraine, the Academy Awards, winter weather and primary season: How many of the 10 questions below can you answer correctly?

title: The Need for Learning Research (1 Letter)
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Differences in Care at For-Profit Hospices
description: People who pay attention to hospice care, so often a godsend for the dying and their families, have noticed and wondered about two trends in recent years:

title: The Effects of Roommates (1 Letter)
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Your Imported Beef Is Served
description: PARIS  Its easy to spend a lot of money here on a mediocre steak.

title: 12 Years Enjoys a Seemingly Narrow Victory
description: LOS ANGELES  Hollywood made history on Sunday night  barely.

title: LSD, Reconsidered for Therapy
description: He heard about the drug trial from a friend in Switzerland and decided it was worth volunteering, even if it meant long, painful train journeys from his native Austria and the real possibility of a mental meltdown. He didnt have much time, after all, and traditional medicine had done nothing to relieve his degenerative spine condition.

title: How a Lizard Gets Rid of a Suitor
description: Female dragon lizards in Australia develop orange patches on their underbellies when they are fertile; the patches disappear only after they lay their eggs.

title: Far More Than a Lady With a Lamp
description: In medical school, as one of only 10 female students, I ignored Florence Nightingale assiduously. I didnt want to play any of the roles I thought she modeled for women  obedient wife, caring sister, modest daughter.

title: Out of Siberian Ice, a Virus Revived
description: Siberia fills the heads of scientists with dreams of resurrection. For millions of years, its tundra has gradually turned to permafrost, entombing animals and other organisms in ice. Some of their remains are exquisitely well preserved  so well, in fact, that some scientists have nibbled on the meat of woolly mammoths.

title: Vanity Fair Oscar party
description: Red carpet arrivals at Graydon Carters Vanity Fair Oscar after party.

title: Backstage Beauty Report | Bushy Brows at Giambattista Valli
description: The makeup artist Val Garland complemented Giambattista Vallis whimsical frocks and ladylike coats with an everyday beauty look centered on a bushy, boyish eyebrow. She brushed on M.A.C. Brow Set Gel for a darker color and hold, and used an eyebrow pencil to drawn in a stronger arch when necessary. Then right before the models stepped out on the runway, their dewy cheeks were pinched to get a natural blush coming through, she explained. The minimal look was fresh-faced overall, or what Garland described as back to reality.

title: Poetry Profiles: Black Ocean
description: The latest in a series of occasional profiles of poetry publishers. These questions were answered by Carrie Olivia Adams, Black Oceans poetry editor.

title: Wimpy Sparrows Welcome Here
description: Male chipping sparrows seem to have a curious motto: Love thy neighbor, as long as he is a weakling.

title: Heart Problems Linked to Those Born With H.I.V.
description: Children born with H.I.V. are more likely to have heart problems later in life, even if they are treated early with antiretroviral drugs, a recent study has found.

title: Monday Motorsports: Harvick Derails the Earnhardt Express
description: Kevin Harvick held off Dale Earnhardt Jr., this years Daytona 500 champion, to score the victory on Sunday in the Nascar Sprint Cup event at Phoenix International Raceway. Although it was the first victory for Harvick with his new team, Stewart-Haas, it was the fifth time he had won at the Phoenix oval.

title: Ukraines Impact on the Markets
description: Financial experts weigh in on how the crisis in Ukraine will affect the international markets.

title: Out of Uganda, In the Midwest
description: Dinaw Mengestus deeply moving new novel, All Our Names, takes place in the early 1970s in two worlds that could not be farther apart: a quiet, semirural town named Laurel in the American Midwest, and Kampala, the capital of Uganda, where bright hopes of independence have given way to violence, corruption and brutal government crackdowns. The young African man who transits these two worlds is named Isaac  or at least that is the name on the passport he carries. He has arrived in Laurel with a one-year student visa and is introduced to a social worker named Helen, who is supposed to be his chaperone into Middle America  his personal tour guide of our towns shopping malls, grocery stores, banks and bureaucracies.

title: Travolta Trips Up and Other High Points
description: LOS ANGELES  With its high point arguably being a retweeted selfie, the Oscars this year were meme-ready. Yes, you can already insert yourself into that photo, which host Ellen DeGeneres took and which Liza Minnelli didnt quite make it into. (It was the most shared tweet of all time.)

title: Strong Starts for Two Broadway Musicals
description: Two new Broadway productions, the Disney musical Aladdin and the latest revival of Les Misrables, got off to strong starts at the box office last week, while several other musicals had a harder time gaining traction, according to data released on Monday by the Broadway League, the trade group of theater owners and producers.

title: A Verdict of Murder
description: Scientists who have examined the mummy of a young Inca say that her death was most likely a homicide and that it was not because of Chagas disease, the tropical parasitic infection that she had. The 20- to 25-year-old Inca, who lived three to five centuries ago, had massive skull trauma and severe face and frontal skull destruction, the researchers report in PLOS One. They used DNA, tissue and isotope analysis and a full body CT scan to study the mummy.

title: Ode to Trilobites Lost
description: Nigel Hughes, a professor at the University of California, Riverside, sings an ode to a creature long vanished in "Lament for the Passing of the Trilobites."

title: Finally, Cartman Can Come Out to Play
description: Since the premiere of South Park in 1997, fans of the show have wanted to play a quintessential companion video game. But early licensed attempts were deemed failures by game critics and players and by Trey Parker and Matt Stone, the shows creators. This time, they say, will be different.

title: Fairy Tale Ballet, Tailored for Short Attention Spans
description: For all their childlike wonder, most story ballets dont cater to the average kids attention span. With its long-running Once Upon a Ballet Series, New York Theater Ballet consolidates the classics into hourlong productions for the under-10 crowd and puts parents minds at ease: Yes, your children will be able to sit through this show. And in inevitable moments of boredom, fidgeting is acceptable.

title: He Cried Out Black Power, Then Left for Africa
description: With Stokely: A Life, the historian Peniel E. Joseph says he set out to recover Stokely Carmichael, the man who popularized the phrase black power and led the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee, known as SNCC, a man whose diminished historical footprint, Mr. Joseph writes, impoverishes our understanding of the most important movement in our national history.

title: My (Feeble) Attempt at Lucas Tills Workout
description: Last spring, shortly after I began reporting The Last, Disposable Action Hero, I drove to an office park in Cherry Hill, N.J., to visit Steve Saunders, whomakes his living training pro-football and hockey players at his gym, PowerTrain Sports Institute.

title: Obama: Russia Broke International Law
description: President Obama, speaking at the White House, said Monday that Russia had violated international law in its military intervention in Ukraine.

title: Seeing Stars at Stella McCartney
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Scene City: Inside Vanity Fairs Oscar Party
description: Graydon Carters hosts annual bash after the 85th Academy Awards.

title: Obama: Russia Violated International Law
description: The president said Russia has broken international law by sending soldiers into Ukraine.

title: The Breast Cancer Racial Gap
description: A troubling racial divide in breast cancer mortality continues to widen in most major cities around the country, suggesting that advances in diagnosis and treatment continue to bypass African-American women, according to new research.

title: Justices Hear Florida Case on Measuring Inmates Mental Disabilities
description: WASHINGTON  A majority of the Supreme Court seemed skeptical on Monday of how Florida decides who is eligible to be spared the death penalty on account of intellectual disabilities. The state uses an I.Q. of 70 as a rigid cutoff, and several justices suggested that it should take account of a standard margin of error or consider additional factors.

title: Saint Laurent: Fall 2014 RTW
description: Paris

title: A Powerful New Way to Edit DNA
description: In the late 1980s, scientists at Osaka University in Japan noticed unusual repeated DNA sequences next to a gene they were studying in a common bacterium. They mentioned them in the final paragraph of a paper: The biological significance of these sequences is not known.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ukraine and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Ukraine, Syria, China and Pakistan.

title: The Many Faces of Alex Katz
description: I always liked faces, the New York-based artist Alex Katz says. But perhaps none as much as his wifes, Adas, which he has been painting throughout his career that spans almost half a century. His depictions of her are included in the 100-odd pieces that make up the 86-year-olds new show, Alex Katz: 45 Years of Portraits; 1969-2014, which opened yesterday at the Galerie Thaddaeus Ropac Paris Pantin. With a catalog featuring essays on the artist by Adrien Goetz and Suzy Menkes, it will come as no surprise if the fashion flock fills the gallerys halls during these last few days of Paris Fashion Week.

title: The Fetching Trilobite, Rewriteable DNA, Neil deGrasse Tyson on the Cosmos
description: Were still learning new and fascinating things about a class of fossils, long gone but not short on character; a new technique allows a kind of chromosomal editing; the astrophysicist and head of the Hayden Planetarium talks about hosting the new-old series Cosmos.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ukraine and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Ukraine, Syria, Myanmar and Belgium.

title: Covering the Russian Army in Crimea
description: Sergey Ponomarev, 33, is a freelance photographer covering the conflict in Ukraine on assignment for The New York Times. He grew up in Moscow and also in Ireland, where his father worked as a journalist for Itar-Tass. He previously worked for The Associated Press. He spoke to James Estrin from Crimea on Sunday evening Eastern time. The conversation has been edited.

title: When Trilobites Ruled the World
description: WASHINGTON  Trilobites may be the archetypal fossils, symbols of an archaic world long swept beneath the ruthless road grader of time. But we should all look so jaunty after half a billion years.

title: Even Among the Stars, the Corps Stands Out
description: The true triumph of the New York City Ballets winter season lay in no individual performance  exciting though several certainly were  but the way its corps danced some works by its co-founder George Balanchine. Its not hard to see how Balanchines choreography motivates a corps. As the geometries keep shifting, every participants role becomes crucial; and everything is so inspiringly dancey. But the corps current display of exhilaration is something that has been steadily rising over the last five or six years.

title: A Violinist and a Pianist Time Travel, Guided by a Virtuosos Whims
description: The cover of a recent Decca recording of the Beethoven Violin Sonatas features a large photo of the violinist Leonidas Kavakos. His name, rendered prominently, overshadows that of his pianist, Enrico Pace, demurely inserted below. Its a puzzling image, not only because Beethoven scored these works for equal partners but also because, as their recital on Sunday evening at Zankel Hall demonstrated, these musicians are masters of balanced ensemble playing.

title: New Website for Books at Least a Year Old
description: Simon & Schuster has created a website intended to drive readers to discover books, the publisher said on Monday. The site, offtheshelf.com, includes reviews, interviews and articles about books, focusing on titles that are at least one year old. Carolyn Reidy, chief executive of Simon & Schuster, said in a statement that the website is meant to inform readers about a book that you may have missed in the often overwhelming number of titles that get published every year. It features books released by an array of publishers.

title: Albums From Real Estate, Linda Perhacs and Nick Waterhouse
description: REAL ESTATE

title: U.S. Military Deaths in Afghanistan
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,300 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans recently:

title: Oscar Pistorius Pleads Not Guilty
description: The South African athlete Oscar Pistorius appeared in court on Monday to deny that he had murdered his girlfriend, Reeva Steenkamp.

title: A Former Police Diver Claims Other Officers Racially Taunted Him
description: As a member of the Police Departments elite scuba-diving unit, Oscar Smith probed the waterways of New York, his tasks both dramatic and painstaking. He has dived into the water in search of helicopter crash victims, and has sifted through the foot-deep muck at the bottom of the East River, looking for murder weapons thrown from bridges.

title: Unilever Drops Ad That Angered Some in New Jersey
description: After getting an earful from New Jersey residents over a planned billboard that referred to the state as an armpit, Unilever has announced that it will not use the ad after all.

title: Making Connections Across the Globe, via Opera
description: I HAVE traveled extensively most of my adult career. When I started my own company, Urban Planet, which develops and distributes mobile education products, my idea was to build a global company, and although I was used to traveling a lot, I missed the detail that to build a global company I would have to travel, well, globally.

title: The Group of 8 Minus One?
Crystals in the Sky
description: This occasional column will explore topics covered in Science Times 25 years ago to see what has changed  and what has not.

title: ScienceTake: Fountains of Chain
description: What, in Newton's name, would make a chain of beads rise and fall like water under pressure?

title: After Hours | Tears of a Clown
description: Political puppet theater, of the Bread and Puppet variety, is by its nature not very subtle. What packs a surprising punch out on the street can often feel like getting hammered with the pious and the obvious in a stage setting. Thats a major drawback of Hobo Grunt Cycle, a work by theLone Wolf Tribe founder Kevin Augustine at Dixon Place through March 15, which marries extraordinary life-size puppets and Chaplinesque antics to show how we use soldiers, fighting pit bulls and clowns for our own various gratifications, then kick them to the curb, wounded and forgotten. Augustine, who possesses formidable puppet-making and pantomime talents, is our main hobo clown  a genre, we learn, at the bottom of the clown chain of command, well below patrician whiteface and the middle-rank, red-nosed Auguste. He is not only forced to become a military fighting machine, trained to shoot and bayonet to kill (the work employs considerable World War I imagery), he also tenderly nurses a badly injured pit bull, another creature raised to fight on command, and even helps a delicate little (puppet) bird convalesce. Amid all this arrive a few theatrically unbearable moments. At one point, we hear two parents, on the other side of a locked door, as they wail for their (puppet) war-vet son, an amputee and PTSD sufferer, who has apparently killed himself in his bedroom. Its just too much.

title: Waiting for an Invasion
description: As Russia reportedly threatened to take over military installations in Crimea, Ukrainian soldiers prepared for a cold night with an uncertain end.

title: The Chain Fountain, Explained
description: Usually, physics research starts with a known problem. There are surprises, of course, but they dont often come from Internet videos, as happened with the case of the mysterious chain fountain.

title: Trilobites: Variations on a Theme
description: Over 300 million years, trilobites evolved a diverse and successful array of forms while maintaining a simple, common body plan.

title: Carlyle Insiders to Sell Some of Their Stock
description: Executives of the Carlyle Group are preparing to sell shares in the private equity firm for the first time since it went public two years ago.

title: An 84-Year-Old Ceramists New York Moment
description: Though Magdalena Suarez Frimkesss ceramics collaborations with her husband, Michael Frimkess, have drawn a following for many years  theyre in the collections of a number of institutions, including the Museum of Arts and Design and the Smithsonian  the 84-year-old Venice, Calif.-based artist has rarely exhibited her own work. But as her debut New York solo show, opening tonight at White Columns, demonstrates, her talent is as singular as the life she has led.

title: Frayed Nerves in Crimea as Rumors of War Spread
description: SEVASTOPOL, Ukraine  Rumors and raw nerves over Russias intentions reverberated on Monday throughout Crimea and especially this Black Sea port, where dozens of Ukrainian sailors donned orange construction helmets and draped mattresses over the side of their ship in response to what they feared was a Russian ultimatum to vacate the vessel.

title: Carnivals Essence in Black-and-White
description: Stripping away the usual hot colors of the Caribbean, Pablo Delano has captured Trinidads Carnival culture at its essence, in black-and-white.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Chlo Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Schohaja.

title: Blame Weather, Not Rules, for Canceled Flights
description: LARRY WOLF has been looking out the cockpit window for a long time, and he doesnt care much for what he has seen so far this year as airline cancellations pile up in an air-travel system so tight that it often takes days for a traveler to reschedule a flight that has been scrubbed.

title: U.S. Cancels Paralympics Delegation, but Athletes Will Compete
description: The United States canceled its presidential delegation to the Paralympic Games in Sochi, Russia, citing Russias intervention in Ukraine. The decision, announced Monday by the White House, will not affect the 80 American athletes scheduled to compete in the Games, which begin with Fridays opening ceremony.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Saint Laurent Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Fox Sees Chemistry in New Baseball Booth
description: A game with three announcers in a booth can be overly wordy. It can be filled with smart opinions from two analysts who come from sharply divergent backgrounds.

title: Chinese, on the Inside
description: Catie and Kimberly were adopted from China by a couple from Maine, who attempt to pass on a culture they've never known firsthand.

title: Fictional Disaster, Made to Sound Real, Draws F.C.C. Fine
description: WASHINGTON  The familiar, piercing tone of an emergency alert jolted television viewers to attention. Then came the frightening images: the White House surrounded by terrorists, landmarks in flames in the nations capital and military convoys patrolling the city. THIS IS NOT A TEST, read the on-screen advisory.

title: Chinese, on the Inside
description: About a decade ago, Barbara Cough adopted two girls from China, Kimberly and Catie. Barbara and her partner, Marilyn Thomas, are raising the children in Portland, Me. I filmed the family last year when the girls (who are not biological sisters) were ages 9 and 11.

title: Republicans From the West Give Support for Gay Marriage
description: Evoking Ronald Reagan and Barry Goldwater, a group of Western-state Republicans plans to enter the battle in favor of same-sex marriage on Tuesday, urging a federal appeals court to declare gay marriage bans in Utah and Oklahoma unconstitutional.

title: How to Respond to the Ukraine Crisis
In Atlanta, Youth Is Served With a Big Payday
description: KISSIMMEE, Fla.  Freddie Freeman turns 32 in September 2021, just before his new, eight-year, $135 million contract expires. Freeman should still be an elite first baseman by then, and could possibly have some good years remaining. But the Atlanta Braves signed him up for his prime.

title: Mayor de Blasios Team: The View From City Hall
description: To the Editor:

title: Children of Gay Marriages
description: To the Editor:

title: A Call to Do Better as a City
description: To the Editor:

title: Has Privacy Become a Luxury Good?
description: LAST year, I spent more than $2,200 and countless hours trying to protect my privacy.

title: With a Barrier Broken, the Intangibles Emerge
description: Homecoming was actually to New Jersey, with a drive along Route 17 and to a Costco for some shopping. For the time being, Brooklyn was one more new experience in the recast life of Jason Collins.

title: Tribes Clash as Casinos Move Away From Home
description: MADERA, Calif.  Hemmed in on a small, rocky settlement, with trailers for housing and tribal members so poor they often cannot afford burials for their family members, the North Fork band of Mono Indians went in search of new land that could offer an economic lifeline: a place to build a casino.

title: The Myth of a Divided Ukraine
description: LVIV, Ukraine  A few days ago a member of the German Green Party came to Lviv. I am a novelist and journalist, as well as a translator in German and Polish, and I sometimes write in those languages. He had read one of my articles, and he asked me to help him understand Ukraine: Too much of the reporting in the German press, he said, was biased by pro-Russian propaganda.

title: Floridas Unconstitutional Death Penalty
description: As the death penalty becomes rarer and more concentrated in a few parts of the country, the states that continue to employ it are resorting to more desperate schemes to kill people.

title: Utility Cited for Violating Pollution Law in North Carolina
description: North Carolina regulators said Monday that five power plants owned by Duke Energy have been cited for violating water pollution laws, three days after announcing a similar action against Dukes plant in Eden, N.C., where 39,000 tons of coal ash fouled the Dan River last month.

title: Mr. Ryans Small Ideas on Poverty
description: Representative Paul Ryan of Wisconsin, the House Budget Committee chairman, has an important role to play within the Republican Party. He provides polished intellectual cover for his party to mow down as many antipoverty programs as it can see. Most Congressional Republicans would love nothing more than to eviscerate programs like Medicaid, Head Start and food stamps. But so as not to appear cruel and uncaring, they need a high-minded excuse to do so.

title: Indias Muslims Wary of Rising Political Star
description: LUCKNOW, India  Salim Shah was cooking egg and chicken rolls on a dusty side street here when Indias most controversial national politician flew to a nearby park in a red helicopter and addressed hundreds of thousands of screaming supporters.

title: My Character to Kill
description: John Wells and I have been together a very long time.

title: Battling a Bank to Collect a Judgment
description: Its not exactly David v. Goliath, but its close.

title: Suicidal Tendencies Are Evident Before Deployment, Study Finds
description: Amid growing alarm at the rate of suicide among members of the military and confusion about possible causes, researchers reported on Monday that most of the Armys enlisted men and women with suicidal tendencies had them before they enlisted, and that those at highest risk of making an attempt often had a long history of impulsive anger.

title: From Russia, Tourists Stir the Protests
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  Around the south and east of Ukraine, in vital cities in the countrys industrial heartland, ethnic Russians have staged demonstrations and stormed buildings demanding a wider invasion of their country by Moscow.

title: Putin Cant Stop
description: Even cynics like to feel moral. Even hard-eyed men who play power politics need to feel that their efforts are part of a great historic mission.
