So as he has been throwing his weight around the world, Vladimir Putin has been careful to quote Russian philosophers from the 19th and 20th centuries like Nikolai Berdyaev, Vladimir Solovyov and Ivan Ilyin.

title: Wishing They All Could Be California Hens
description: ATWATER, Calif.  Hens in California are living the good life. Many can now lay their eggs in oversize enclosures roomy enough to stand up, lie down  even extend their wings fully without touching another bird.

title: As Obama and Netanyahu Meet, Ukraine Becomes a Focus of Conversation
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama welcomed Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel to the White House on Monday to discuss a litany of familiar problems and confront a new one: the Ukrainian crisis, which threatens American policies throughout the Middle East.

title: Top Russians Face Sanctions by U.S. for Crimea Crisis
description: WASHINGTON  The United States prepared Monday to impose sanctions on high-level Russian officials involved in the military occupation of Crimea, as the escalating crisis in Ukraine prompted turmoil in global markets, pounding the Russian ruble and driving up energy prices.

title: As Prime Russian Trading Partner, Germany Appears Crucial to Ending Crisis
description: In the face of the diplomatic maneuvering over how to confront a bellicose Russia in Ukraine, one country appears to hold the key to any long-lasting entente: Germany, Europes economic powerhouse and one of Russias primary trading partners.

title: Conservative Group Counters Criticism of Ad Against Health Law
description: WASHINGTON  Americans for Prosperity, the conservative advocacy group being challenged by Democrats over the content of its ads attacking the health care law, is pushing back with a new commercial that will begin airing Tuesday in Michigan.

title: For Runner With M.S., No Pain While Racing, No Feeling at the Finish
description: WINSTON-SALEM, N.C.  When a pack of whip-thin girls zipped across the finish of the 1,600-meter race at a recent track meet here, the smallest runners legs wobbled like rubber, and she flopped into her waiting coachs arms. She collapses every time she races.

title: Intersection: As Chic as Paris
description: In the upscale 16th Arrondissement of Paris, Gilles Garcia, an employee at the World Bank, dresses simply and says that clothes are not supposed to be complicated.

title: For Two Collectors, a Weekend Getaway to the 1939 Worlds Fair
description: PAWLING, N.Y.  Keith Sherman and Dr. Roy Goldberg call it the Chester, and there is a reason it resides in the garage.

title: Crimea: Russias Next Afghanistan?
description: SIMFEROPOL, Ukraine  Since Saturday, the headquarters of the government of Crimea  an autonomous region of Ukraine  have been occupied by special forces whose uniforms are unmarked but whose identity is a mystery to no one here.

title: Frustration With Afghanistan
description: President Obama and NATO last week threatened to withdraw all troops from Afghanistan by years end, given President Hamid Karzais refusal to sign a bilateral security agreement with the United States.

title: Biting Words but No Action at Security Council Meeting
description: UNITED NATIONS  As the Security Council jousted in an emergency session over Russian military action in Ukraine on Monday, Ukraines United Nations ambassador sent a three-page letter to every member state, accusing Russian forces of using stun grenades against Ukrainian soldiers, trespassing in Ukrainian airspace and deploying 16,000 troops to the Crimean peninsula.

title: Fake Outrage in Kentucky
description: Kentucky may be home to the countrys most closely watched Senate race, but it is no place for loose talk about Nazis. That, at least, is something Kelsey Cooper feels very strongly about. So when Cooper, the spokeswoman for the states Republican Party, heard that a supporter of Alison Lundergan Grimes, the Democratic candidate, compared the defeat of the incumbent, Mitch McConnell, to the liberation of Europe, the young operative snapped into peak indignation mode. Cooper issued a statement calling it completely inappropriate and appalling. That kind of hateful rhetoric, Cooper said, has no place in public discourse in our beloved Commonwealth. She demanded a heartfelt apology from Grimes.

title: From Politics to Advising Microsofts Chief, Not Without Noise
description: SEATTLE  Mark Penn has spent years spinning for politicians in Washington. Now his own career is the subject of spin here at Microsoft, where he has been handed a fresh role under its new chief executive.

title: Yankees Want No Room for Misinterpretation
description: TAMPA, Fla.  George Rose, the Yankees liaison for all things Japan, handed out yellow boxes containing Living Language kits to all four Japanese players in the Yankees camp this week. The idea is to assist the players in their efforts to learn English, a task as challenging as throwing or hitting a baseball.

title: Celebrity Guests Populate Yankees Camp
description: TAMPA, Fla.  There was a green hue to the Yankees camp Monday, as the Hall of Fame quarterback Joe Namath threw out the first pitch and served as co-manager of the game, alongside Joe Girardi. Also in attendance was Rex Ryan, the Jets head coach.

title: Crackdown Proposed to Prevent Illegal Immigrants From Obtaining Medicare
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration is planning new steps to prevent people in the country illegally from obtaining Medicare after finding that tens of thousands were improperly receiving benefits.

title: Obama Budget Would Expand Low-Income Tax Break
description: WASHINGTON  When President Obama releases his proposed annual budget on Tuesday, he will grab his best opportunity of the year to show, in one comprehensive package of hard numbers and precise detail, how he would have the government address what he has called the defining challenge of our time  economic inequality.

title: When Dad Gets Mad, Learn to Disappear
description: Families have been falling apart on American stages ever since the countrys theater came to maturity back in the early decades of the last century. Fathers alienate sons. Wives excoriate husbands. Generation gaps yawn; alcohol plays the dual role of salve and fuel; lives are irrevocably destroyed.

title: Spirit of Experiment
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  Bifocals, the lightning rod and the odometer. These are just a few of the everyday objects that BENJAMIN FRANKLIN invented when he wasnt busy with his other hobbies. Like publishing Poor Richards Almanac. Or developing the postal service. Or, oh yeah, fostering American independence. Reading his full roster of accomplishments will make you feel like a dolt.

title: Deal Is Reached on Redevelopment of Brooklyn Sugar Refinery
description: A waterfront-altering redevelopment of the Domino Sugar refinery in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, is poised to be approved by the city this week after the de Blasio administration struck a deal Monday to include more affordable housing units in the project.

title: Noah Syndergaard, Mets Prized Prospect, Passes Big Test
description: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla.  For a brief moment, as Noah Syndergaard took the mound on Monday for his first Grapefruit League game, his focus was interrupted. He heard Mets fans cheering for him, calling his name, yelling out his nickname: Thor! Thor!

title: Cities Mobilize to Help Those Threatened by Gentrification
description: PHILADELPHIA  Cities that have worked for years to attract young professionals who might have once moved to the suburbs are now experimenting with ways to protect a group long deemed expendable  working- and lower-middle class homeowners threatened by gentrification.

title: Reactions Are Mixed in Canada as Chrysler Bluntly Calls for More Help
description: OTTAWA  Five years after Chrysler received 2.9 billion Canadian dollars from Canadas government to help it stay in business, the automaker is looking for more help. This time, it is in the form of financial assistance that it says it must have to continue producing minivans and other vehicles in Canada.

title: Domestic Crude Oil Drives a Cautious Refining Revival
description: NIXON, Tex.  Since its construction in 1980, the small hard-luck refinery on the outskirts of this little cattle town has been locked shut for more years than it has been open.

title: In Yet Another Act, Larry Brown Writes a Winning Script
description: STORRS, Conn.  The game was five minutes old. The score was 2-0. Southern Methodists point guard, Nic Moore, brought the ball up in transition and quickly launched an unsuccessful 3-point attempt.

title: Antidote And Encore To a War
description: Life will probably never again be a matter of Forward, march for Elliot (Armando Riesco), the ex-Marine whose life keeps spinning off new challenges and surprises in The Happiest Song Plays Last, the third in a trilogy of plays by Quiara Alegra Hudes focusing on Elliots search for purpose after returning from duty in Iraq. Moving ahead will also be a matter of zigging and zagging for his cousin Yaz (Lauren Vlez), the music professor who is the other central character in this play and its predecessor, the Pulitzer Prize-winning Water by the Spoonful.

title: Pistorius Murder Trial Starts
description: The South African track star Oscar Pistorius pleaded not guilty in Pretoria to murdering his girlfriend, Reeva Steenkamp.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 3, 2014
description: March 3, 2014

title: Bill Adler, Author, Editor and Compiler, Dies at 84
description: Bill Adler, who pursued his goal of being the P. T. Barnum of books by conceptualizing, writing, editing, compiling and hustling hundreds of them  prompting one magazine to anoint him the most fevered mind in publishing  died on Friday in Manhattan. He was 84.

title: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, March 4, 2014
description: We feel the people who toughed it out should be rewarded.

title: Selfies, Pizza and Promoting Brands at the Oscars
description: IN recent years, it appeared that the Academy Awards was becoming increasingly desirable as a marketing platform, perhaps even approaching the biggest day of the year for advertising, the Super Bowl. After the Oscars broadcast on ABC on Sunday night, that now seems self-evident  or should that be selfie-evident?

title: Federal Prosecutors Looking Closely at Christie Aides, Court Papers Show
description: Court papers filed by a lawyer for Gov. Chris Christies former campaign manager indicate that federal prosecutors are moving aggressively to investigate the role of the governors aides in the George Washington Bridge lane closing scandal.

title: Court Says BPs Spill Agreement Is Binding
description: NEW ORLEANS  In a setback for BP as it deals with the aftermath of the 2010 Gulf of Mexico oil spill, a federal appeals court on Monday ruled that the company would have to stick to its agreement and pay some gulf businesses for economic damage without their having to prove it was caused by the spill.

title: Corrections: March 4, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Leaders Words Dont Tell the Real Story
description: United States Senator Cory A. Booker talks of his adopted city of Newark as if it were his very own Wild West. As mayor, he ran toward gunshots that sounded like cannon fire, cradled a dying boy whose mouth foamed red with blood, and learned as much from a plain-spoken woman in the projects as from any professor.

title: Before Sellout Crowd on Special Night, Nets Return to .500
description: It was only a few minutes into the game Monday when the fans behind the Nets bench began chanting Jason Collinss name. The chant popped up again periodically, louder each time, late into the night.

title: Chandlers Season of Frustration Shows No Letup
description: AUBURN HILLS, Mich.  In his quest to resuscitate the Knicks dying playoff hopes, Coach Mike Woodson shuffled his starting lineup Monday night before the team faced the Pistons here at the Palace of Auburn Hills. In: Amare Stoudemire and J. R. Smith. Out: Iman Shumpert and Pablo Prigioni. Were searching, Woodson said.

title: Reservoirs Neighbors Want More Than Return of Their Water Views
description: For the past five years, the Jerome Park Reservoir  an important link in New York Citys water supply system  has been dry. Residents have missed the radiant blue of the 94-acre basin, not to mention the cooling breeze that comes off it in summer.

title: In Crimea, Mother Russia Looms Large
description: As Ukraine is tugged by the East and the West, many in Crimea welcome Russias aggressive stance, hoping Moscow will secure their place in a fractured future.

title: Variety of Projects Vying for Grants From $19.5 Million Oil Spill Fund
description: For decades, oil seeped from the refineries that once occupied parts of Greenpoint, Brooklyn, and pooled under nearby homes and businesses, into a plume roughly the expanse of 50 football fields.

title: U.N. Debates the Breadth of a Mission in the Central African Republic
description: UNITED NATIONS  The world is watching: That has been the resounding message of world powers in the face of deadly sectarian strife in the Central African Republic.

title: Japan: Informal Talks Held With North Korean Envoys
description: Diplomats from Japan and North Korea talked for two hours on Monday in an informal meeting that could be a first step toward the reopening of an official dialogue between the countries. Japan and North Korea do not have formal diplomatic ties and have not held government-to-government talks since late 2012. The diplomats met for two hours in the Chinese city of Shenyang on the sidelines of talks between the Red Cross societies of both nations to discuss the return of the remains of Japanese who died in Korea at the end of World War II. Japanese officials declined to disclose details of the diplomats talks, the first since an official dialogue was suspended after North Korea tested a rocket in December 2012.

title: Times Minute | Ukraine Tourists Rally
description: A growing number of protest tourists in Ukraine. Also on the Minute, new research on military suicides and an advantage of Multiple Sclerosis.

title: A Dual Review of Whats New, Starring Ceelo Green and Gary Shteyngart
description: (PHOTOGRAPHS FROM TOP: COURTESY OF LIVING ROYAL; COURTESY OF BLUE RIDER PRESS; ETRO; MAGNUS SCHEVENE; GLENN SEVERANCE.)

title: Times Minute | Ukraines Protest Tourists
description: In the Video

title: A Conversation With Venture Capitalist Ben Horowitz on the Hard Things
description: Ben Horowitz is the co-founder and general partner of Andreessen Horowitz, a well-known Silicon Valley venture firm that has invested in Facebook, Foursquare, Box, Jawbone and dozens of highly successful start-ups.

title: Tax Reforms Hard-to-Find Payoff
description: Bruce Bartlett held senior policy roles in the Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations and served on the staffs of Representatives Jack Kemp and Ron Paul. He is the author of The Benefit and the Burden: Tax Reform  Why We Need It and What It Will Take.

title: Word of the Day | indeterminate
description: indeterminate \in-di-trm-nt, -tr-m-\ adjective

title: Familiar Questions at 3rd Trial in Killing of Psychologist
description: Nearly a year after his most recent trial ended in a hung jury, a schizophrenic man accused of killing a psychologist on the Upper East Side went on trial a third time on Monday, and the opening arguments underscored what again will probably be the central question: When David Tarloff committed murder, was he sane enough to know right from wrong?

title: In Job, Appointee Profits and Christie Gains Power
description: When Gov. Chris Christie pushed to expand financial incentives to keep businesses in New Jersey, one of the first companies to benefit was a client of David Samson, a lawyer with a long and close relationship to the governor.

title: United Nations Secretary Generals Report Recommending a Peacekeeping Mission to the Central African Republic
description: The secretary general, Ban Ki-moon, on Monday issued his recommendations: up to 10,000 soldiers, plus 1,820 police officers to protect civilians from armed militias, along with a civilian team to rebuild the state machinery, practically from scratch.

title: In Honduras, Going From Door to Door to Prosecutors
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras  The only way Andy Daz could find a witness to a murder was to pick up a Bible. Mr. Daz, a private investigator, posed as a Christian evangelist and spent a month knocking on the doors of hillside shacks with only a rumor and a description to guide him.

title: Don Singleton, 77, Dies; Daily News Reporter Examined Corruption
description: Don Singleton, a former reporter whose byline was familiar to readers of The Daily News in New York for four decades, often on investigative articles that examined corruption in high places, died on Sunday in Hoboken, N.J. He was 77.

title: Justin Kaplan, Prize-Winning Literary Biographer, Dies at 88
description: Justin Kaplan, a Pulitzer Prize-winning biographer renowned for his lives of Mark Twain, Walt Whitman and Lincoln Steffens, and who was later known as the editor of Bartletts Familiar Quotations  a job akin to running the admissions committee of the most selective college in the world  died on Sunday in Cambridge, Mass. He was 88.

title: Rikers Island Guards Are Found Not Guilty in Prisoner Assault Case
description: Two Rikers Island guards accused of assaulting a prisoner and covering up their actions were found not guilty Monday on all charges, after a trial that escalated tensions between the city and the correction officers union.

title: Whats on Tuesday
description: 8 P.M. (13) STEVE MARTIN AND THE STEEP CANYON RANGERS FEATURING EDIE BRICKELL IN CONCERT Mr. Martin, above, with Ms. Brickell, shows off his lightning-fast fingers and quips in this Great Performances presentation, taped last fall in Riverside, Calif. The playlist features works from Love Has Come for You, his album with Ms. Brickell; Rare Bird Alert, his collaboration with the Steep Canyon Rangers; and his Grammy-winning recording, The Crow: New Songs for the Five-String Banjo.

title: After Prodding, U.S. State Department Labels Kunming Attack Terrorism
description: After the killing of 29 people by knife-wielding attackers in a Kunming train station Saturday, articles in the Chinese state news media accused overseas news agencies of failing to label the attack as terrorism. There was also criticism of some foreign governments who were said to have failed, or been slow, to label violent attacks in China as terrorism, when they might do so quickly at home.

title: Graffiti Artists in Srinagar Aim to Go Beyond Vandalism
description: SRINAGAR, Kashmir  When Ali gets ready to paint, he puts on a mask, an occupational necessity, and not just because of the fumes from the spray can.

title: Q. & A.: Albert Ho on Democracy and Civil Disobedience in Hong Kong
description: Hong Kongs government buildings have flown the Chinese flag since 1997, but the territory is governed separately from the mainland, retaining a legal system inherited from the British and a wide range of civil liberties. One of those liberties, freedom of assembly, may be on display later this year. Advocates for popular elections of Hong Kongs top leader  the chief executive plan sit-in demonstrations in the heart of the city, one of the worlds most important financial hubs, should Chinas national legislature set conditions that limit voters choices.

title: Assailing U.S. and Kiev, Putin Keeps Open Option of Force
description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia broke his silence over the Ukraine crisis on Tuesday for the first time since it boiled over, asserting that he saw no reason for his forces to intervene but leaving open the possibility of military action if Russian speakers in the countrys south and east are endangered.

title: Market Report | Whats in a Bag?
description: Decoding the meaning of the man bag.

title: Test Yourself | History, March 4
description: Take the Quiz

title: 6 Qs About the News | Airport Chaplains Offer Guidance, and Directions
description: In The Airport Chaplain, Now Offering Earthly Aid, Mike Tierney writes about the changing role of this ministry.

title: Carnivals Essence in Black and White
description: As a photographer who teaches at Trinity College, perhaps Pablo Delano was fated to go to Trinidad.

title: What Have You Learned in Your Teens?
description: With experience, we gain wisdom.

title: Michelle Obama to Stress Education on China Trip
description: Michelle Obama, the American first lady, will travel to China this month for a visit that will focus on the power and importance of education and include a meeting with Peng Liyuan, the wife of President Xi Jinping of China, the White House has  said.

title: Markets Rebound on Hopes of Tension Easing in Ukraine
description: PARIS  Global markets calmed on Tuesday on hopes of a cooling of tensions between Russia and Ukraine, helping stocks recover some of their losses from a sell-off on Monday.

title: Israeli Airstrike Kills 2 Palestinians in Gaza
description: JERUSALEM  An Israeli airstrike killed two Palestinian men in the Gaza Strip and wounded two children on Monday evening, according to the Israeli military and Palestinian health officials, continuing the increased violence between Israel and Gaza this year.

title: Ethan Stiefel to Leave Royal New Zealand Ballet
description: Ethan Stiefel, the former American Ballet Theater principal dancer who became the artistic director of the Royal New Zealand Ballet in 2011, has announced that he will leave his post on Sept. 1, the company announced on Tuesday. In a statement on the companys website, Mr. Stiefel cited both personal and professional reasons for leaving, saying that he had found it difficult to be far from family and friends, and that the distance made it hard for him to pursue other professional projects.

title: New York Today: Colder Than Montana
description: Good Tuesday morning to you.

title: Daily Report: Mixed Responses at Microsoft to Rise of New Strategy Chief
description: Mark Penn has spent years spinning for politicians in Washington. Now his own career is the subject of spin here at Microsoft, where he has been handed a fresh role under its new chief executive, Nick Wingfield reports from Seattle.

title: Mixcloud: A Streaming Service for Mixtape Lovers
description: Music streaming services are great when you know exactly which songs or albums you want to hear. But for people who have always been a bit more inclined to make or listen to mixtapes, those services tend to come up short.

title: What I Learned (the Hard Way) About Outsourcing
description: Many businesses outsource work to other countries. But outsourcing can be scary. How do you know youre not going to be ripped off, with a job that will return half-baked or not at all?

title: Indian Cricket Teams Problems Boil Down to Bowling, Experts Say
description: NEW DELHI  Cricket contests between India and Pakistan are always an emotional affair, and it was no different on Sunday in Mirpur, Bangladesh, when the two sides met during the Asia Cup.

title: Kerry Takes Offer of Aid to Ukraine and Pushes Back at Russian Claims
description: KIEV, Ukraine  In a demonstration of support for Ukraines fledgling government and a new swipe at Russia, Secretary of State John Kerry visited Kiev on Tuesday with an offer of $1 billion in an American loan guarantee and pledges of technical assistance.

title: Crimean Premier Says Ukrainian Military Units Have Started to Surrender
description: SIMFEROPOL, Ukraine  The prime minister of Crimea, the autonomous Ukrainian republic seized by Russian military forces, said Tuesday that most Ukrainian military units on the Crimean Peninsula had surrendered and pledged allegiance to his pro-Russian government, and that local officials were working to speed up a referendum on independence from Ukraine.

title: A Calming of Global Markets
description: GLOBAL MARKETS RISE AFTER UKRAINE TENSIONS COOL | Global markets calmed on Tuesday after Russia appeared to back away from further action in Ukraine, with President Vladimir V. Putin calling an end to a military exercise he ordered last week. The crisis in Ukraine had caused turmoil in the global financial markets on Monday, hitting stocks and driving up energy prices. Analysts maintained that there was little risk of damage to Western economies, but the rising tension nevertheless unsettled investors, who were already concerned about emerging markets, David Jolly writes in The New York Times.

title: Bright Passages
description: In a brief respite from danglers and who/whom problems, heres another small sampling of sparkling prose from the last few weeks.

title: Live Stream | Valentinos Fall 2014 Collection at Paris Fashion Week
description: The latest womens collection from Valentino at Paris Fashion Week.

title: Brit Insurance Joins I.P.O. Flurry Among Private Equity Holdings
description: LONDON  The specialty insurer Brit Insurance said on Tuesday that it was planning an initial public offering on the London Stock Exchange later this year.

title: March 4 Updates on Ukraine Crisis
description: The Lede is following the tense standoff over Ukraine on Tuesday, after the Russian president, Vladimir V. Putin, said the new government in Kiev had come to power through an unconstitutional coup, and reserved the right to use force as a last resort. Updates below mix breaking news with dispatches from Times correspondents and firsthand accounts of events on the ground posted on social networks by bloggers and journalists in Crimea and other parts of Ukraine.

title: In Our Pages: March 5
description: 1889: Harrison Inaugurated

title: Timber Thieves Threaten Californias Redwood Giants
description: Most of my focus on poaching and illegal logging has been in other parts of the world, but the United States has seen waves of timber thievery of late, with a particularly awful example being night-time raids in Californias extraordinary redwood forests.

title: High and About to Be Unemployed
description: Dear Diary:

title: North Korea Tests Rocket Launcher With Range Beyond Seoul, South Says
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea on Tuesday tested a new multiple-rocket launcher with a range long enough to strike major American and South Korean military bases south of Seoul, South Korean military officials said.

title: Chanel: Fall 2014 RTW
description: Paris

title: Physician, Review Thyself
description: So youre on the road and suddenly have this horrible pain in your lower middle. In the old days, your hotel would have a doctor, but those went the way of elevator operators. Your options now are the emergency room or an urgent care clinic.

title: Republican Hypocrisy on the Minimum Wage
description: There are no good economic arguments against raising the federal minimum wage.

title: Flimflam, The Next Generation
description: I took Paul Ryans measure almost four years ago, back when everyone in Washington was determined to see him as the Serious, Honest Conservative they knew had to exist somewhere. Everything weve seen of him since then has confirmed that initial judgment. When you see a big report from Ryan, you shouldnt ask Is this a con job? but instead skip right to Wheres the con?

title: RadioShack Posts $400 Million Loss for 2013 and Plans to Close 1,100 Stores
description: RadioShack said on Tuesday that it would close about 1,100 of its stores in the United States, as losses piled up during a dismal holiday shopping season.

title: Wheelies: The Corvette Resurrection Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Busch Will Try an Indy-Nascar Doubleheader
description: For the first time since 2004, a driver will try the single-day feat of racing in the Indianapolis 500 and the Coca-Cola 600.

title: Park Hyatt Flagship Is Set for New York
description: Park Hyatt New York, the flagship property of the Park Hyatt brand, is opening this summer in the One57 skyscraper in Midtown Manhattan near Carnegie Hall.

title: Cevian Capital Increases Its Stake in ThyssenKrupp
description: LONDON  Cevian Capital, an activist investment firm, said on Tuesday that it had increased its stake in the German conglomerate ThyssenKrupp to more than 15 percent from 11 percent last year.

title: Apple Says Its Chief of Finance Will Retire
description: Peter Oppenheimer, Apples senior vice president and chief financial officer, plans to retire in September, after an 18-year career at the technology giant.

title: Herszenhorn on the Latest in Crimea
description: The New York Times' David Herszenhorn reports on the latest in Crimea.

title: Whats It Like Reading Peyton Place Today?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Thomas Mallon and Anna Holmes discuss what its like reading Peyton Place today, 50 years after the death of its author, Grace Metalious.

title: Steve McQueen on 12 Years a Slave
description: The director spoke with Melena Ryzik of The Times on the red carpet before the Oscars, where his film was named best picture of the year.

title: A Wide-Ranging Season at Kennedy Center
description: Something for everyone is how the John F. Kennedy Centerfor the Performing Arts in Washington could describe its 2014-2015 season of 2,000 performances from September to August.

title: Final Rules, and a Warning, on Banker Bonuses in Europe
description: LONDON  The European Commission adopted rules on Tuesday that finalize the details for limits on banker bonuses, and a top official cautioned against efforts that have cropped up to circumvent the new restrictions.

title: A Genetic Entrepreneur Sets His Sights on Aging and Death
description: J. Craig Venter is the latest wealthy entrepreneur to think he can cheat aging and death. And he hopes to do so by resorting to his first love: sequencing genomes.

title: Paris Fall 2014: Elements | Shape
description: A thematic visual diary of Paris Fashion Week inspired by the essential building blocks of fashion and style.

title: Learning the Rules of the Preschool Application Game
description: Talk! I silently signaled to my 2-year-old from across the classroom. At home, Zee was a sophisticated chatterbox, impressing friends with run-on sentences and words like bougainvillea. But at this distinguished preschool complete with ceramics atelier, science lab and dance program, she plopped herself in the doll corner, plunking babies in strollers. At least show curiosity, I noiselessly begged. Go to the Play-Doh.

title: Chanels Supermarket Chic
description: PARIS  Not since Marie Antoinette played milk maid on her farm at Versailles has there been such a conjunction of high and low. But this time the milk  like everything else in the supermarket  was marked with the double Cs of Chanel.

title: For the Moderate Thirst (or Budget)
description: If you like wine but arent feeling up to a whole glass, a number of New York wine bars (including the Terroir chain) sell half-servings. If you thirst for beer but want to try a few different brews without emptying your wallet and clouding your brain, half-pints are common at many beer halls including, yes, the Half Pint in Greenwich Village. And if you are curious about an unfamiliar brand of whiskey, you can buy one-ounce pours in places like Char. No. 4 in Brooklyn and St. Andrews Restaurant and Bar in Midtown.

title: Obamas Budget Is a Populist Wish List and an Election Blueprint
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama sent Congress a $3.9 trillion budget request on Tuesday that stands as a platform for Democrats to run on in this election year, full of policies intended to invite contrasts with Republicans rather than offer compromises as he did last year, without success.

title: WWS 594, Economics of the Welfare State: Fighting Poverty

description: LOS ANGELES  Never listen to me.

title: Immelt Spends His Cash Bonus on G.E. Stock
description: Jeffrey R. Immelt, the chief executive of General Electric, says he spent his whole 2013 cash bonus on G.E. stock.

title: In Performance: Mark Padmore
description: The tenor Mark Padmore, who performed recently with the Berlin Philharmonic in a new staging of Bachs St. John Passion, was in New York just weeks ago, portraying Captain Vere in a production of Brittens Billy Budd from Glyndebourne Festival Opera at the Brooklyn Academy of Music. Here, Mr. Padmore performs the prologue from Billy Budd.

title: Times Minute | How to Edit DNA
description: A new enzyme that can conceivably fix genetic mutations. Also on the Minute, the standoff in Ukraine's Crimean region and a plan by several American cities to help those threatened by gentrification.

title: Egyptian General Moves to Formalize Presidential Bid
description: CAIRO  Field Marshal Abdul-Fattah el-Sisi edged closer on Tuesday to formalizing his all-but-declared candidacy for president, telling a military academy audience that procedures will be finalized over the coming days.

title: Saint Laurents Teen Spirit
description: PARIS  At Saint Laurent, the designer Hedi Slimane became one of the first to drag fashion across the screen and take it downtown. Even when the clothes in his winter 2009 show were tailored and smartened up, the models acted like young women with a dont care attitude.

title: Image of the Day: March 4
Big Victory for Chevron Over Claims in Ecuador
description: Since losing a $19 billion judgment in an Ecuadorean court three years ago, Chevron has drawn the condemnation of human rights and environmental activists by refusing to pay anything in fines or accept blame for polluting the Ecuadorean rain forest.

title: Syria Speeds Its Deliveries of Chemicals for Disposal
description: GENEVA  The Syrian government, which missed its original Dec. 31 deadline for shipping its most toxic chemical weapons overseas for destruction, has sped up deliveries recently and has proposed finishing the job by the end of April, the international group monitoring the process reported on Tuesday.

title: Model-Morphosis | Josephine van Delden at Valentino
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures the transformations of the Fall 2014 Fashion Week in Paris. Here, the model Josephine van Delden (left) and after (right) makeup by Pat McGrath and hair by Guido Palau.

title: St. Louis Symphonys Music Director Extends Contract
description: David Robertson has extended his contract as the music director of the St. Louis Symphony through the 2017-18 season, the orchestra announced on Tuesday.

title: Putins First Remarks on Ukraine Crisis
description: President Vladimir V. Putin, in his first comments since the crisis in Ukraine boiled over, said on Tuesday that Russia reserved the right to use all means in Ukraine.

title: Travels Photo Feed
description: Exploring the globe through the lens of recent Travel photography.

title: Tribeca Film Festival Announces First Round of Programming
description: Films about Susan Sontag, New York City Ballet and the artistic director of Christian Dior are among the works in competition at the 2014 Tribeca Film Festival, organizers announced Tuesday. The world narrative and documentary competition categories will include 12 films each, while 22 films will be featured out of competition in the Viewpoints series.

title: Huffington Post Business and Global News Editor Is Leaving for International Business Times
description: Peter S. Goodman, the executive business editor and global news editor of The Huffington Post, is leaving the website to become editor in chief of International Business Times.

title: Culture Lab Detroit to Focus on Regenerative Design
description: Culture Lab Detroit, which began last year as a program to recruit well-known designers and artists to collaborate with their peers in Detroit, announced a series of events for its second year, which will feature the British architect David Adjaye; the Chicago artist and community activist Theaster Gates; and the Brazilian designers Fernando and Humberto Campana.

title: Celeste E Verde
description: Maryam Nassie Zadeh collaborated with the independent filmmaker Alexa Karolinski to create a short about Zadehs latest makeup collection.

title: Is Breast-Feeding Really Better?
description: Many women who are unable to breast-feed feel guilty about it and worry they may be depriving their children of a range of benefits. Groups like the American Academy of Pediatrics and the World Health Organization recommend six months of exclusive breast-feeding for all infants, citing studies that show breast milk is easily digestible and has nutrients that are superior to or absent from infant formulas, including immunological substances that reduce rates of infection and fatty acids important in brain development.

title: Putins First Remarks on Crisis
description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, in his first comments since the Ukrainian crisis escalated, said on Tuesday that Russia reserves the right to use all means necessary in Ukraine.

title: British Officials Arrest a Blow to Cameron Government
description: LONDON  The arrest of a British government aide accused of possessing child abuse imagery has dealt a blow to Prime Minister David Cameron, who has already faced criticism over his choice of advisers.

description: Paris

title: Steven Ballmer Reflects on Missteps and Ponders the Future of Microsoft
description: OXFORD, England - A month after stepping down as Microsofts chief executive, Steven A. Ballmer hasnt lost any of his energy.

title: Invitation to a Dialogue: A Smaller Army
Now Facebook Has a Drone Plan
description: With all his talk of better data compression and more efficient phone chips, Mark Zuckerberg, Facebooks chief executive, has had a bit of trouble getting people excited about Internet.org, his ambitious plan to get everyone in the world onto the Internet.

title: Where Theres Smoke, Theres Scrutiny
description: The tobacco giant Reynolds American may be considering a bid for its smaller rival Lorillard, apparently to investors pleasure. Shares of the possible target, which specializes in menthol cigarettes, leaped more than 9 percent after The Financial Times indicated that Lorillard might attract an offer of more than $20 billion.

description: Jerry Garrett takes a look at some highlights of the first day of press previews at the Geneva Motor Show.

description: Anna Agovino has been making espresso in the Morris Park section of the Bronx for 14 years. She describes the drink as her gasoline.

description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Kasia Bobula.

title: Espressos Disciples Worship Here
description: You can travel to La Casa del Caffe, on Morris Park Avenue in the Bronx, and try to coax Anna Agovino into spilling some of the secrets behind making a perfect cup of coffee. She will shoot you that Fellini-worthy smile of hers, and shell be patient with your questions. For a minute or two.

title: Gunmen Kill 7 in Attack on Iraqi Government Building
description: BAGHDAD  Gunmen wearing suicide belts raided a local government building in Samarra on Tuesday, killing four government employees and three police officers in a two-hour battle with security forces, Iraqi officials said. Four of the gunmen died in the fighting, and a fifth blew himself up inside the building, the officials said.

title: Injections Providing Protection Against AIDS in Monkeys, Studies Find
description: BOSTON  Researchers are reporting that injections of long-lasting AIDS drugs protected monkeys for weeks against infection, a finding that could lead to a major breakthrough in preventing the disease in humans.

title: Apples New CarPlay Is Almost a Step in the Right Direction
description: Apple this week announced Apple CarPlay, a new system for integrating an iPhone into certain cars. This is not the first time Apple has tried its hand at in-car integration, and while Im not interested in a proprietary car, its a good step toward a driving future I am interested in: one where you bring your own phone into your cars dashboard for mapping, messaging, voice controls and more.

title: Apples Departing Finance Chief Is Goldmans Newest Director
description: The newest member of Goldman Sachss board will soon have some free time on his hands, after he leaves his job as the chief financial officer of Apple.

title: California Drivers License Program Hits an Unexpected Hurdle
description: BELL, Calif.  The auditorium was packed. There were single mothers, day laborers, grandparents pushing infants in strollers and teenagers interpreting for parents. All of them faced a potentially life-changing prospect: Within a year, California will start offering drivers licenses to immigrants who are living in the country illegally.

title: Confrontation in Crimea
description: At the Belbek military installation in Crimea on Tuesday, Ukrainian soldiers refused to surrender to Russian troops and instead marched, unarmed, to confront them in the face of warning shots.

title: Some Who Fled Cuba Are Returning to Help
description: HAVANA  The business ideas have ranged from a bikini franchise to a peanut farm, restaurants, and design firms for software and home interiors. But even more novel than the pitches  in a country where entrepreneurship used to be illegal  is the financial muscle behind them: Cuban-Americans whose families lost their previous ventures to Cubas Communist government.

title: Martin Amis and Lydia Davis on the Bill for PEN World Voices Festival
description: The British novelist Martin Amis, the American short story writer Lydia Davis, the former Polish dissident journalist Adam Michnik, the Iranian artist Shirin Neshat, and the Syrian poet Adonis will be among the more than 100 writers and artists from 30 countries that will gather in New York for the 10th annual PEN World Voices Festival.

title: Obamas Calculations on the Deficit and Debt
description: On Tuesday, the Obama administration released an interesting if dead-on-arrival 2015 budget. The big message is that the White House wants to bolster support for the poor and middle class, paying for such measures with increased taxes on high-income households.

title: Moelis & Company Files for an I.P.O.
description: Updated, 6:57 p.m. | Since leaving UBS in 2007, the veteran investment banker Kenneth D. Moelis has dreamed of running a firm that could rival his former employer.

title: U.S. Seeking to Keep Potentially Inflammatory Topics Out of Terrorism Trial
description: In the terrorism trial of Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, who prosecutors say was a top adviser to Osama bin Laden, the specter of the Sept. 11 attacks has naturally loomed heavily during jury selection, which resumed on Tuesday morning.

title: A Downtown Fashion Sage Turns Her Eye to Makeup
description: Through her Lower East Side store, her eponymous clothing line and her styling work, Maryam Nassir Zadeh has built a cult following by curating clothing and accessories in vivid, unusual color combinations. Now, shes lending her creative prowess to the one-year-old cosmetics label Make for a rich new assortment of spring makeup shades inspired by Antonionis 1964 Technicolor film, Red Desert. Zadeh is part of a larger artist collaboration project set forth by Make, which has also commissioned the furniture designer Faye Toogood and the photographer/filmmaker Erik Madigan Heck to create palettes. In Zadehs case, her collection, called Celeste e Verde, was not only realized through color, but also through the medium of film.

title: Kerry Condemns Russian Action in Crimea
description: Speaking in Kiev on Tuesday, Secretary of State John Kerry also defended Ukraines fledgling government.

title: Obama Responds to Putin's Comments
description: President Obama reacted to Russian President Vladimir V. Putins earlier statements on the situation in Ukraine.

title: Orpheus Chamber Orchestra to Debut New Works at Carnegie Hall
description: The Orpheus Chamber Orchestra will debut works by Timothy Andres, Anna Clyne and Fazil Say, and play concertos with prominent soloists, over the course of four concerts next season at Carnegie Hall, the orchestra announced on Tuesday.

title: Convoy With NATO Supplies Is Attacked in Pakistan
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  Gunmen in the Khyber tribal region in Pakistan, which borders Afghanistan, opened fire Tuesday on a two-truck convoy carrying NATO supplies, killing one driver and wounding two others, a government official said.

title: Life Lived on Flip Side of Sports Page
description: Dan Jenkins has been among Americas best and funniest sportswriters for more than six decades, writing for Sports Illustrated and then Golf Digest. But hes best known to many as the author of Semi-Tough (1972), a shaggy novel about professional football that became a movie starring Burt Reynolds and Kris Kristofferson.

title: The Gun Report: March 4, 2014
description: The Kentucky Baptist Convention is leading so-called Second Amendment Celebrations, in which churches around the state give out guns as door prizes to lure new devotees. The goal is to point people to Christ, the church said. Its own spokesperson calls it outreach to rednecks.

title: Obama Unveils Budget
description: President Obama unveiled his $4 trillion budget for the 2015 fiscal year, which proposed tax credits for the working poor and increased spending for early-childhood education.

title: The Real Poverty Trap
description: Earlier I noted that the new Ryan poverty report makes some big claims about the poverty trap, and cites a lot of research  but the research doesnt actually support the claims. It occurs to me, however, that the whole Ryan approach is false in a deeper sense as well.

title: Wait Wait Tells Us: Carl Kasell Is Stepping Down
description: Carl Kasell, the longtime National Public Radio morning newscaster who found an improbable second career as Official Judge and Scorekeeper of the call-in comedy quiz show Wait Wait  Dont Tell Me!, will step down from the show sometime in the spring, the network said Tuesday.

title: Notes for a History Lesson
description: Vienna: City of Dreams, Carnegie Halls three-week, citywide festival, is aiming for the broadest possible representation of Viennese music and, to some extent, Viennese culture in general. As a small part of the festival (small, at least, in contrast to the Vienna State Operas concert performance of Bergs Wozzeck, which was taking place at the same time in Carnegies Stern Auditorium), the concert of the Ensemble ACJW on Friday in Weill Recital Hall offered a fascinating cross-section of the citys incomparable musical history.

title: Cuomo Vows to Defend Charter Schools, Setting Up Another Battle With de Blasio
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, standing shoulder to shoulder in Albany with thousands of parents and students who rallied in support of charter schools, vowed on Tuesday to defend the movement and offered a sharply different vision for their place in the educational system than Mayor Bill de Blasios.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Stella McCartney Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Schohaja.

title: Eating Lionfish, Green Tea Cookies, Bread From She Wolf Bakery and More
description: To Catch: Eating This Fish Will Save Other Fish

title: Baby Jeep Introduced in Geneva
description: GENEVA  Jeep introduced its Renegade subcompact sport utility vehicle here Tuesday on the opening day of press previews for the 84th Geneva Motor Show. Information about the new baby Jeep had been leaked Sunday on the Internet, and multiple media outlets followed suit and posted photos and details about the model on Monday.

title: The First Important New Record of 2014
description: In the days before a new album was released practically every second, March was the month when the rollout of the years major music releases would start. So in that spirit, and to accompany the resurgence of vinyl (even Target is selling it now), here is the first Very Important Record of 2014 (with apologies to Pharrell Williams): Atlas, the third album by Real Estate.

title: Unexpected Africa: Investigating New Ways to Think About the Continent
description: What do you think of when you hear the word Africa? In this lesson, we seek to challenge preconceptions with articles that offer new perspectives and defy stereotypes. From poverty and war to arts and entertainment, the worlds second largest continent is far more complex than it may seem  or than front-page headlines may reveal.

title: Deal Between Dish and Disney Seen as a Win for Both
description: LOS ANGELES  Media analysts and investors on Tuesday cheered a newly signed accord between the Walt Disney Company and Dish, the nations No. 3 pay-TV provider, that ends fighting over a controversial ad-skipping feature and includes advances in how digital television rights are handled.

title: Apples CarPlay Captivates the Auto Industry
description: GENEVA  Ferraris are fast on the road, and they are no slouch when it comes to electronic gadgetry, apparently. The automaker says it is first to the market with CarPlay, Apples new control system for in-car infotainment.

title: A New Chef at Le Cirque
description: Headliner

title: Obama Discusses Budget for 2015
description: The president unveiled his $4 trillion budget for the 2015 fiscal year, which proposes tax credits for the working poor.

title: Shops and Sweets in Portland, Ore.
description: Nestled just west of Portlands downtown and south of its popular Pearl District, the West End began transforming from vacant lots and decaying buildings into the citys hottest new neighborhood with the arrival of the hip Ace Hotel on Southwest Stark Street in 2007. Coupled with an explosion of food carts around the corner on 10th Avenue (not to mention Powells Books mammoth flagship store holding court less than two blocks away), the West End has produced a wave of boutique shops and trendy dining spots that exemplify the citys youthful, eclectic spirit.

title: In Search of the Real Africa in Mozambique
description: I assumed it was luck that within two minutes of clearing customs in Maputo, I found myself sharing a cab with Darcio Arsnio Novela (stage name Mr. Arssen), one of Mozambiques top hip-hop personalities. And that he gave me his cellphone number, and a rundown of the top cultural hot spots in town. And that we went out that night for beers with his friends at Ncleo de Arte, a bar and fine-arts work space, and that the next night he texted me about an event at the Mozambique-Germany Cultural Center  even though he wouldnt be making it himself.

title: Crisis in Ukraine Threatens Russia as Market for Auto Sales Growth
description: GENEVA  This years Geneva car show should have been the most upbeat in years. But among auto executives who gathered here on Tuesday, relief about an incipient recovery in the European auto market was clouded by the crisis in Ukraine and the fear that Russia might no longer serve as the source of sales growth it had in the recent past.

title: Richard Gere Not the Only Star at the Bedford Post Inn
description: Westchester County is becoming a magnet for marquee chefs. Michael Whites Altamarea Group, which owns Ristorante Morini, Costata and others in Manhattan, will take over the food and beverage service of the Bedford Post Inn, a Relais & Chateaux property in Bedford, N.Y., owned by Richard Gere and Russell Hernandez.

title: Five Theses on Ukraine
description: 1) It probably wasnt rhetorically helpful, but John Kerry was entirely correct when he called Vladimir Putins quasi-invasion of Ukraine the work of somebody who is acting out of weakness. Putins aggression doesnt undermine anything I wrote a week ago about the limits of Russian power and the essential implausibilityof the Kremlins grand ambitions; this gambit is a salvage operation following a major political setback, not a plausible stepping-stone toward some sweeping long-term objective. The echoes of earlier Russian aggressions are real, but the comparison to Czechoslovakia in 1968 and Hungary in 1956 should be illuminating: In those cases, Russia was projecting power well beyond its borders, and using force to keep a relatively-vast sphere of influence intact, whereas in this case its projecting power  in the Russian-speaking regions of a former Soviet republic/czarist province. You can make the case that Putin is playing as well as he can with a losing hand, or you can make the case that hes out of touch with realityand stumbling into an epic disaster. But either way, what were witnessing isnt the re-emergence of Russia as a major geopolitical threat to the United States and our allies, unless by major geopolitical threat you mean weakened ex-empire struggling to control its own periphery.

title: U.S. Activist Says Egyptian Police Assaulted Her
description: CAIRO  Medea Benjamin, a co-founder of the American protest group Code Pink, which opposes United States military actions, said Tuesday that she had been detained in the Cairo airport and assaulted by the Egyptian police while trying to travel to Gaza for a meeting opposing Israeli incursions and restrictions there.

title: Bright Young Things
description: Sun Buddies sounds like something crappy youd find at Walmart, but its quite the opposite, says Hannes Hogeman, the 33-year-old Swedish owner of the new quirky-chic line of sunglasses that he founded with his younger brother Simon. An outgrowth of their hyper-cool boutique Trs Bien, Sun Buddies employs handmade techniques to mold and finish their acetate frames and sources lenses from master Carl Zeiss Vision, with the hope of becoming an affordable alternative to iconic brands like Persol and Moscot. A limited-edition collection, created in partnership with Dover Street Market, will be available next month.

title: Guggenheim Poaches Tech Banker from Evercore
description: Eric Mandl, one of Evercores most productive technology bankers, jumped to Guggenheim Securities on Tuesday.

title: Why Must the News Be So Newsy?
description: Juxtaposing photos from a celebrity gossip tabloid and a newspaper, the writer Alain de Botton, speaking at the Brooklyn Academy of Music on Monday night, said that the tension between Taylor Swifts legs and the Arctic melt is not just a journalistic problem, its a problem for our society.

title: Brazilian Rhythms, With Hip-Hop Moves
description: Companhia Urbana de Dana sounds like a bad idea. It is a Brazilian dance troupe composed of young people, mostly men of African descent, mostly from the favelas, or slums, of Rio. But it is led and choreographed by Sonia Destri Lie, a white woman not from the favelas. She is trained in ballet and American and European contemporary dance, yet the works are based in hip-hop, somehow refined. Exploitation, condescension: Pitfalls abound.

title: Organization Help for Turning Phone Photos Into Albums
description: THEY say the best camera is the one you have with you. Nowadays, thats probably your cellphones camera.

title: App Smart: Organizing Photos
description: The Timess Kit Eaton examines three apps that can help you sort your many cellphone pictures into digital albums.

title: Pictures of the Day: Russia and Elsewhere
description: Russia and More  Pictures of the Day

title: In Butlers Trying Season, a Coaching Link to Past Success
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Soon after Butler Coach Todd Lickliter was named Division I coach of the year in 2007, he left to take over Iowas program. The universitys athletic director, Barry Collier, in need of a replacement, settled on a Butler assistant named Brad Stevens, a 30-year-old with no previous head coaching experience.

title: The Ratings, the Ads, the Backstage Emotions
description: The Oscars have been handed out, but theres still news trickling in:

title: A Miami Congressman Adamantly Defends Isolating Cuba
description: As more Cuban-Americans find ways to engage with Cuba  through travel, helping families with new businesses, and now business training  they have increasingly come into conflict with Cuban-American lawmakers who insist that isolation, through the United States trade embargo, is the best and only acceptable approach when dealing with Cuba.

title: Pictures of the Day: Russia and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Russia, Ukraine, Spain and France.

title: E-Cigarettes, by Other Names, Lure Young and Worry Experts
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Olivia Zacks, 17, recently took a drag of peach-flavored vapor from a device that most people would call an e-cigarette.

title: A Rapper Whittling Down, in His Waist and Elsewhere
description: Rick Ross came out on the Best Buy Theater stage on Monday night somewhere in the past  the 2010-11 era, specifically. That was the moment of his greatest triumph, when he made songs that sounded like gladiator calls, when the fictions he had written to transform himself into one of hip-hops kingpins were beginning to breathe life.

title: In Newark Airport Lounge, Israeli Art
description: A new lounge at Newark Liberty International Airport is providing an artistic  -and kosher  respite for travelers to Israel who might be looking for more than just free Wi-Fi and contemporary furniture while they wait.

title: Slurp Worthy: The Top 10 Ramen Destinations in New York
description: The ramen belt, once tightly buckled around the East Village, now loops from Fort Lee, N.J., to Queens and Brooklyn. Following are my picks for New Yorks most delicious ramens, ranked in descending order. All outlets are open for lunch and dinner unless otherwise noted.

title: City at Halfpipe Kings Feet
description: Leaving behind the paparazzi and requests from eager sponsors in Zurich, Iouri Podladtchikov, who is known as I-Pod, recently spent a few days in New York. Even though he upset Shaun White to win the mens halfpipe in snowboarding at the Sochi Games last month, he was able to glide through the streets of Manhattan in anonymity.

title: Ramens Big Splash
description: The first rule of the serious ramen hunter: look everywhere, even in places that dont look like ramen shops. This is how, in January, I found myself inhaling noodles at a cluster of tables shoved into the center of a bagel shop in Long Island City, Queens.

title: Its Harder to Age in Hollywood. Where Is It Harder to Raise Kids?
description: It has been hard for Oscar watchers to let go of the sight of Kim Novak, puffed and padded into a pseudo-youthful effigy of an 81-year-old woman. As Amanda Hess wrote on Slates XXFactor blog, Hollywood is a horrible place to be an old woman. Its not just Hollywood  a few years ago, Dominique Browning wrote of her cohort: Weve reached a stage where cosmetic surgery is so readily available that in certain circles it is expected of women and men to avail themselves of these age-deniers. If you choose not to partake of the benefits of needle and knife, you are judged to be making a statement. You are taking a position against the current standards of beauty.

title: Financial Regulator Calls Obama Budget Woefully Insufficient
description: The countrys top derivatives regulator is making clear that it is unhappy with President Obamas 2015 budget proposal.

title: Seen on the Street | Outside the Paris Fall/Winter 2014 Womens Shows
description: A glimpse at what gals are wearing this season.

title: L.B.J., Civil Rights and Dramatic License
description: All the Way, the hit play about Lyndon B. Johnsons first year in office thats now in previews on Broadway, revels in the historical details of Washington politics, with large chunks of dialogue taken directly from the Congressional Record and Johnsons voluminous phone transcripts.

title: Basquiat Estate Sues Christies, Saying Some Works For Sale May Not Be Real
description: Two sisters of the artist Jean-Michel Basquiat filed a $1 million lawsuit against Christies on Tuesday, accusing the auction house of trying to sell possibly fake Basquiats and falsely suggesting that they had been authenticated by his estate.

title: Silk Road, Shut Down in Fall, Had Digital Outpost in Pennsylvania
description: A staff member in the electrical engineering department of a liberal arts college in eastern Pennsylvania played a small role in the investigation that resulted in the shutdown last fall of Silk Road, the online marketplace where drugs and weapons could be bought with Bitcoin.

title: At Disney, a Celebration That Was a Long Time Coming
description: BURBANK, Calif.  The gathering at Walt Disney Animation here was supposed to be a giddy celebration. The studio had achieved the ultimate validation for its hard-fought creative rebirth: Frozen, its Nordic tale of two sisters and a wisecracking snowman, won two Oscars on Sunday, the same day the film crossed $1 billion at the global box office.

title: Alexander McQueen: Fall 2014 RTW
description: Paris

title: In Indianapolis, a Bike Path to Progress
description: For an old car town, Indianapolis has been doing a lot for biking lately. A new eight-mile landscaped bike and pedestrian pathway is helping residents rediscover their city and reshaping how outsiders view it. The trail is putting Indianapolis on the map as a place to see bold innovation, along with the Colts and some car races in a town long known as an international racing capital, home to the Indy 500 and the Indianapolis Motor Speedway.

title: A Heavy Bass Beat, a Wreath of Smoke, an Aura of Sweat
description: The man in the black leather vest looks nervous. All around him, glistening half-naked men dance to the disco beat as smoke curls in the air. They writhe, touch and kiss, skin against skin, leather against leather. A guy in chaps pauses and locks his eyes on our nervous man. Here, looking is cruising, an overt exchange of desire: Its about watching and waiting, and being conspicuously out of the closet and the thrilling promise of something more. Then the scene stops and the actors wait as James Franco and Travis Mathews, the directors choreographing this bacchanalia, plot their next move.

title: Street Stops Still a Basic Tool, Bratton Says
description: The New York police commissioner, William J. Bratton, said on Tuesday that the practice of stopping people for questioning on the street would remain a very basic tool of his department and that he intended for his officers to aggressively enforce the law against low-level offenders to ensure that public places feel safe.

title: Punch, Crunch and Pli
description: During a recent fitness class at the Flatiron branch of the New York Health & Racquet Club, 20-odd women wearing pink one-pound weighted gloves did rounds of uppercuts, side jabs and fancy footwork before slowing down for plis and leg lifts.

title: A Young Composer in a Swirl of Life, Love and, Finally, Disillusionment
description: The enigma of the internationally prestigious and prolific choreographer Alexei Ratmansky continues. Most of his works show you that he has the finest mind among creators of ballet today. Seldom, however, do they show this consistently.

title: Thinking Outside the Borders
description: LOS ANGELES  They began as buskers on downtown Olvera Street here, immigrant and working-class Latino kids singing Besame Mucho and Sabor a M for tourists. So when the members of the band La Santa Cecilia took to the stage of the Staples Center five weeks ago to receive the Grammy Award for best Latin rock or alternative recording, they had come a lot further than just a couple of miles.

title: Bragging Rights for St. Albans, Queens
description: Given the list of gifted public figures who once called it home, St. Albans has bragging rights, even by New York standards. But beyond their role as window dressing, these long-gone luminaries  among them Ella Fitzgerald, Count Basie, John Coltrane and Lena Horne  have helped provide a sense of communal identity.

title: Netanyahu Warns Against Iran at Aipac
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel urged world powers to prohibit Iran from enriching uranium.

title: To Scientists in Pursuit, a Bit of Matter Is No Small Matter
description: A description of Particle Fever  Mark Levinsons mind-blowing new documentary  must grapple with some issues of scale. This is a modest, compact movie about the largest imaginable subject: the structure of the cosmos.

title: N.S.A. Director Says Snowden Leaks Hamper Efforts Against Cyberattacks
description: WASHINGTON  Gen. Keith B. Alexander, the director of the National Security Agency, said Tuesday that the leaks by the former agency contractor Edward J. Snowden had slowed the effort to protect the country against cyberattacks on Wall Street and other civilian targets.

title: This Is About Killing Much More Than Kenny
description: By the standards of efforts by Trey Parker and Matt Stone to bring the comedy they have perfected for 17 seasons on television to new mediums, South Park: The Stick of Truth is a disappointment.

title: Repurposing Closed Hospitals as For-Profit Medical Malls
description: New Jersey has been losing hospitals for more than two decades; 26 have closed in that time, many in poor, urban neighborhoods that are left with an empty shell where a hospital once stood.

title: Cruising the History of Biker Jackets
description: Opening today at the Museum at F.I.T., the exhibition Beyond Rebellion: Fashioning the Biker Jacket explores the utilitarian genesis of the biker jacket and its evolution into a high-fashion garment. Its outlaw mystique is traced through time while displaying designer interpretations from the likes of Jean Paul Gautier and Yves Saint Laurent.

title: Tax Program Aims to Reverse Decades-Long Decline in Allentown
description: ALLENTOWN, Pa.  More than 600,000 square feet of office and retail space is being built in the long-depressed center of this city, spurred by an unusual state-sanctioned project that permits revenues from tenants tax bills to be used to pay down some of the debt incurred during construction.

title: When the Battle Is Over, What Remains Is ... Art
description: LOS ANGELES  Never listen to me.

title: The Man I Am, the Man Im Not, the Man I Want To Be
description: David Hilliards multipanel images are visual possibilities of what could be, while exploring his masculinity through his subjects.

title: Justices Unite on Key Point in Chase Ending in Fatal Police Shooting
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court seemed to have little trouble concluding during an unusually one-sided argument on Tuesday that Arkansas police officers who had used deadly force to end a high-speed car chase could not be sued by the family of the driver.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: Recent Sale

title: In Change, Tourre Wont Be Teaching University of Chicago Course
description: The University of Chicago may have had a change of heart about Fabrice Tourre, the former Goldman Sachs trader who was found liable of securities fraud last year.

title: A New Form of Shareholder Activism Gains Momentum
description: The aftermath of the Dole Food management buyout is showing that the new, new thing on Wall Street is appraisal rights. The battle being waged by hedge funds over appraisal rights in the Dole buyout just may be the tipping point, as hundreds of millions of dollars flow to the funds to pursue these actions.

title: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: 100 Days
description: The 2014 World Cup begins on June 12, when Brazil plays Croatia in the opening match. Reporters and editors for The Times will count down to the start of the tournament each day with a short capsule of news and interesting tidbits.

title: Comcast Indefinitely Extends Low-Cost Broadband for Poor Families
description: WASHINGTON  Comcast, which is preparing to ask federal regulators to approve its proposed takeover of Time Warner Cable, said Tuesday it would extend indefinitely its program that provides low-cost broadband service and computers to poor families and give $1 million in neighborhood grants to support digital literacy.

title: Inside the Brothels
description: Seven unforgettable stories in the battle against sex trafficking, collected over two decades of reporting. Curated by Nicholas Kristof.

title: Cyberattacks Rise as Ukraine Crisis Spills to Internet
description: The crisis in Ukraine has spread to the Internet, where hackers from both sides are launching large cyberattacks against opposing news organizations.

title: The Writer Behind @GSElevator Speaks Out
description: Remaining anonymous as he posted on Twitter under the handle @GSElevator was simply a device, John LeFevre said on Tuesday, that allowed him to paint a broader picture of life on Wall Street.

title: Karen Mulligan of Pret--Surfs Whirlwind Oscars Week
description: When theyre not designing their New York-based beachwear label Pret--Surf, Karen Mulligan and Jillian Demling are busy with their high-powered 9-to-5s (Mulligan is the studio manager for the photographer Annie Leibovitz; Demling is aneditor at Vogue). Last week, on the occasion of Taschens release of Leibovitzs self-titled book, Mulligan had the chance to hit some Oscars-week festivities in high style.

title: Sherwin B. Nuland, Author of How We Die, Is Dead at 83
description: Dr. Sherwin B. Nuland, a surgeon and author who drew on more than 35 years in medicine and a childhood buffeted by illness in writing How We Die, an award-winning book that sought to dispel the notion of death with dignity and fueled a national conversation about end-of-life decisions, died on Monday at his home in Hamden, Conn. He was 83.

title: G.M.s Barra Promises to Investigate How Recall Was Handled
description: DETROIT  General Motors chief executive, Mary T. Barra, told employees on Tuesday that she had personally taken charge of the companys recall of 1.6 million vehicles to fix defective ignition switches.

title: Examining the Options for Ukraine
Morning Show for Weather Channel
description: AS the Weather Channel continues to add regularly scheduled programming to its lineup  like a flagship morning show with news, sports and entertainment reports as well as a documentary series devoted to investigative journalism on subjects like homelessness and climate-change denial  Madison Avenue might be prompted to ask, Whither the weather?

title: How We Diagnose and Treat A.D.H.D.
description: To the Editor:

title: Mark Willis
description: Mr. Willis, 52, is the chief executive of Keller Williams Realty, a real estate brokerage firm based in Austin, Tex. The company has about 700 franchise offices with more than 95,000 agents worldwide, including Keller Williams New York City, which opened in April 2011.

title: How to Define Fair Use
description: To the Editor:

title: Chrysler Backtracks on Asking Canada for More Cash
description: OTTAWA  After widespread criticism of its demand linking continued minivan production in Canada to more government assistance, Chrysler unexpectedly withdrew its request on Tuesday. The automaker said that it would go ahead with significant investments in two Canadian factories without financial aid.

title: Effort to Honor Eliot Ness in Nations Capital Finds Trouble in Chicago
description: CHICAGO  The bootleg-busting exploits of Eliot Ness, an incorruptible federal agent often credited with taking down the mobster Al Capone in the 1930s, have been immortalized in a book, The Untouchables, and a television show and movie by the same name.

title: Kentucky Law Official Will Not Defend Ban on Same-Sex Marriage
description: Gov. Steven L. Beshear of Kentucky said on Tuesday that the state would hire an outside lawyer to defend a same-sex marriage ban after a fellow Democrat, the state attorney general, declined to do so.

title: Annemijn Dijs Transforms Backstage at Alexander McQueen
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures the transformations of the Fall 2014 Fashion Week in Paris. Here, the model Annemijn Dijs (left) and after (right) makeup by Pat McGrath and hair by Guido Palau.

title: Chaos at Home, but Ukraine Arrives to Play U.S.
description: LARNACA, Cyprus  When the plane carrying the United States mens soccer team touched down Tuesday in Cyprus for an exhibition against Ukraine on Wednesday, it was not even certain that the Americans would have an opponent to face. Then they spotted an Air Ukraine jet on the tarmac at Larnaca Airport. That was at least a good sign.

title: Knicks Cant Win, Even if They Play to Lose
description: Joel Embiid and Andrew Wiggins, the star Kansas players who are likely to be two of the first three picks in the 2014 draft, are from Cameroon and Canada, respectively. Jabari Parker, a Duke freshman standout who is also likely to go in the top three, grew up in Chicago. How the Knicks play over the remaining 21 games of the season will probably determine whether one of them ends up in Denver.

title: Are Alt Weeklies Over?
description: BALTIMORE  WHEN the Baltimore Sun Media Group recently announced that it was buying the Baltimore City Paper, the local alternative weekly where I work as an editor, the prognosis for aggressive, independent journalism in Baltimore was pretty grim. Tom Scocca, a reporter who used to work at City Paper, declared that the city was now one step closer to being a zero newspaper town.

title: Time to Try Compassion, Not Censure, for Families
description: Nearly 50 years ago, Daniel Patrick Moynihan, assistant secretary of labor for President Lyndon B. Johnson, noted that nearly a quarter of African-American children were born to single mothers and proposed that this deterioration of the Negro family was at the heart of the deterioration of the fabric of Negro society.

title: Effort to Decriminalize Small Amounts of Marijuana Gains in District of Columbia
description: WASHINGTON  District of Columbia lawmakers voted on Tuesday to decriminalize the possession of small amounts of marijuana, in what advocates of more lenient marijuana laws hope is another step toward legalizing the drug outright.

title: Emerging, but No Longer a Mother Lode of Profits
description: When it comes to investing in emerging markets, few companies have been as gung-ho as Diageo, the British maker of the Guinness, Johnnie Walker and Smirnoff brands. But now that troubles are cropping up in many such countries around the world, Diageo has turned from cheerleader to excuse-monger.

title: Some Progress on Eating and Health
description: For those concerned about eating and health, the glass was more than half full last week; some activists were actually exuberant. First, there was evidence that obesity rates among pre-school children had fallen significantly. Then Michelle Obama announced plans to further reduce junk food marketing in public schools. Finally, she unveiled the Food and Drug Administrations proposed revision of the nutrition label that appears on (literally, incredibly) something like 700,000 packaged foods (many of which only pretend to be foods); the new label will include a line for added sugars and makes other important changes, too.

title: Arkansas House Votes to Extend Health Insurance Program
description: The Arkansas House of Representatives voted Tuesday to let the state keep taking federal money for the expansion of Medicaid under President Obamas health care law and using it to buy private insurance for poor people.

title: Why Putin Doesnt Respect Us
description: Just as weve turned the coverage of politics into sports, were doing the same with geopolitics. There is much nonsense being written about how Vladimir Putin showed how he is tougher than Barack Obama and how Obama now needs to demonstrate his manhood. This is how great powers get drawn into the politics of small tribes and end up in great wars that end badly for everyone. We vastly exaggerate Putins strength  so does he  and we vastly underestimate our own strength, and ability to weaken him through nonmilitary means.

title: Arizona: Bill Advances to Allow Surprise Inspections of Abortion Clinics
description: The State House of Representatives on Tuesday approved a measure that would allow state health department officials to conduct unannounced inspections of abortion clinics. The clinic inspections now require warrants, and Democrats argued that the legislation would empower public officials to harass abortion providers. Republicans said the bill would ensure that abortion providers were following state and federal laws. The bill was approved on a nearly party-line vote, with one Republican voting against and one Democrat voting in favor. The measure heads to the Senate, where it has strong support from the Republican majority. The bill was drafted by the Center for Arizona Policy, a Christian organization that championed a recent bill that would have allowed business owners to cite religious beliefs in refusing to conduct business with gays and others. Gov. Jan Brewer, a Republican, vetoed that bill.

title: Setting Up a Better Domino Plan
description: Updated March 5, 2014:TheCity Planning Commissionon Wednesday approved the proposal toredevelop the old Domino Sugar refinery.

title: Massachusetts: Report Chides Drug Laboratory for Lapses
description: A report conducted by the Massachusetts inspector general, Glenn A. Cunha, found that a chemist who may have compromised tens of thousands of criminal cases was the sole bad actor at the drug laboratory where she worked, but took its management to task for lapses that it said had created an atmosphere that enabled her actions. The chemist, Annie Dookhan, admitted last fall that she falsified test results at the Hinton State Laboratory Institute in Boston, and is serving up to five years in prison. The laboratory has since closed. Mr. Cunhas report, which was made public on Tuesday, said that the laboratory lacked important protocols and adequate oversight and that investigators were retesting drug samples in more than 2,000 additional cases.

title: Australia Puts Green Credibility to the Test
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Since Australias conservative government took office almost six months ago, Prime Minister Tony Abbott has declared the country open for business.

title: The What-Might-Have-Been Budget
description: President Obamas 2015 budget wont survive the solid wall of Republican opposition in Congress, but that doesnt mean its a useless document. Virtually every section is an important illustration of how many national goals  in particular, reducing inequality and rebuilding the economy  could be achieved if Congress would end unnecessary and unfair tax breaks for the rich.

title: Stubborn Blanket of Snow in New York Region
description: Repeated storms followed by freezing temperatures have kept snow on the ground in much of the region.

title: Governor Declares Florida Better, and Takes Credit
description: MIAMI  In a surprisingly personal speech reflecting his campaign for a second term, Gov. Rick Scott of Florida focused his State of the State address Tuesday on tax cuts, job creation and his contention that he was making significant progress in tackling the hardships that Florida families face.

title: Finding New Worlds in New York Citys Old Snow Piles
description: The view inside the snow globe has gotten pretty old here in New York. Snow falls. It sits there. It turns gray. More snow falls and turns gray.

title: A Rational Response to Ukraines Crisis
