description: The tensions over Ukraine eased somewhat after President Vladimir Putin of Russia halted military maneuvers on the Ukrainian border and declared at a news conference on Tuesday that there was no immediate need to send troops into eastern Ukraine. The conciliatory talk prompted Russian financial markets to rebound from their plunge on Monday. The markets reward peaceful behavior.

title: Market and Rates Helped Private Equity Chiefs Thrive Last Year
description: Payouts for the top executives in private equity have rocketed into the stratosphere, thanks to a soaring stock market and shrewd maneuvers by their firms in the aftermath of the financial crisis.

title: With Roberts, Yanks Hope Imperfect Piece Is Good Fit
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Maybe it was the cluster of Yankees championships in the late 1990s, or maybe the creation of their own cable network a few years later. Probably, it was the explosion of their payroll, demonstrated again with their $500 million off-season.

title: Frozen in a Niche?
description: As the statuesque Cate Blanchett clutched her statuette, she sent an acid air kiss Sandra Bullocks way.

title: Judge Wont Dismiss Sexual Assault Charges Against General
description: FORT BRAGG, N.C.  A military judge on Tuesday rejected a defense motion to dismiss charges against Brig. Gen. Jeffrey A. Sinclair, the decorated former deputy commander of United States forces in southern Afghanistan, who has been charged with sexually assaulting a junior officer. The judges move clears the way for General Sinclairs long-awaited trial before a jury of generals, possibly starting on Thursday.

title: Putin, Flashing Disdain, Defends Action in Crimea
description: MOSCOW  He sat alone in an armchair, alternately slouching, his legs spread wide in confidence, and squirming uncomfortably. He displayed flashes of sardonic wit, anger and palpable disdain, especially toward the Americans and Europeans but also toward the leaders of a country, Ukraine, he made clear was a political neophyte, unable to govern itself.

title: Fighting Afghan Terrorism, Without Troops
Wheelers Potential Is on Display in His First Spring Start
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Only one of the Mets three young power arms will be pitching for the team when the season starts. Noah Syndergaard will probably be called up around midseason, and Matt Harvey could return by September. In the meantime, Zack Wheeler, the 23-year-old right-hander, will try to further establish himself.

title: No Easy Way Out of Ukraine Crisis
description: WASHINGTON  For all his bluster and bravado, President Vladimir V. Putins assurance on Tuesday that Russia does not plan, at least for now, to seize eastern Ukraine suggested a possible path forward in the geopolitical crisis that has captivated the world. Global markets reacted with relief, and the White House with cautious optimism.

title: Group Close to Obama Says It Erred on Donation
description: A political advocacy group backed by President Obama acknowledged Tuesday that its executive director had set up a White House meeting for a New Jersey businessman entangled in a lawsuit with a federal agency, who then pledged to raise $100,000 for the group one day after the meeting.

title: Nets See .500 as Just a Stop on Playoff Drive
description: There was a buoyant ambience on the practice court at Barclays Center on Tuesday afternoon, a day after the Nets re-established equilibrium to their win-loss record.

title: Viral Post Draws Attention to Plight at a Brooklyn School
description: Annette Renaud was riding the C train last weekend when a man approached and asked to take her picture. It was Brandon Stanton, of the popular website Humans of New York, and as usual, he asked what was on her mind. Thats when Ms. Renaud, a parent who is on the School Leadership Team at the Secondary School for Journalism, a high school housed in the John Jay educational campus in Brooklyns Park Slope neighborhood, let loose.

title: Just Right Inequality
description: If we cant have (and dont actually want) total equality or total inequality, what is the right amount of inequality?

title: Inspired by Woods; Now Inspiring Others
description: DORAL, Fla.  French basketball royalty is in Victor Dubuissons blood. His uncle Herv was a prolific scorer for the French national team and participated in the 1984 Summer Olympics.

title: Being and Nothingness
description: Administrivial Alert! Do you enjoy constructing crossword puzzles? Looking to contribute to a fresh venue? The Chronicle of Higher Education is accepting submissions. Send your puzzles or even your theme ideas to editor Jeffrey Harris at xwords@chronicle.com. You can read the specifications by clicking here and scrolling down to the bottom of the page.

title: A Standoff of Lawyers Veils Madoffs Ties to JPMorgan Chase
description: It remains one of Wall Streets most puzzling mysteries: What exactly did JPMorgan Chase bankers know about Bernard L. Madoffs Ponzi scheme?

title: Pointing Fingers Over Heavy Death Toll at an Indonesian Zoo
description: SURABAYA, Indonesia  A gaunt, malnourished white tiger died of pneumonia in mid-February. A lion died of strangulation in January when its neck became entangled in the cable that opened and closed the door of its cage. More than 100 other animals have perished since last summer, including a rare Komodo dragon found dead in its enclosure last month.

title: Bangalore Welcomes a Later Last Call
description: BANGALORE  As Indias hub of globalization, Bangalore has long had one major obstacle in its quest to be a truly cosmopolitan city: a lack of nightlife, thanks to a stringent city ordinance mandating an 11:30 p.m. closing time for its many bars and restaurants.

title: Texas G.O.P. Beats Back Challengers From Right
description: McALLEN, Tex.  Establishment Republican leaders on Tuesday defeated challenges from the right in a statewide primary election as conservatives inspired by Senator Ted Cruz largely failed to topple mainstream incumbents, and a race for lieutenant governor headed for a runoff.

title: No Bloodshed in a Standoff at an Airfield in Ukraine
description: BELBEK, Ukraine  Unarmed and uncertain of what they would face from the Russian soldiers deployed ahead of them, the men of the 45/15 air force unit marched through the gloomy morning up the road to the military airfield here, determined to take back the guard posts they usually operate.

title: What Putin Really Wants
description: MOSCOW  The decision of the Russian president, Vladimir V. Putin, to send forces into Crimea provoked a hysterical reaction, but his motives are less ambitious than is commonly assumed.

title: De Blasio and Operator of Charter School Empire Do Battle
description: She was a darling of Mayor Michael R. Bloombergs administration, given free space to expand her charter schools from a single one in Harlem into a network larger than many New York State school districts. Along the way, her Success Academy empire became a beacon of the countrys charter school movement, its seats coveted by thousands of families as chronicled in the film Waiting for Superman.

title: Brodeur Earns Win in What May Be His Devils Finale
description: NEWARK  Martin Brodeur stood smiling, a Devil for at least one more night.

title: A New Magazine for Fans of the Vaticans Biggest Star
description: ROME  Just a few days short of the first anniversary of Pope Francis election, there is fresh evidence that his honeymoon with the public persists: He is getting his own magazine.

title: One Killed in Gas Explosion at Condo Complex
description: A gas explosion at a condominium complex in central New Jersey on Tuesday killed a woman and damaged dozens of homes, officials said.

title: How Agencies Clashed on Banks Madoff Files
description: A new document reveals that JPMorgan Chase and federal regulators fought over access to bank employee interviews, eventually pitting the Justice Department against the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency.

title: Parents Fight Against Sepsis Reaches C.D.C.
description: There it was: an A to Z index on the website of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. One morning, Ciaran and Orlaith Staunton of Queens turned to the S page. Somewhere between seasonal flu and sexual health, they were sure, they would find sepsis. It is among the leading causes of death in the United States, taking far more lives than the best-known cancers or heart attacks or criminal violence.

title: Impaired-Driving Case Took Toll, Kennedy Says
description: BEDFORD, N.Y.  Leaning back on a bone-white sofa, her glasses perched on her head, Kerry Kennedy spoke of her 20-month-long prosecution for driving while drugged that ended last week, when she was acquitted after an hour by a six-person jury.

title: Bond Market in China May See First Local Default
description: Updated, 8:18 p.m. |

title: Chinese Officials Seek to Shift Attention From Rampage
description: KUNMING, China  After knife-wielding assailants dressed in black killed 29 people and injured 143 at the train station here on Saturday, shocking the nation with an act of unfathomable terror, Chinese authorities appeared eager to change the subject.

title: At Retrial, Therapist Retraces Grisly Scene
description: The story would not be an easy one to tell even once: how a man tried to kill you, swinging a cleaver mercilessly at your face, while your colleague lay bloodied and dying a few feet away.

title: C.I.A. Employees Face New Inquiry Amid Clashes on Detention Program
description: WASHINGTON  The Central Intelligence Agencys attempt to keep secret the details of a defunct detention and interrogation program has escalated a battle between the agency and members of Congress and led to an investigation by the C.I.A.s internal watchdog into the conduct of agency employees.

title: Head of Port Authority Police Union Questioned in Bridge Inquiry
description: The two men have met almost weekly since 2012, sometimes in a government office, but also in New Jersey diners and Manhattan bars, including a Gilded Age tavern replete with marble and mahogany, and a watering hole that once served as a gathering place for fashion models.

title: In A.T.V. Case, a Police Sketch but No Suspect
description: What began over the weekend as a simple traffic stop has escalated into a manhunt for the driver of a four-wheel all-terrain vehicle who ran down a New York City police officer and dragged him nearly 200 feet down a busy Brooklyn street.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 4, 2014
description: March 4, 2014

title: De Blasio on Eva Moskowitz
description: Long before he was elected mayor, Bill de Blasio made it clear that he had little time for Eva S. Moskowitz, the leader of a charter school network.

title: Parking Rules
description: Because of Ash Wednesday, alternate-side street-cleaning regulations will be suspended in New York City on Wednesday. Other regulations will remain in effect.

title: Netanyahu Promotes Efforts Toward a Peace Deal
description: WASHINGTON  A day after meeting with President Obama, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel on Tuesday made an uncharacteristically enthusiastic pitch for a peace accord with the Palestinians, saying it would enable Israel to tighten ties with its Arab neighbors and catapult the region forward on issues like health, energy and education.

title: Fight Club
description: At 37, Floyd Mayweather Jr. is the biggest name in boxing, with a spotless 45-0 record and a supersize personality to match. His taste for excess is the stuff of legend. Six-figure blackjack bets. A $10 million watch collection. A massive entourage he calls the Money Team, with Lil Wayne and Justin Bieber as honorary members. And last year, despite having zero endorsement deals, he still made a whopping $90 million  making him far and away the worlds highest-paid athlete. (LeBron James, by comparison, made around $60 million.) Mayweather is also a ruthless competitor, known for pummeling his opponents both in the ring and in the press. And when his next fight comes around on May 3, you can bet everything you have that hes going to extend his streak. Its what Mayweather would do, anyway. Here, a brief look at the fabulous life of the boxing champ.

title: Word of the Day | senility
description: senility \si-ni-l-te also se-\ noun

title: The Economics of Randomized Experiments
description: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago. He is the author of The Redistribution Recession: How Labor Market Distortions Contracted the Economy.

title: Times Minute | Natural Gas in Ukraine
description: A look at natural gas in Ukraine, Russias and Ukraines points of leverage, and the United States role in the situation.

title: How Fat May Hurt the Brain, and How Exercise May Help
description: Obesity may have harmful effects on the brain, and exercise may counteract many of those negative effects, according to sophisticated new neurological experiments with mice, even when the animals do not lose much weight. While its impossible to know if human brains respond in precisely the same way to fat and physical activity, the findings offer one more reason to get out and exercise.

title: Times Minute | Natural Gas in Ukraine
description: In the Video

title: Mexico Targets Gang That Infiltrated the Mining Industry
description: MEXICO CITY  Mexico has stepped up its effort to crack down on one of the most powerful and feared criminal organizations in the country, with arrests and seizures this week aimed not at drug trafficking or extortion but at the gangs lucrative infiltration of mining and smuggling iron ore to China.

title: China Announces 12.2% Increase in Military Budget
description: BEIJING  China announced on Wednesday that it would increase its military budget for 2014 to almost $132 billion, a 12.2 percent rise over last year. The rapid growth in defense spending is another sign of the countrys goal of becoming a dominant military presence in the Pacific, with a navy able to project power across the region.

title: Whats on Wednesday
description: 10 P.M. (Bravo) FLIPPING OUT This Season 7 opener finds the ever-energetic Jeff Lewis, above center, settled into his newly refurbished Los Angeles home and juggling a roster of high-profile clients, including George Eads, of CSI: Crime Scene Investigation, and his wife, who are undertaking a major renovation of their own. And Mr. Lewis scrambles to plan around Jenni Pulos-Nassos maternity leave.

title: U.S. Takes Training Role in Africa as Threats Grow and Budgets Shrink
description: DIFFA, Niger  Across Africa, affiliates of Al Qaeda and other Islamist militants are proving resilient and in some cases expanding their influence, from Nigeria to Libya to Somalia, Western and African counterterrorism officials say.

title: For Rich, 13 Was Good for Making, and Spending, Money
description: You guessed it: The rich are getting richer. And  shocker!  they are having a pretty good time spending their money.

title: Japan Said to Be Ready to Impose Bitcoin Rules
description: TOKYO  Japan is drawing up a plan to regulate Bitcoin, officials said on Wednesday, including clauses the Nikkei business daily said would tax Bitcoin transactions and ban banks and securities firms from handling the digital currency.

title: Indias 814 Million Voters Get Their Polling Dates
description: Updated, 5:35 p.m. | NEW DELHI  The Election Commission of India announced Wednesday the dates on which Indias 814 million voters will go to the polls to choose representatives for the Lok Sabha, or lower house of Parliament.

title: China Declares War Against Pollution
description: The first year of President Xi Jinpings administration, Prime Minister Li Keqiang said at the opening of the National Peoples Congress on Wednesday, was: Arduous. Complex. Difficult. Downward pressure on the economy increased. Natural disasters occurred frequently.

title: Corrections: March 5, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Stealth Changes for Chinas Stealth Fighter
description: When China unveiled its J-20 stealth fighter in 2011, analysts noted the aircrafts potential to shift the regional balance of power further in the favor of the Peoples Liberation Army Air Force. And the country is clearly committed to investing in military hardware. On Wednesday, China announced it was increasing its defense spending in 2014 to 808.23 billion renminbi, or about $132 billion, a rise of 12.2 percent.

title: Test Yourself | Math, March 5, 2014
description: Our weekly math problems are written by teachers at Math for America.

title: Paris Opera Ballet Announces New Season
description: New works by John Neumeier and Pierre Rigal and visits from the Tanztheater Wuppertal and the Royal Swedish Ballet are some of the highlights of the Paris Opera Ballets 2014-15 season, which the company announced on Tuesday. The season is the final one to be programmed by the current director, Brigitte Lefvre, who will retire on Oct. 31, making way for Benjamin Millepied, the former New York City Ballet principal who will take up the reins as director of dance on Nov. 1. Ms. Lefvres public farewell will take place on Oct. 4 with a performance that includes Harald Landers tudes, and William Forsythes Woundwork and Pas/Parts, both commissions from Ms. Lefvre for the Paris Opera in 1999.

title: Imerys Raises Offer for Amcol International, Again
description: The French industrial materials company Imerys has raised its offer for the second time in less than a month as it seeks to acquire Amcol International.

title: 6 Qs About the News | A New Cosmos for a New Generation
description: In A Successor to Sagan Reboots Cosmos, Dennis Overbye writes about a new rollicking 13-part tour of the universe that will begin on television this Sunday.

title: Voting Dates Are Set for National Elections in India
description: NEW DELHI  Indias national elections will begin on April 7 and continue on nine separate dates until May 12, with results expected to be announced on May 16, the Election Commission of India announced Wednesday.

title: Arundhati Roy, the Not-So-Reluctant Renegade
description: Ive always been slightly short with people who say, You havent written anything again, as if all the nonfiction Ive written is not writing, Arundhati Roy said.

title: The Man I Am, the Man Im Not, the Man I Want To Be
description: At first, our choices are easy: whether to sit or stand, run stutter-step through the afternoon light or rest sweetly in our mothers lap. As we age, we enter the twilight of limitless possibility. Despite our best intentions, we accept that there are fewer possible selves.

title: Michael Fords Homeplace: Mississippi in the 1970s
description: Correction appended.

title: What Challenges Have You Overcome?
description: The Times is full of articles every week about people who have overcome challenges of all kinds and have learned from failure.

title: Israel Says It Seized Ship in Red Sea With Load of Iranian Rockets Headed to Gaza
description: JERUSALEM  Israel demonstrated its long reach early Wednesday when its navy commandos boarded and seized a merchant ship in the southern Red Sea carrying an Iranian shipment of advanced weapons destined for Palestinian militant groups in Gaza, according to senior Israeli officials.

title: New York Today: A Winter to Remember
description: Good morning. Its Ash Wednesday.

title: In Our Pages: March 6
description: 1939: Plot to Kill Cathedral Pigeons

title: U.S. Effort to Broker Russia-Ukraine Diplomacy Fails
description: PARIS  An effort by the United States to broker the first face-to-face diplomatic meeting between Russia and Ukraine over the Crimea crisis failed on Wednesday, but Secretary of State John Kerry and his Russian counterpart announced more discussions in the days ahead.

title: What Im Still Learning About Managing Cash Flow
description: I learned years ago that there is a big difference between cash flow and profit. You always need cash flow to stay in business, which is why you often hear the phrase cash is king. But you eventually need profit to have a successful business, which is why I wrote a blog post several years ago called Why Cash Is NOT King.

title: Daily Report: Chief of Finance at Apple to Retire
description: Peter Oppenheimer, Apples senior vice president and chief financial officer, plans to retire in September, after an 18-year career at the technology giant, Rebecca Ruiz reports.

title: Bank of England Suspends Worker as Currency Inquiry Expands
description: Updated, 8:00 p.m. | The Bank of England saidon Wednesdaythat it had suspended an employee as it escalated a review into whether bank officials had known about or condoned potential manipulation of the currency markets.

title: Opposing Narratives in Piecing Together Kunming Attackers Motives
description: Were the assailants who slashed to death 29 people and wounded 143 others at a train station in southwestern China last Saturday aspiring jihadists or would-be refugees seeking to flee the country?

title: Italy Fines Novartis and Roche in Collusion Case
description: PARIS  Italian antitrust authorities said on Wednesday that they had fined two Swiss pharmaceutical companies, Novartis and Roche Holdings, a total of $250 million for colluding to keep doctors from prescribing a relatively inexpensive eye treatment in favor of a more expensive drug.

title: Live Stream | Miu Mius Fall 2014 Collection at Paris Fashion Week
description: The latest womens collection from Miu Miu at Paris Fashion Week.

title: Louis Vuitton: Fall 2014 RTW
description: Paris

title: With Close Ties to Russia, China Sets a Cautious Tone on Ukraine Crisis
description: China has joined international voices calling for peace and stability in Ukraine, while continuing to withhold criticism of Russia, its traditional partner.

title: Lowflation and the Two Zeroes
description: Via the always invaluable Mark Thoma, the IMF blog  yes, the IMF has in effect become an econblogger  has a terrific piece on the problem with low inflation in Europe. Its the perfect antidote to the do-nothing voices insisting that theres no problem, because we dont see actual deflation yet.

title: British Floods Could Be a Harbinger
description: BURROWBRIDGE, England  Just outside this pretty village in southwest England is a steep, grassy mound called Burrow Mump. From the ruined church on the top, you can see miles of what look like shallow lakes but what are really submerged wheat fields and pasture.

title: A New Word for Filthy Snow
description: Dear Diary:

title: An Architect and a Sociologist to be Honored at Swiss Pavilion in Venice
description: The work of the Swiss economist and sociologist Lucius Burckhardt and the British architect Cedric Price will be the subject of the Swiss Pavilion at the 14th International Architecture Exhibition at the Venice Biennale, which runs from June 7 to Nov. 23. The show, A stroll through a fun palace, is being organized by Hans-Ulrich Obrist, a director of the Serpentine Galleries in London.

title: A Legal Standoff in the Madoff Case
description: Even after five years, it is still unclear what exactly JPMorgan Chase bankers knew about Bernard L. Madoffs huge Ponzi scheme. A newly obtained government document does not provide the answer, but does shed some light on why the mystery remains, Ben Protess and Jessica Silver-Greenberg write in DealBook. The document reveals that JPMorgan and federal regulators fought over access to bank employee interviews, eventually pitting the Justice Department against the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency.

title: Irish Tycoon Wins a Round in Claridges Takeover Fight
description: LONDON  Patrick McKillen, the Irish property tycoon locked in a fierce takeover struggle involving Claridges and its two sister landmark hotels in London, has won the latest round in his battle with rival British magnates.

title: Book on Losing British Generals Wins American History Prize
description: The British may have lost the colonies in 1781. But the tale of their defeat has just won a prestigious literary honor, thanks to Andrew Jackson OShaughnessys study The Men Who Lost America: British Leadership, the American Revolution, and the Fate of the Empire, which has been awarded the New-York Historical Societys annual American history book prize.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Alexander McQueen Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Morgan Stanley Is Said to Weigh Sale of Its Swiss Private Bank
description: LONDON  Morgan Stanley is in the early stages of a strategic review of its Swiss private banking business, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: How a Campaign Organization Became a Social Welfare Group
description: After Barack Obama was re-elected, his campaign organization, Obama for America, underwent a tax-code morph and became a social welfare group called Organizing for Action, intended to support the presidents initiatives. It kept the same initials, the same circular logo, and many officials who had worked on the campaign and in the Obama White House. Their website is called barackobama.com.

title: Israel Says It Seized Iranian Shipment of Rockets Headed for Gaza
description: JERUSALEM  Israeli naval commandos intercepted and boarded a civilian ship in the southern Red Sea early Wednesday, preventing an attempt to smuggle an Iranian shipment of advanced rockets to Gaza, according to senior Israeli officials.

title: Veronica Mars Fans Are Happy to Finance a Reunion
description: LOS ANGELES  Hardly a week after Cyrus and Ina Chung had moved to Providence, R.I., to start new jobs, this married couple were standing here in a parking lot, dressed in formal clothes with the Southern California sun bearing down on them in late June, having paid a total of $3,000 for the privilege of being extras in the Veronica Mars movie.

title: Peek.com Raises $5 Million in New Financing
description: Start-ups like Uber and Airbnb have succeeded in moving traditionally offline businesses like taxis and apartment subletting to the Internet.

title: The Lady With the Lamp and the Angel of the Battlefield
description: Florence Nightingale and Clara Barton, two great heroines of 19th-century nursing, were born a year apart but in utterly different circumstances. Nightingale was born in the spring of 1820 to a wealthy British family living in Italy. They returned to England shortly after, entertaining the beau monde of the day at Embley Park, their estate near London. Barton, born on Christmas Day in 1821, was the youngest of five children in a farming family in North Oxford, Mass. Her mother and sister Dolly seem to have suffered from mental illness; Clara was raised, in large part, by her brother Davie. She became a teacher at the age of 15.

title: At Trade Center Transit Hub, Vision Gives Way to Reality
description: How can a $3.94 billion building be made to look cheap?

title: E.U. Offers Billions in Aid to Ukraine
description: The European Union said it would offer an aid package to Ukraine worth as much as 11 billion euros (approximately $15 billion) over the next two years.

title: Image of the Day: March 5
Cant Get a Bank Loan? The Alternatives Are Expanding
description: Ivan Rincons products may have been skimpy, but he was convinced his growth prospects were not. Orchid Boutique, the online swimwear shop he founded six years ago in Miami with his wife, Mayra, was approaching $3 million in annual sales. It had been profitable since 2010, he said, with margins that ran between 10 and 15 percent. But the business was highly seasonal, leaving him scrambling for cash in the off-season when he needed to place orders.

title: Westchester Leader Opens Bid to Deny Cuomo a Second Term
description: ALBANY  Entering a field devoid of formidable Republican contenders, Rob Astorino, the Westchester County executive, formally announced his candidacy for governor on Wednesday, beginning a campaign to unseat Andrew M. Cuomo, the popular and well-funded Democratic incumbent.

title: Louis Vuitton: A Debut With Desire
description: PARIS  Tweet the message from Paris to Shanghai: The Louis Vuitton show on Wednesday was a success  for its modernity, its clarity, its decency  and its respect for women.

title: Californias Last Slave Case
description: In January 1864, African-Americans across California celebrated the one-year anniversary of the Emancipation Proclamation with midnight church services, rallies and parades. Although California was a free state with an antislavery constitution, and was distant from the battlefields of the Civil War, most black Californians linked the national conflict over slavery to their own freedom struggle on the Pacific Coast.

title: Another Way to Do the Math for Social Security Reform
description: Phillip Swagel is a professor at the School of Public Policy at the University of Maryland and was assistant secretary for economic policy at the Treasury Department from 2006 to 2009.

title: Target Executive Resigns After Breach
description: The highest-ranking technology executive at Target has resigned, the company said on Wednesday, just one week after it revealed how badly its profits had been hurt during the holiday season by an enormous breach of its system that exposed customer information.

title: An End to Polio in India?
description: ALIGARH, INDIA  On Jan. 13, 2011, a case of polio was discovered in the Indian state of West Bengal. India has been a hotbed of polio, often exporting strains to polio-free countries such as China. Whats remarkable is that this case, three years ago, may be the last ever discovered in India. This year, the World Health Organization (W.H.O.) will officially remove India from its list of polio-endemic countries, leaving just Afghanistan, Pakistan and Nigeria.

title: Italy Moves to Speed Up Maintenance at Pompeii After Collapses
description: After heavy rains damaged several structures at the archaeological site of Pompeii over the weekend and on Monday, Italys culture minister has moved to speed up spending on maintenance at the heavily visited attraction, according to the BBC.

title: Russias Defense Minister Calls Evidence of Troop Presence in Crimea Complete Nonsense
description: Russias defense minister and foreign minister both denied on Wednesday that there were any Russian troops among the large contingent of masked men in armored vehicles with Russian military plates blockading government buildings and Ukrainian military installations in Crimea.

title: Listen Up | Avey Tares New Trio Puts On a Puppet Show
description: Though hes best known for having been a member of the experimental indie-rock band Animal Collective for more than a decade, David Portner also has a long history of collaborating with other musicians. Last year, the 34-year-old, who performs as Avey Tare, formed a trio, Avey Tares Slasher Flicks, with the ex-Dirty Projectors member Angel Deradoorian and the former Ponytail drummer Jeremy Hyman. Now, the group is poised to release its debut album, Enter the Slasher House (April 8, Domino Records), which features some of the most precise and straightforward compositions Portner has ever written.

title: Researching a Snowboarding Trip
description: Throughout the past six years, Jeremy Jones has traveled to Alaska to snowboard new zones under his own power. With each trip, he has refined how he researches these areas.

title: Video: Snowboarder Blends Exploration With Research
description: Higher Unplugged looks at the making of the film Higher, which follows the snowboarder Jeremy Jones and the Teton Gravity Research crew as they ascend and ride peaks in Alaska, Wyoming, California and Nepal. Jones is a professional snowboarder who has been named big mountain rider of the year 10 times by Snowboarder magazine.

title: A Deal Makers Deal of a Lifetime
description: Ken Moelis has engineered the transaction of his lifetime. The veteran investment banker is taking his eponymous seven-year-old advisory firm public.

title: Beauties, Beasts and Movie Posters
description: What would posters for The Lion King and Beauty and the Beast look like today? Mondo, an offshoot of the Austin, Tex., theater chain Alamo Drafthouse, has one answer. In collaboration with Disney, it has commissioned new versions of posters for those and other films, all hand-drawn by artists. They will be on display at a show, titled Nothings Impossible, opening on Friday in Austin, timed to the beginning of the South by Southwest film festival. You can see some of the selections in this slide show, featuring work by Martin Ansin, Tom Whalen, Anne Benjamin and more. Additional images are at the Disney-owned blog Oh My Disney.

title: In Banking Overhaul Fight, a Ruckus Over an Obscure Product
description: First, there was the TruPs crisis, as everyone surely recalls.

title: Hitting High Velocity Without the Meth
description: BURBANK, Calif.  Among the downsides of making and selling crystal meth are all the ancillary chores one must attend to. As Jesse Pinkman, one-half of the drug-dealing pair on the AMC series Breaking Bad, Aaron Paul had to dissolve a corpse in acid, help babysit a D.E.A. informant shackled in his basement and endure a vicious beat-down by a crazy guy named Tuco. And that, as any dedicated Breaking Bad fan can tell you, was just in the first season.

title: With Move to Limit Gun Sales, Facebook Is Caught in Debate
description: Facebook wants to unite the world so everyone can talk about everything. One of the big things people want to talk about, it seems, is guns.

title: Classical Playlist: Stephanie Blythe, Eva-Maria Houben, Nicholas Phillips and More
description: AS LONG AS THERE ARE SONGSStephanie Blythe, mezzo-soprano; Craig Terry, pianist(Innova)The mezzo-soprano Stephanie Blythe has one of the most naturally big, rich and penetrating voices in opera. Yet she is a vocal artist with keen sensitivity to the expressive nuances of music and the texts she sings. She has proved an engaging and stylish performer of American standard and musical theater songs, as on this recording, released last fall, titled As Long as There Are Songs. With the pianist Craig Terry, she gives alternately tender and sassy, swinging and melting accounts of Always, A Star Is Born: The Man That Got Away, How Deep Is the Ocean? and 11 others songs. (Anthony Tommasini)

title: Brother of Afghan Leader Expected to Drop Out of Election
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  President Hamid Karzai has vowed to stay out of Afghanistans presidential race, and not to show preference or prejudice toward any of the 11 contenders, but it is now clear that he has made an exception in at least one case: his own brother.

title: Have You Tried a Peer-to-Peer Lender?
description: As Amy Cortese explains in an article we have just published, small businesses that cannot get bank loans suddenly have new alternative lenders to consider.

title: Times Minute | Indonesia's Zoo of Death
description: Petitioners want a zoo in Indonesia closed. Also on the Minute, following Ukraine's money trail and e-cigarette use among teenagers.

title: Times Minute | Indonesias Zoo of Death
description: In the Video

title: Miu Miu: Fall 2014 RTW
description: Paris

title: New York Demands Data From Mortgage Firm Nationstar
description: Updated, 8:48 p.m. | New York States top banking regulator is raising questions about the capabilities of the mortgage servicing firm Nationstar Mortgage Holdings, demanding details about the companys staffing levels, modification procedures and affiliated businesses.

title: Rangers Trade Callahan and Are Dealt a Defeat
description: The newest Ranger, Martin St. Louis, only 5-foot-8 but a two-time N.H.L. scoring champion, stood before reporters at the end of a long day Wednesday and talked about why he had asked to end his 13-season career with the Tampa Bay Lightning and be traded to the Rangers.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Louis Vuitton Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: A Stray Swastika, and a Delay, for South Park Video Game
description: South Park is known for humor that pushes the boundaries of taste on television, and the new video game South Park: The Stick of Truth  released on Tuesday in North America  is no different.

title: Her Beloved Beast, Loved Just as He Is
description: Their previous collaborations include The Freak and the Showgirl and Apocastrip Wow! Now the performance and burlesque artists Julie Atlas Muz and Mat Fraser are appearing at the Abrons Arts Center under the more family-friendly title Beauty and the Beast. But dont expect G-rated material. Staged by Phelim McDermott (Shockheaded Peter, and productions of Satyagraha and The Enchanted Island at the Metropolitan Opera), this production uses pageantry, puppetry and two daring stars to explore the totems and taboos of our notions of physical attractiveness.

title: The Socks Dirty, but Hes Keeping It
description: Jasons idea of a fun Saturday night is rehearsing the old Whos on First? vaudeville routine, while Tyrone prefers demolishing as many commandments as possible. The two Texas churchgoers make for an unlikely duo, but in Hand to God, which opens Monday at the Lucille Lortel Theater, they are joined at the hip. Or, rather, at the wrist.

title: Sally Beauty Investigating Possible Credit Card Theft
description: In what may be the latest cyberattack on an American retailer, Sally Beauty Holdings said Wednesday that it had been investigating a security breach that others say may have resulted in hundreds of thousands of stolen customer credit cards.

title: E-Cigarettes Versus E-Hookahs
description: The New York Timess David Gillen describes the difference between e-cigarettes and e-hookahs.

title: In Eastern Ukrainian City, a Tug of War for More Autonomy
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  Pro-Russian demonstrators demanding greater independence from the central government overcame riot police in this eastern Ukrainian city and poured into the regional administration building here on Wednesday evening, retaking it for a second time this week in a tug of war with the local police.

title: Herms: Fall 2014 RTW
description: Paris

title: Democrats in Senate Reject Pick by Obama
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Democrats on Wednesday rejected President Obamas nominee to lead the Justice Departments Civil Rights Division in an embarrassing rebuke of the president on the choice of a key legal adviser and one that left senior White House officials furious with members of their own party.

title: Big Data Picks Up the Pace
description: We may be heading into the next phase of big data. The early bets and stand-alone products seem to be moving rapidly into more sophisticated uses and broader corporate alliances.

title: Pradas Artful Pouches
description: The printed fur jackets from Pradas spring/summer 2014 collection, with their abstract faces rendered in bold pops of color,are some of the most talked-about items of the season. Theyre also some of the most expensive and hard to get. But fear not: There is now a way to have a touch of that Prada art-you-can-wear in your spring wardrobe. The label has repurposed its face print for a small set of fur and leather zip pouches, now available exclusively at Bergdorf Goodman. And for those in love with the collections aesthetic but not quite ready to carry such a traffic-stopping clutch, Prada has installed art from its runway show in the department storesFifth Avenue windows, complete with murals by the artist El Mac, on view though March 10.

title: Plaintiffs in Suit Seek to Freeze Mt. Goxs U.S. Assets
description: Customers of Mt. Gox are trying to freeze assets in the United States of the bankrupt Bitcoin exchange and its chief executive, Mark Karpeles.

title: The Man Onstage Who Wasnt There
description: A lanky, soft-spoken older man whose name matches his timidity, Douglas Whymper is living a variation on the actors nightmare.

title: Quebecs Separatist Premier Calls a Snap Election for April
description: OTTAWA  Less than 18 months after gaining a tenuous hold on power, Pauline Marois, the separatist premier of Quebec, on Wednesday called a snap election.

title: Behind Closed Doors, Microsofts Board Reportedly Battled Chief Over Nokia Deal
description: When Microsoft announced last fall that it would buy Nokias handset business for $7.2 billion, jaws dropped across Wall Street.

title: 3 Gulf Countries Pull Ambassadors From Qatar Over Its Support of Islamists
description: CAIRO  Tensions between Qatar and neighboring Persian Gulf monarchies broke out Wednesday when Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates and Bahrain withdrew their ambassadors from the country over its support of the Muslim Brotherhood and allied Islamists around the region.

title: Herms: Gentle End to Hectic Week
description: PARIS  The Sturm und Drang of four weeks of international collections ended Wednesday on a gentle note as Herms closed the autumn/winter 2014 shows in Paris, where changes in designers at established brands have been paramount.

title: Revisiting Nicaragua, This Time as a Tourist
description: Managuas airport doesnt look anything like it did the day I first arrived there with an ill-considered buzz cut, two donated microscopes and a mind brimming with untested idealism. That was in 1985, when the Sandinista revolution and the American-backed contra campaign opposing it were in full swing. I had taken a leave from college to see the revolution up close, to lend my hand in whatever way I could, including teaching, and ended up staying for nearly three years. At the immigration counter, a compaero in fatigues insisted, in Spanish, that I redo my forms. Leafing through my American passport, he noted that I was born in Germany, but he seemed disappointed that my birthplace was in the western half of the country, not in socialist East Germany. To tell the truth, I was a little disappointed, too, and all the more so when my microscopes, destined for a rural health clinic, were seized by customs.

title: Hotel Review: the Guest House in Vienna
description: Rates

title: Restaurant Report: La Madame in San Sebastin, Spain
description: With its packed pintxos bars and Michelin-starred temples of avant-garde gastronomy, San Sebastin is one of the worlds great dining destinations. Even with all that Basque bounty, though, sometimes a traveler gets a hankering for home. New Yorkers might find their fix at La Madame, which opened two years ago a block in from the beach, offering a rare taste of the States.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Valentino Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: Senior U.N. Envoy Threatened at Gunpoint in Crimea
description: UNITED NATIONS  A senior United Nations diplomat who was sent to the Crimea region of southern Ukraine to assess the Russian military takeover there was threatened by armed men at gunpoint on Wednesday, and aborted his visit a day after it had begun.

title: A Moose Mystery
description: Moose in Minnesota are dying at an alarming rate, and biologists are racing to understand what's behind the rapid decline.

title: Minnesota Mystery: Whats Killing the Moose?
description: GRAND PORTAGE, Minn.  For moose, this years winter-long deep freeze across the Upper Midwest is truly ideal weather. The large, gangly creatures are adapted to deep snow: Their hollow fur insulates them like fiberglass does in a house. And the prolonged cold helps eradicate pests that prey on moose, like ticks and meningeal worm, or brain worm. Yet moose in Minnesota are dying at an alarming rate, and biologists are perplexed as to why.

title: The Man on Horseback
description: David Brooks: Gail, Im not a big believer in the theory that if women ran the world everything and everyone would be peaceful and cooperative, but I have to admit it is hard to imagine a female version of Vladimir Putin.

title: Emma Thompson Tackles Sweeney Todd
description: The actress Emma Thompson and the director Lonny Price talk about preparing for the New York Philharmonics concert stagings of the musical Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street.

title: Syria and Security Council Criticized by Rights Panel
description: UNITED NATIONS  A commission of inquiry established by the United Nations to investigate human rights abuses in Syria singles out the government and its allied militias for systematically committing murder, torture, rape and enforced disappearance, while pointing a sharp finger at the Security Council for allowing both sides in the three-year-long war to continue breaking international laws with impunity.

title: Convicted SAC Trader Loses His Business School Degree
description: Mathew Martoma, the former SAC Capital Advisors trader convicted of insider trading in February, can no longer say he has a degree from Stanford Graduate School of Business.

title: A Penchant for Privacy in Williamsburg
description: Since her arrival in New York nearly four years ago after graduating from Loyola University Chicago, Nicki Shamel has had good luck finding roommates and apartments via Craigslist.

title: A New SAT Aims to Realign With Schoolwork
description: Saying its college admission exams do not focus enough on the important academic skills, the College Board announced on Wednesday a fundamental rethinking of the SAT, ending the longstanding penalty for guessing wrong, cutting obscure vocabulary words and making the essay optional.

title: Steppenwolf Theater to Present New Lisa DAmour Play
description: A New Orleans parking lot, a suburban British home, a Dublin flat, and the court of Marie Antoinette are the diverse settings for the next round of plays at Steppenwolf Theater Company of Chicago, which announced its 2014-15 season lineup on Wednesday.

title: On Twitter, ITV Editor Reports U.N. Envoys Ordeal in Crimea as It Unfolds
description: As my colleague Somini Sengupta reported from the United Nations, 10 to 15 unidentified armed men threatened a U.N. special envoy, Robert Serry, as he left a meeting at a naval base in Crimea, ordering him to go to the airport and leave the peninsula, the deputy secretary-general, Jan Eliasson, said.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Miu Miu Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: Suspensions for Students Who Rooted Against India
description: NEW DELHI  Kashmiri students at a private university in northeastern India were suspended indefinitely and removed from their dorms on Monday after they cheered for the Pakistani team during a televised cricket match against India.

title: For Bitcoin, Secure Future Might Need Oversight
description: Nearly half a billion dollars has gone missing, and nobody knows how. Some say there was outright theft. Others suspect fraud. Many blame lax controls, poor oversight and, above all, a reckless, globe-spanning, Wild West culture  a culture that everyone agrees is ripe for wholesale reform.

title: The Gun Report: March 5, 2014
description: This afternoon, New York Attorney General Eric Schneiderman announced an agreement with Facebook to monitor and eliminate illegal gun sales on its sites, calling it the strongest step ever taken to end illegal sales of firearms on social media sites. Facebook and its photo-sharing platform, Instagram, are not e-commerce sites, but they have been called out in recent months for hosting pages that boast background check-free gun sales across state lines to minors, felons and those with mental disabilities.

title: U.S. Hopes Boom in Natural Gas Can Curb Putin
description: WASHINGTON  The crisis in Crimea is heralding the rise of a new era of American energy diplomacy, as the Obama administration tries to deploy the vast new supply of natural gas in the United States as a weapon to undercut the influence of the Russian president, Vladimir V. Putin, over Ukraine and Europe.

title: Andris Nelsons to Open Boston Symphony Season With a Flourish
description: The Andris Nelsons era at the Boston Symphony Orchestra will begin in earnest on Sept. 27 when he opens his first season as its music director with a gala concert featuring Kristine Opolais, a rising soprano who happens to be his wife, and the tenor Jonas Kaufmann.

title: Geneva, Day 2
description: Jerry Garrett offers some highlights of the second day of press previews in Geneva.

title: A Top Models Online Wishing Well
description: In fiercely competitive world of tech start-ups, the idea of a website devoted to doing things out of the kindness of ones heart may seem counterintuitive. But thats just what the 26-year-old British model, actress and Cambridge graduate Lily Colehas put forth with her new online social platform and app,Impossible. The site, which debuted last year in the U.K. but launches stateside this month,functions as a real-life, high-tech giving tree of sorts. Users can post their wishes  for goods or services, for skills like learning to play the piano or for loftier goals like curing disease or ending prejudice  and grant those of others. Once a wish is granted, users post thank-you notes, taking the sites warm-and-fuzzy factor even further.

title: Last Looks at Lost Species
description: Not long after the magazine published Nathaniel Richs article about de-extinction, a book of the last known photographs taken of extinct animals circulated around the sixth floor. Errol Fullers Lost Animals: Extinction and the Photographic Record, is a sad and moving collection ofpassenger pigeons, heath hens, Tasmanian tigers and other vanished animals.

title: Music Born of Magical Thinking
description: Outside, the sleet came down like needles, a perfect night for slipper socks and 1940s weepers on Turner Classic Movies. But no: I have tickets to My Mother Has 4 Noses, a one-woman musical written and performed by the singer/songwriter Jonatha Brooke about the harrowing years when she saw her mother through the final stages of Alzheimers disease.

title: Where It Began
description: I received about 35,000 pieces of mail and propaganda from the Jews in this country, Harry Truman told Senator Claude Pepper in 1947. I put it all in a pile and struck a match to it. The man destined to be canonized by American Jews as a champion of Israel felt exhausted and outmatched by the young but influential Zionist lobby.

title: Was a Post on Russia Todays Abby Martin a Hit Piece?
description: The clip from Russia Todays Breaking the Set was riveting, and the moment unforgettable. The shows host, Abby Martin, stepped closer to the camera and  dropping any pretense of journalistic distance or impartiality  said exactly what she thought about the Russian governments action in Ukraine.

title: How Can I Talk to My Kids About Vaping if I Dont Really Know What That Means?
description: This weekend, Im setting out to buy a vape pipe. Or possibly a hookah pen, or an e-hookah.

title: At Every Performance, a Sweet Job Opening
description: At first, I thought the fix was in.

title: Iconoclasm Out of Austria
description: Since the Austrian Cultural Forum opened the doors of its tall, narrow East 52nd Street headquarters to the public in 2002, this vital, eager institution has teemed with illuminating exhibitions, lectures and concerts, presented free, week in and week out. It makes sense, then, that the forum is among the key participants in Vienna: City of Dreams, Carnegie Halls latest elaborate arts festival.

title: In Queens Raid, Federal Agents Seize Artifacts They Suspect Were Looted
description: The hunt for Indian antiquities allegedly smuggled into New York by Subhash Kapoor, a former Manhattan gallery owner accused of overseeing a $100 million art trafficking ring, led to a Queens warehouse Tuesday where federal officials seized hundreds of Southeast Asian and Indian items that they valued at $8 million.

title: What the Real George Smiley Thought
description: Fifteen years after the novelist John le Carr revealed John Bingham as one of the real-life models for his famous fictional spy George Smiley, he is answering a critic who says Bingham detested Mr. le Carrs opinions of the espionage game.

title: Turn Down the Volume: Researching the Science of Sound and Noise-Induced Hearing Loss
description: Why are a growing number of teenagers suffering from hearing loss? How can the noise in our lives be dangerous? How do our ears and our brain work together to detect sound?

title: Testimony at Hacking Trial Gives Peek Into British Tabloids
description: LONDON  When Rebekah Brooks first entered the witness box in Britains phone hacking trial, her lawyer reminded the jury that she was not on trial for running Rupert Murdochs tabloid newspapers.

title: Schoolboy Q Tops Chart for Top Dawg
description: The success of the rapper Kendrick Lamar over the last year or so has turned the music industrys attention to his record label, Top Dawg Entertainment. A small independent based in Los Angeles, the label released Mr. Lamars good kid, m.A.A.d city in October 2012 through a distribution deal with the Interscope Records, and the album went to No. 2 and earned Mr. Lamar seven Grammy nominations (though he won none).

title: Obama Budget Seeks to Eliminate Inversions
description: Buried in the $3.9 trillion budget request that President Obama sent to Congress on Tuesday is a clause that has Wall Street tax advisers on edge.

title: Barclays Chief Defends Contentious Increase in Bonus Pay
description: Barclays chief executive, Antony Jenkins, told the Telegraph newspaper in Britain that he decided to increase bankers pay last year in spite of falling profits to avoid a death spiral in the investment bank unit, where the rate of attrition among senior bankers last year doubled.

title: Pro-Russian Forces Regain Donetsk Center
description: Pro-Russian protesters recaptured the administrative headquarters of the eastern Ukrainian city of Donetsk just hours after Ukrainian authorities managed to take back control.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Moncler Gamme Rouge Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Valerio Mezzanotti.

title: Ex-Trader Kerviel Takes the Long Way Home
description: PARIS  Pilgrimage of penance  or Hail Mary publicity stunt?

title: Brooklyn to the Big Time, but First a Stop in Mississippi
description: ELLISVILLE, Miss.  The energy in the home locker room at A.B. Howard Gymnasium was slightly more charged than usual on a cold Monday night last month. The mens basketball team at Jones County Junior College, a two-year school in this small farming community, miles from nowhere, was minutes from the opening tip of a big game against Pearl River Community College, and Coach Jay Ladner was dusting off some of his finest material.

title: Theater Producers Lobby for an Upstate Tax Credit
description: A group of Broadway producers and theatrical tour operators, on a lobbying trip to Albany on Wednesday, proposed a new state tax credit that would aim to entice producers to prepare national tours of Broadway shows in Buffalo, Rochester, Syracuse and other upstate cities rather than go to states that already have such tax breaks.

title: Consumers Allowed to Keep Health Plans for Two More Years
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration, grappling with continued political fallout over its health care law, said Wednesday that it would allow consumers to renew health insurance policies that did not comply with the new law for two more years, pushing the issue well beyond this falls midterm elections.

title: With Eye on Midterms, Obama Pushes Rise in Minimum Wage
description: NEW BRITAIN, Conn.  Flanked by four like-minded New England governors, President Obama took his campaign for a higher federal minimum wage to this rough-hewed city on Wednesday, declaring that nobody who works full time should ever have to raise a family in poverty.

title: The Senates Hierarchy of Victimhood
description: Debo Adegbile did his job, and for that he was deemed unfit by the Senate to become the head of the Justice Departments Civil Rights Division. His misstep, specifically, was helping represent a death-row inmate while he was director of litigation at the NAACP Legal Defense Fund.

title: Early Treatment Is Found to Clear H.I.V. in a 2nd Baby
description: BOSTON  When scientists made the stunning announcement last year that a baby born with H.I.V. had apparently been cured through aggressive drug treatment just 30 hours after birth, there was immediate skepticism that the child had been infected in the first place.

title: Wedding Q. and A.
description: Rehearsal Dinner Invites

title: Housing Hunting in ... Croatia
description: A SIX-BEDROOM VILLA ON KOBAS BAY IN CROATIA

title: K.K.R. Raises $2 Billion Energy Fund
description: The private equity giant Kohlberg Kravis Roberts is making a bigger push into the North American energy business, with a fresh $2 billion fund to invest in oil and gas assets.

title: E.M.T.s With a Funny Bone
description: In seven seasons of Rescue Me, Denis Leary proved he could do drama with humor. In his new show, Sirens, he changes it up, proving he can do comedy without humor. Its not clear why you would want to do this, but there it is.

title: A Virtuous Divorced Man, Pestered to Date Again
description: At times over the last dozen years, George Lopez has often seemed as if he were waging a one-man crusade against the dismaying underrepresentation of Latinos on mainstream English-language television in the United States. First there was his long-running sitcom George Lopez. Then came Lopez Tonight, his spunky late-night talk show.

title: Its the End of a Travoltified Season
description: LOS ANGELES  What was that we were saying about cynicism?

title: Amid the Slush Piles and Proofs Lurks a Page-Turner With a Dirty Secret
description: Chris Pavone managed to turn his experience in book editing and living in Luxembourg into an Edgar-winning spy novel, The Expats. With The Accident, he matches that first novels nail-biting level of excitement while continuing to write about what he knows. The Accident is a thriller about publishing, and if that sounds like an oxymoron, Mr. Pavone is very good at rendering it wildly dramatic. Hes also good at diverting close scrutiny about where any holes in his story may be. He just keeps the shocks coming and leaves the head scratching for later.

title: Study Gives Hope of Altering Genes to Repel H.I.V.
description: The idea of genetically altering peoples cells to make them resist the virus that causes AIDS may seem like a pipe dream, but a new report suggests it can be done.

title: No Messiah, but It Does Bring the House Down
description: Handel, in his late 50s, was on a roll. His oratorio Samson had its premiere in February 1743, less than a year after Messiah.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ukraine and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Ukraine, South Africa, France and China.

title: News Flash: John Cornyn Is Really Conservative
description: Steve Stockman, the fringe-right congressman from Texas, spent the last few weeks trying to make the case that Senator John Cornyn was insufficiently conservative. He lost Tuesdays Republican primary in part on his own merits  Texans expect their candidates to show up for a campaign  but also because the effort was unnecessary. Mr. Cornyn gave in to the Tea Party a long time ago.

title: LinkedIn Co-Founder Defends EBay Against Icahn
description: Carl C. Icahns battle against eBay has drawn a number of boldface names into the fray. The latest entrant happens to be one of the most prominent executives in Silicon Valley at the moment: the LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman.

title: Stark Drama Thats Found in Real Life
description: Vladimir V. Pozner, the Russian talk-show host who more than two decades ago spun the Cold War, is back on American television, warning CNN viewers not to believe everything they hear about Ukraine in the American news media.

title: Raising, and Understanding, the Class Clown
description: Look  hes under there, the teacher said, pointing.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ukraine and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Ukraine, Russia, South Africa and France.

title: What You Get for ... $700,000
description: WASHINGTON, D.C.

title: Ivess Study Resurrected, Inch by Inch
description: There was much hand wringing in the classical music world in the summer of 2012 when word emerged that Charles Ivess house in West Redding, Conn., was up for sale, and it seemed possible  likely, even  that this iconoclastic composers retreat faced imminent destruction. The asking price for the 18.5-acre property was $1.5 million, and developers were said to be eager to tear down the modest house in Fairfield County where Ives lived from 1914 until his death in 1954.

title: Rihanna Gets Checked Out at Paris Fashion Week
description: The singer took the prize as the weeks most inescapable front-row presence.

title: Rihanna Gets Checked Out
description: PARIS  Wait, was that Rihanna going by in a shopping cart?

title: Musical Allies and Brothers in Song
description: Its one thing for two longtime stars to share a double bill that pools their audiences and lets them play larger places. Its another to do what Paul Simon and Sting are doing on their arena tour together: actually to team up for about one-third of the concert, sharing songs and mingling the 14 backup musicians from their bands, displaying mutual respect without undue deference. (The tour has two T-shirts: one that reads Paul Simon & Sting on Stage Together, the other vice versa.)

title: At the End, a New Start
description: For many in the crowd, Nicolas Ghesquires debut collection for Louis Vuitton was the return of the prodigal son after his sudden and bitter departure from Balenciaga.

title: At the End, a New Start
description: PARIS  On Wednesday morning, the last day of Paris Fashion Week, a throng of attendees arrived at the Cour Carre of the Louvre a half-hour early to wait in line for Nicolas Ghesquires debut collection for Louis Vuitton.

title: Gold Coast Congress Shows Upside of Being Down Under
description: If you are planning a trip to Australia, it would be a good idea to visit the Gold Coast, south of Brisbane in Queensland, in February. That is when the eight-day Gold Coast Congress is held. A lot of top players compete, making the bridge excellent, but the social side is almost as important.

title: Kerry Continues Talks on Ukraine Crisis
description: Secretary of State John Kerry said he and his counterparts from Russia, France, Germany, Britain and Ukraine met in Paris and agreed to continue talks on how to stabilize Ukraine.

title: New Trips for Cycling in the City
description: If bicycling along the scenic countryside is getting a little ho-hum, Bicycle Adventures offers an alternative. The outfitter just began the Urban Adventure Series, four-day trips designed for the city lover  this year in Seattle; Portland and Bend, Ore.; and New York City.

title: Player Ratings: Ukraine 2, U.S. 0
description: In a game that offered little comfort to Coach Jurgen Klinsmann 99 days before the start of the World Cup in Brazil, the United States lost decisively to a team from Ukraine that appeared inspired in the face of the international crisis gripping its country.

title: A France Made of More Than Whimsy
description: Paris is no longer the center of the universe. Lamour no longer makes the world go round. And Catherine Deneuve, that regal symbol of eternal beauty and Gallic composure, has stepped down from her pedestal. Those are among the significant deviations from tradition in the 19th edition of Rendez-Vous With French Cinema, the annual showcase of recent French movies presented by the Film Society of Lincoln Center and Unifrance Films.

title: Travel Essentials | Tokyo
description: Where to eat, drink and caffeinate in Shibuya and the surrounding areas, courtesy of Takashi Murakami and the Scandanavian trio behind the coffee shop Fuglen.

title: Food Matters | Culture Klatch
description: The Japanese artist Takashi Murakami has teamed up with a trio of Scandinavian coffee and design aficionados to open Bar Zingaro, the coolest new cafe in Tokyo.

title: The Mystery Car of the Geneva Motor Show
description: The mystery car tooling around at the Geneva Motor Show this week, acting as a kind of V.I.P. shuttle, is itself a special vehicle. It is  more or less  a Hispano Suiza. But it is also something else. The car wears the badge Pic-Pic, which Geneva claims as its one and only hometown automaker.

title: Beethoven Sonatas for Two, With Violin and Piano Precisely Balanced
description: On Monday evening, the Greek violinist Leonidas Kavakos and the Italian pianist Enrico Pace presented the second installment of their three-part traversal of the complete Beethoven Sonatas for piano and violin at Zankel Hall. It was, in many ways, a seductive performance.

title: A Hip-Hop Everyman, Pumped Up for a Star Turn With a Top Album
description: Not all second bananas are sidekicks. Take Schoolboy Q, the Los Angeles rapper and longtime running mate of Kendrick Lamar, one of hip-hops ascendant stars. The two share a label, Top Dawg Entertainment, and they recently shared the cover of Billboard. Without a doubt, though, the stronger wind belongs to Mr. Lamar, an inventive stylist and mercurial personality loved by purists and progressives.

title: All the Glamour, With No Acceptance Speeches
description: WEST HOLLYWOOD, Calif.  Ive been here since 5, said Tom Ford, his hands encircling Anne Hathaways slim waist at the entrance to the Vanity Fair Oscars after-party on Sunday. It was nearly midnight. He waggled a finger at the bow tie worn by Ms. Hathaways husband, Adam Shulman, who didnt seem to mind.

title: SAT Scores of the Rich and Famous
description: The College Board announced today that it will fundamentally change the SAT exam and return to the old 1,600 grading scale, which prompted a wave of people tweeting their SAT scores, followed by a wave of people tweeting their annoyance about the tweeting of SAT scores.

title: Escaping Winter in New York
description: We have been through so much in this seemingly unending and often brutal winter.

title: Repairing History and Other Dog Tricks
description: The setup for Peabodys Improbable History was simple: It featured the cartoon tales of a dog and his adopted boy (who just happened to share a time machine). Sherman, the boy, played the panting straight man to the dog, Mr. Peabody, rather than the lad in danger, like Timmy did with that brave collie Lassie. And while Lassie had her fine points, she was a tongue-lolling dunce when compared to Mr. Peabody.

title: Heavy Petting Is Allowed
description: If you want to be in vogue next fall, you had best start saving now, for there was fur on the runway in show after show, especially in softer colors. At Marc Jacobs, there were ombr pastel jackets; at the up-and-comer Kaelen, pretty pink stoles; at Gucci, shaggy toppers in pinks and blues. Fashion week showgoers appeared hip to what they would see on the catwalk, as they, too, bundled up in chalky furs. Already, there are furry bits for spring in the stores: offbeat shearling lace-up oxfords from Amlie Pichard and faux-fur clutches and jackets from the English label Shrimps, any of which are sly options for getting the look. As are these cheerfully surreal earrings, a collaboration between Fendi and the jeweler Delfina Delettrez, for whom an eye is a signature motif.

title: Events and Sales Starting the Week of March 6
description: Openings and Events

title: Paris Fashion Week: Hermes Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Catering to the Refined Ruffian
description: A THUG AGES. Slows down. Softens. Begins to look both ways when crossing the street. Walks a little more slowly around older people. Looks babies in the eye, and smiles.

title: Dutiful, Beautiful, Morning and Night
description: Zo Kravitz, 25, the daughter of the singer Lenny Kravitz and the actress Lisa Bonet, has pursued both of her parents professions. Her new projects include a supporting role in the soon-to-be-released Divergent, an action movie based on the first book in a trilogy of young-adult novels by Veronica Roth. Born in the Venice section of Los Angeles, Ms. Kravitz, who is also a member of the rock band Lolawolf, now lives in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, with the kind of luxuriously bohemian beauty regimen common to each neighborhood.

title: One Part Mr. Peanut, One Part Hipster Chic
description: The one-lensed eyepiece, an item favored by 19th-century military men, robber barons and Mr. Peanut, is finding itself wedged anew into the ocular sockets of would-be gentlemen seeking to emulate the stern countenances of their stuffy forebears.

title: Envy, Anger and the 1 Percent
description: To the Editor:

title: Redoing a Nest for Bird-Watchers
description: The Norman Bird Sanctuary is 325 acres of startling geography overlooking the Atlantic Ocean and the Sakonnet River in Middletown, R.I. Its benefactor was Mabel Norman Cerio, a local artist who lived in its farmhouse in the late 19th century and bequeathed the property for the propagation, preservation and protection of birds. Since 1949, the sanctuary has done just that, but Ms. Cerios 18th-century house has been slowly rotting away. In a collaboration between the Urban Design Group of Bristol, R.I., and Foster Associates of Portsmouth, R.I., the place was taken down to its studs and meticulously reconstructed. Its spare, though not spartan, so the emphasis is on the architectural details and the views. The farmhouse has seven bedrooms and sleeps 16 (there are three bunk beds in one bedroom); it is open for retreats of all sorts, from family weekend roosts to yoga retreats. Natasha Harrison, executive director of the Norman Bird Sanctuary, said that next year she hopes to host artists residencies, too. Information: 401-846-2577 or normanbirdsanctuary.org.

title: Architecture to Promote Healing and Comfort
description: In 1995, Maggie Keswick, an expert on Chinese gardens who was terminally ill with breast cancer, founded an organization with her husband, the architecture critic Charles Jencks, to provide free information and support for people with cancer and their families. The first Maggies Centre opened in Edinburgh in November 1996, a year after her death, with services that included guidance in navigating the medical system and advice on where to buy a wig. Now there are 16 centers in Britain and one in Hong Kong. All are on the grounds of cancer hospitals, and share a reliance on design to promote healing and comfort. Architecture amplifies the message, Mr. Jencks said. Maggies Centres: A Blueprint for Cancer Care, on view from Friday through April 25 at the New York School of Interior Design, features centers designed by Frank Gehry (in Dundee), Rem Koolhaas, Richard Rogers, Steven Holl, and Piers Gough with Paul Smith. Information: 212-472-1500 or nysid.edu.

title: Tapping Into a Goodnight
description: Insomnia is always a miserable experience, but at least it used to be an eclectic one. On long nights, a sleepless soul had options: toss and turn, pour a drink, smoke a cigarette, organize shoes, watch TV, count sheep, look out the window. Evelyn Waugh sipped a mixture of bromide and crme de menthe; William Styron stared straight ahead into the darkness.

title: Nordic, for Outdoors
description: It may seem counterintuitive to ask a couple of guys from Scandinavia to design outdoor furniture, but that is the brief Design Within Reach gave to Jonas Bjerre-Poulsen and Kasper Ronn of NORM Architects in Copenhagen. We can really only use it six months a year; its so snowy and rainy, Mr. Bjerre-Poulsen said. But who else can be counted on to draw from the serene midcentury modern aesthetic of Danish designers like Finn Juhl? The nine-piece group, which is called Finn after Mr. Juhl and is the first outdoor furniture collection developed exclusively for Design Within Reach, includes tables, chairs and recliners, below. The pieces are framed in teak with seats of Serge Ferrari mesh or Sunbrella upholstery. Prices range from $375 for a side table to $1,985 for a dining table. Information: 800-944-2233 or dwr.com.

title: Sales at Ann Gish, Artek and More
description: Ann Gish is discounting some sample bed linens by up to 80 percent through Saturday (a king-size quilted silk charmeuse coverlet, usually $1,200, is $240); 4 West 20th Street (Fifth Avenue), 212-727-2122, anngish.com.

title: Should I Replace Fake Wood Paneling?
description: Q. Some of the walls in our house are covered in fake wood paneling. Should we replace it?

title: Getting Contractors to Man Up
description: When stories about home renovation end in tears, the villain, likelier than not, is the contractor. Now a reality show purports to find the bad eggs and bring them to justice. Catch a Contractor starts Sunday on Spike TV, hosted by the comedian, author and radio personality Adam Carolla. For the series, Mr. Carolla, who is 49 and had a previous career in carpentry, teams up with Skip Bedell, a general contractor, and Mr. Bedells wife, Alison, a private investigator. Their mission: track down negligent contractors, return them to the scene of the crime and assist them in making amends. (This interview was edited and condensed.)

title: Our Homes, Our Selfies
description: What a clever conceit the British designer and journalist Rob Meyers had to mail disposable cameras to musicians, artists, designers and bloggers, asking if they would snap pictures of their homes. They seemed to like the idea that it was non-intrusive, Mr. Meyers writes in the introduction to his new book, Behind Closed Doors: The Private Homes of 25 of the Worlds Most Creative People ($29.95, Hardie Grant).

title: Salad Bowls and Servers: Croutons Optional
description: As the executive director of Edible Schoolyard NYC, it is Kate Brasharess job to help children learn how to grow and prepare their own food.

title: Russian Channels War Coverage Continues to Cost It Journalists
description: Russia Today, a government-funded English language news channel that says it is available to 644 million people worldwide and 85 million in the United States, has been rocked in recent days by two of its anchors protesting its coverage of Ukraine.

title: Scratching a Niche
description: I recently asked a distinguished garden designer what I should plant in the blank space next to my garage, and he said a wheat field. Interesting choice. But then Ive read that heritage grains are fashionable in that obsolete kind of way: like landlines and pencils and romantic love.

title: A Keen Eye on the Fitness Scene
description: As beginnings go, Well&Good NYCs wasnt exactly auspicious, with posts such as Keeping Your Runners High in High Temperatures and Does Your Apartment Need a Master Cleanse? Even the websites November 2009 missive about the heinous karmic crime of TriBeCa yogis stealing their studios $70 mats  which put Well&Good on the map when New York magazine picked it up  today makes its founders, Alexia Brue and Melisse Gelula, cringe as if they were confronting old yearbook photos.

title: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: 99 Days
description: The 2014 World Cup begins on June 12, when Brazil plays Croatia in the opening match. Reporters and editors for The Times will count down to the start of the tournament each day with a short capsule of news and interesting tidbits.

title: Through Van Notens Eyes
description: PARIS  The most surprising thing about the new Dries Van Noten exhibition, which runs through Aug. 31 at the Muse des Arts Dcoratifs here, is twofold: how much Dries Van Noten there is in it, and how much Dries Van Noten there isnt in it.

title: Laws in California Governing Chicken Farms
description: To the Editor:

title: Sean Potts, 83, Master of the Tin Whistle and a Founder of the Chieftains, Dies
description: Sean Potts, who learned to play the tin whistle from his grandfather in the 1930s and for a time made an international career out of it as a founding member of the traditional Irish band the Chieftains, died on Feb. 11 in Dublin. He was 83.

title: The Digital Classroom
description: To the Editor:

title: Michael Fords Homeplace: Mississippi in the 1970s
description: The filmmaker found a home and life lessons in unexpected terrain  a blacksmith shop in Oxford, Miss., where all people, young, old, black, white, drunk, sober, were treated equally.

title: Drug Arrests and Race
description: To the Editor:

title: His Profile, and His Plumage, Grow Ever More Bold
description: Last Friday, at a soundstage in Los Angeles, the only article of clothing Johnny Weir didnt change five times was a pair of Versace underwear.

title: Federal Truck-Size Limits
description: To the Editor:

title: Criminal Charges Expected for 3 Former Dewey & LeBoeuf Executives
description: Three former top executives of Dewey & LeBoeuf, the giant law firm that filed for bankruptcy protection in 2012, are expected to be charged on Thursday with misleading other lawyers and lenders about the financial health of the firm.

title: Stairs, an East Village Gay Club, Opens
description: In recent years, the East Village gay bar scene has diminished as places like the Slide, the Hose and the Urge have closed. So neighborhood gays were curious when a new club called Stairs opened in January.

title: For the Infamous, More Than 15 Minutes
description: I dont mind calling them D-listers, said Gina Rodriguez, the former pornographic-film actress from Los Angeles, who has carved out an unlikely second career representing tabloid fodder like Anthony Weiners ex-sexting gal pal, Sydney Leathers; the parents of Lindsay Lohan, and various cast members from Bravos Real Housewives series.

title: Coal Firm to Pay Record Penalty and Spend Millions on Water Cleanup in 5 States
description: One of the nations biggest coal companies will pay a record civil penalty and will spend tens of millions of dollars to clean up water flowing from mines in five states, the Environmental Protection Agency and the Justice Department announced on Wednesday.

title: Notes Composed for the Nose
description: The city was blanketed in winter, but in a kitchen with a birds-eye view of Central Park, Fabio Luisi was conjuring up spring.

title: This Old Thing Is Turning Heads
description: Perhaps the most captivating fashion statement this season in New York was not on the runway or the street, but at the Winter Antiques Show: a modest black and white vintage dress, in mint condition and priced at $135,000, displayed by Allan Katz Americana, that was vigorously photographed, shared on Instagram and Facebook, and pinned on Pinterest.

title: Infections Linked to Chinese Seafood Markets in New York
description: At least 30 people have contracted a rare skin infection after buying seafood at markets in Chinese neighborhoods across New York City, prompting health officials to issue a warning to consumers and market workers to take precautions when handling raw or live fish.

title: Wisconsin and the Unions
description: Wisconsin and the Unions

title: The Wildebeest in the Room
