description: Malaysian authorities examined whether a military radar detected Flight 370.

title: Site of Building Collapse
description: Map of the site in Harlem.

title: A Luxe Leather Bike Designed by Pharrell
description: Pharrell Williamss style is almost as popular as his music this year. In January, the Twittersphere buzzed when the artist arrived to the red carpet wearing a Vivienne Westwood hat that looked undeniably similar to the Arbys logo. A week ago, social media flared up again when Williams walked into the Oscars with his hands shoved into the pockets of a pair of Lanvin tuxedo shorts. And yet somehow, the luxe limited-edition Brooklyn Bike that he created with the Paris duo Bruno Domeau and Philip Prsand Brooklyn Machine Works  a New York-based bike company that Williams co-owns  is flying just under the trending hashtag radar. Just looking at the bright-yellow water-buffalo leather hand-stitched around its frame makes you feel as happy as Williamss song of the same name. Its available exclusively at Atelier Courbet, a new SoHo shop and gallery that represents artisan workshops like the one run by Domeau and Prs, who, before setting up shop together, were craftsmen for Herms. The made-to-order pieces are customized for each client; at $16,500, it is more a piece of art than a way to get around town.

title: Breaking Bad Creator Vince Gilligans Next Project: An Appearance on Community
description: After bringing his AMC series Breaking Bad to its highly praised conclusion and earning an Emmy Award for outstanding drama, creator Vince Gilligan probably could have done anything he wanted for his next act.

title: Reducing Early Elective Deliveries
description: How do institutions change their practices? In medicine, the usual answer is slowly. Clinical trials can show the efficacy of a new practice  yet, decades later, many physicians still havent gotten the message.

title: Two Maharashtra Parties Compete for National Partys Affections
description: NEW DELHI  Two cousins, leaders of rival right-wing parties in the western state of Maharashtra, are engaged in a power struggle that has far-reaching implications for one of the oldest political alliances in the states history.

title: Postcard From Paris: Artaud and van Gogh
description: PARIS  In the last desperate months of his life, Vincent van Gogh retreated to the French countryside of wheat fields and thatched houses where he warned in a letter to his brother that I risk my life for my own work.

title: Fort Tilden and The Great Invisible Win SXSW Film Awards
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  A comedy about an ill-fated trip to the beach and a documentary about the 2010 Deepwater Horizon oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico won the top awards at the South by Southwest film festival on Tuesday night.

title: SXSW 2014: Jungle Unmasked, Sort Of
description: A mystery shouldnt have a banal solution. But it did with Jungle, a London R&B group that made its first career moves with determined anonymity: it had said only that its leaders were named T and J, it used dancers (mostly black men) in its videos, and it employed stills from those videos as publicity photos. By the end of the year, the New Musical Express was calling Jungle the UKs most mysterious act. On tour, Jungle has generally performed in a thick smoke-machine fog.

title: Today in Small Business: Yelp Gets Negative Reviews
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today:

title: Scrabble Contest Seeks New Words
description: Playing questionable words in Scrabble is a venerable tradition, originating long before Jerrys mother threw down quone in an episode of Seinfeld, or George W. Bush offered dignitude against Al Gore in a 2000 Saturday Night Live skit.

title: Missing Rockwell Painting Found in Ohio
description: A Norman Rockwell painting that went missing from a Queens warehouse last year has been recovered in Ohio, according to the art-storage company that had been keeping it.

title: Changes at Motherlode: Living the Family Dynamic
description: Living the Family Dynamic.

title: The Unhip, Unexpected Joys of Cruising
description: I have an embarrassing admission to make: I like cruises.

title: Inside the Design of Cruise Itineraries
description: If youve been on a cruise, chances are it was designed by someone like Terry Thornton. For more than 25 years, he has helped create itineraries for Carnival Cruise Lines, the largest of the cruise industry companies, balancing fuel costs with revenue and customer feedback for a 24-ship fleet that regularly loops through ports in Mexico and the Caribbean.

title: Prone to Seasickness? Distraction Might Help
description: Few things will ruin a cruise faster than feeling seasick. To help prevent motion sickness, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends staying hydrated, curbing alcohol and caffeinated drinks, eating small meals and limiting external stimuli (closing your eyes, lying face down or keeping your eyes on the horizon). And while some experts say that cabins in the middle of the lower deck of a ship may help temper motion sickness, the C.D.C. has reported that cabin location on a cruise ship does not appear to influence the likelihood of motion sickness.

title: Performance Festival at LaMaMa to Honor Tom Murrin
description: Tom Murrin, the lawyer turned playwright and performance artist, who often appeared under the names Tom Trash, Jack Bump and Alien Comic, and who died in 2012, will be commemorated in an 11-day Tom Murrin Full Moon Performance Festival at La MaMa in April.

title: Photos: The Big Easts Garden Party
description: The way the Big East tells it, this years mens basketball tournament represents a return to the conferences roots as a group of proud basketball schools that escaped from under the thumb of all-powerful college football to revel in their sports greatness. And they will do it at Madison Square Garden, the conference tournaments home since 1983. In reality, the Big Easts current membership would stump most Jeopardy contestants, and the gathering is certain to feel haunted by the ghosts of departed stalwarts like Syracuse, Connecticut and Pittsburgh.

title: In Store | Just in Time for SXSW, A Shoppable Home Away From Home
description: For a certain type of girl during a certain stretch of the aughts, I Heart  the late, lamented subterranean NoLIta boutique housed in Sonic Youths former practice space  was more than a place to shop for night-out looks from under-the-radar designers; it was a second home of sorts, a spot for kicking back, listening to obscure dance records and reading zines. That stores owner, Jill Bradshaw, recently decamped to Austin, Tex., her old college stomping grounds. Now, just in time for the South by Southwest conference, she has joined forces with two more Brooklyn expats, the restaurateurs Greg Mathews and Jade Place Mathews, to openFriends & Neighbors, an equally convivial concept store housed in a residential bungalow in burgeoning East Austin.

title: Times Minute | The Search for Flight 370
description: A look at the search efforts for the Malaysia Airlines plane that vanished early Saturday morning.

description: Representative-elect David Jolly, a Republican, spoke after narrowly winning a special election for a House seat in a hotly contested swing district in Florida.

description: Two of the stars of Neighbors discuss their film.

title: Supporting Start-Ups With Connections, Advice and Caffeine
description: Lauren Cannon was clearly nervous as she started a carefully prepared presentation about her start-up, PackSack, which makes a reusable grocery bag that folds into itself for storing. Just 22, Ms. Cannon was speaking to a forum of 20 entrepreneurs in a conference room at Co-Merge, a sleekly outfitted co-working space in downtown San Diego. She talked about her market research, her decision to manufacture in Mexico and her pricing.

title: Buffett Shrinks Ties to the Graham Family

description: AUSTIN, Tex.  With the tech world as its subject, the coming HBO series Silicon Valley could only benefit by holding its premiere here at South by Southwest, home to a huge interactive conference.

title: A Song-and-Dance Survival Strategy
description: When I left the 3LD Art & Technology Center the other night, I had half of a pulled-pork sandwich in my pocket, and Vaclav Havel was dancing around the room, singing a rambunctious version of the Velvet Undergrounds Im Waiting for the Man to live accompaniment. Such are the happy vagaries of a New York theater critics life.

title: Planes Locating Device Went Silent Before Disappearance
description: WASHINGTON  One of the mysteries surrounding Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 concerns the aircrafts transponder, which apparently stopped functioning about 40 minutes into the flight, leaving ground controllers in the dark about where the plane was.

title: Scenes From the Building Collapse
description: A gas leak set off a large explosion and the collapse of two buildings in East Harlem.

title: The Other People Are Back. Do They Ever Leave?
description: Unlike poor deluded Blanche DuBois, nobody in Jean-Paul Sartres bleakly comic existential thesis, No Exit, depends on the kindness of strangers. At least not for long. The principal characters in this needling 1944 one-act play, being revived by the Pearl Theater Company, learn the hard way that Hell is just  other people.

title: Scenes From the Harlem Building Collapse
description: Multiple fatalities have been reported in the collapse.

title: Secrets Rooted in a Family Tree
description: In his 2010 play Neighbors, Branden Jacobs-Jenkins featured black actors in blackface to grapple with self-loathing among blacks. In his latest work to open in New York, Appropriate, he is more subtle: Incendiary visuals are the crux of the plot, but the audience never sees them.

title: Kerry Plans 11th-Hour Meeting With Russians Over Crimea
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State John Kerry will fly to London to meet with his Russian counterpart in a 11th-hour effort to persuade the Kremlin not to move forward with the annexation of Crimea, American officials said on Wednesday.

title: Q&A: The Fed Will Manage a Soft Landing
description: John Williams, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco, is feeling pretty good about the economy. He is ready to continue the Feds retreat from bond-buying and forward guidance. And he says hes optimistic that this time, the Fed will manage to produce a soft landing. The transcript of our conversation earlier this week has been lightly edited for clarity.

description: Claire Chase performs Edgard Varses Density 21.5 on a platinum flute.

title: House Hunting in ... Luxembourg
description: A SIX-BEDROOM FARMHOUSE-STYLE VILLA IN MUNSBACH

title: A New York Artists Wartime Childhood
description: Lush violet shadows, a sense of the page as a deep box  a stage, really  in which a quiet drama unfolds in acute perspective: New Yorkers may recognize James McMullans signature watercolors from his posters for Lincoln Center Theater. (His saucy sailor girl, looking back over her shoulder to advertise a production of Anything Goes at the Vivian Beaumont, is a particularly well-known example.) New York Times readers may remember the illustrated 12-part series McMullan wrote on the artistic process for the Opinionator blog in 2010. And children and their art-loving parents will recall the many picture books he has illustrated, including the Times Best Illustrated winner I Stink!  written by his wife, Kate McMullan  a first-person account of the life of a garbage truck. Know what I do at night while youre asleep? Eat your trash, thats what! See those bags? I smell breakfast!

title: Groundhog Days
description: Gail Collins: David, this will be our last online conversation for a while. But well still run into each other in the hall, right?

title: New Trips to North Korea and Iran
description: Over the last three decades, Douglas Grimes, the founder of Mir, a tour company, has built a business around his ability to gain access to destinations that are difficult to reach, and this year he adds North Korea to the list, offering an 11-day tour making stops in Nampo and Pyongyang, as well as Kaesong, in the demilitarized zone.

title: Ligety, Giant Slalom Specialist, Gains First Podium in Downhill
description: LENZERHEIDE, Switzerland  Three weeks after Ted Ligety of the United States won gold in the giant slalom at the Winter Olympics in Sochi, Russia, he notched another first: a top-three finish in the downhill.

title: Health Mandate Wont Be Delayed, Sebelius Says
description: WASHINGTON  Kathleen Sebelius, the secretary of health and human services, said Wednesday that the Obama administration would not extend the deadline for people to sign up for health insurance or delay the requirement for most Americans to have coverage.

title: Metro-North Service Restored After Explosion in Harlem
description: Updated, 5:12 p.m.

title: Dispatches From SXSW: A Winning Translation App
description: On Sunday night before a packed house at the Austin Hilton Downtown, winners of the SXSW Accelerator Awards were announced. The ceremony is the culmination of a two-day tech competition where some of the worlds most innovative start-ups pitch themselves to a panel of judges including venture capitalists, angel investors and industry executives. Out of hundreds of initial applicants and 48 preliminary finalists, 18 were chosen to return on Sunday and six were named winners.

title: CBS Signs Up Big Bang for Three More Years
description: How important is The Big Bang Theory to CBS? Important enough for the network to step up to an unusual order for three more seasons of what is now by far the biggest hit on network television.

title: Panel Says Yemeni Man Should Stay in Detention
description: WASHINGTON  A parole-style panel at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, has decided to recommend that the military continue to hold a Yemeni man in indefinite wartime detention without trial, according to a military document. The decision is the first of its kind for the Obama administrations new Periodic Review Board system.

title: What 1 Million Cups Has Meant to Kansas City
description: As Eilene Zimmerman writes in an article we just published, 1 Million Cups has been part of a serendipitous series of events that has helped galvanize the Kansas City start-up community.

title: Image of the Day: March 12
Debate on Bourbon St.: Should the Good Times Roll Less Loudly?
description: NEW ORLEANS  Last Thursday, two nights after Mardi Gras, amid the customary debauchery that is apparently immune to the chill and the Lenten hangover, a tall man with a device resembling a 1980s-era cellphone was going door to door on Bourbon Street.

title: A Landmark Restored, From Mosaic Marble Floor to Grand Dome
description: As sumptuous as a jewel box suspended 110 feet over the mosaic marble floor, and as radiant as a peacocks plumage, the great dome of the former Williamsburgh Savings Bank headquarters at Broadway and Driggs Avenue once again inspires awe.

title: F.T.C. Inquiry Into Herbalife Prompts Big Share Selloff
description: The Federal Trade Commission said on Wednesday that it had opened an official inquiry into Herbalife, the nutritional supplement company that has been the focus of a 15-month crusade by the hedge fund billionaire William A. Ackman.

title: Resurrecting Republican Populism
description: If you want to cut to the heart of whats gone wrong in the Republican Party over the last two presidential cycles, you could do worse than start with this post from the liberal blogger Kevin Drum, lamenting the weakness of his own partys pitch to working and middle class voters:

title: Fannie Mae Investors May Be Using Magic Calculators
description: Fannie Mae investors may be using magic calculators. As the latest overhaul blueprint takes shape in the Senate, hedge funds like Fairholme Capital Management have urged Washington to revitalize Fannie, the mortgage finance giant, which along with Freddie Mac was kept alive with nearly $190 billion of taxpayer cash in the aftermath of the financial crisis.

title: Gel Protects Monkeys From H.I.V. After Sex, Study Finds
description: In another promising development in AIDS prevention, scientists have shown that monkeys can be protected against infection with a vaginal gel even when it is used as long as three hours after sex.

title: New Book From Oprah Winfrey Is What I Know for Sure
description: Oprah Winfrey has written a new book collecting some of her insights about lifes struggles and inspirations, her publisher said on Wednesday.

title: Arizona Governor With Tough Immigration and Abortion Stands Wont Run Again
description: GLENDALE, Ariz.  Gov. Jan Brewer of Arizona, a Republican whose approval of controversial measures on immigration and abortion have repeatedly put her in the national spotlight, announced Wednesday that she would not run for re-election, ending speculation that she might seek a third term.

title: What You Get for ... $1,850,000
description: VENICE BEACH, CALIF.

title: Atomico Adds to Investment in Brazil
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil  Atomico, the venture capital firm led by Niklas Zennstrom, the co-founder of Skype, is investing in Brazil again, a sign that entrepreneurship continues to grow here even amid a lagging economy.

title: Gaza-Israel Escalation Threatens Cease-Fire
description: JERUSALEM  Sixty rockets fired from the Gaza Strip rained down across southern Israel on Wednesday afternoon, sending thousands of Israelis scrambling into bomb shelters, in by far the most intense barrage since a cease-fire that ended eight days of cross-border violence in 2012.

title: Spurred by Paul, Kentucky Weighs Change to Ballot Rule
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky has not said if he plans to run for the Republican presidential nomination in 2016, but his supporters are already backing a bill in his states Legislature that would let him appear more than once on the ballot.

title: Where to Find the Most Inequality
description: The gap between the rich and poor has increased in 94 of the 100 largest metropolitan areas since 1990. And the growth in the gap has accelerated in the past few years.

title: Avid Reader Leaves Library $6 Million in Her Will
description: Simply because she loved to read, Lotte Fields bequeathed $6 million to the New York Public Library after her death, the library announced on Wednesday.

title: By Design | Architecture for Living
description: The grandson of a master mosaicist pays tribute to his heritage with a new furniture line.

title: De Blasio on East Harlem Explosion
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio said a gas leak caused the explosion that destroyed two buildings in Harlem.

title: A Wild Idea: Making Our Smartphones Last Longer
description: When Apple unveiled the iPhone 5 late in 2012, it was the fastest and most capable smartphone on the market, a highly intricate collection of electronics that had been miraculously forged into a single sturdy slab of aluminum and glass. Unlike most ephemeral gadgets, this phone felt as if it were built to last for ages.

title: App Smart: Birthdays
description: Kit Eaton describes three apps that can help you keep track of the birthdays for the people in your life.

title: Forget a Birthday? Not if the Phone Can Help It
description: ITS my birthday this week! Its a date I am not likely to forget, but I acknowledge that when it comes to friends or family members birthdays, my memory is awful. Often, I even miss the Its Xs birthday alerts that pop up in Facebook. Beyond simple calendar alerts, many apps can help you remember and celebrate a birthday.

title: Blast Ripped the Stomach Right Out of You
description: The explosion was so powerful it lifted Jaye Virgo off her bed and blasted her window fan from the sill. Outside that window was chaos. People lay on the pavement, strewed among shattered glass and parts ripped from cars, the sidewalk dusted in ash.

title: Jackson Heights: More Space; Hold the Frills
description: Jill Schwartzman moved often within Manhattan and Brooklyn, always happy to sample a new location. When she and Brian Shirey met in 2006, he lived in Astoria, Queens. She found the borough interesting, diverse and delicious.

title: Huge Recall by G.M. Sets Off Painful Questions on Crashes
description: LEXINGTON, Ala.  The broken windshield and singed grass that have been on the side of State Route 64 since December serve as a daily reminder for the unsettling hunch that nags Steve W. Smith: Something about that accident was not quite right.

title: Bolshoi Soloist to Debut as Guest Artist With Ballet Theater
description: Olga Smirnova, a leading soloist with the Bolshoi Ballet who had a breakout season in London last summer, will make her debut as a guest artist with American Ballet Theater in May at the Metropolitan Opera House, where she will dance in a single performance of La Bayadre, the company announced on Wednesday.

title: Mikhailovsky Ballet to Make American Debut at Koch Theater
description: The Mikhailovsky Ballet, a Russian dance troupe based in St. Petersburg, had planned to make its United States debut in the summer of 2012 but decided to scuttle the visit when the American Ballet Theater exercised a non-compete clause involving two dancers who worked with both companies, Natalia Osipova and Ivan Vasiliev.

title: Elliott Raises Stake in Juniper Networks
description: The hedge fund Elliott Management is raising its bet on Juniper Networks after the networking equipment company announced a series of new initiatives.

title: Russian Website Is Reined In Over Article on Ukrainian
description: MOSCOW  The retribution against one of Russias most popular independent online news organizations, Lenta.ru, was as swift as it was unexpected. And to many it served as an ominous warning about the state of the media today as the conflict over Ukraine deepens.

title: The Phony Bill to Help Sick Kids Actually Helps Corporations Extend Their Influence
description: One particularly effective (and cynical) way to roll back the public campaign finance system is to claim youre doing so on behalf of some needy group. Republicans do that kind of thing all the time, but Senate Democrats went along yesterday in a particularly unfortunate vote.

title: On the Street in East Harlem
description: A look at the aftermath of the Harlem building collapse.

title: Video: Seth Rogen and Zac Efron on Neighbors
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  The actors Seth Rogen and Zac Efron brought their coming summer comedy Neighbors to the South by Southwest film festival for a premiere screening. The movie, directed by Nicholas Stoller, follows what happens when a college fraternity moves in next door to a couple with a baby. Mr. Rogen and Rose Byrne star alongside Mr. Efron. In this video interview, conducted at an Austin bar that was converted into a makeshift version of a fraternity house, Mr. Rogen and Mr. Efron discuss their characters in Neighbors and their approach to the films comedy.

title: The Gun Report: March 12, 2014
description: Yesterday we brought you the tragic tale of Peter Lanza and his son, the perpetrator of the massacre at Sandy Hook Elementary. But something good followed the shooting: Fifteen states, plus the District of Columbia, have strengthened their gun control laws in the past year, regulations that cover roughly half of the U.S. population, according to a new report by Johns Hopkins Center for Gun Policy and Research.

title: Whos Who Becomes Lethal Guessing Game
description: Olen Steinhauers recent three-volume Milo Weaver series was about the Tourists, a top-secret C.I.A. spy unit. Milo was an exceptionally appealing character among black ops types. His personal life was as fraught as his cloak-and-dagger work, and when he wasnt trotting around the globe, he was apt to turn up in Brooklyn. But by the third installment, after the Chinese had entered the mix, the plot had thickened so much that it bordered on the impenetrable. Only the most seasoned le Carr buffs had the chops to tackle Mr. Steinhauers ever more elaborate tricks.

title: A Study Seeks to Determine What Makes Prekindergarten Successful
description: The teacher held up a card with a number on it, then looked at the 4-year-olds waving their hands eagerly in front of her. Anderson, she said, calling on a small boy in a blue button-up shirt and a sweater vest.

title: Personal Mix of Familiar and Fresh, With a Show-Tune Encore
description: The young American soprano Julia Bullock won lots of fans in New York last spring for her endearing, vocally radiant performance of the title role in Janaceks The Cunning Little Vixen, presented by Juilliard Opera in an enchanting production. Clearly Ms. Bullock is still faring well in her studies at Juilliard, for late next month, she will sing the title role in the schools production of Massenets Cendrillon.

title: Rainbow-Hued Housing for Gays in Golden Years
description: PHILADELPHIA  DENISE SAMEN, who is 65 and a military veteran, has not had an easy life. She lost an arm in a train accident, supported herself by working a series of low-paying service and clerical jobs, needs a wheelchair to get around and came of age when homosexuality was considered a psychiatric disorder. And though she has never hidden who she is  she often dresses in mens-styled clothing  she doesnt play it up, either.

title: Skier Taps Natural Terrain
description: Skier Tim Durtschi garnered attention for his exploits in ski resort terrain parks and jumps in the backcountry. But he has stepped away from manicured features to ski natural terrain.

title: Dudley Lashes Out at Banks
description: William C. Dudley, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, criticized banks for their lack of respect for law, regulation and the public trust.

title: Offering a German Lesson for Asias History Wars
description: Why not let him visit the Holocaust memorial? asked Chan Koonchung, a Beijing-based Hong Kong writer, of President Xi Jinping of China.

title: New Plays by Donald Margulies and David Auburn in Manhattan Theater Club Season
description: The Manhattan Theater Club will present new works by Donald Margulies, David Auburn and Frances Ya-Chu Cowhig as part of its 2014-15 season, the company announced Wednesday.

title: Keeping Stand-Up in the Box
description: Give him a microphone and 10 minutes in front of a live crowd, and Sean Patton, a short, rotund, live-wire comedian, is just about a sure thing.

title: In Club Hockey League, Meager Funding Doesnt Kill Appetite for Competition
description: NEWARK, Del.  After 19 games in six days, the American Collegiate Hockey Associations Division I mens national tournament ended Tuesday night with a matchup that reflected the breadth of the club league.

title: Art Sales Grew Last Year, Especially in U.S., Report Says
description: The sale of art and antiques around the world rose 8 percent last year to $65.9 billion, the highest level since 2007, continuing a recovery in the art market, according to the latest annual report for the European Fine Art Foundation.

title: Video: Skier Taps Natural Terrain for a Larger Canvas
description: Behind the Line is a video series produced by Teton Gravity Research that takes you into the minds of skiers. In each episode, the athletes will look back on a line, a jump or a session, and discuss the moment.

title: China, With You Behind the Wheel
description: Steppes Travel, a London-based company specializing in high-end cultural and archaeological tours, has introduced a 10- to 15-day trip to China with a self-drive component.

title: Jefferies in $25 Million Settlement With S.E.C.
description: The Jefferies Group, the investment bank and brokerage firm, agreed on Wednesday to pay $25 million to settle accusations by the Securities and Exchange Commission that it failed to supervise traders who lied to investors about the price of mortgage-backed securities.

title: Hitting the High Notes in Tribute
description: What do Freddie Mercury, Jimmy Scott, Frankie Valli and Enrico Caruso have in common? In Jarrod Spectors highly polished show, A Little Help From My Friends, at 54 Below on Monday evening, all were depicted as belonging to a line of tenors stretching into the mists of time. From this perspective, there isnt much difference among pop, rock, opera or even the blues. All are platforms for tenors and falsettos of every stripe to unleash their high notes.

title: Text to Text | Is the Wolf a Real American Hero? and Hunting Habits of Wolves Change Ecological Balance in Yellowstone
description: Was the reintroduction of wolves to Yellowstone National Park in the 1990s, after they were exterminated earlier in the century, the major ecological success story it has been declared to be by scientists and the media alike? Or, is the story  like ecology itself  much more complicated than that?

title: Paris Through Eddie Borgos Eyes
description: The jewelry designer Eddie Borgo recently returned from his semi-annual fashion-week trip to Paris, which offered, as usual, a mix of business (sales and press appointments) and pleasure (food, culture and a side trip to Versailles). From moldings to museum shows, the citys rich trove of decorative arts is particularly inspiring for Borgos metier. Here, he shares snapshots and stories from the journey.

title: Jacksons Triangle Offense: One Way to Reshape a Knicks Star
description: When Phil Jacksons most recent book tour took him to northern New Jersey last spring, he was asked for his opinion of the Knicks reigning star, Carmelo Anthony. Seldom shy, Jackson said, An amazing ballplayer who still has another level to step up.

title: In His Second Year, Pope Faces Expectations That Change Is Coming
description: VATICAN CITY  Pope Francis marks the first anniversary of his papacy on Thursday having become so globally celebrated that he recently felt compelled to deflate his own superman aura. He is a star of magazine covers and social media, praised for his welcoming, nonjudgmental persona, his embrace of the poor and his decisiveness in moving to reform an ossified Vatican bureaucracy.

title: Pharrell Williamss Happy Holds at No. 1; Rick Ross Tops Album Chart
description: Pharrell Williamss song Happy  and that Vivienne Westwood Mountain hat of his  have been ubiquitous lately, including in a performance at the Academy Awards last week. So it is not especially surprising that Happy holds at No. 1 on Billboards singles chart for a fourth week, with 490,000 downloads and eight million streams on services like Spotify, according to Nielsen SoundScan.

title: The Gray Jobs Enigma
description: In her years as a probation officer north of Dallas, Patricia Lowell reckoned that she would work until age 65, confident that she could then retire halfway comfortably on her pension and Social Security. After retiring, she thought, she would pick up some extra spending money by working part-time retail jobs during the holiday season.

title: For Some, Age Is No Obstacle to Entrepreneurship
description: WHEN Marvin Gay, 71, a retired accountant, and his wife, Leslie, 61, decided to open a Painting With a Twist franchise in St. Petersburg, Fla., their start-up costs were close to $70,000.

title: Transferring Old Palm Desktop Data
description: Q. I have been using the Windows XP Palm Desktop software for my calendar and contacts even though I dont use the Palm Pilot any longer. Is there a way to pull the information into Microsoft Outlook?

title: Classical Playlist: John Adams, Prokofiev, Harrison Birtwistle and More
description: JOHN ADAMS: The Gospel According to the Other Mary Los Angeles Philharmonic and Los Angeles Master Chorale, conducted by Gustavo Dudamel (Deutsche Grammophon)This capacious oratorio, with a libretto by Peter Sellars, John Adamss frequent collaborator, was revised from when I first heard it in Los Angeles two years ago. While it may be a bit tighter, its strengths and weaknesses remain: an enormously creative and confident score and a weak text (drawn largely from modern and ancient poetry) that makes ponderous political points. This is a clearly rendered, strongly sung version. The tenor Russell Thomas still makes a showstopper out of the aria that closes the first act, Tell Me: How Is This Night Different From All Other Nights? (Zachary Woolfe)

title: Candy Crush Maker Picks Valuation From Thin Air
description: The maker of the popular game Candy Crush Saga has picked $7.6 billion out of thin air for what it sees as its value after an initial public offering. Its parent company, King Digital Entertainment, uses creative metrics to justify its whopping valuation. But theres no way to calculate what an enterprise is worth when its profit can skyrocket 70-fold one year and could collapse the next. Zyngas I.P.O. flub serves as an apt warning.

title: SXSW 2014: No Lady Gaga Show for Me
description: One thing I wont be doing at SXSW is attending Lady Gagas concert on Thursday night, which is sponsored by a greasy, salty, metallic-tasting, obesity-friendly snack chip that experts could easily condemn on physiological terms.

title: Pause Is Seen in a Continents Peopling
description: Using a new method for exploring ancient relationships among languages, linguists have found evidence further illuminating the peopling of North America about 14,000 years ago. Their findings follow a recent proposal that the ancestors of Native Americans were marooned for some 15,000 years on a now sunken plain before they reached North America.

title: Reviewing Beats Music
description: Is the new music streaming service from Beats Electronics a worthy competitor to Spotify and Pandora? Molly Wood gives her verdict.

title: Beats Hopes to Serve Up Music in a Novel Way
description: THERES a new subscription music service in town, one that purports to know you and your music tastes better than you know them yourself. One that urges you to forget about what you think you like and surrender to a sea of playlists lovingly created by artists and celebrities far more brilliant and beautiful than you.

title: Pictures of the Day: New York and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from New York, Turkey, Afghanistan and Pakistan

title: Those Kings of Southie Unveil Some Princesses
description: Kristina has been dating Mikey for about a year, but Mikey says she has not yet earned the right to call him her boyfriend. As he puts it, Im pretty certain if it keeps going this way, we will have that label.

title: New Worlds Open at the Artists Easel
description: PAUSING in the middle of a brush stroke, Vincent Cass leans back in his wheelchair  paintbrush in hand  and offers an observation on life and art.

title: The Science of Older and Wiser
description: Since ancient times, the elusive concept of wisdom has figured prominently in philosophical and religious texts. The question remains compelling: What is wisdom, and how does it play out in individual lives? Most psychologists agree that if you define wisdom as maintaining positive well-being and kindness in the face of challenges, it is one of the most important qualities one can possess to age successfully  and to face physical decline and death.

title: Pictures of the Day: New York and Elsewhere
description: Photos from New York, Turkey, Afghanistan and Central African Republic.

title: England Takes the Peggy Bayer Trophy
description: At the British junior international events played in Belfast, Northern Ireland, on Feb. 22 and 23, the Peggy Bayer Trophy (for players born after Jan. 1, 1994) was won easily by England.

title: Two Buildings Collapse in East Harlem
description: Flames and smoke could be seen billowing from the street, and the force of the damage blew out windows in neighboring buildings.

title: Medicare Changes Prompt Enrollees to Reconsider Plans
description: WHEN Don and Elizabeth Dersch, of Chester, Va., both 68, became eligible for Medicare a few years ago, they carefully weighed the costs of traditional Medicare and Medicare Advantage, the coverage provided by private insurers. They chose Medicare Advantage.

title: Rite of Spring as a Rite of Passage
description: After youve performed Stravinskys brash and fulminating Rite of Spring for all its worth, what could you possibly do for an encore? The question is usually asked rhetorically, because few would even think of doing such a thing.

title: What Was Inside the Collapsed Buildings
description: Floor-by-floor look of the East Harlem buildings destroyed by Wednesdays blast.

title: In Syria, Questions About News Photographers
description: The death of an 18-year-old Syrian freelancing for Reuters has led to questions about the work of local activists the wire service employs there as photographers.

title: Michael J. Fox Says No Series Death Sentence Yet
description: Michael J. Fox does not fold easily. As if there were any doubt.

title: Annuities Not for Everyone, but They Have a Place
description: SIMPLE, useful ideas have a way of becoming more complicated  and less useful  as the urge to improve them takes hold. Annuities may have succumbed to this tendency, financial advisers warn.

title: For the 60th Time, a Visit to the Kingdom of Taylor
description: In Paul Taylors still-astonishing 1976 work Cloven Kingdom, human beings are shown to exist on several levels at the same time. We see their capacity for impersonal sublimity, their animal energies and their politely civilized behaviors, all overlapping peacefully and yet with disconcerting complexity. On Tuesday, better performed than it has been for many years, the work opened his companys annual three-week season at the David H. Koch Theater. Its one of those irresistible, imaginative and profound pieces in which Mr. Taylor proves himself the greatest choreographer alive.

title: Guardians of Trusts
description: THE legacy part of retirement can be unsettling. If you have planned carefully and set up trusts and wills, you still might have some nagging doubts about how your wishes will be carried out after you are gone.

title: Faith-Based Housing That Meets Evolving Needs
description: WHEN Elaine Daniels turned 60, she made a small deposit on an apartment at Pennswood Village in Bucks County, Pa., knowing that one day she might want to move into the retirement community founded on Quaker values.

title: Shopping for a Masterpiece (With Help) for $5,000
description: Robert Edelman, a private art dealer, was moving quickly down the aisles of Volta NY, one of the satellite art fairs going full blast in New York last week, when he hit the brakes at the booth being run by the Frederieke Taylor Gallery.

title: In Beijing, Families of Missing Press for Action and Answers
description: BEIJING  The first waves of shock had passed, and it was not time yet for mourning.

title: Candy Crush and the Curve of Impressiveness
description: Back in 2008, I created a theory called the Guitar Hero Curve of Impressiveness. It holds that others admiration for your gaming skills follows a bell curve: rising, rising, rising  until it crests over into a loathsome drop.

title: Brutal Winter, and Painful Rises in Heat Costs
description: HOUSTON  Opening up heating and electricity bills has been a bit of a shocker in recent weeks. Exactly how shocking became clear on Wednesday when the Energy Department released a report showing just how expensive it was to keep warm and cook dinner this winter.

title: Older Athletes Punching Above Their Age
description: PHILADELPHIA  I DONT blanch as the guy in the green muscle shirt posts me up, six feet from the basket. He is 30 years younger, four inches taller and 25 pounds of muscle heavier. He gets the ball and goes up for the shot, but my arm flashes in front of him and, somehow, his shot goes awry and I grab the rebound as the game-ending clock buzzes.

title: Obscurity Is the Lure
description: They call themselves lemmings. And like those mythic rodents, whose herd mentality is said to be so strong as to lead them off cliffs, these women are united in a mission that, to outsiders, may seem baffling and even berserk.

title: The Rise of Back-to-the-Basics Funerals
description: First there was Slow Food. Now come slow funerals. On a recent frigid Sunday at the Park Slope Food Coop, Amy Cunningham was giving a PowerPoint talk on green funerals to a graying crowd of about two dozen, many of them note-takers. I think when the baby boom is of age and were actively leaving this world, the environmentally friendly approach will be business as usual, she said. It will not be the odd thing.

title: Albany County Orders a Halt to Growth in Oil Processing
description: Citing the potential impact on public health of Albanys growing role as an oil hub, the county executive on Wednesday ordered a moratorium on the expansion of oil processing facilities at the Port of Albany.

title: In Their Own Terms
description: The first time Rhys Ernst saw Zackary Drucker was in 2005 at a bar in the East Village.

title: Plagued by Uncertainties, Barcelona Still Dazzles
description: BARCELONA, Spain  In recent months, the grace and natural beauty of this city have not necessarily included Camp Nou stadium. A collection of off-field ugliness for Barcelona  including a tax fraud scandal and an under-pressure resignation from the clubs president  was accompanied by a rash of lackluster play on the field. Add in a few injuries and the announcement by the longtime fixture Carles Puyol that he would leave the club after the season, and there was a crisis of confidence among the Blaugrana fans.

title: Citi Reduces the Pay of Its Mexico Chairman Amid Inquiries
description: Citigroup cut the pay of its chairman for Mexico, Manuel Medina-Mora, by about $1.1 million last year from 2012, citing control issues at its Banamex USA unit.

title: Theories Grow Without Facts on Lost Flight
description: It is the talk of lunchrooms, chat rooms and, most certainly, television green rooms across the globe: How and why could a modern passenger jet disappear without a trace?

title: Sales at Desiron, Ochre, Kartell and Artemide
description: Desiron is discounting some furniture by up to 70 percent, through Wednesday (the Bowery bench, originally $3,100, is $1,600); 200 Lexington Avenue (East 32nd Street), Suite 702; 212-353-2600, desiron.com.

title: Woven From the Archives of a Textile Designer
description: Alexander Girard, an exuberant colorist and avid promoter of folk art, was the first director of textile design at the furniture company Herman Miller. During his tenure there, from 1952 to 1975, he worked for other clients as well, including Braniff International Airways, which in the mid-1960s hired him to revamp its visual identity. Girards designs for the airline included brightly painted airplanes, airport lounge furniture, boarding passes and cheerful throws.

title: Greasing a Squeaky Wheel
description: The Wolfsonian-Florida International University museum is a bastion in Miami Beach of what it once called thinkism. From March 20 through 23, it will host its first Power of Design festival, with big-time thinkers like the computer scientist Jaron Lanier, the author of Who Owns the Future?, and Kurt Andersen, the Studio 360 radio show host.The subject will be complaint as a source of inspiration. Its not a gripe fest; its a solution fest, said Cathy Leff, the museums outgoing director. So many people like the TEDs, and the PechaKuchas, she added, referring to two forms of fast-paced, information-stuffed presentations. Events free and open to the public include a complaints choir, on March 20; a show of original posters curated by the graphic designer Steven Heller; and Prophets of the Digital Age, a March 22 conversation with Mr. Lanier, the novelist Michael Chabon and the technology writer Clive Thompson: 305-535-2625 or powerofdesign.wolfsonian.org.

title: A Pizza to Stay, and Make It Special
description: Pizza Vinoteca, which opens next week at 15 Union Square West, represents James Bibers return to restaurants. The architect, who did the interiors of Gotham Bar & Grill and Mesa Grill, which is now defunct, created a visual concept for this new chain, owned by Julius Numavicius, a Lithuanian billionaire. Avoiding the primary hues usually associated with fast food, he used black-and-white bar codes as a motif.

title: The Hole-in-the-Wall Gang
description: What youll need to repair your walls.

title: Blog Cabins: Home Page, Sweet Home
description: The British design journalist Ellie Tennant, 31, made virtual investigations of bloggers rooms to find candidates for her first book, Design Bloggers at Home: Fresh Interiors Inspiration From Leading Online Trend-Setters (Ryland Peters & Small), just out. A former shopping editor and staff blogger at Ideal Home magazine, she spent about three years on and off determining which personalities behind the keyboards had interiors actually worth documenting.

title: Is the Wall Cracked, or Am I?
description: When our plumber spent five minutes replacing a $15 valve in an upstairs bathroom last month, he fixed a mystery leak that we had hunted for a decade. We only knew about the leak because the water had corroded the drywall above our front entrance.

title: Sebelius Testifies Before the House
description: A sampling of the tough questions Kathleen Sebelius, the secretary of health and human services, fielded on Capitol Hill.

title: The Best 401(k)s Set a Higher Bar for Others
description: EVERY December for five years, BrightScope, a financial research firm based in San Diego, has published a list of the top 30 401(k) plans. These standouts provide, among other qualities, generous company contributions, quick access to that corporate money, low fees and a wide array of investment options.

title: Roll Out the Snow Carpet
description: This is where we want to be was the first thought that Clay Heighten and his wife, Debra Caudy, had when they stepped off the plane at the Jackson Hole Airport eight years ago. As Dr. Heighten said, Those mountains really make an impact.

title: Doormats: No Footprints to Follow
description: Across the country, doormats have gotten a workout this winter. And particularly in New York, where theyve had it easy for the last few years, repeated snowstorms and freezing rain have taken a toll. By this point, many of those mats need to be replaced.

title: A Call for a Highly Encrypted Future
description: The future will be encrypted, from the start of a conversation or data transmission to the end of it, if privacy activists and security specialists get their way.

title: Whats Black and Red and Read All Over?
description: The country of Michelangelo and Fellini has long inspired Louise Fili, a New York City graphic designer and author. When creating a line of gift products for Princeton Architectural Press, she found in the 1920s and 30s pencil cases she collects from Italian flea markets a subject that was perfect, or in this instance, perfetto. Her Perfetto Pencils are double-sided and come 12 to a box. (Ms. Fili, a celebrated riffer on vintage European typography, also designed the Art Deco-themed package.) They have two tones like the pencils traditionally used by teachers in Italy for grading homework, which are red and blue; red for a minor infringement, blue for a serious offense, she said. Hers are red and black. The combination, she said, feels much more Italian, and are the only colors that I wear. The pencils are about $9 on Amazon. Information: amazon.com.

title: Long Time Coming
description: At first, the mens wear designer Mark McNairys fall 2014 show for his New Amsterdam line last month seemed like business as usual. Preppy men, and some women, of varying ages strolled onto the runway in wryly monogrammed grandpa cardigans, cuffed pants and caps before an audience that included Damon Dash and the N.F.L. players Victor Cruz and Mychal Kendricks in the front row.

title: Comparing Action Cameras
description: Roy Furchgott tests the video quality of several action cameras on the market.

title: Jackbar in Williamsburg
description: For those whose thumbs arent getting enough of a workout with digital games, pinball machines are enjoying a revival at Jackbar, which features a rotating selection of 10 games from the 90s, and theyre all handily equipped with pint-glass holders.

title: A Jeweler Changes His Game
description: Glancing at Gabriel Urists kitchen counter, you might think he had a very complicated blender, possibly of Eastern European origin. In actuality its a magnetic tumbler. And in place of a toaster and other appliances are hulking metalsmithing and jewelry-making contraptions.

title: African Oils, Exotic and in Demand
description: Working with a chemist and a French perfumer, Magatte Wade sought to incorporate ingredients traditionally used by healers from her native Senegal into Tiossan, a line of fragrance and bath products.

title: By the Luck of Her Lacquer
description: Victoire de Castellane, who since 1998 has overseen haute joaillerie for Dior, arrived in New York this week with a cadre of friends. They were speckled with emeralds, sapphires, diamonds and rubies, and most were no larger than a Coke can or a fist.

title: When a Senator and the C.I.A. Clash
Elections in Crimea?
Tougher Car Safety Rules
description: To the Editor:

title: No to More Admission Tests
description: To the Editor:

title: Exporting Natural Gas
description: To the Editor:

title: A Flawed Curriculum
description: To the Editor:

title: Twerking Their Way to a Sweaty Workout Nirvana
description: As green and red strobes flashed around a darkened Midtown studio, some 75 women, many in animal-print Lycra capri pants and wedge-heeled sneakers, scrambled for lipstick touch-ups, then took their places for their exercise class warm-up.

title: At Sass & Bide, Gallery Girls of the World Unite
description: Art made with found materials is all very well, but you dont necessarily want to find it in your living room. Marcel Duchamps 1917 Fountain was, in the end, a urinal. Damien Hirsts tanks of the 1990s leaked, the animal corpses within rotting.

title: Across Turkey, New Unrest as Teenage Boy Is Buried
description: ISTANBUL  An enormous outpouring of grief and antigovernment rage during the funeral procession for a teenage boy felled by a police tear-gas canister turned into another mass confrontation with the Turkish authorities on Wednesday as mourners clashed with antiriot squads in Istanbul, Ankara and Izmir. At least one person was killed.

title: Why Arent Doctors Drug Tested?
description: PEOPLE go to hospitals to get well. We all know that medical care involves risks, but what patients dont expect is that the doctors, nurses and other staff members charged with their care may deliberately cause them harm. As an important recent case demonstrates, thats exactly what can happen without stronger controls.

title: Bossy Pants?
description: The same week that Sheryl Sandberg, Facebooks chief operating officer, helped start a campaign to ban the word bossy, so as not to discourage women from being assertive, the Princeton Mom, Susan Patton, who penned a widely condemned letter about why young women should focus on marriage in The Daily Princetonian, went on MSNBCs Morning Joe to flog her new book. This is what she told a group of young women working in the studios newsroom:

title: New Hampshire Nears Repeal of Death Penalty
description: CONCORD, N.H.  In October 2006, John Breckinridge, a Manchester police officer, saw his partner, Michael Briggs, shot to death in an alley. It was a searing moment that not only cost the Briggs family a father and husband, it also sent Mr. Breckinridge into a spiral of depression and doubt.

title: Ukrainian Premier at the White House
description: President Obama, along with Secretary of State John Kerry, met with the interim prime minister, Arseniy P. Yatsenyuk, and vowed to stand with Ukraine.

title: Jamming for a Cause
description: If you want to be the musical guest on Saturday Night Live, take some advice from the guy who runs the show.

title: Collier Schorr Mixes It Up
description: Ms. Schorr has a new exhibition, 8 Women.

title: When Fashion Meets Art
description: I dont know what to do until I meet them, the photographer Collier Schorr said of working with models. Who are you? Im going to take that picture.

title: Power Grid Preparedness Falls Short, Report Says
description: WASHINGTON  Nearly all the utilities that participated in two-day exercise last November to test the preparedness of the power grid for online and physical attacks said that their planning was not good enough, according to a report by the North American Electric Reliability Corporation, which organized the drill.

title: European Union Takes Steps Toward Protecting Data
description: BRUSSELS  The European Parliament passed a strong new set of data protection measures on Wednesday prompted in part by the disclosure of Americas vast electronic spying program.

title: New Natural Shampoos
description: Big-time hairdressers like Frdric Fekkai and John Frieda have long been in the shampoo business, but some smaller operations are now diving into the bubbles, emphasizing natural ingredients. Below, three indie labels of note.

title: Opponent of Mexicos Cartels Is Detained in Vigilantes Deaths
description: MEXICO CITY  Hiplito Mora often said that he started the first self-defense group in the Mexican state of Michoacn to end the boundless cruelty of the Knights Templar cartel  the killing, the extortion, and the monopolistic control it exerted over local lime growers.

title: The Buildings and the Blast Zone
description: Map of what was damaged in the neighborhood and a floor-by-floor diagram of what was in the collapsed buildings.

title: Clean & Clear Videos Dare Not Speak Blemishs Name
description: ADVERTISING for acne products often shows teenagers distraught over breaking out, as did a recent commercial for Oxy Maximum Action in which the word zit appears in red letters on teenage faces and screen text asks, Zituation?

title: Fashion Simplicity With Ease in Paris
description: The 16th Arrondissement in Paris is known for its ornate 19th-century buildings, upscale shops and museums, including the Palais de Tokyo. The area is lined with beautiful parks and lively cafes filled with locals, many dressed in refined and classic styles. On a recent afternoon, Gilles Garcia was walking home from grocery shopping in the neighborhood, dressed in a cashmere scarf, which he bought in Spain; a cashmere vest; a button-down shirt; chino pants; and Ray-Ban sunglasses. For him, he said, style is about easiness, from shopping to getting dressed.

title: Center That Aids Domestic Violence Victims Opens in Manhattan
description: The lobby of a newly renovated suite in the Manhattan district attorneys office looks more like an upscale pediatricians office than a place where one might discuss filing criminal charges.

title: U.S. General Warns of Perils in Leaving Afghanistan
description: WASHINGTON  The top American commander in Afghanistan said on Wednesday that Al Qaeda would regroup and stage another attack on the West from Afghanistan if international troops completely withdrew from the country at the end of 2014.

title: Massachusetts: Ex-School Doctor Sentenced for Child Pornography
description: A former pediatrician who worked as the medical director of Phillips Academy in Andover was sentenced on Wednesday to six-and-a-half years in prison on child pornography charges. Dr. Richard Keller, 57, of Andover, pleaded guilty in November to two counts of receiving and one count of possessing hundreds of photos and videos of child pornography depicting boys between the ages of 7 and 16. He was arrested in 2012 and surrendered his medical license after the authorities investigating a Toronto company discovered that he had bought $2,695 worth of child pornography from it. He will be on probation for five years after his release, and he must register as a sex offender and pay a $10,000 fine.

title: Homeworks Emotional Toll on Students and Families
description: When your children arrive home from school this evening, what will be your first point of conflict? Hows this for an educated guess? Homework.

title: Lunch on the Barricades
description: Lets consider school lunches.

title: Afghan Militant Group Declares Itself Reporters Killer
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A little-known Islamist militant group has claimed responsibility for the killing of a Swedish journalist in Kabul, adding another layer of mystery to a case in which Afghan and Western officials have struggled to determine why a veteran radio correspondent would be singled out for assassination.

title: Let the Military Run Drone Warfare
description: WASHINGTON  AS night fell on what had been a scorching August day in Hadhramaut, Yemen, in 2012, four large explosions shattered the quiet. When the smoke cleared a few minutes later, Sheik Salem Ahmed bin Ali Jaber, a respected and openly anti-extremist cleric, his cousin, a young local police officer named Waleed Abdullah bin Ali Jaber, and three other men, who have been identified in news reports as likely extremists, lay dead  reportedly by an American drone strike.

title: The Unhealthy Meat Market
description: Where does our food come from? Often the answer is Tyson Foods, Americas meat factory.

title: Italian Leader Offers Plan to Fix Economy
description: ROME  Prime Minister Matteo Renzi on Wednesday announced a $14 billion package of tax cuts and other measures intended to stimulate Italys stagnant economy, invest in public education and create jobs at a time of record unemployment, especially for young people.

title: Extra Pay for Extra Work
description: For the first 40 years of its existence, a workers right to time-and-a-half for overtime, established by federal law in 1938, operated as intended. It guarded against exploitation and inequality by ensuring that extra hours meant extra pay.

title: High Mortality From Alzheimers Disease
description: A provocative new study has suggested that Alzheimers disease causes six times as many deaths as the official statistics would indicate.

title: Senators Simmering Battle With C.I.A. Over Detentions Report
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Dianne Feinstein gave no warning before she strode to the Senate floor on Tuesday morning to deliver an attack accusing the C.I.A. of spying and intimidation  not to her Senate colleagues, and not to the C.I.A. But she was well aware of the significance of the moment she had chosen to throw her punch.

title: Regulators Size Up Wall Street, With Worry
description: Money laundering, market rigging, tax dodging, selling faulty financial products, trampling homeowner rights and rampant risk-taking  these are some of the sins that big banks have committed in recent years.

title: In Alabama, College Students Take On Challenge of Health Insurance Sign-Up
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala.  Students at the University of Alabama Honors College here are encouraged to do volunteer work in the community and on campus.

title: Communism Is the Goal at a Commune, but Chinese Officials Are Not Impressed
description: LINCANG, China  Members of this idyllic utopian commune tucked away in the mountains of southwest China share an agrarian life that would probably have delighted Chairman Mao: Every day they volunteer six hours to work the fields, feed their jointly owned chickens and prepare enough food to fill every belly in the community. The bounty of their harvest is divided equally and apparently without strife, part of a philosophy that emphasizes selflessness and egalitarian living over money and materialism.

title: Let Me Count the Days
description: By the time we reach our 50s, most of us have experienced a moment when, for the first time, we truly confront our mortality, a moment when it suddenly and forcefully comes home to us that we ourselves personally actually are going to die  as in: be dead  someday. This revelation can be produced under varied circumstances: It happens for one person upon the death of a friend, a contemporary; for another while he or she reads Four Quartets:

title: Events and Sales Starting the Week of March 13
description: Openings and Events

title: Welcomed Aboard, as Someone Else
description: The disappearance of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 has laid bare serious flaws in passenger identity procedures amid what has become a booming world market in stolen and counterfeit passports. These problems are sizable and deserve remedial attention for the risks they present to traveling.

title: China Moves on Banking Reforms
description: In November, Chinas leaders announced their intention to enact sweeping reforms in economic and social policies. This week, they said they were ready to carry out some important financial changes that could strengthen the countrys banking system and benefit savers and small businesses.

title: Sudan: Police Fire Tear Gas After Funeral in Khartoum
description: Riot police officers on Wednesday fired tear gas on protesters after the funeral of a student at the University of Khartoum. The student, Ali Abaker Musa Idris, was shot to death on Tuesday, when student activists from Darfur who were demonstrating against an escalation of violence in Darfur attempted to march on the streets of Khartoum. They were met with riot police officers.

title: Financial Adviser Sidesteps Prison in Bond-Rigging Case
description: Updated, 9:03 p.m. | The names read like signposts on the highway of financial hardship  Detroit; Jefferson County, Ala.; San Bernardino and Vallejo, Calif.

title: Harmony in a Land of Milk, Honey and Pucks
description: ROCKVILLE, Md.  Midway through the opening period of a youth game here Sunday night, Daniel Haim Lonkry knocked in a rebound. In the second period, his teammates Fadi Haj and Adam Ayoub added goals to tie the score, 3-3.

title: F.D.A. Panel Recommends Replacement for the Pap Test
description: The Pap test, a ritual for women that has been the mainstay of cervical cancer prevention for 60 years, may be about to play a less crucial role.

title: For Friends and Relatives of the Missing, Shock, Questions and, Most of All, Fear
description: Did they make it out? Are they hurt? Where are they?

title: The Assumptions Behind Obama's Initiative
Amid Search for Plane, Malaysian Leaders Face Rare Scrutiny
description: SEPANG, Malaysia  Malaysias governing elite has clung to power without interruption since independence from Britain almost six decades ago through a combination of tight control of information, intimidation of the opposition and, until recently, robust economic growth.

title: Lawyers Prepare for G.M. Suits With Novel Strategies
description: Ever since General Motors announced the recall of 1.6 million vehicles because of a faulty ignition switch, lawyers across the country have been preparing to sue the automaker.

title: How a Military Sexual Assault Case Foundered
description: FORT BRAGG, N.C.  The most important sexual assault prosecution in the military came apart on Monday. But cracks had appeared two months earlier in the same North Carolina military courtroom.

title: As Knicks Rebuild, Their Ex-Architect Is on an Upswing
description: WASHINGTON  Bradley Beal launched jump shot after jump shot at the Verizon Center on Wednesday morning. He was the lone member of the Washington Wizards who remained on the court after the shootaround. Ernie Grunfeld, the teams president, watched from a courtside folding chair.

title: Standing for More Than a Century, Only to Vanish in an Instant
description: They were fixtures of their block in East Harlem, recognizable to any neighbor  yet so unremarkable as to be anonymous.

title: Health Law Tied to G.O.P. Victory in Florida Race
description: CLEARWATER, Fla.  For Democrats hoping to claim a prized House seat in a swing district, Alex Sink seemed a shining candidate: a moderate, business-minded banker and former candidate for governor with ample experience in running a big race and raising money for it.

title: Brown Is the New Green
description: Yolanda Muoz was leading a double life, water-wise.

title: Smelling a Problem at the Site of the East Harlem Explosion
description: Natural gas meant for residential use is supposed to cause a stink before it causes an explosion like the one that destroyed two buildings in East Harlem on Wednesday.

title: Columbine Said to Influence Gunman at Maryland Mall
description: The teenager who opened fire with a shotgun inside a Maryland shopping mall in January, killing two people, was obsessed with the Columbine High School massacre, and he took a photo of himself with the weapon and uploaded it to a social media site just before he started shooting, the authorities said Wednesday.

title: Action Cameras, for When a Smartphone Wont Be Able to Keep Up
description: THANKS to smartphone cameras, we are privy to the most mundane details in the lives of our friends, from the cinnamon bun on the breakfast table to the temperature gauge on the car dashboard.

title: Corrections: March 13, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Brittle Beauty Can Be Picture Perfect Until, of Course, It Cracks
description: Couples in toxic relationships arent usually people you would choose to hang out with. Who wants to be caught in the crossfire of flying recriminations and possibly family china?

title: Kids Art Activity
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  To whom do you silently give thanks when you solve a New York Times crossword puzzle? Of course, theres editor Will Shortz; we wouldnt be having this discussion if he didnt select seven crosswords each week for us to dig into. Im talking about those who have taught you the popular and sometimes arcane things you need to know in order to be a decent solver.

title: Germany: Soccer Stars Tax Dodge
description: Uli Hoeness, the beloved former national and Bayern Munich soccer player who is now manager of the German club, is under growing pressure to resign, despite his popularity, after a trial revealed that he had avoided as much as $38 million in taxes through two bank accounts in Switzerland. The trial has been the talk of Germany this week, with a verdict widely expected on Thursday. Mr. Hoeness confessed last year to holding a Swiss bank account, but suggested he had avoided only $5 million in taxes.

title: Mets Wright Waits for His Team to Catch Up
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  The Mets have worn lots of colors  blue, orange, black  but never red. Yes, those were St. Louis Cardinals fans packed into Tradition Field on Wednesday, up from Jupiter to see the National League champions play the Mets.

title: Germany: Bishops Select Popes Confidant as New Leader
description: Cardinal Reinhard Marx, 60, the archbishop of Munich, was selected on Wednesday to head the Roman Catholic bishops conference in Germany. Known as outspoken, the cardinal is a confidant of Pope Francis, who this month named him head of a new Economic Council at the Vatican. Cardinal Marx succeeds Robert Zllitsch as the effective leader of Germanys 24 million Roman Catholics. He is known for emphasizing the need for the church to stand by its teachings and acts, and wrote a book  called Das Kapital, in a dig at Karl Marxs 19th-century treatise  that vigorously warns against the dangers of an unbridled market economy. He has also sought ways to allow Catholics who divorce and then remarry to take Communion. We cannot treat these people as second-class Christians, the German DPA news agency quoted him as saying.

title: The New York Times Hires Critic and Fashion Director
description: PARIS  Vanessa Friedman, the fashion editor of The Financial Times, has been named fashion director and chief fashion critic of The New York Times.

title: Top Yankee Hitter So Far? Hes Fighting for a Job
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Darkness blanketed the stadium as the ballplayer arrived at 6:30 a.m. He is usually the first Yankee in the clubhouse, where his locker sits across the aisle from Derek Jeter, maybe five feet away. It might as well be five light-years.

title: G.M. Reveals It Was Told of Ignition Defect in 01
description: General Motors said on Wednesday that it had received reports as early as 2001  three years earlier than previously disclosed  of a safety defect in its cars that the company has now linked to 12 deaths and at least 31 accidents over the past decade.

title: Protests in Istanbul
description: Thousands of people took to the streets to protest the death of a teenager who was struck by a police tear-gas canister during antigovernment protests last year.

title: Quiet in Morning, Pierce Erupts at Night to Lead Nets Over Heat
description: MIAMI  A group of reporters approached Paul Pierce during the Nets shootaround hereWednesdaymorning, and he got up from his seat and walked away. Im in locked-in mode, Pierce said, apologizing and adding that he would talk after the game.

title: Vincent's Painting Class
description: In 2012, a stroke left Vincent Cass partly paralyzed. Soon after, the 77-year-old took a painting class and discovered a talent he never realized he had.

title: Knicks Enjoy Outcome as They Keep Waiting for Resolution
description: BOSTON  Maybe Phil Jackson should take his time. The longer the suspense lasts over whether Jackson will join the Knicks, the more the team he may one day oversee continues to win in the here and now.

title: The Americans Recap: Its All About Work/Life  Balance
description: When we last saw them, in Episode 2, Elizabeth and Philip were in mourning. Their friends  and lets be clear, their only friends  Emmett and Leanne, were murdered, along with the couples teenage daughter, Amelia.

title: Providences Inexhaustible Point Guard Almost Never Leaves the Court
description: Providence point guard Bryce Cotton almost never leaves the court. A senior, he is the only player in the nation who averages more than 40 minutes per game (40.1), and he has averaged 41.9 minutes in Big East competition.

title: Interactions of Bin Laden and Son-in-Law Detailed in an F.B.I. Document
description: Osama bin Laden was nothing if not strategic. He recruited a Kuwaiti cleric to become a close associate and to speak to his trainees because he wanted more recruits from the Gulf region. And for that clerics fiery speeches after Sept. 11, the Qaeda leader provided the bullet points.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 12, 2014
description: March 12, 2014

title: Fire Department Copes With Destruction
description: A video shot by the New York Fire Department shows the destruction that resulted after two buildings collapsed in East Harlem.

title: Commune Living in China
description: Meng Lichun, a member of New Life Oasis who goes by the name Buddhist Creed, talks about the philosophy behind life at the commune.

title: Hip-Hop Pioneers Plan a Museum for the Bronx
description: Before hip-hop became a musical genre, it was a form of expression  and an escape  for its early creators in the Bronx.

title: Looking for a Way Out
description: After a life of hard labor in the fields, Cui Wenzhen, who calls herself Beneficial Ground, came to New Oasis as an escape.

title: Countdown to the 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 92
description: The 2014 World Cup begins on June 12, when Brazil plays Croatia in the opening match. Reporters and editors for The New York Times will count down to the start of the tournament each day with a short capsule of news and interesting tidbits.

title: Man Facing Murder Charge in Death of a City Bus Driver
description: A man accused of stealing a truck after a night of drinking and plowing it into a New York City bus, killing a veteran driver, has been charged with second-degree murder, an unusually serious felony for a drunken-driving fatality, the Manhattan district attorneys office said.

title: Times Minute | Making Pre-K a Success
description: Also on the Minute, flight 370 conspiracy theories, and fighting noise on Bourbon Street.

title: Gilded Crusade for Charters Rolls Onward
description: To call Eva S. Moskowitz a walking lightning rod is to deeply understate the matter. Electricity all but arcs and leaps off her scalp.

title: Holder Endorses Proposal to Reduce Drug Sentences in Latest Sign of Shift
description: Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. is endorsing a proposal that would reduce prison sentences for people convicted of dealing drugs, the latest sign of the Obama administrations retrenchment in the so-called war on drugs.

title: Emergency Rooms Are No Place for the Elderly
description: The elderly man lived alone in an apartment complex not far from the hospital. A younger neighbor, whod watched him hobble down the buildings stairwell for nearly a week, insisted on taking him to the emergency room. Doctors there immediately diagnosed an infection in his painful toe and prescribed antibiotics for him to take at home.

title: More on Social Security Math
description: Phillip Swagel is a professor at the School of Public Policy at the University of Maryland and was assistant secretary for economic policy at the Treasury Department from 2006 to 2009.

title: Word of the Day | sinewy
description: sinewy \sin-y-we also si-n-\ adjective

title: Times Minute | Making Pre-K a Success
description: In the Video

title: Mets Pitching Coach Apologizes for a Slur
description: Dan Warthen, the Mets pitching coach, apologized for using a racial slur in the teams spring training clubhouse in Port St. Lucie, Fla.

title: Hal Douglas, 89, Superstar of Movie Trailer Narrators, Dies
description: Hal Douglas, a voice-over artist who narrated thousands of movie trailers in a gravelly baritone heard by audiences everywhere, as he might have put it, thrilled by images never before seen ... until now!,  died on Friday at his home in Lovettsville, Va. He was 89.

title: Patriots Said to Add Darrelle Revis; the Jets Pick Up Eric Decker
description: The Jets cleared significant salary-cap space earlier this week, producing the expectation that they were preparing to splurge on new players. Early in free agency, however, they were largely silent, even as their archrival, the New England Patriots, snatched up Darrelle Revis hours after the Tampa Bay Buccaneers released him Wednesday, according to a person in the N.F.L. who requested anonymity because the deal had not been formally announced.

title: Court Jails Indian Tycoon
description: NEW DELHI  Subrata Roy has long been one of Asias most flamboyant billionaires, a bejeweled modern maharajah who lives on an opulent 270-acre estate and presides over the Sahara Group, which is, by its own account, the largest private employer in India. To his allies, Mr. Roy is an up-by-bootstraps hero who built from scratch a sprawling empire that provides vital financial services to the countrys poor.

title: Whats on Thursday
description: 9:30 P.M. (13) DONALD FAGEN, MICHAEL McDONALD, BOZ SCAGGS: THE DUKES OF SEPTEMBER Mr. Fagen of Steely Dan, Mr. McDonald of the Doobie Brothers and Mr. Scaggs team up to create a new group with roots in the R&B and soul music that inspired some of their greatest individual hits. The playlist of this Great Performances show, taped at Lincoln Center, includes What a Fool Believes, Lowdown, Lido Shuffle, Pretzel Logic and Reelin in the Years.

title: Rangers Sign Haggerty
description: The Rangers signed the free-agent forward Ryan Haggerty, a junior at Rensselaer Polytechnic, and he will join the team this weekend. Haggerty, a 21-year-old from Stamford, Conn., had 28 goals this season, which led the Eastern Collegiate Athletic Conference and was third in N.C.A.A. Division I. He finished his career at Rensselaer with 47 goals and 37 assists in 106 games.

title: Ophelia DeVore-Mitchell, 92, Dies; Redefined Beauty
description: Ophelia DeVore-Mitchell, a former model, agent, charm-school director and newspaper publisher who almost single-handedly opened the modeling profession to African-Americans, and in so doing expanded public understanding of what American beauty looks like, died on Feb. 28 in Manhattan. She was 92.

title: As Crews Search for Survivors, They Discover Only More Victims
description: Firefighters and emergency personnel on Thursday dug deeply into the wreckage of two buildings in East Harlem that were leveled in a powerful explosion, looking for survivors and possible evidence of what caused the blast.

title: When Voting in India, Whats in a Name?
description: MUMBAI, India  Kalomington, I remember, nearly threw a fit. Sadoschand was more forgiving, even able to see some humor in it all. And Debrokamilm On? We never found out, because he or she never showed up to vote.

title: Leaders Deny Report of a Truce in Mideast Violence
description: JERUSALEM  Islamic Jihad, the militant group responsible for firing dozens of rockets into Israel from the Gaza Strip, announced Thursday that Egypt had intervened to restore calm, offering what at first looked like a familiar resolution to an escalation of violence that had shaken both sides of the border.

title: Test Yourself | English, March 13, 2014
description: Take the Quiz

title: 6 Qs About the News | Lordes Take on Teenage Life
description: In A Less Glossy Take on Teenage Life, Jon Caramanica, a Times music critic, reviews the singers recent show at Roseland Ballroom in Manhattan.

title: Jet Hunt Shifts as Findings Hint at Longer Flight
description: WASHINGTON  Investigators are examining data that appear to show that the missing Malaysia Airlines jetliner was still in automated communication with satellite systems, and may therefore still have been airborne or at least functional, for hours after ground controllers last heard from it, a well-placed official involved in the investigation said on Thursday.

title: Senator Tom Coburn: Power Is a Tool
description: You recently learned you have prostate cancer and announced that youll be leaving the Senate next January   two years before the scheduled end of your term. How are you feeling? Im feeling good. Im not cured of the disease, but Im on my way to marked improvement. And they may potentially have a cure. But Ive got 5 or 10 years in front of me even if they dont cure it.

title: Mitch McConnell Is Not as Vulnerable as He Seems
description: WASHINGTON  It has been a dreadful winter for Democrats as red state incumbents struggle to overcome President Obamas sagging popularity. But theres one person in particular Democrats still hope to beat: Mitch McConnell, the Senate minority leader.

title: The Cold, Hard Lessons of Mobile Home U.
description: Dont get too hung up on appearances, Frank Rolfe reminded us as our tour bus made its way to the first of several trailer parks we would visit on a bright Saturday afternoon in Southern California. Remember, you dont have to live in these homes.

title: Should Colleges Ban Fraternities?
description: Fraternities have been in the news this school year for problems like racism, sexual harassment and violence, and hazing-related injuries and deaths.

title: Reubin Askew, a Progressive Governor of Florida in the 70s, Dies at 85
description: Reubin Askew, a progressive New South Democrat who promoted racial equality and ethics overhauls as a two-term governor of Florida in the 1970s and campaigned briefly for the presidency in 1984 and for the Senate in 1988, died on Thursday in Tallahassee. He was 85.

title: New York Today: Extreme Drop
description: Good Thursday morning. Its very cold.
