description: HARRISON, N.J.  Early in the 2012 N.F.L. season, a pivotal, disputed call in Seattles last-gasp victory against Green Bay led to a quick resolution of the leagues labor dispute with its officials.

title: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, March 16, 2014
description: These movements are consistent with deliberate action by someone on the plane.

title: In With the Old: Providence Rules the Revamped Big East
description: The Providence coaches sat courtside to watch Creightons win over Xavier in the semifinals of the Big East tournament Friday night, arriving back in their hotel well after midnight. Their night was just beginning.

title: Corrections: March 16, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Lindsey Green and Lockhart Steele
description: Lindsey M. Green and Lockhart Steele were married Saturday in Las Vegas. Kenneth Schwartz, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated at the Flamingo Las Vegas Hotel.

title: Down Slopes, Along Trails, Up the Aisle
description: Annemarie Susan Baltay, the daughter of Virginia Rohan Baltay and Charles Baltay of Guilford, Conn., was married Saturday to Eric Robert Sundstrom, a son of Chary Sundstrom and Robert J. Sundstrom of Cary, N.C.

title: Jessica Berg, Christopher Elders
description: Jessica Carrie Berg and Christopher Calvin Elders were married Saturday evening at the Powel Crosley Estate, a museum and event space in Sarasota, Fla. The Rev. Robert D. Hoffman, a United Methodist minister, officiated.

title: Lisa Richenstein, Andrew Silverman
description: Lisa Eryn Richenstein, the daughter of Mindy R. Richenstein and Lawrence J. Richenstein of Sagaponack, N.Y., was married Saturday evening to Andrew Ross Silverman, the son of Nancy C. Silverman and Howard J. Silverman of White Plains. Rabbi Irwin A. Zeplowitz led the ceremony at the Plaza in New York.

title: Scheming Friends Turn Out to Be Right
description: Sarah Elizabeth Scott and Steven Wiley Frank were married Saturday in the gardens of the Gaillard-Bennett House, a historic home in Charleston, S.C. The Rev. Dr. George F. Coleman, a Presbyterian minister, officiated.

title: Colette Dribben and Joshua Lieberman
description: Colette Paige Dribben and Joshua Adam Lieberman are to be married Sunday by Rabbi Stephen H. Pinsky at the Addison, an event space in Boca Raton, Fla.

title: Kathleen Courcey, Mark McFadden
description: Kathleen Elizabeth Courcey and John Mark McFadden were married Saturday at the Union League Cafe, a restaurant in New Haven. Linda Stray, a Connecticut justice of the peace, officiated.

title: Robert Pini, Michael Boodro
description: Robert Louis Pini and Michael Boodro were married Wednesday morning at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Michael M. McSweeney, the New York City clerk, officiated.

title: Seetha Ramachandran and Justin Herring
description: Seetha Ramachandran and Justin Shibayama Herring were married Saturday evening at the Park Hyatt in Washington. Sharon Cohen Levin, a friend of the couple who became a minister of the American Marriage Ministries for the event, officiated.

title: Elizabeth Gardner and Theodore Wiles
description: Elizabeth Downes Gardner, a daughter of Stephen H. Gardner of New York and the late Elizabeth N. Means, was married Saturday to Theodore Stickley Wiles, a son of Ben Wiles and Sharon L. Wiles of Schenectady, N.Y. The Rev. Galen Guengerich, a Unitarian Universalist minister, performed the ceremony at All Souls Unitarian Church in New York.

title: Jennifer Drahos, Kombiz Lavasany
description: Jennifer Kay Drahos and Kombiz Navaei Lavasany were married Saturday at the Powerhouse Community Center in Del Mar, Calif. Justin Krebs, a friend of the couple and a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Courtney Wilson and Ryan Gerdes
description: Courtney Theresa Wilson and Ryan Frederick Gerdes were married Saturday at Sacred Heart Catholic Church in Tampa, Fla. The Rev. C. Timothy Corcoran III, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Robert Danielowich, Manoj Pardasani
description: Robert Michael Danielowich and Manoj Pahlaj Pardasani were married Saturday at the Liberty House Restaurant in Jersey City. Anthony Gillespie, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Jennifer Pincus, Adam Pilchman
description: Jennifer Lisa Pincus and Adam Todd Pilchman were married Saturday evening by Rabbi Stacy Bergman at the Village Club at Lake Success, a country club in Great Neck, N.Y.

title: Robert Chaloner and Oscar Mandes Jr.
description: Robert Stanley Chaloner and Oscar Fabriciano Mandes Jr. were married Saturday by the Rev. Karen Ann Campbell at the Christ Episcopal Church in Sag Harbor, N.Y.

title: Video Notebook: Big East Final
description: The Providence senior guard Bryce Cotton and the Creighton senior forward Doug McDermott talk about the Big East tournament final and the Friars decision to play a zone defense.

title: Alibaba Confirms It Will Begin I.P.O. Process in U.S.
description: The Alibaba Group, Chinas online commerce giant, confirmed early on Sunday that it planned to begin the process of becoming a public company in the United States.

title: Whats On Today?
description: 10 P.M. (NBC) CRISIS When a busload of teenagers from a Washington high school is kidnapped during a field trip, parents must decide how far theyre willing to go to guarantee the students safe return in this new action thriller. Especially when they are the children of business leaders, diplomats, politicians  and the president. Dermot Mulroney, above left, plays a former C.I.A. analyst turned chaperone who is also captured in the ambush. Gillian Anderson is the chief executive of a multinational corporation whose daughter (Halston Sage) could be worth a huge ransom. Writing in The New York Times, Alessandra Stanley said that the pilot, directed by Phillip Noyce, was terrific, noting that it makes clear that money alone isnt the driving motive behind the crime, and that high-level conspiracies within the government play a role. She added: Motive, however, is almost always the weakest point of a television thriller. The trick for Crisis is to keep the action moving so fast that viewers dont get bogged down in the logic  or lack of it.

title: Timing of Report by Flights Pilot Focuses Inquiry
description: SEPANG, Malaysia  A signaling system was disabled on the missing Malaysia Airlines jet before a pilot spoke to air traffic control without mentioning any trouble, a senior Malaysian official said Sunday, reinforcing theories that one or both of the pilots may have been involved in diverting the plane and adding urgency to the investigation of their pasts and possible motivations.

title: In China, Shaking Up Currencys Strength
description: HONG KONG  One of the surest bets on China is starting to look a bit shaky.

title: In Our Pages: March 17
description: 1889: A New Richard III.

title: India Suspends Its Search for Flight 370
description: PORT BLAIR, India  After scouring more than 24,000 nautical square miles, India on Sunday suspended its search for Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 in the waters around the isolated Andaman and Nicobar Islands chain while officials in Kuala Lumpur consider where else to search.

title: Shouldnt the Breast Pump Be as Elegant as an iPhone and as Quiet as a Prius by Now?
description: John: I made my way upstairs, drawn by a strange sound emanating from our bedroom. It was rhythmic, like the sound of an old dot matrix printer. As I opened the door, I was confronted with the image of my wife holding two plastic funnels over her breasts with a big frown across her face. I immediately thought of Madonnas cone-shaped bra from the 1980s and let out a gasp.

title: Fall Derails Mens Duel in Half Marathon; Womens Record Is Set
description: Two days before the New York City Half Marathon, Geoffrey Mutai talked about his strategy against Mo Farah, the Olympic double gold medalist from Britain who was returning to the race he won in 2011.

title: Crimea Votes to Secede From Ukraine as Russian Troops Keep Watch
description: SIMFEROPOL, Ukraine  With thousands of heavily armed Russian troops occupying this perennially embattled peninsula, an overwhelming majority of Crimeans voted on Sunday to secede from Ukraine and join Russia, resolutely carrying out a public referendum that Western leaders had declared illegal and vowed to punish with economic sanctions.

title: Syrian Government Forces Seize Town in a Deep Blow to Opposition
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  When Syrian government forces on Sunday swept into Yabrud, a town long held by rebels near the Lebanese border, it was a symbolic turning point for insurgents and government supporters alike in a conflict now heading into its fourth year.

title: The Wages of Men
description: For reference: Here are changes in hourly real wages of men, 1973-2012, at different percentiles of the wage distribution, calculated from Census data by the Economic Policy Institute. As you can see, wages have fallen for 60 percent of men.

title: Dont Prosper and Die Early
description: I was pleased to see this article by Annie Lowrey documenting the growing disparity in life expectancy between the haves and the have-nots. Its kind of frustrating, however, that this is apparently coming as news not just to many readers but to many policymakers and pundits. Many of us have been trying for years to get this point across  to point out that when people call for raising the Social Security and Medicare ages, theyre basically saying that janitors must keep working because corporate lawyers are living longer. Yet it never seems to sink in.

title: Staying Home, Connected to the World
description: On March 22, 1876, The New York Times reported that a hot new technology, the telephone  not Bells, but a device invented by a German  might mean that people would never have to leave their homes again.

title: Charge of the Right Brigade
description: Canon to right of me, canon to left of me  actually, scratch that, its all canon to right of me.

title: Mitch Leigh, Who Composed Man of La Mancha, Dies at 86
description: One day in 1964, a New York advertising-jingle composer in his early 30s received an unlikely job offer.

title: Years After Abduction by North Korea, a Reunion
description: TOKYO  The parents of a Japanese woman abducted by North Korea in 1977 were allowed to see their North Korean-born granddaughter for the first time last week at a secret meeting in Mongolia, Japans Foreign Ministry said on Sunday.

title: Mo Farah Falls
description: The runner Mo Farah fell Sunday at the New York City Half Marathon.

title: The Nature of the Search Has Changed
description: At a news conference on Sunday, the Malaysian authorities listed possible reasons behind the disappearance of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, including sabotage.

title: For Free Texting Apps, the Market Is Far From Conquered
description: In late February, while I was in Barcelona at the Mobile World Congress, the mobile phone trade show,I had a bit of a communication problem. To avoid racking up a hefty cellphone bill, I tried to keep in touch with the people I met using WhatsApp, the prominent free text messaging service that Facebook recently bought. But to my surprise, most people I met were using their countrys own flavor of texting app.

title: 'Danny Boy'
description: A song by an Okinawan duo, Isamu Shimoji and Yukito Ara, sung to the traditional Irish tune.

title: An Engineering Landmark Faces Demolition
description: One of the great feats of 20th-century engineering, a landmark of modernist architecture is facing demolition. Late last month, the Russian State Committee for Television and Radio Broadcasting agreed to the dismantling of the Shabolovka radio tower in Moscow.

title: Accusations of Racism in a Brooklyn Lutheran Community
description: The Rev. Samuel Cruz went into a meeting at his Sunset Park church last month as his bishops sole nominee for dean of the southwest Brooklyn conference of the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America.

title: The Flute, the Flute Is Calling
description: Except for its deadly snakes, and the warmth of its blue-green ocean, Okinawa might as well be Ireland. It is a chain of emerald isles whose people lived for centuries under the boot of an oppressive empire. (Think Irish-English relations are complicated? Try Okinawan-Japanese.) Poverty drove generations of strivers from its shores  not to Boston or New York, but Hawaii, Peru, Brazil and beyond.

title: A Rough Weekend for New Movies
description: Tyler Perrys near decade-long run as a supplier of hit movies ended over the weekend, as Tylers Perrys The Single Moms Club became his worst-performing release by far. Also disappointing was Need for Speed, a car-racing movie designed to start a franchise for Steven Spielbergs deeply troubled DreamWorks Studios.

title: Hollywood Conservatives Are Granted Tax-Exempt Status
description: LOS ANGELES  Friends of Abe, a loose fellowship of Hollywood conservatives, will be recognized by the Internal Revenue Service as a tax-exempt organization, a lawyer for the group confirmed on Sunday. Friends of Abe was recognized as a 501(c)(3) public charity effective as of the date of its formation, the lawyer, Ofer Lion, said in response to an email query.

title: Ferlinghetti Travel Journals to Be Published
description: The poet Lawrence Ferlinghetti, at 94 one of the last living links to the Beat generation, has sold his travel journals to Liveright Publishing, a division of W.W. Norton, which plans to publish them in September 2015 as Writing Across the Landscape: Travel Journals (1950-2013). Sterling Lord, Jack Kerouacs longtime literary agent and the representative for the Kerouac estate, made the sale to Robert Weil, the editor in chief of Liveright.

title: Kerry Presses Russia on Provocations in Ukraine
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State John Kerry expressed concern in a phone call on Sunday with his Russian counterpart about the Russian militarys seizure of a gas plant near the border of Crimea and what American officials described as continuing provocations in Ukraines eastern cities.

title: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 88
description: The 2014 World Cup begins on June 12, when Brazil plays Croatia in the opening match. Reporters and editors for The Times will count down to the start of the tournament each day with a short capsule of news and interesting tidbits.

title: Excerpt: 'Appropriate'
description: A scene from Branden Jacobs-Jenkinss new play at the Signature Center.

title: On the Street and in the Pews, East Harlem Mourns
description: A Sunday morning in East Harlem means dressing up for church and buying flowers at the Associated supermarket on East 116th Street. It means stopping by the Dunkin Donuts down the block or maybe the tamale-and-atole stand on the corner of Lexington Avenue.

title: Army General Reaches Deal on Sex Counts
description: RALEIGH, N.C.  The senior Army officer prosecuted in the militarys most closely watched sexual assault case, Brig. Gen. Jeffrey A. Sinclair, has agreed to plead guilty to sharply reduced charges, including that he disobeyed a commanders order, misused his government charge card and mistreated his former mistress, a captain.

title: At Shortstop, Red Sox See a Cornerstone Taking Shape
description: FORT MYERS, Fla.  Right through the main clubhouse doors of the Boston Red Sox complex here, in the hallway just off the locker room, is a floor-to-ceiling photograph of the 2013 World Series celebration. Among the revelers is a player wearing No. 72, which seems out of place. Nobody with a number that high usually makes it out of spring training.

title: Overheated Passion Is a Thing With Feathers
description: In Swan Lake, the timeless ballet about a swan queen, the prince who loves her and the black swan who seduces him, the real tragedy happens when choreographers try to sex it up. The music, the story, the swans: Its already there.

title: Red Bulls Rewind: Lights, Camera, Henry
description: HARRISON, N.J.  As goal-scoring celebrations go, the Red Bulls captain, Thierry Henry, has a distinct flair for the dramatic with a flash of cinma vrit.

title: Composers Virtuosity Captured
description: The musical family tree of Unsuk Chin, who was honored with a Composer Portrait at the Miller Theater on Thursday, has widespread roots. The strongest of them is Gyorgy Ligeti, with whom she studied in the 1980s, but there is also a discernible dose of Bartok in the pugilistic power of her orchestral writing and that of Conlon Nancarrow in the polyrhythmic dazzle of her piano tudes and electronic compositions. The shimmering sonorities and complex ensemble play of Balinese gamelan music vividly influence works like her Double Concerto for piano and percussion and ensemble, while the musical traditions of Ms. Chins native South Korea exert a much subtler pull.

title: Ballerinas, So Elegant, Take a Moment to Vent
description: When Jenifer Ringer, who retired last month from New York City Ballet after 24 years, watched Darren Aronofskys Black Swan, she laughed at this thriller on the forces of ballet darkness. But her memoir, Dancing Through It: My Journey in the Ballet, does not skimp on what she calls the crazy side of ballet. With quiet eloquence and self-deprecating humor, Ms. Ringer suggests how a profession as idealistic as it is hierarchical and competitive might drive a talented young woman to self-destruct.

title: An Irish Medal at the 1979 European Championships
description: Since this is St. Patricks Day, lets have a deal featuring Ireland. It occurred during that countrys third-place finish behind Italy and Denmark at the 1979 European Open Teams Championship in Lausanne, Switzerland.

title: For the Irish Arts Center, a New Home to Expand
description: Aidan Connolly has to employ a multitude of slashes to describe the cramped quarters of the Irish Arts Center, a hearth for Irish culture that he operates from a former Hells Kitchen tenement on West 51st Street.

title: A New Lynn Nottage Play
description: The Oregon Shakespeare Festival has announced that the world premiere of a Lynn Nottage play will be among the highlights of its 2015 season. Ms. Nottage, who won a Pulitzer Prize in 2009 for her drama Ruined, visited Reading, Pa., over two years to research her new work, Sweat. It follows a group of friends who work in a steel plant. The festival lineup is to include two more world premieres: Head Over Heels, an Elizabethan musical comedy that features a book by Jeff Whitty (Avenue Q) and music and lyrics from the catalog of the pop group the Go-Gos, and Fingersmith, a play based on Sarah Waterss 2002 novel of the same name. The festival also announced that it would stage all of Shakespeares plays over a 10-year period, starting in 2015 with Much Ado About Nothing, Pericles and Antony and Cleopatra.

title: St. Josephs Rises Above V.C.U. to Take A-10 Title
description: Minutes before the Atlantic 10 tournament final at Barclays Center on Sunday, Virginia Commonwealth students began chanting, This is our house. Daryus Quarles, the senior forward for St. Josephs, shook his head in disagreement.

title: Art Worlds Cream Rises at Maastricht
description: MAASTRICHT, the Netherlands  It seems as if just a moment ago New Yorkers were complaining about fair fatigue after the citys busiest art week, with its dizzying number of shows, its oversaturation of contemporary art, its proliferating number of collectors and spiraling prices.

title: Another Taylor Marathon: They Push Dancers, Dont They?
description: The choreographer Paul Taylor will be 84 in July; his companys current season at the David H. Koch Theater is its 60th anniversary. His three-page program biography, laden with superlatives, begins with the sentence Choreographer Paul Taylor is the greatest living pioneer of Americas indigenous art of modern dance. Though hes certainly a master, its been decades since he seemed any kind of pioneer.

title: Boy Meets Girl; Boy Must Win Dad Over
description: The wages of love  that is, the salaries of people in love  is the most interesting plot hinge in Nupur Asthanas Bollywood romantic comedy Bewakoofiyaan (Foolishness in Hindi). This tale of a yuppie couple (played by Ayushmann Khurrana and Sonam Kapoor) flirts with intriguing notions of recessionary struggle, though strained, contrived humor bogs it down.

title: Barely Treading Water at $9.49 an Hour
description: Much of the attention lavished on HBO tends to go to its elaborate fictions: True Detective, for instance, which just completed its first season, and Game of Thrones, which is about to start its fourth. But fact has a place on the network as well, and you cant get much closer to the hard facts of everyday existence than Paycheck to Paycheck: The Life and Times of Katrina Gilbert, a documentary on Monday night.

title: The Story of Bridie and Mo
description: ON a visit to Dublin in 2008, just before Irelands economic collapse, I took a walk down to the Docklands at the edge of the River Liffey and was astonished to find that what had long been a sooty, rundown port of 19th-century warehouses had become one of the most modern and desirable neighborhoods in Europe  all luxury apartments and upscale hotels bathed in theatrical lighting, a glossy prairie of glass and steel.

title: The Ugandan Tabloid That Stole Our Pride
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  IN 2012, I was living and working at a nonprofit in rural Uganda, far away from my friends at home. As a single gay man, I longed for community. I contacted Frank Mugisha, the executive director of Sexual Minorities Uganda, an umbrella organization for gay rights groups, after reading an opinion essay he wrote. Through Frank, I met Richard Lusimbo, the nonprofits research manager, and then others in the vibrant L.G.B.T. community in Uganda.

title: In Masochistic Twist, the Faster You Die, the More Popular the Game
description: The popularity of video games is proof that people enjoy having problems. Apparently life isnt tough enough for those of us who seek amusement in failures premiere form of entertainment. Taxes, relationships and health troubles not stressful enough? Play an arduous video game that youll fail at in seconds. Millions of people do. They like a challenge. They like to walk into a bit of trouble.

title: Room Under the Roof
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  Lest I be further accused of being prejudiced against vowel progressions (you know who you are), Im going to skip that part of my discussion and just welcome John Lieb back. His last puzzle dribbled people all over the grid, but todays puzzle is a considerably neater solve. Today, we have a G*M progression.

title: New York Will Lose Ballet Theaters Nutcracker
description: In the end, maybe this town wasnt big enough for the two of them after all  the two Nutcrackers, that is.

title: Russia Could Still Turn U.S. Into Radioactive Dust, News Anchor in Moscow Reminds Viewers
description: As the United States condemned a referendum on the future of the Crimean peninsula staged by pro-Russian separatists on Sunday, one of Russias most influential television hosts appeared on the evening news in Moscow, before a huge mushroom cloud graphic, to remind viewers that Russia is still the only country in the world capable of turning the U.S.A. into radioactive dust.

title: The Battle Over the MedFly
description: In 1981, California tried to stop the Mediterranean fruit fly from infesting crops and threatening the states agricultural industry. But it would take more than conventional tools to defeat this bug.

title: News From the Advertising Industry
description: Accounts

title: The Battle Over the Medfly
description: Ceratitis capitata. To a Muggles ears, it sounds like an incantation from a Hogwarts wizard. If only the matter were whimsical.

title: Duke Loses Cool as Virginia Wins First Tournament Title Since 76
description: GREENSBORO, N.C.  The swirl of Virginia orange and Duke royal blue in the Greensboro Coliseum stands seemed to rise and fall with each possession, each drive to the basket, each steal, each tie and each lead change in the heart-stopping Atlantic Coast Conference tournament final Sunday afternoon.

title: Big Money Upends a Festival
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Ive had it with hashtags.

title: Crimeans, at the Crossroads
description: On Sunday, the referendum on the status of Crimea divided the population of the multicultural region.

title: What to Do About Californias Drought
description: To the Editor:

title: Rangers Lose Game and Their Cushion in the Race for the Playoffs
description: Henrik Lundqvist called it painful, and it was  a 1-0 defeat to the San Jose Sharks that further imperiled the Rangers already precarious playoff situation.

title: Undercover TV Reports on School Security Raise Ethical Questions
description: The three news reports followed the same format: Television reporters walked into schools with hidden cameras, under the premise of testing the security measures. Each time, the anchors provided a sobering assessment of the findings.

title: When Speech Wont Come: Understanding Aphasia
description: To the Editor:

title: Heroin Use in Vermont
description: To the Editor:

title: Jail Reform in California
description: To the Editor:

title: The Men's Bracket
description: View and print our N.C.A.A. tournament bracket.

title: Honor Killings in the West
description: To the Editor:

title: A New Model for Music: Big Bands, Big Brands
description: I like Doritos as much as the next guy. More, probably. And I admire Lady Gaga for her handcrafted rise to the top of pop culture. In Austin last week, the salty, cheesy wonder of Doritos was brought to you by the sweet, uplifting allure of Lady Gaga. Or was it the other way around?

title: Palestinians Split in Gaza as Hamas Blocks Fatah Rally
description: GAZA  Hamas, the Islamic militant group that controls Gaza, prevented supporters of the rival Fatah party from holding a rare demonstration here on Sunday in solidarity with President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority ahead of his meeting with President Obama, which is set for Monday in Washington.

title: Viral Video Turns Senator Into a Silent Comedy Star
description: WASHINGTON  When Senator Mitch McConnells re-election campaign released two-and-a-half minutes of video footage featuring him wordlessly smiling, it was most likely hoping to provide a friendly super PAC with high-quality images of Mr. McConnell to use in ads.

title: Los Angeles Times Fires Writer of Articles on College
description: The Los Angeles Times fired an investigative journalist last week, after disclosing errors in articles about sexual abuse accusations at Occidental College and revealing that the reporter had an inappropriate relationship with a source for one of those articles.

title: Video Notebook: Atlantic 10 Final
description: The St. Joseph's coach Phil Martelli responds to a question about comments made by the Duke coach Mike Krzyzewski about the quality of the Atlantic 10 conference.

title: In Illinois, Republicans See an Office Up for Grabs
description: CHICAGO  Democrats have dominated state government here for so long that they even held on to the governors office in 2010 as their last governor, Rod R. Blagojevich, was facing corruption charges that would send him to federal prison.

title: Marlo Thomas Carves a Niche on Internet TV
description: The comedian Danny Thomas was a television pioneer of the 1950s and 60s. Now, his daughter Marlo Thomas has emerged as an unlikely innovator on Internet TV.

title: Wave of Sexual Abuse Allegations for Private Boys Schools in Britain
description: LONDON  Prompted by publicity surrounding recent child abuse scandals involving well-known figures, dozens of British men are breaking decades of silence about molestation they say they suffered as boys at expensive private schools, forcing the schools to confront allegations that in the past might have been hushed up, ignored or treated derisively.

title: Family Cable Channels Add Original Series
description: CABLE channels that specialize in family programming are adding more original scripted series to their schedules as marketers demonstrate growing interest in such shows while, at the same time, introducing commercials that offer new definitions of what makes a family.

title: In Two Starts, Tanaka Has Made It Look Easy
description: TAMPA, Fla.  It is only two starts, and it is only spring training, but like a developing piece of film, a clearer image of Masahiro Tanaka is emerging, and it continues to dazzle.

title: In Reversal Since the Recession, Some States Give More Money to Public Television
description: Gov. Mike Pence of Indiana would seem an unlikely candidate to receive an award from the Association of Public Television Stations: In 2005, while in the House of Representatives, he led a failed attempt to zero out federal funding for public media.

title: Lithium Producer Chases Teslas Bold Battery Plan
description: Last month, Tesla Motors, the maker of high-end electric cars, announced plans to open the worlds largest battery plant in 2017. The goal is to overcome what it calls the biggest obstacle to meeting increased demand for its vehicles: a reliable supply of the advanced batteries that power them.

title: Vodafone Agrees to Acquire the Spanish Cable Operator Ono for $10 Billion
description: Updated, 7:23 a.m. | LONDON  The British telecommunications company Vodafone is doubling down on cable.

title: Canada Explores G.M. Link to Accidents
description: OTTAWA  As pressure mounts on General Motors in the United States over its worldwide recall of 1.6 million cars for a defective ignition switch that has been linked to 12 deaths, Canadian officials are starting to take notice.

title: 2 Oligarchs in $7 Billion Deal for a German Oil Company
description: LONDON  The German utility RWE said on Sunday that it had reached a preliminary agreement to sell its oil and natural gas subsidiary, RWE Dea, to the Russian billionaires Mikhail Fridman and German Khan for 5.1 billion euros, or roughly $7 billion.

title: That Old-Time Whistle
description: There are many negative things you can say about Paul Ryan, chairman of the House Budget Committee and the G.O.P.s de facto intellectual leader. But you have to admit that hes a very articulate guy, an expert at sounding as if he knows what hes talking about.

title: Bostons St. Patricks Day Breakfast Breaks Barriers, but Its Parade Does Not
description: BOSTON  A stage filled with many Irish-American politicians, a traditionally male cohort, opened the annual St. Patricks Day breakfast in South Boston on Sunday with a jaunty version of If Youre Irish, Come Into the Parlor, when someone else burst in  a Haitian-American woman, singing, dancing and electrifying the audience.

title: Midwest: Transfer and Sidekick
description: The fairy-tale moment of Rodney Hoods young basketball career came when the phone rang in spring 2012 and the voice on the other end belonged to Duke Coach Mike Krzyzewski.

title: A Constellation of Satellites
description: Planet Labs, a San Francisco aerospace start-up, is launching 100 of its small satellites into orbit this year where they will photograph the Earth every single day.

title: Start-Ups Aim to Conquer Space Market
description: SAN FRANCISCO  It was party time at the Planet Labs satellite factory, in an unkempt office in the trendy South of Market neighborhood here.

title: East: Unselfish and Deep
description: It has been five years since Villanova Coach Jay Wright and the all-American point guard Scottie Reynolds took the Wildcats to the Final Four  their second appearance in four years. It turned out that 2009 was the apex of a five-year run in which Villanova won at least two N.C.A.A. tournament games four times.

title: What Would Plato Tweet?
West: Leading With Defense
description: Arizona was locked in a difficult game against Colorado on Friday night in Las Vegas when the Buffaloes Xavier Johnson swooped down the lane for a one-handed dunk. But a not-so-strange thing happened on the way to a momentum swing.

title: As U.S. Looks for Terror Links in Plane Case, Malaysia Rejects Extensive Help
description: WASHINGTON  With malicious intent strongly suspected in the disappearance of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, American intelligence and law enforcement agencies renewed their search over the weekend for any evidence that the planes diversion was part of a terrorist plot. But they have found nothing so far, senior officials said, and their efforts have been limited by the Malaysian authorities refusal to accept large-scale American assistance.

title: States Urge Retail Giants With Pharmacies to Stop Selling Tobacco Products
description: More than two dozen attorneys general sent letters on Sunday to five of the countrys largest retailers, encouraging them to stop selling tobacco products in stores that also have pharmacies, which would follow the example CVS Caremark set with its announcement earlier this year that it would stop selling such products in its drugstores.

title: Treasury Auctions for the Week of March 17
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills, an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday and an auction of 10-year inflation-protected securities on Thursday.

title: South: Playing With Discipline
description: Scottie Wilbekins toes were over the edge of Florida Coach Billy Donovans gangplank in June, when Wilbekin was caught violating a team rule for a second time in seven months and was suspended for a second time.

title: Florida Leads No. 1 Seeds in an N.C.A.A. Bracket Light on Midmajors
description: The Florida Gators, who barely held off Kentucky to win the Southeastern Conference tournament championship on Sunday and extend their winning streak to 26 games, landed the No. 1 overall seed when the N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament pairings were announced less than an hour after the SEC final.

title: After Deadly Draft Riots, a Shared Experience Reshaped Families in Manhattan
description: The draft riots exploded on the streets of Manhattan in 1863 when poor Irish immigrants and other whites turned on African-Americans in a bloody spasm of beating, maiming and lynching. Many of us know the story: It was the worst civil disturbance in our citys history, a bloodletting that left more than 100 people dead and laid bare the tensions between Irish and black New Yorkers who often lived and labored side by side.

title: Wests Drought and Growth Intensify Conflict Over Water Rights
description: MUMFORD, Tex.  Across the parched American West, the long drought has set off a series of fierce legal and political battles over who controls an increasingly dear treasure  water.

title: Kansas Has Star on the Court and Maybe One in Reserve
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  There are times when Andrew Wiggins, the versatile freshman guard for Kansas, will scowl, smile and laugh, displaying the usual emotions of a 19-year-old navigating his first collegiate postseason.

title: Fed to Cut Stimulus Efforts, and a Net Neutrality Vote
description: FED IS EXPECTED TO CUT ITS STIMULUS EFFORTS FURTHER

title: Unskilled and Destitute Are Hiring Targets for Fukushima Cleanup
description: NARAHA, Japan  Out of work? Nowhere to live? Nowhere to go? Nothing to eat? the online ad reads. Come to Fukushima.

title: Hey, Subway Hog
description: Dear Diary:

title: A Squabbling Family Kept in the Dark
description: Branden Jacobs-Jenkins admits he is a thief. This is a refreshing and useful confession. For as you watch Appropriate  his very fine, subversively original new play at the Pershing Square Signature Center  youre sure to find yourself thinking of a host of literary antecedents for this seemingly traditional family melodrama.

title: Ola L. Mize, Honored for Heroics in Korean War, Dies at 82
description: Ola L. Mize, a sharecroppers son who was awarded the Medal of Honor for valor after leading his outnumbered men in harrowing combat in the Korean War and single-handedly killing dozens of enemy soldiers, died on March 5 at his home in Gadsden, Ala. He was 82.

title: Low-Wage Workers Are Finding Poverty Harder to Escape
description: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn.  At 7 in the morning, they are already lined up  poultry plant workers, housekeepers, discount store clerks  to ask for help paying their heating bills or feeding their families.

title: Charter Schools
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio campaigned on the promise of re-evaluating the practice of co-locating charter and noncharter schools in public school buildings. Critics of charter schools were encouraged; charter enthusiasts feared he would damage schools that served students well.

title: A Hard Turn
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio sailed into office on the winds of a well-run campaign. Then he kept on campaigning, pressing for one overriding goal: a vast expansion of full-day prekindergarten and after-school programs, financed by an income tax on wealthier New Yorkers. Though the tax has always had only a whisper of a prayer of coming true  it needed approval in the State Legislature, and Gov. Andrew Cuomo and Senate Republicans were dead set against it  Mr. de Blasio pushed on anyway, giving no indication of having a Plan B.

title: Fans and the Foes They Love to Hate
Global Crises Put Obamas Strategy of Caution to the Test
description: WASHINGTON  For five years, President Obama has consciously recast how America engages with the worlds toughest customers. But with Russia poised to annex Crimea after Sundays referendum, with a mounting threat to the rest of Ukraine and with the carnage in Syria accelerating, Mr. Obamas strategy is now under greater stress than at any time in his presidency.

title: Developers Skyscraper Is Focus of Latest Dispute at Rebuilt Trade Center
description: One World Trade Center, the nations tallest skyscraper, is nearing completion, as is a $4 billion transit hub and the Sept. 11 museum. The memorial park is finished and a second office tower, built by the developer Larry A. Silverstein, is open, if not occupied.

title: N.B.A. Game of the Week: Teams That Cope
description: Each week, The New York Times chooses one essential game to watch, highlighting hot teams, winning and losing streaks and statistical intrigue in the N.B.A.

title: Main Ingredient in Mayors TV Cameo: Ham
description: The last time Bill de Blasio appeared on a popular prime-time network drama, it was as merely a name on a chalkboard, an afterthought in the set design of a 2000 episode of The West Wing.

title: Facts Elusive in Kabul Death of Swedish Reporter
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  With few facts emerging about why a Swedish journalist was gunned down on a crowded street here last week, some Afghan officials have begun offering an unsupported, if not familiar, theory: A spy war involving Western intelligence agents was to blame, rather than some homegrown cause.

title: Amid Mayoral Missteps and Snubs of Parades, Irish Eyes Are Rolling in New York
description: He wants to close schools for the Chinese New Year, has pledged fealty to an Israeli political group, sprinkles Spanish and Italian phrases into his speeches and speaks frequently of his wifes Caribbean heritage.

title: Five Freshmen to Watch in the N.C.A.A. Tournament
description: Before the season, four freshmen were billed as making up the best rookie class since Greg Oden and Kevin Durant arrived on campus, and the superlatives only multiplied. Then Kansas discovered it had another freshman star, Joel Embiid, who could leapfrog the rest to be the No. 1 pick in the N.B.A. draft in June. But why worry about all that now? Lets enjoy watching these stars play in the N.C.A.A. tournament.

title: Popular Demand
description: Most of the top video games in February were franchises like Call of Duty and NBA 2K, which are typically released for major game systems and the PC. This ranking represents sales of physical games in stores and online.

title: In Loss, Federer Shows More Evidence of Resurgence
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif.  Roger Federer leaves the BNP Paribas Open having reclaimed his champions aura, even after finishing as the runner-up.

title: Gender Inequality in Morocco Continues, Despite Amendments to Family Law
description: When Zineb lost her father at the age of 15, her grief was compounded when she learned that she had to share his inheritance with an older half-brother unknown to her or her mother and sister.

title: Guinness Withdraws Sponsorship of St. Patricks Day Parade
description: Guinness USA has dropped its sponsorship of the St. Patricks Day parade in New York, joining protests of a ban on public expression of gay pride.

title: 9/11 Architect Says Bin Ladens Son-in-Law Had No Role in Qaeda Military Operations
description: Khalid Shaikh Mohammed, the self-described architect of the Sept. 11 attacks, says that a former top associate of Osama bin Laden who is now on trial in Manhattan had no role in military operations for Al Qaeda and, he suggests, was enlisted to make fiery speeches because he was an eloquent, spellbinding speaker.

title: Photo Replay: March 9-16
description: There is a dramatic difference between a leap of faith and a fall from grace.

title: Larry Scott, Bodybuilder Who Inspired Schwarzenegger, Dies at 75
description: Larry Scott, a renowned bodybuilder who won the first and second Mr. Olympia competitions in the 1960s and inspired a generation of musclemen, including a young upstart from Austria named Arnold Schwarzenegger, died on March 8 in Salt Lake City. He was 75.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 16, 2014
description: March 16, 2014

title: New Contenders Emerge in Quest to Identify Yales First African-American Graduate
description: For Richard Henry Green, recently declared to have been Yale Colleges first known African-American graduate, fame, or at least the certainty of his claim on history, was fleeting.

title: Chinese News Agency Slams Delays in Search for Jet
description: Chinas state-run news agency, Xinhua, has sharply criticized Malaysia for delays in revealing information about the disappearance of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370.

title: Giant Interactive, a Chinese Web Video Game Operator, Agrees to $3 Billion Buyout
description: HONG KONG  Giant Interactive, one of Chinas biggest online video game operators, said on Monday that it had agreed to be taken over and privatized by its chairman and a pair of private equity companies after the buyers made a sweetened, $3 billion offer.

title: In Varanasi, a Lifetime Spent in a World of Death
description: VARANASI, India In Indias oldest city, the only female gatekeeper of heaven sits in her homespun sari and tends to an open oven in a 14th-century building near the sacred Ganges River.

title: One-Thing Shops:Luggage, London
description: For this series, T asks friends and contributors to share their favorite shops from around the world that sell just a single kind of product.

title: 59E59 Theaters to Announce Fresh Plans
description: The Off Broadway theater company Primary Stages announced in January that it would end its decade-long residency at 59E59 Theaters this spring, moving to the Duke on 42nd Street. 59E59 Theaters has a plan to fill the void: Elysabeth Kleinhans, the artistic director, and Peter Tear, the executive producer, are to announce on Monday that they will introduce 5A Season, a new slate of productions to be presented on the main stage of 59E59s three-theater complex, the 196-seat Theater A.

title: Word of the Day | hedonist
description: hedonist\he-d-nist\ noun

title: A Surgical Procedures Risks, Unmentioned
description: Many patients assume that, like prescription drugs, surgical procedures and instruments undergo extensive testing and must be government-approved. Its not necessarily so.

title: Ticket Pricing Puts Lion King Atop Broadways Circle of Life
description: How did The Lion King turn around its once-shaky fortunes and become the top-grossing show on Broadway in 2013, an unprecedented feat for long-running musicals, which usually cool after a few hot seasons? Hint: Its not because it added performances after 16 years.

title: Whats on Monday
description: 1:45 P.M. (TCM) THE RISING OF THE MOON (1957) Comprising three Irish tales that were filmed in Ireland with Irish actors, this movie, directed by John Ford, is about as close to the Emerald Isle as American audiences can get without leaving home this St. Patricks Day. The first vignette, The Majesty of the Law, is about a highly principled man arrested in an assault case; the second, A Minutes Wait, is a farce set on a train; and the third, which shares the films title, is based on Lady Gregorys one-act drama about an Irish patriot. All in all, Mr. Ford, who made this picture as a personal labor of love, has given us Irish characters as lushly sentimental as the songs that run through his black-and-white idyll, Bosley Crowther wrote in The New York Times. The film is one of several Irish-centric movies the channel is showing throughout the day, including The Flying Irishman (1939), at 9 a.m.; the musical My Wild Irish Rose (1947), at noon; and Finians Rainbow (1968), at 5:15 p.m.

title: Girls Recap: Hannahs Envy and Thwarted Ambition
description: This latest episode of Girls was about that moment that makes monsters of many: your friends and boyfriends are having success for once. And you? Oh yeah, youve got that job writing stupid advertorials.

title: 5-Year-Old Boy Fatally Struck by Car in Brooklyn
description: A 5-year-old boy was struck and killed by a car in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn on Sunday, the police said.

title: New York City Census Record From 1870
description: An 1870 census record shows some families made up of Irish women and African-American men in the Eighth Ward.

title: Times Minute | What's Next in Crimea
description: David Herszenhorn reports from Crimea, where an overwhelming majority of Crimeans voted on Sunday to secede from Ukraine and join Russia.

title: Times Minute | Whats Next in Crimea
description: In the Video

title: Corrections: March 17, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Indian Play About Muslim Identity Canceled Over Fears of Violence
description: BANGALORE, India An Indian play on the Muslim identity, Ali J, had a strong start last year, premiering at the Edinburgh Fringe festival in August to good reviews during its 25-day run and then making its first domestic appearance in October at the National Center for the Performing Arts in Mumbai.

title: Test Yourself | E.L.L. Practice, March 17, 2014
description: Would you ever eat a bug?

title: SEAL Team Raids a Tanker and Thwarts a Militias Bid to Sell Libyan Oil
description: CAIRO  United States Navy commandos seized a renegade tanker carrying illicit Libyan oil in the Mediterranean southeast of Cyprus on Monday, thwarting a breakaway militias attempt to sell the oil on the black market. No shots were fired, no one was injured and the commandos captured three armed Libyans described by the ships captain as hijackers.

title: 6 Qs About the News | In Public Referendum, Crimeans Vote to Secede from Ukraine, Join Russia
description: In Crimea Votes to Secede From Ukraine as Russian Troops Keep Watch, David M. Herszenhorn writes about the ongoing situation in Ukraine.

title: Hunting Honey, and Trying to Hide
description: Andrew Newey has made a career documenting vanishing cultures and traditions: Mongolian eagle hunters, ritualistic bull-jumping in Ethiopia and tribal festivals in Papua New Guinea. But the Indiana Jones-ish golden stills of his latest project, Gurung Honey Hunters, present a paradox, because photojournalists like Mr. Newey contribute to the traditions disappearance in central Nepals foothill villages and mountainsides.

title: Who Are the Characters That Authors Should Be Writing About?
description: Many children learn about the world through books that are read to them and books they read themselves.

title: Toyota Unit Shuts 2 Factories in India
description: NEW DELHI  The Indian unit of Toyota shut down its two factories near Bangalore on Monday in response to a labor dispute over wages that has lasted for 10 months.

title: Behind the Cover Story: Yiren Lu on the Angst, Perks and Failures of the Tech Industry
description: Yiren Lu, a graduate student in computer science, wrote this weeks cover story about why Silicon Valleys younger generation of engineers would rather work for a sexting app than try to cure cancer and why the older generation remains set in its ways.

title: Rosneft to Take Stake in Pirelli Owner
description: LONDON  The Russian state oil company Rosneft has agreed to take a 50 percent stake in a reconstituted Camfin, the holding company that owns the Italian tire maker Pirelli.

title: Death of Brooklyn Boy Latest in Spate as City Turns to Traffic Safety
description: They are maneuvers committed to muscle memory by most any New Yorker, two of the countless mundane acts that make the citys transportation machinery hum.

title: Daily Report: Start-Ups Set Their Sights on Space
description: Silicon Valley, not content with changing how retailers, taxi companies and hotels do business, is taking its disruptive ways into outer space. Several young companies with roots in Silicon Valley are trying to elbow their way into a business long dominated by national governments and aeronautics giants like Boeing, Quentin Hardy and Nick Bilton report.

title: New York Today: Cold, Yes. Snow, No.
description: Good frosty Monday morning to you.

title: Jaccar Offers to Acquire Ship Supplier Bourbon
description: LONDON  Bourbon, which supplies ships to the offshore oil and natural gas industry, said on Monday that its largest shareholder, Jaccar, had offered to buy it in a deal that values the company at roughly $2.48 billion.

title: Lawmakers in Crimea Move Swiftly to Split From Ukraine
description: SIMFEROPOL, Ukraine  In the face of stern international criticism a day after a disputed referendum, the Parliament of the breakaway republic of Crimea declared its independence from Ukraine on Monday, formally asking Russia to annex it and moving swiftly to cement its rupture with the authorities in Kiev.

title: Jewish State Declaration Is Unyielding Block to a Deal
description: WASHINGTON  With time running out before an April 29 diplomatic deadline and no signs of progress in the Israeli-Palestinian negotiations, President Obama on Monday warned President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority that were going to have to take some tough political decisions and risks if were able to move it forward.

title: Catholic Bishop Who Spent Decades in Prison Dies in Shanghai
description: Bishop Joseph Fan Zhongliang, who was imprisoned for more than two decades in China and spent his final years under house arrest, died on Sunday, a Roman Catholic organization based in the United States announced. He was 95.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | March 17, 2014
description: Update: March 18

title: Why This Has Been the Winter of My Discontent
description: Ive added a new skill to all of those Ive picked up in the last 27 years: weather forecaster. Its been that kind of winter.

title: Lost Jets Path Seen as Altered via Computer
description: WASHINGTON  The first turn to the west that diverted the missing Malaysia Airlines plane from its planned flight path from Kuala Lumpur to Beijing was carried out through a computer system that was most likely programmed by someone in the planes cockpit who was knowledgeable about airplane systems, according to senior American officials.

title: Alibabas New York State of Mind
description: The Alibaba Group, Chinas online commerce giant, says it plans to begin the process of going public in New York, Michael J. de la Merced writes in DealBook. The long-awaited initial public offering could be one of the biggest ever and could eventually raise more than the $16 billion that Facebook secured nearly two years ago. Analysts estimate that Alibaba could reach a valuation upward of $130 billion.

title: Markets Worldwide Brush Off Crimea Vote
description: Global financial markets on Monday shrugged off an anticipated Russian annexation of Crimea, as stocks rose strongly on Wall Street and in Europe.

title: Is Crimea the Next Yugoslavia?
description: Simferopol, Ukraine  Here is a disturbing thought: What if Vladimir V. Putin no longer has power to prevent bloodshed in Ukraine, even if he wants to?

title: Putative Bitcoin Founder Categorically Denies It
description: Around 10 days after being identified by Newsweek magazine as the mysterious creator of the digital currency Bitcoin, Dorian Nakamoto, a 64-year-old semi-employed engineer, has hired a lawyer and issued a statement unconditionally denying that he had any involvement in Bitcoin.

title: Searching for Profits in Mobile
description: Maybe the problem of making money in mobile is getting easier, using the same basic technique that was used for the web. Or for that matter, for junk mail.

title: Your Questions, My Answers (II)
description: As promised, heres the second installment of my answers to reader questions (you can read the first here); again, theyve been edited slightly for length, and the full versions are available from the link on each questioners name.

title: Googles Legal Chief Joins K.K.R.s Board
description: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts has attracted one of Silicon Valleys top legal executives to its board of directors.

title: Metro-North: A Severe Assessment
description: Federal officialsreportedFridaythat they found a deficient safety culture in the second largest commuter railroad in the country: Metro-North, which connects New York City to its northern suburbs and Connecticut. Every weekday nearly three hundred thousand people depend on a system that, it turns out, poorly trains too many of its employees and emphasizes punctuality over caution.

title: Putin Recognizes Crimea Secession, Defying the West
description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia signed a decree on Monday formally recognizing Crimea as a sovereign and independent state, laying the groundwork for annexation and defying the United States and Europe just hours after they imposed their first financial sanctions against Moscow since the crisis in Ukraine began.

title: Weekend Gun Report: March 14-16, 2014
description: Zakia McCormick wants charges filed against the man who shot and killed her son. But as of now, that looks unlikely.

title: For Some, Reader Contributions Become a New Reporting Tool
description: Not too long ago, it happened like this: A newspaper would publish a story. Response came in the form of letters to the editor, or maybe an outraged phone call or two, or a handwritten note to a reporter  or, every once in a while, a lawsuit.

title: Space Ripples Reveal Big Bangs Smoking Gun
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  One night late in 1979, an itinerant young physicist named Alan Guth, with a new son and a years appointment at Stanford, stayed up late with his notebook and equations, venturing far beyond the world of known physics.

title: Moist Brown Soda Bread Loaf With Oats
description: For years Ive been trying to make a moist soda bread loaf like the kind I love to eat when Im in Ireland. Finally Ive achieved it with this recipe, which is adapted from Bon Apptits recipe for Fallon & Byrne Soda Bread (Fallon & Byrne is a restaurant in Dublin). The bread is a whole-wheat loaf with both rolled and steel-cut (pinhead) oats, and does not have the hard crust that round soda breads can have. One reason is that the moist dough is baked at a lower temperature than free-form soda bread.

title: Fighting Pollution, Paris Imposes Partial Driving Ban
description: PARIS  With air pollution in and around Paris still unusually high, the government imposed a partial driving ban here on Monday for the first time in nearly 20 years, and public transportation was free for a fourth consecutive day.

title: Whole-Wheat Soda Bread With Raisins (Spotted Dog)
description: Traditional spotted dog is made with white flour and does not always include an egg. Ive always preferred brown soda bread made with a mix of whole-wheat and white flour, with more whole wheat than white. For this version, rather than traditional currants or sultanas I used a delicious mix of large golden, flame and jumbo raisins. As always with soda bread, the trick to success is to handle it as little as possible.

title: Brown Soda Bread Loaf With Caraway Seeds and Rye
description: Some regional variations on Irish soda bread, from Donegal and Leitrim, call for caraway seeds. I love caraway seeds in bread, but in my personal food memory bank they will always be paired with rye. So I decided to add a little rye flour to this already dark brown, grainy and moist bread.

title: Whole-Wheat Buttermilk Scones With Raisins and Oatmeal
description: You may be accustomed to the gigantic, sweet scones in coffee shops in this country. They are nothing like the diminutive, light scones that originated in Britain and Ireland. This is a whole-wheat version, only moderately sweet  the way I think scones should be. You can always top them with jam or honey if you want more sugar. The whole-wheat flour brings a rich, nutty flavor to the scones.

title: Savory Whole-Wheat Buttermilk Scones With Rosemary and Thyme
description: These rich, herbal scones are savory like American biscuits, with the added nutty, wholesome dimension of the whole-wheat flour. Theyre great with cheese and with salads, soups and stews.

title: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 87
description: He has lost 22 pounds and sworn off bread. Then there are the 11 goals he has scored in Italys Serie A this season for sixth-place Parma.

title: Julia Bullock Wins $15,000 Naumburg Prize
description: Julia Bullock, a soprano from St. Louis who made her New York recital debut just last week, and is scheduled to sing the title role in the Juilliard Opera production of Massenets Cendrillon next month, has won the first prize of the Walter W. Naumburg Foundations international vocal competition. The competition, which the foundation has fielded since 1925, and which rotates focus between different instruments, voice and composition, was held at the 92nd Street Y and Manhattan School of Music, where the winners were announced on Friday evening.

title: Airline on Planes Communication System
description: The chief executive of Malaysia Airlines says it is unclear when the missing planes communications system, known as Acars, was switched off.

title: U.S. Imposes New Sanctions on Russia
description: President Obama announced sanctions aimed at President Vladimir V. Putins inner circle.

title: Opposing Testimony Caps Trial of General
description: FORT BRAGG, N.C.  At a military courtroom here on Monday, two former lovers, now enemies, told their stories.

title: Kerry Announces U.S. Representative to Syrian Opposition
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State John Kerry on Monday named Daniel Rubinstein, a senior foreign service official with long experience in the Middle East, as a new special envoy for Syria.

title: On Stage, Nirbhaya Gives Delhi Gang Rape Victim a Voice
description: NEW DELHI  When a 23-year-old student was gang raped and brutally assaulted on a bus in Indias capital in December 2012, it provoked an unprecedented wave of public anger in India. But in one Indian woman, the gang rape also brought on a deep sense of guilt.

title: Weibo I.P.O. Sets a Low Bar for Alibaba
description: Imagine the riskiest possible share offering. It would be a new, unprofitable company with rapid and uncertain growth in an emerging market. One whose customers are fickle, which lives under the constant threat of being snuffed out by regulators, and where external shareholders are dominated by insiders. The listing of Sina Weibo fits the bill. The Twitter-like microblog has also set a low bar for the upcoming market debut of the e-commerce giant Alibaba.

title: Measuring the Facebook Cover Photo
description: Q. What is the size of the space used by the cover photo on the Facebook desktop website?

title: A Coin Problem
description: This weeks puzzle was suggested by Daniel Finkel of the Seattle-based Math for Love. Our last few from Dr. Finkel traced the path of a traveling nun; this week we transition to new territory with a coin challenge. Heres Dr. Finkel with

title: An Inspired Lunch Puts Brunch to Shame
description: I dont do brunch, or not if I can help it. Does that make me a traitor, or simply a curmudgeon?

title: Haste Clouds Long-Term Effort on Mortgage Fraud
description: A report issued by the Justice Departments inspector general, Michael E. Horowitz, underscores the danger of extolling short-term results when it comes to prosecuting white-collar crimes. The report highlights how generating headlines seemed to take precedence over accurate figures in the governments fight against mortgage fraud.

title: Obamas Statement on New Sanctions Against Russia
description: Following is a transcript of President Obamas announcement of new sanctions in response to Russian actions in Ukraine, as provided by the White House.

title: The Role Orson Welles Almost Played
description: The Chilean filmmaker Alejandro Jodorowsky explains how he convinced director Orson Welles to play a monstrous role in his unseen version of Dune.

title: Ultranationalist-Turned-Liberal Is Expected to Lead Serbia
description: Aleksandar Vucic, the man expected to be Serbias next prime minister, is a former ultranationalist who recast himself as a pro-Western liberal and is determined to shepherd the poor Balkan country toward the European Union.

title: Judge in Germany Dismisses Hedge Fund Suit Against Porsche Holding
description: FRANKFURT  The former holding company for the automaker Porsche won a victory Monday in its long-running legal battle with a group of aggrieved hedge funds, after a judge in Stuttgart dismissed a suit seeking damages over events leading up to its unsuccessful attempt to acquire Volkswagen.

title: Memories of 87 Blast Jarred Loose by Explosion
description: The ear-shattering boom came first, just as they walked out of the building. They turned to look back, the smell of gas now mixed with thick smoke, covering all that had once stood behind them.

title: American Airlines Focuses on the Glory Days of Flying
description: As competition in the United States transcontinental aviation market heats up, American Airlines is running a new advertising campaign highlighting its decades of service on these routes.

title: Ron Howard, Kevin Spacey and Michael Douglas to Talk at Tribeca Film Festival
description: In addition to its roster of movies the Tribeca Film Festival will once again offer plenty of conversation next month. Ron Howard, Kevin Spacey and Michael Douglas will be among those taking part in the Tribeca Talks series, festival organizers announced Monday. As part of the directors series Mr. Howard will discuss his films and his long career in Hollywood. Also as part of that series the Oscar-nominated director Lee Daniels will chat about his filmography, including Precious and Lee Daniels The Butler. Mr. Spacey will be on hand to discuss the documentary NOW: In the Wings on a World Stage, about the Old Vic, the London theater company where he is artistic director.

title: In Our Pages: March 18
description: 1914: Old Jewelry at London Museum

title: The Unworried Unwell
description: She is an organized, punctual patient who makes appointments and keeps them. He drops in whenever he feels like it. Her visits are short and organized; his seem to drag on forever. The two have nothing in common  except that they both leave the office empty-handed.

title: U.S. May Quit Giving Aid for Outdated Technology
description: WASHINGTON  A federal program that provides money to schools and libraries for high-speed Internet connections is likely to stop paying for outdated services, including pagers, mobile phones for school officials, email, web hosting and 800 numbers, the chairman of the Federal Communications Commission said on Monday.

title: New Play by Danai Gurira Among Highlights of Yale Rep Season
description: Danai Gurira was an Obie Award-winning playwright (Eclipsed, In the Continuum) before she shot to wider fame in 2012 playing the sword-wielding Michonne on the hit cable series The Walking Dead, becoming one of its most popular characters. But Ms. Gurira never stopped writing: Her new play, Familiar, about a Midwestern bride whose family is rocked by her choice of wedding rituals, will have a world premiere production in January as part of Yale Repertory Theaters 2014-15 season, the theater announced on Monday.

title: Vodafone-Ono Deal a Big Win for Team of Deal Makers in London
description: LONDON  The Vodafone-Ono marriage featured many of the investment bank names one would expect in a deal worth about $10 billion.

title: Times Minute | New Sanctions for Russia
description: In the Video

title: Times Minute | New Sanctions for Russia
description: President Obama announces new sanctions on Russian officials. Also on the Minute, a push for peace in the Middle East and the looming enrollment deadline for the Affordable Care Act.

title: More Nights to Come for Janis Joplin
description: When A Night With Janis Joplin closed at the Lyceum Theater in February, after a four-and-a-half-month run, the shows producers said that they had a deal in the works that would lead to a quick revival in another New York theater. On Monday, the shows lead producers, Todd Gershwin, Michael Cohl and Daniel Chilewich, announced the details: in a new partnership with Live Nation Entertainment, the giant concert promoter, they will present what they are calling a new production of the show at the Gramercy Theater, on East 23rd Street. Opening night is April 10.

title: How Do I Make the Most of My Paternity Leave?
description: Late last year, The New York Times Company announced that it would offer six weeks of paid parental leave for all employees. The timing couldnt have been better for me, because late last year I became a father. I worked out some scheduling with my managers, and my wife, and in one weeks time Ill start paternity leave with our 4-month-old daughter as my wife returns to work from her maternity leave.

title: Bookshelf | An Illustrator Captures the Spirit of San Francisco (and an April Bloomfield Recipe)
description: My San Francisco is one of 100,000 San Franciscos, the illustrator and graphic journalist Wendy MacNaughton says. A fifth-generation native of that metropolis, she has paid tribute to her hometown with a collection of watercolor renderings, observations and stories titled Meanwhile in San Francisco: the City in its Own Words, which hits bookshelves tomorrow.

title: Determining the Markup on Municipal Bonds
description: Most of the market news you hear tends to be about stocks, but bonds are just as useful a tool for most investment portfolios. One type in particular, the municipal, or muni bond, remains very popular. These bonds are issued by local governments, theyre often tax-exempt and they can be relatively low risk. But muni bonds come with a catch: You may be entering a dark and dangerous world when you go through the process of buying one.

title: At Monteverdi Tuscany, a Celebration of the Composer
description: Monteverdi Tuscany, a boutique hotel and collection of villas in the village of Castiglioncello del Trinoro, Italy, is partnering with the renowned British conductor Sir John Eliot Gardiner from April 22 to 26 for its first Accademia Monteverdi.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week.

title: 3 Activists Held in Sri Lanka, Raising Fears of Crackdown
description: NEW DELHI  Fears of a broad crackdown against rights activists in Sri Lanka have been heightened after the Sri Lankan police recently arrested two prominent human rights advocates and a woman who has made a public campaign of finding her missing son.

title: NYT Now: Obama and Abbas Discuss Israel
description: President Obama spoke with the Palestinian Authority president, Mahmoud Abbas, on the progress of Israeli-Palestinian negotiations.

title: N.C.A.A. Tournament: Who Do You Hate (and Love)?
description: Which team do you think will win? Eh, never mind that. Tell us which teams losses would give you the greatest joy, and which teams success would make you most happy.

title: Sorting Out the Risks of Fish
description: Fish is often called brain food. Its an excellent source of lean protein, rich in nutrients like omega-3 fatty acids, B vitamins and iodine, and pregnant women are encouraged to eat it. Theres just one, ah, catch: Fish also may have mercury, which can harm the developing brain.

title: Manhattan Doesnt Have to Look Far for Its Talent
description: Like a Williamsburg restaurant getting its lettuce from a Brooklyn rooftop, Manhattan College sourced its mens basketball team locally.

title: LWren Scott, Whose Designs Melded Daring and Sophistication, Dies at 49
description: LWren Scott, a fashion designer whose creations were known for their discreet elegance, though with a soupon of daring and glamour evoking her days as a celebrity stylist in Hollywood and her romantic partnership with Mick Jagger, was found dead on Monday in her Manhattan apartment. She was 49.

title: A Reflection: Suzy Menkes on the Fashion Designer LWren Scott
description: The designer LWren Scott, who was was found dead in her New York apartment on Monday, started her fashion collection eight years ago, building it on her own elegant and towering self. But she never forgot her Hollywood years as a stylist dressing the stars.

title: Obama and Abbas Confer in Washington
description: President Obama spoke with President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority on the progress of the Israeli-Palestinian negotiations.

title: Writer From Zimbabwe Wins PEN/Hemingway Award for First Novel
description: NoViolet Bulawayo has won the PEN/Hemingway Foundation Award for We Need New Names, her novel about a 10-year-old Zimbabwean girl who travels to the United States in search of a fresh start. The prize, established in 1976 by Mary Hemingway in memory of her husband, Ernest Hemingway, honors distinguished first books of fiction, and includes a $10,000 award, a one-week residence at the University of Idaho, and a fellowship at the Ucross Foundation, a retreat for artists and writers in Wyoming.

title: By Design | One-Room Hotels
description: When it comes to providing the experience of a home away from home, very little can go a very long way.

title: Something Went Very Wrong at G.M., Chief Says
description: Mary T. Barra, General Motors chief executive, announced another round of wide-ranging recalls on Monday, a sign that the company was moving with a new sense of urgency on safety problems after it disclosed a decade-long failure to fix a defect tied to 12 deaths.

title: Monday Motorsports: Rosberg Wins an Eventful Australian Grand Prix
description: Nico Rosberg, driving for Mercedes-Benz, handily won the season-opening Formula One race in Australia on Sunday. Over all, it was a strong start for the Mercedes team, as Rosbergs teammate, Lewis Hamilton, had started from pole. Hamilton, however, retired soon after the start of the race because of an engine misfire.

title: Rachel Mellon, an Heiress Known for Her Green Thumb, Dies at 103
description: Rachel Lambert Mellon, an heir to the Listerine fortune and a horticulturalist, fine arts collector and philanthropist who redesigned the White House Rose Garden, died on Monday at the Upperville, Va., estate that had been her principal residence for decades. She was 103.

title: The Work of LWren Scott
description: The designer started her fashion collection eight years ago, building it on her own elegant and towering self.

title: Two SAC Capital Traders Jump to Highbridge Capital
description: The hedge fund Highbridge Capital Management just lured away two portfolio managers from Steven A. Cohens SAC Capital Advisors to manage money for its stock trading funds.

title: Brooklyn Provides the Secret to Nashville-Style Hot Chicken
description: At Peaches HotHouse in Brooklyn, a restaurant that specializes in notoriously spicy Nashville-style fried chicken, they are not exaggerating when they say the chicken is hot.

title: G.M. Chief Updates on Recall
description: In a video message addressed to General Motors employees, Mary Barra, the chief executive, said the company had made mistakes and needed to change its processes.

title: Weekly News Quiz | March 11-17, 2014
description: Flight 370, March Madness, viral videos and more: How much do you know about this weeks news?

title: In the Air | Masculin, Feminin
description: The recent feminization of mens dressing feels downright manly in its brazen embrace of the softer side.

title: The Read Around: Helen Oyeyemi
description: Helen Oyeyemi, whose new novel, Boy, Snow, Bird, was inspired by Snow White, says fairy tales allow us to focus on the nature of stories themselves, and the curious power they have.

title: Future of Fusion, Cancer as Demon Baby, Laughing for Science
description:
We look at how far nuclear fusion has come and how far it has yet to go; contemplating the frightful parallels between a growing embryo and a runaway tumor; what is the science behind side-splitting, tear-inducing humor?
Subscribe to the Podcast

title: Billionaires Sprawling Compound Challenges a Villages Mellow Ethos
description: HASTINGS-ON-HUDSON, N.Y.  In this comfortable Westchester County community, many residents like to think of their village as the anti-suburb, jokingly calling it the Upper Upper West Side.

title: All Dressed Up and Nowhere to Go
description: With a bit of patchwork, some lace and a pair of exceptionally matronly shoes, the quirky charm of the noble eccentric is only a stop away.

title: String of High Notes for Pianist
description: BOSTON  Haydn, Mozart and Beethoven are playing Scrabble in heaven. No, it is not the setup of a joke  well, not exactly. It is the first scene of the highly improbable comic opera being written by the pianist Jeremy Denk and the composer Steven Stucky, based on one of the most influential scholarly music books of recent decades: Charles Rosens The Classical Style.

title: The Mets Enchanted Island Offers Students a Cultural Refuge
description: The soprano Danielle de Niese was dressed as an antiquated scuba diver when she greeted a group of 10 young guests during intermission at Saturdays performance of The Enchanted Island at the Metropolitan Opera.

title: Squeezing the Milky Way Into a Photo
description: Q. When I see a published photograph purporting to be of the entire Milky Way, I wonder, was it really possible for someone to take it?

title: After Years in Politics and Prison, Louisiana Ex-Governor Will Run for Congress
description: BATON ROUGE, La.  After seven years in Congress, 16 years as governor, eight years in the federal penitentiary and several weeks of coyly prodding the speculation of political reporters, Edwin Edwards, 86, announced on Monday that he would be running as a Democrat to represent Louisianas Sixth Congressional District.

title: Airlines Use Digital Technology to Get Even More Personal
description: LONDON  As the door of his limousine opened outside Virgin Atlantics business class lounge at Heathrow Airport one recent afternoon, Declan Jones was startled to be greeted by more than just a smiling face.

title: Video: Helen Oyeyemi on the Power of Fairy Tales
description: In The Read Around, a weekly video feature, authors talk about the when, where and how behind their books. Above, Helen Oyeyemi discusses her new novel, Boy, Snow, Bird  which was inspired by Snow White  and how fairy tales allow us to focus on the nature of stories themselves, and the curious power that they have.

title: A Tumor, the Embryos Evil Twin
description: During her first encounter with cancer, Susan Sontag described a tumor as a demonic pregnancy. This lump is alive, she wrote in Illness as Metaphor, a fetus with its own will. She could hardly know that the comparison would become more than a figure of speech.

title: China Releases Plan to Incorporate Farmers Into Cities
description: BEIJING  China has announced a sweeping plan to manage the flow of rural residents into cities, promising to promote urbanization but also to solve some of the drastic side effects of this great uprooting.

title: Following Up on Bag Check Rules
description: THERE was a lot of response to last weeks column, in which I asked for comment from readers about the move by United Airlines to crack down on oversize carry-on bags by more strictly enforcing size regulations at the check-in areas. I have the space to use only a handful of the responses, alas. But Ill try to summarize the gist of them.

title: Ha! Takes a Serious Look at Humor
description: So theres this baby who has swallowed a .22-caliber bullet. The mother rushes into a drugstore, crying, What shall I do?

title: Ha! The Quiz
description: Laughter seems like the most natural response when something funny happens. But why dont we all laugh at the same thing? How the brain processes humor reveals some interesting truths about human nature. Take this quiz, based on the new book Ha! The Science of When We Laugh and Why, by Scott Weems, to find out how much you know about your funny bone.

title: Privacy in the War Without End
description: How should we think about balancing civil liberties and national security? It may depend on what a speech later this year tells us about how a modern war really ends.

title: Probiotic Eases Ills in Children
description: A randomized trial of a common probiotic has shown that a daily dose substantially reduced episodes of diarrhea and respiratory tract infections among children at day care centers.

title: Best Selling Science Books
description: 1 DAVID AND GOLIATH by Malcolm Gladwell. Little, Brown. How disadvantages can work in our favor, from the author of The Tipping Point and Outliers. (1)

title: The Gene Behind a Butterfly Disguise
description: A single gene controls all the colors, structures and wing patterns in a species of swallowtail butterfly, researchers say  allowing it to mimic the look of another swallowtail that is toxic to predators.

title: A Chickadee Mating Zone Surges North
description: In a long, narrow strip of territory from Kansas to New Jersey, two closely related species of chickadees meet, mate and give birth to hybrid birds. Now scientists are reporting that this so-called hybrid zone is moving north at a rate that matches the warming trend in winter temperatures.

title: A Mythical Director Unveiled in Jodorowskys Dune
description: Alejandro Jodorowsky, the 85-year-old director who was profiled in last weekends magazine, describes his 1975 adaptation of Frank Herberts unwieldy science-fiction epic, Dune, as a psychedelic fever dream. I wanted to make something sacred. A film that gives LSD hallucinations  without taking LSD, says Jodorowsky, who never actually read the book.
