description: BRUSSELS  When antigovernment protesters first took to the streets of the Ukrainian capital, Kiev, late last year, Jos Manuel Barroso, the president of the European Unions executive arm, applauded the demonstrators for writing the new narrative for a 28-nation bloc weighed down by economic gloom and growing public skepticism about its purpose.

title: EchoAge and Other Better Ways to Do Birthday Presents
description: Like many of you, I suspect, Ive long felt a little empty inside when I see the giant pile of presents awaiting children at birthday parties they host for their friends.

title: New Kyle Abraham Works Inspired by Fights for Freedom
description: New York Live Arts, the Chelsea home of the Bill T. Jones/Arnie Zane Dance Company, will present two weeks of world premieres choreographed by Kyle Abraham, the centers 2012-14 resident commissioned artist.

title: In Book, Architect of Health Law Predicts a Shift Away From Employer Coverage
description: WASHINGTON  Ezekiel J. Emanuel, who helped devise the Affordable Care Act, has a vision for how it will eventually work. Democrats hope it will not materialize anytime soon.

title: Times Minute | The New Sandy Hook
description: A look at the designs for the new Sandy Hook Elementary School. Also on the Minute, General Jeffrey A. Sinclair s sentence for sexual misconduct and museums efforts to attract donations.

title: Times Minute | The New Sandy Hook
description: In the Video

title: Wheelies: The Baby Engine Boom Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Former Naval Academy Football Player Is Acquitted of Sexual Assault
description: WASHINGTON  A military judge on Thursday found a former United States Naval Academy football player, Joshua Tate, not guilty of sexually assaulting a fellow midshipman when she was too drunk to consent, bringing partial resolution to a highly publicized case that has lasted for nearly two years.

title: $80 Million for 6 Weeks for Cable Chief
description: Updated, 8:55 p.m. | Robert D. Marcus became chief executive of Time Warner Cable at the start of the year. Less than two months later, he agreed to sell the company to its largest rival, Comcast, for $45 billion.

title: Former Head of Piper Jaffray Asset Management Switches to Consulting Role
description: The investment firm Piper Jaffray has hired its own former head of asset management as a consultant.

title: Group Suggests New Rules for Further Cuts in Carbon Pollution
description: WASHINGTON  An influential environmental group on Thursday released a new analysis suggesting major climate change regulations that could lead to even steeper cuts in carbon pollution than those being considered by the Obama administration.

title: Old-Meets-New Accommodations at the Hotel dAngleterre in Copenhagen
description: Sybarites in need of an escape  and a spectacular pool to float in  should consider a visit to Copenhagens Hotel dAngleterre. The historic, centuries-old property was completely taken apart and reconstructed last spring, a two-year undertaking that restored many original details, including Art Nouveau cornices, fireplaces and corridors that were originally built wide enough for ladies in crinolines to pass each other comfortably. A vintage framed oil portrait of the young Queen Victoria, painted by Franz Xaver Winterhalter, hangs in the lobby, while a limited-edition Andy Warhol silkscreen of Queen Margrethe II of Denmark sits perched above the reception desk.

title: Fred Phelps, Anti-Gay Preacher Who Targeted Military Funerals, Dies at 84
description: TOPEKA, Kan.  The Rev. Fred Phelps, the virulently antigay preacher who drew wide, scornful attention for staging demonstrations at military funerals as a way to proclaim his belief that God is punishing America for its tolerance of homosexuality, died here on Wednesday. He was 84.

title: Obama Delivers Statement on Ukraine
description: President Obama announced that the United States was imposing sanctions on more Russians because of that countrys actions in Crimea.

title: In Shift, Exxon Mobil to Report on Risks to Its Fossil Fuel Assets
description: Energy companies have been under increasing pressure from shareholder activists in recent years to warn investors of the risks that stricter limits on carbon emissions would place on their business.

title: WeChat Valuation Is Still Just a Hunch
description: Putting a value on WeChat remains an act of faith. Its parent, the Internet giant Tencent, has shed some light on WeChat, the popular messaging and social media service, but sparse details about costs and regulatory risks make future growth and earnings potential hard to pin down. Valuations are still largely based on hope.

title: The Diminishing Returns of Modern Medicine
description: For several decades, doctors have taken it as an article of faith that more rapid treatment of an acute heart attack improves patient survival. The treatment of choice today is angioplasty, where tiny balloons and wire-mesh cylinders called stents are used to open up blockages in the arteries that feed the heart. A door to balloon, or D2B, time  the period from a patients arrival in the hospital to inflation of the coronary balloon  of less than 90 minutes has become a quality metric for American hospitals. Time is muscle is the operative mantra, and the shorter the delay, the better.

title: A New Phantom and Christine Are Coming to the Opera
description: Norm Lewis, who starred as Porgy in The Gershwins Porgy and Bess, will join the cast of Andrew Lloyd Webbers The Phantom of the Opera on May 12, succeeding Hugh Panaro in the title role. At the same performance, Sierra Boggess will take over the role of Christine Daa from Mary Michael Patterson.

title: Only Seeding Reminds Virginia of Sampson Days
description: GREENSBORO, N.C.  If Ralph Sampson raised Virginias national profile and gave the mens basketball program its identity in the 1980s, he remains the towering measure of every team that has come through Charlottesville since.

title: Twitter Rolls Out Easier, Faster Video Playback
description: Over the past year, Twitter has worked closely with television networks and other professional video creators to upload and promote thousands of video clips on the service, from sports highlights to previews of coming shows.

title: Image of the Day: March 20
Koch Group, Spending Freely, Hones Attack on Government
description: WASHINGTON  Americans for Prosperity  the group backed by David H. and Charles G. Koch that has been pouring millions of dollars into competitive Senate races to the rising alarm of Democrats  was also among the politically active groups on the ground in this months special House election on Floridas Gulf Coast.

title: Transparency Comes to the Port Authority, but Not to Christies Appointee
description: After decades of secrecy about their multi-billion dollar operations, commissioners at the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey this week began casting important votes in public. Only at this strange, behemoth of an agency would this be news.

title: Reid Orders Computer Review to Defend Senate Committee in Rift With the C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate majority leader, Harry Reid, said on Thursday that he had ordered a forensic examination of the Senate Intelligence Committees computer equipment to answer what he called the C.I.A.s absurd claims that the committees staff had hacked into the agencys network.

title: Clip: The French Minister
description: A scene from Bertrand Taverniers film.

title: Text to Text | Groundbreaking Women, Then and Now
description: For this edition of Text to Text,  we celebrate Womens History Month by collaborating with the Makers project, a digital and broadcast initiative from AOL and PBS that showcases stories of groundbreaking women from all walks of life.

title: Modern Love | Fight or Flight
description: As her relationship with her boyfriend was coming to an end, the writer Sarah L. Courteau grasped for a moment of tenderness between them.

title: Malaysia Official on Objects in Ocean
description: Malaysias defense minister, Hishammuddin Hussein, said reports from Australian authorities of objects floating in the Indian Ocean were a credible lead in the search for the missing plane.

title: Lawrence E. Walsh, Prosecutor in Iran-Contra Scandal, Dies at 102
description: Lawrence E. Walsh, a former federal judge and a mainstay of the American legal establishment who as an independent counsel exposed the lawbreaking in the Reagan administration that gave rise to the Iran-contra scandal, died on Wednesday at his home in Oklahoma City. He was 102.

title: An Act of Protection, Even as Things Fell Apart
description: Cigarette smoke drifted in the bedroom window. My boyfriend always went outside to smoke, which I appreciated, though lately the smell wafting in had become, more than anything, a reminder of his absence from our bed. I could picture him at the table in our garden, the ashtray bristling with old butts and the red tip of his cigarette hovering over the glow of his phone screen.

title: Not Giving Up, Bouygues Raises Bid for Vivendis Mobile Unit
description: LONDON  Bouygues said Thursday that it had sweetened its offer for SFR, Vivendis mobile phone unit, despite Vivendis decision last week to enter into exclusive negotiations with Altice for three weeks.

title: Sadness Is Part of March, Too, as Dayton Upends Ohio State
description: BUFFALO  Aaron Craft lay on the floor, his arms behind his head, staring up at the arena ceiling, as if the hardcourt were a poolside chaise longue.

title: TimesTalks: James Franco & Chris ODowd
description: The actors James Franco and Chris ODowd discuss making their Broadway debuts in Steinbecks Of Mice and Men.

title: Unemployed? You Might Never Work Again
description: The long-term unemployed are an unlucky subset of the unemployed. They tend to be a little older, a little more educated, a little less white  but really theyre not that different from the broader pool of people who have lost jobs in recent years. Except for one thing: There is a good chance theyll never work again.

title: Friction by Alex Seel
description: Edwin David Sepulveda collaborated on a 24-foot-high, 100-foot-wide mural with three artists in Manhattan in November.

title: After Trailing Early, Wisconsin Goes on 40-6 Run to Rout American
description: MILWAUKEE  American provided a little angst early for Wisconsin fans who drove from all around the state to watch the Badgers opening game of the N.C.A.A. tournament here.

title: The Gun Report: March 20, 2014
description: Some good news: Gang shootings are down in Chicago, according to the citys police chief. Garry McCarthy said Tuesday that his strategy to reduce gang violence is taking root, and gang shootings now represent less than half of the total number of shooting incidents in the city.

title: N.C.A.A. Round of 64: The Day in Pictures
description: All the action from the first day of the round of 64 in the N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament.

title: Pistorius Plans to Sell His House to Cover Legal Costs, Lawyer Says
description: Facing the need to raise money for legal fees as he stands trial for the murder of his girlfriend, Oscar Pistorius, the double-amputee track star, plans to sell the house where he admits shooting her, a lawyer said on his behalf on Thursday.

title: Big Data, the Feature
description: What if big data, that much-proclaimed multibillion-dollar hope of the enterprise software industry, is just a feature of something else?

title: Sierra Club Trips for Younger Travelers
description: In order to take more young people into the wilderness and bring them onto its membership rolls, the Sierra Club is offering trips (some with discounts) that it hopes will entice the 30-and-under crowd.

title: The Americans Recap: The Country They Love and Hate
description: A couple of weeks ago, for Episode 2, we explored the question of whether Nina would ultimately side with Stan or the Soviet Union. Annet Mahendru, who plays Nina, retweeted the piece.

title: Trial Lawyer Nominated to Lead Delaware Chancery Court
description: Andre G. Bouchard, an experienced trial lawyer who has represented both plaintiffs and defendants in corporate battles, was nominated on Thursday to lead Delawares Chancery Court, the nations leading court for business disputes.

title: Pluralism and Power
description: I want to return briefly to the Emily Bazelon piece I discussed yesterday, because I dont think my commentsquite teased out the interesting tangles in her argument, and their potential implications for how debates about religious pluralism tend to play out.

title: The Latest Flimsy Excuse for Blocking Jobless Benefits
description: There was never much doubt that Speaker John Boehner would try to block the deal to extend unemployment benefits that was reached in the Senate last week. The only real question was what ridiculous justification he would come up with, and the one he chose on Wednesday exceeded expectations.

title: Improving a Signal Chain: Part 1
description: This recording of a simulation by the company ARUP renders an M.T.A. announcement as normally heard in the subway, before various simulated improvements to the signal chain have been implemented.

title: Improving a Signal Chain: Part 2
description: In this second simulation, improvements have been made to the M.T.A. stations public announcement system. The booth and microphone have been redesigned to minimize background noise, and better cabling helps remove the hiss. Better loudspeakers and station acoustics all combine to make the announcement more audible.

title: The Search for Silence
description: There is a brilliant art installation at the Headlands Center for the Arts in Sausalito, Calif. Its also a working bathroom. The project upends everything we take for granted about a bathroom  something we assume to be pristine, porcelain, private.

title: Nodding From East to West
description: Fung Tu at night is a faint red glow on a block of almost Chinatown on the Lower East Side. Inside, the booths are puritanical, with stiff backs of dark stained wood, overlooked by mirrors and crimson wallpaper in a study of drifting leaves.

title: Spread No Ill Will
description: My wife and I recently shared with a small circle of family and friends the news that our young daughter was found to have leukemia. Its a hard time for us, especially for our little girl, who has started a difficult round of treatments. Most of the people weve told have been incredibly supportive, except my best friend, who hasnt said a word to me. This is making me furious. I would like to be honest with him. (Frankly, Id like to punch him out.) But Im not sure that anything is going to repair how I feel about him. So why bother, right? Or not?

title: Former Aide to S.E.C. Leaders Joins Consulting Firm
description: Myron Marlin, a former top aide to the chairwoman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, has joined a prominent consulting firm in Washington.

title: A Graffitist Takes On a Corporate Space
description: Since uprooting from Puerto Rico six years ago, Edwin David Sepulveda, 32, has tagged, tattooed and painted in locales from his new home of Bushwick, Brooklyn, to Barcelona, Spain, under the name Don Rimx.

title: Most Large Banks in U.S. Could Cope in Event of Turmoil, Fed Says
description: Nearly all of the nations largest banks have adequate capital to withstand a severe economic downturn and market turmoil, the Federal Reserve has found in its latest annual stress test of the United States financial system.

title: A Duncan Admirer Leads Pittsburghs Rout
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  As a youngster in Nigeria, Talib Zanna watched an old videotape of a San Antonio game and was inspired by the play of Spurs center Tim Duncan.

title: Japan and North Korea Said to Agree to Formal Talks
description: TOKYO  Japan and North Korea agreed on Thursday to hold formal talks for the first time in more than a year, Japanese officials said, as the government of Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan tried to achieve a coveted diplomatic success.

title: Syria Delivers Another Shipment of Chemical Weapons for Disposal
description: GENEVA  Syria delivered another consignment of deadly chemical weapons to the port of Latakia on Thursday, the third delivery in a week to be shipped abroad for destruction and further evidence that it has stepped up the pace of shipments after coming under international pressure over earlier delays.

title: Areas of Search for Malaysian Jet
description: Satellite imagery captured near the Australian search areas shows objects that officials said could be related to the missing Malaysian plane.

title: A Collector Changes Course
description: WITH LIFE CHANGE, COLLECTOR TO SELL CONTEMPORARY WORK

title: Following Dylan Thomas in Wales
description: Climbing along a steep coastal path through a forest in southern Wales, with russet red and tawny brown autumn leaves crunching beneath my feet, I reached a crest where the trailhead looked back onto a long estuary lined with salt flats. The River Taf ran through the headlands before me, its glacier-cut course unmistakable alongside the grass-covered cliffs on either side. The sea spread out before me, a moody canvas of blues and gray. White-topped gorse and cherry-red currant bushes gave color to my panorama, the plaintive chorus of sea birds the only soundtrack.

title: Living With Cancer: The Cost of Trials
description: A recent CT scan made me realize that the clinical trial extending my life effectively excludes all but the most privileged cancer patients.

title: The Weekly Health Quiz
description: In the news: sleeping teenagers, house pests and toxic fish. Test your knowledge of this weeks health news.

title: Obama Imposes More Sanctions on Russia
description: The president said the United States is imposing sanctions on key sectors of the Russian economy in addition to the current sanctions on individuals.

title: Pursuing Sex With a Bad Boy
description: A mood poem to summer loving and sexual awakening, It Felt Like Love powerfully evokes a time when flesh is paramount, and peer behavior is the standard by which we judge our own.

title: Symantec Fires Chief Seen as Too Slow on Innovation
description: Symantec, the troubled antivirus software maker, has fired Steve Bennett, its chief executive, the company said on Thursday.

title: A Hot Pick, No. 12 Seed Harvard Shows Why
description: SPOKANE, Wash.  Last year was a surprise. This year, even the president saw it coming.

title: Limits on Ivory Sales, Meant to Protect Elephants, Set Off Wide Concerns
description: New federal rules aimed at blocking the sale of ivory to protect endangered elephants are causing an uproar among musicians, antiques dealers, gun collectors and thousands of others whose ability to sell, repair or travel with legally acquired ivory objects will soon be prohibited.

title: Terrace for Sale, Includes Condo
description: After a seemingly endless winter, the first hints of spring have teased us with a day or two of temperatures over 60 degrees. That fleeting glimpse of warmth sent many New Yorkers flying out of doors to enjoy the sunshine. For my part, I sipped my morning coffee at home last week and stared wistfully out the window at a neighbors balcony.

title: Kingmakers Death Lays Bare Erosion of Parties Authority
description: WASHINGTON  When Robert S. Strauss headed the Democratic Party in the early 1970s, he was a man of unusual sway. A phone call could change a presidential campaign, or at times, even the presidency itself. He held the exalted status of wise man in the capital, a kingmaker who helped bring Jimmy Carter to power and Ronald Reagan to recognize the damage from Iran-contra, a man with such inside knowledge of power, politics and relationships that he could make all manner of problems go away.

title: Golden Gate Buys Stake in Parent of Ann Taylor
description: The private equity firm Golden Gate Capital prides itself on its retail expertise, having helped revive companies like Eddie Bauer and Zale. Now it thinks it can aid the parent of Ann Taylor.

title: A New Weapon for Bidding Wars
description: In response to the fierce competition for homes in healthy metropolitan markets like those surrounding New York City, some mortgage lenders are taking steps to put buyers who must borrow on par with those offering to pay in cash.

title: Iranian Ship, in Plain View but Shrouded in Mystery, Looks Very Familiar to U.S.
description: WASHINGTON  Iran is building a nonworking mock-up of an American nuclear-powered aircraft carrier that United States officials say may be intended to be blown up for propaganda value.

title: A Cop With a Secret
description: The dour McCanick banks way too much on what it is not telling us, making for a movie that thinks its being cryptically suspenseful but is really just annoying. The film was one of the last projects for Cory Monteith, the Glee star who died of a drug overdose last year, and it would have benefited from more screen time for him and less for its title character, a growly police detective with a dark secret.

title: Hedge Fund Uses Hitler Parody in Campaign Against Ocwen Chairman
description: If youre looking for a little attention, its hard to go wrong with Hitler.

title: Was It Fatal for You, Darling?
description: I have been dating age-appropriate men, and I must tell you that sex with men in their late 60s can make you a nervous wreck.

title: Get. Arts. Fast.
description: AT the Vineyard Theater on a recent Friday night, the lights dimmed at 8, and Alexandra Silber began singing her heart out. In a set evoking an ordinary middle-class American living room, she sang of love and loss, of her new soldier husband fighting thousands of miles away, of her mothers many visits to the plastic surgeon, of her pregnancy and of her growing suspicions that her darling husband might be committing atrocities.

title: Syracuses Zone Is Sharp in Opening Win
description: BUFFALO  There was a thought, by some, that 14th-seeded Western Michigan might have the right formula to topple Syracuse on Thursday afternoon. The Broncos would be prepared for the Oranges vaunted 2-3 zone. After all, they were familiar with the 2-3 employed by Eastern Michigan, coached by Rob Murphy, a former Syracuse assistant.

title: Pro-Clinton Group Plans Event Focused on Gay and Lesbian Donors
description: A super PAC supporting Hillary Rodham Clintons possible presidential campaign is reaching out to some of New Yorks most powerful and wealthy gay and lesbian donors.

title: Staging a Rescue From Obscurity
description: We live in what might be called the era of no artist left behind. Its a period of sometimes exhilarating excavation and rediscovery during which art history has become larger and more inclusive. It encompasses more kinds of people from different parts of the world and all kinds of backgrounds  as opposed to art-school educated white men from the United States and Europe. It also encompasses more mediums, from ceramics to performance art.

title: Whats in Veterans Affairs $164 Billion Budget?
description: The secretary of the Department of Veterans Affairs, Eric K. Shinseki, last week, outlined President Obamas 2015 budget for the department before hearings of the House and Senate veterans affairs committees, calling for total spending of $163.9 billion, a 6.5 percent increase from last year. The plan asks Congress to allocate $68.4 billion for discretionary spending, a 3 percent increase from last year, which is largely used for health care, and $95.6 billion for mandatory programs such as disability compensation and pensions for veterans.

title: Army General Speaks Out After Sentencing
description: Brig. Gen. Jeffrey A. Sinclair gave a statement outside the courthouse at Fort Bragg, N.C., after the conclusion of the sentencing phase of his sexual misconduct trial.

title: Muppets, a Front for Bigger Schemes
description: The United States government today called on Walt Disney Pictures to delay or cancel the release of Muppets Most Wanted on national security grounds. Or at least, it should have. Not only might this movie annoy Russia, with whom the American government is already nose-to-nose over Crimea, but it could also cause any European allies being courted by President Obama to unfriend him and the rest of the country.

title: Desperately Seeking the Exit Memorializes a Flop
description: Coming of age more or less in the mid-1980s, the Miser witnessed firsthand what could only be described as Madonnamania. For several heady years, that pop provocateur reigned, writing the rule book for todays dynamic divas, from Lady Gaga to Lorde.

title: Still Doleful, Still Impulsive
description: Even for a composer as famously prolific as John Zorn, the repertory designated as Masada  a single strand in a multifarious oeuvre  verges on overwhelming. Introduced in 1993, Masada was born of a fairly straightforward idea: wedding the Jewish klezmer style to the rollicking free-jazz ethos of Ornette Coleman.

title: The Grandest Block in New York
description: No one agrees on the best block in the city  some people like the crooked alleyways of Greenwich Village, or the picturesque brownstone rows of Brooklyn. Some people like cute little stores; some people like doormen with white gloves.

title: Facebooks Hack, a Language of Tech Competition
description: [ Updated | Added reference to the open source programming language developed in part by Google. ]

title: Is It Raging Lust, or Youthful Angst? Either Way, Shes Taking a Beating
description: Attentive filmgoers who stuck it through Lars von Triers 2009 movie Antichrist  a deranged heave with a dead child, talking fox (chaos reigns) and his-and-her mangled genitalia  might have noticed a strange closing credit for researcher on misogyny. It seemed like a joke, especially given that the movie pivots on a crazy woman (Charlotte Gainsbourg) who, consumed by grief, and having made the extremely bad call to undergo treatment by her therapist husband, mutilates them both. Yet several other credits, including researchers on anxiety, theology and mythology and evil, suggested that Mr. von Trier wasnt kidding even if, oh, maybe he was.

title: Residential Sales Around the Region
description: Information on sales in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Moderate Tag a Label to Fear for Republicans
description: Jane Nelson, a Republican of Flower Mound, was considered a crazy right-winger when she was elected to the Texas Senate in 1992.

title: Events in New Jersey for March 23-29
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: Pictures of the Day: India and Elsewhere
description: India, Afghanistan, Ukraine and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Comedy Listings for March 21-27
description: For news about comedy and humor, including critical commentary: nytimes.com/arts. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: CNNs Ratings Continue to Hinge on Flight 370 News
description: The news that wreckage from the missing Malaysia Airlines jet may have been spotted in the southern Indian Ocean was enough to create a surge in news viewing late Wednesday night and, for the moment anyway, stave off potential flagging interest in the two-week-old story.

title: Events on Long Island for March 23-29
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: Theater Listings for March 21-27
description: Approximate running times are in parentheses. Theaters are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of current productions, additional listings, showtimes and ticket information are at nytimes.com/theater. A searchable, critical guide to theater is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Movie Listings for March 21-27
description: Ratings and running times are in parentheses; foreign films have English subtitles. Full reviews of all current releases: nytimes.com/movies.

title: Pictures of the Day: India and Elsewhere
description: Photos from India, Afghanistan, Ukraine and Germany.

title: Pop & Rock Listings for March 21-27
description: Prices may not reflect ticketing service charges. For full reviews of recent concerts: nytimes.com/music. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Jazz Listings for March 21-27
description: Full reviews of recent jazz performances: nytimes.com/jazz. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Pandora Wins a Battle, but the War Over Royalties Continues
description: In the increasingly bitter dispute over royalties for online music, Pandora Media won an important battle in court. But the state of the larger war is far from clear.

title: Dance Listings for March 21-27
description: Full reviews of recent dance performances: nytimes.com/dance. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Opera and Classical Music Listings for March 21-27
description: Full reviews of recent classical performances: nytimes.com/classical. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: To Promote Recycling, a City Wants to Eliminate Separating
description: Houston, which recycles only 6 percent of the waste it collects, has a bold idea to improve that figure: Eliminate the extra blue bin for recycling.

title: Museum and Gallery Listings for March 21-27
description: Museums and galleries are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of recent art shows: nytimes.com/art. A searchable guide to these and many other art shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Ukrainian Nationalists Hand Russians Propaganda Coup With Video of Assault
description: Since a coalition of Ukrainian opposition groups took control of Independence Square in Kiev and held it long enough to undermine the authority of President Viktor Yanukovych, the Russian government and news media outlets under Kremlin control have consistently focused on the part played by far-right, nationalist demonstrators who manned the barricades there during deadly clashes with the police.

title: Events in Westchester for March 23-29
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: Oregon Shuts Down High-Scoring B.Y.U.
description: MILWAUKEE  Oregon slowed Brigham Youngs high-powered offense enough to advance in the West Region, getting strong contributions off the bench from the Milwaukee product Elgin Cook and others to win, 87-68.

title: Countdown to the 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 84
description: The 2014 World Cup begins on June 12, when Brazil plays Croatia in the opening match. Reporters and editors for The Times will count down to the start of the tournament each day with a short capsule of news and interesting tidbits.

title: The Role of Charters in School Reform
description: To the Editor:

title: Welcome Home. Just Avoid the Headgear
description: Superlatively silly in concept and execution, Joycelyn Engle and Arno Malarones Awakened fully believes that its a psychological thriller about a traumatized young woman. In reality, however, its a poorly acted grab bag of shopworn ideas and hyperbolic behaviors that not even Ryan Murphy could translate into entertainment.

title: To Cut Heating Bills, Look Beyond Coal Plants
description: To the Editor:

title: Rape as a Weapon in Syria
description: To the Editor:

title: Deportees as Pawns in a Zero-Sum Tragedy
description: The full title of the new documentary by Maria Iliou, From Both Sides of the Aegean: Expulsion and Exchange of Populations, Turkey-Greece: 1922-1924, is quite a mouthful. It not only describes the subject but also gives a sense of the films dry, dense and sometimes convoluted style of exploring this otherwise fascinating subject.

title: Elusive Military Justice
description: To the Editor:

title: Buying an Energy Hog
description: Ask Real Estate is a new weekly online column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: Benefits of One Primary
description: To the Editor:

title: Tales of Legends and Curiosities
description: The Martha Graham enterprise is growing quainter and quainter, though heaven knows it remains earnest. On Wednesday the company Graham founded almost 88 years ago began its season at City Center with a gala celebrating the connection between her and Greece.

title: Bennington, Vt., Combats Heroin
description: To the Editor:

title: In Search of a Duck, and a Way Through That Awkward Age
description: Thats the great thing about this field, Lawrence Konrad (Ben Kingsley), a bird-watching fanatic, declares to a group of adolescent followers in A Birders Guide to Everything. It doesnt matter if youre a high school kid on your bike, or if youre an egghead like me with a boatload of degrees. Anybody can be a birder.

title: Shaker Artifacts Are on the Move
description: SHAKER ARTIFACTS DOING THE SHUFFLE

title: A Quick Way to Cut College Costs
description: COLLEGE admission notifications have begun to arrive. With every thrilling acceptance comes something far less welcome: the heart-stopping reality of what it all costs.

title: Foot Is the New Traffic for Urban Cowboys
description: Five years ago, a trip on foot over the busy freeway that separates downtown Dallas from neighboring Uptown would have required a bit of courage.

title: The Cop and the Crook, Brothers at Odds
description: Hollywood gangster movies, especially those directed by Martin Scorsese and Francis Ford Coppola, have conditioned us to expect every film in the genre to follow particular guidelines or risk feeling inauthentic. Thats the obstacle that the French director Guillaume Canet (Tell No One) cannot surmount in Blood Ties, his laborious, tonally wobbly attempt at an American crime epic. If its unfair to expect a reputable European director to follow that template, so be it. But by now, those expectations have been programmed into us. Every wrong note, of which there are dozens in Blood Ties, feels almost traitorous.

title: GTT
description: Our quirky, discerning picks for

title: Arkansas Court Reverses $1.2 Billion Judgment Against Johnson & Johnson
description: The Arkansas Supreme Court reversed a $1.2 billion judgment against Johnson & Johnson on Thursday, finding that the state attorney general erred by suing under a law that applied to health care facilities, not drug companies.

title: Tracing an Activist Through Decades
description: Plumbing the achievements of a 98-year-old activist, American Revolutionary: The Evolution of Grace Lee Boggs also grapples with the daunting challenge of political awareness. The director Grace Lee, who met her subject while making a movie about people who share her name (The Grace Lee Project), shadows this variable exploration of identity and engagement with an acknowledgment of generational shifts in sensibility, including her own perspective.

title: A Long-Overdue Dialogue With Beethoven
description: Many young virtuoso pianists perform the Beethoven sonatas as a demonstration of their musical depth. But when he emerged as a major young artist, the Norwegian pianist Leif Ove Andsnes avoided Beethoven. He thought he should wait until he had something to say, as he explained in 2012 in an appearance at the Greene Space in the WQXR and WNYC radio studios.

title: Nassau County Prosecutors Decision to Seek House Seat Is Rooted in Family
description: HEMPSTEAD, N.Y.  Being raised in a family of 10, everything was negotiated, everything was a compromise, Kathleen M. Rice, the Nassau County district attorney, said the other day in her office here.

title: Doug Wheeler: LC 71 NY DZ 13 DW
description: David Zwirner

title: House Ethics Panel Investigating Illinois Congressman
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Luis V. Gutirrez, Democrat of Illinois, is the subject of a House Ethics Committee investigation focused on whether he improperly hired a former aide turned Illinois lobbyist as a consultant, using federal tax dollars to pay for the work, the lawmakers office confirmed Thursday.

title: Sarah Lucas: Nud Nob
description: Gladstone

title: Alone Then, Supported Today
description: With the new documentary Anita, the Oscar-winning director Freida Mock (Maya Lin: A Strong Clear Vision) brings a fresh perspective to a somber and awkward chapter of modern American politics: the Senate hearings to confirm Clarence Thomas to the Supreme Court amid accusations of sexual harassment by Anita Hill.

title: Israel: Settlement Plans Renew Palestinian Outrage
description: Revelations this week over Israels continuing construction plans for West Bank settlements renewed outrage among Palestinian leaders even as the two sides face critical decisions in the American-led peace talks that started last summer. Israels Interior Ministry on Wednesday posted online the minutes of a Feb. 19 committee meeting during which more than 2,000 housing units, including 839 in the city of Ariel, advanced through the bureaucratic process, the antisettlement group Peace Now said Thursday. Also on Wednesday, the city of Jerusalem granted building permits for nearly 200 apartments in two Jewish neighborhoods in East Jerusalem, which most of the world considers to be illegal settlements. (About 50 permits for Arab areas were also approved.) This has to stop, said Hanan Ashrawi, a member of the executive committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization. Building is not just building, its not something that is so benign. Building is the willful destruction of the two-state solution. Its a constant act of aggression. Its a war crime.

title: With a French Accent, a Soap Brand Tells a Tale of Well-Scrubbed Lovers
description: CONSUMERS making major life transitions are often in the market for big-ticket items, which is why there are so many cap-tossing graduates, newlyweds and newborns in commercials from real estate companies, automakers and banks. But now milestones are at the center of an advertising campaign for a decidedly smaller purchase: household products.

title: Tibet and India: Buddhist Traditions and Transformations
description: Metropolitan Museum of Art

title: Strangers, but Their Eyes Meet on a Train to Paris
description: In Just a Sigh, the French star Emmanuelle Devos plays Alix, a rudderless, beautiful, middle-aged actress first glimpsed in Calais waiting to go onstage in a production of Ibsens The Lady From the Sea. Alix commutes between Calais and Paris, where she lives with Antoine (voiced by Denis Mnochet), her lover of eight years. He is a documentary filmmaker who is unseen in the movie but heard over the telephone.

title: Syrias War Fuels Rise of Asylum Seekers, U.N. Report Says
description: The number of people applying for asylum in industrialized countries rose in 2013 to the highest number in more than a decade, increased to a large extent by Syrians seeking refuge in the West, the United Nations refugee agency reported Thursday.

title: Florida Fends Off Pesky Great Danes
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  The Florida Gators own the N.C.A.A. tournaments No. 1 overall seed and have not lost in more than three months. So expectations were rightfully high despite the pressure of facing an overmatched opponent looking to make history.

title: Events in Connecticut for March 23-29
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

title: You Load the Uzi, Honey
description: Real-life tragedy receives a comic-caper makeover in Rob the Mob, Raymond De Felittas breezy retelling of one of New York Citys more unusual crime sprees.

title: A Fortuitous Chicken Saves Lives in East Harlem Blast
description: The chicken that would save their lives was, at first, a concern. It was perched on the netting above a coop at the Urban Garden Center in East Harlem. Someone had tossed the bird over the fence, in a red paper Macys bag, and Anthony Douglas and another worker were trying to figure out how to bring it down.

title: Michigan State Opens With an Easy Win
description: SPOKANE, Wash.  Michigan State, a team many experts predict could be the rare fourth seed to win the national championship, embarked on its latest quest with a breezy 93-78 win over No. 13 Delaware.

title: Art Book Depicting Murder Inc. Is No Steal
description: Not that anyone is out to make a killing, but a new book on the mob hit men of Murder Inc. will cost you.

title: Wind Industrys New Technologies Are Helping It Compete on Price
description: The wind industry has gone to great lengths over the years to snap up the best properties for its farms, often looking to remote swaths of prairie or distant mountain ridges to maximize energy production and minimize community opposition.

title: An Irish Romance With an Uncertain Future
description: An expatriate in rural Ireland gets restless in her relationship with an older man and questions her commitment in the light drama Stay. Because of the lukewarm scenarios and signpost-filled screenwriting, audiences may well follow suit with their own antsiness.

title: Amy Arbus: On the Street 1980-1990
description: Leica Gallery

title: Going Home Again
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia  The TED conference is dedicated to innovation. Most of the people who give TED talks are working on some creative project: to invent new bionic limbs for amputees, new telescopes, new fusion reactors or new protest movements to reduce the power of money in politics.

title: Russia Hints at Using Iran Talks as Leverage
description: Despite public assurances by Western officials, concern is growing that the escalating animosity between the United States and Russia over the Ukraine crisis could have a corrosive effect on the nuclear talks with Iran.

title: The Timidity Trap
description: There dont seem to be any major economic crises underway right this moment, and policy makers in many places are patting themselves on the back. In Europe, for example, theyre crowing about Spains recovery: the country seems set to grow at least twice as fast this year as previously forecast.

title: Mayor Vows Jail Reforms on Rikers Island
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio on Thursday called the death of a mentally ill veteran in an overheated cell on Rikers Island shocking and troubling and vowed to make reforms to the citys sprawling jail complex, where violence has surged in recent years.

title: If Only Orson Welles Had Starred
description: A making-of special about a film that was never made, Jodorowskys Dune details the mid-1970s efforts of the Chilean director Alejandro Jodorowsky to translate Frank Herberts extravagant science fiction novel Dune to the big screen.

title: Israel Confirms Fate of 8 Jews Who Left Iran
description: JERUSALEM  Israels intelligence agency announced Thursday it had confirmed the murder of eight Jews who disappeared while trying to immigrate to Israel two decades ago, but it did not say where they were killed or by whom.

title: Adam Scott Fights an Illness and Ties a Record
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Since his victory in the 2013 Masters, Adam Scott has traveled extensively with his size 40 green jacket, eliciting a wide-eyed delight from friends and strangers alike that gives him a joy nearly equal to the win itself.

title: Netflix Chief Alters View on Net Neutrality
description: Less than a month after Netflix insisted that its deal to pay Comcast to get a more direct connection to the companys Internet pipes had nothing to do with net neutrality, Netflixs chief executive, Reed Hastings, said Thursday that, well, yes it did.

title: An Empty Suit, but Such Fine Material
description: Whoosh. When the title character slams a door in Bertrand Taverniers dry, sly comedy The French Minister, the walls shudder, and papers and people go flying. A man on the furious move, Alexandre Taillard de Worms isnt only the French minister of foreign affairs, with a name thats a meaningful mouthful, but hes also a force of nature or maybe of bureaucracy. Sleek, coifed and buffed, with tailored suits and brilliantly shined shoes, he looks like one of the more sober masters of the universe, even if his violent gestures and the wreckage he leaves in his wake make him a closer kin to that old cartoon menace, the Tasmanian Devil, than to one of the boldface names running La France.

title: Time Inc. May Join Media Exodus to Lower Manhattan
description: Time Inc., with its stable of magazines, lavish offices and steady profits, has been a fixture in Midtown Manhattan for more than 75 years and the nations premier magazine publisher.

title: A Singular Trumpeter Unreels His Life
description: There is a wonderful Milt Hinton photograph of Louis Armstrong in 1954, standing by his beloved reel-to-reel tape recorders, which he took with him everywhere to record performances and memories. Its this Armstrong  relaxed, intimate and gregarious  that John Douglas Thompson vividly resurrects in Terry Teachouts Satchmo at the Waldorf, a one-man show at the Westside Theater.

title: This Weeks Movies: March 21, 2014
description: The New York Times film critics on Divergent, The Missing Picture and Nymphomaniac: Volume I.

title: On Russias List for Sanctions, and Proud of It
description: WASHINGTON  President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia might have hoped that American lawmakers and officials targeted for reciprocal sanctions on Thursday would respond with fear or outrage. Instead, the reaction was more like a synchronized spit-take combined with a bipartisan declaration of pride unseen since President Richard M. Nixon assembled his enemies list.

title: Mayors Ouster Is Approved in Colombia
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  The leftist mayor of Bogot, Colombia, lost his fight to stay in office after President Juan Manuel Santos approved an order to remove him and bar him from holding public office for 15 years.

title: Credit Suisse Hires Senior Power Banker From RBC Capital Markets
description: Credit Suisse has hired a new head of its power and renewables investment banking group from RBC Capital Markets, the firm announced in an internal memorandum on Thursday.

title: Complaint Against Kibkalo
description: Alex A. Kibkalo has been accused of handing over trade secrets, including prerelease software updates for Windows 8 RT, to an industry blogger while he was employed by Microsoft.

title: Microsoft Software Leak Inquiry Raises Privacy Issues
description: SEATTLE  Technology companies have spent months denying they know anything about broad government spying on people who use their Internet services.

title: Despite Critics, de Blasio Finds Success in Pursuit of Liberal Agenda
description: On the surface, these are rocky days for Mayor Bill de Blasio, whose infant tenure has endured impasse in Albany, speeding police escorts, and poll numbers that have rapidly diminished.

title: Venezuelan Mayors Are Jailed Amid Protests
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  The authorities have jailed the mayors of two cities that have experienced some of the most intense unrest in a wave of protests that has shaken the country in recent weeks. The arrests came as the National Assembly called for a criminal investigation of a prominent opposition lawmaker on charges related to the demonstrations.

title: Tough Path for Closer After Liner to the Face
description: PORT CHARLOTTE, Fla.  The Tampa Bay Rays scurried around their clubhouse Thursday afternoon, tracking the N.C.A.A. tournament and playing a hockey video game. Just one TV, in the corner of the room above Desmond Jenningss locker, showed baseball highlights. It was best not to concentrate on those.

title: A Fathers Legs and an Uncles Skills
description: LAS VEGAS  Nick Johnson looks familiar, and it goes beyond playing guard for Arizona and being named the Pacific-12 Conference player of the year. It might be his 6-foot-3 build, his eyes and eyebrows, the constellation of freckles across his nose.

title: Apple After Jobs: Pretty Much the Same as Ever
description: You could be forgiven, after reading Haunted Empire: Apple After Steve Jobs, for concluding that Apple is on the verge of going belly up. In the new book by Yukari I. Kane, a former reporter for The Wall Street Journal, the company is depicted as having radically declined after the death of its former impresario.

title: Panel Proposes Changes to New Jersey Bail System
description: Criminal defendants in New Jersey would be held or released based on the risk they pose, rather than merely their ability to pay, under major changes to the states bail system proposed by a panel led by the chief justice of New Jerseys Supreme Court.

title: The Technology Is Out There, but Satellites Dont Track Jets
description: Airlines routinely use satellites to provide Wi-Fi for passengers. But for years they have failed to use a similar technology for a far more basic task: tracking planes and their black-box flight recorders.

title: Arenas Meditation Room Raises Its Own Existential Questions
description: Construction has barely begun on the 2,250 promised affordable housing units. Just one of the 15 proposed towers has even started to take root. The leafy plazas remain mere sketches on paper.

title: Ukraine Sets Deadline for Militias to Surrender Illegal Guns
description: KIEV, Ukraine  In an effort to stabilize Ukraine and extend its authority, the interim government has set a deadline of Friday for turning in the illegal firearms that are now carried openly by so-called self-defense groups in Independence Square, the politically important plaza in the center of the capital.

title: A Livelihood in Nuclear Waste, Under Threat
description: CARLSBAD, N.M.  For 15 years, workers from this dusty New Mexico town have made the 26-mile drive down a series of worn two-lane highways until reaching a strange complex of alabaster buildings in the middle of the Chihuahuan Desert.

title: PETA Videos Prompt New York and Kentucky to Investigate Horse Trainers
description: The horse racing authorities in New York and Kentucky opened investigations on Thursday into allegations of mistreatment of thoroughbred racehorses by Steve Asmussen, the nations second-winningest horse trainer, and his assistant Scott Blasi.

title: The Plot to Cut Food Stamps, Foiled
description: The Republican Party has spent years stigmatizing the food stamp program while trying to cut benefits or make them harder to get. In last months farm bill, conservative lawmakers thought they had imposed an $8 billion cut in the program. In the last few weeks, though, it has become clear that that cut isnt going to materialize, thanks to a few states more generous than Congress. And this has infuriated a party that doesnt believe that poor families should get public assistance in buying groceries.

title: North Carolina Planner Named to Head New York City Parks Dept.
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio has chosen an out-of-state urban planner to head the citys Department of Parks and Recreation, an agency that oversees 29,000 acres of parkland and 1,900 parks, according to officials with firsthand knowledge of the decision.

title: A Fire Department for the 21st Century
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio acted in the interest of justice when his administration agreed on Tuesday to pay nearly $100 million to black and Latino citizens who were either denied jobs as firefighters or hired years after they should have been based on a screening test that the courts later found to be racially biased.

title: Battle Lines for Change
description: A change is gonna come, the soul singer Sam Cooke promised in his 1964 hit song. And so it did. Officially, it arrived fast, with the signing into law of the Civil Rights Act that year. In reality, its progress was killingly slow, and by then already a decade old.

title: Suppressing the Vote
description: If a federal judges disappointing ruling this week on a voter registration case is allowed to stand, state lawmakers around the country could well make it harder for eligible citizens to register to vote in federal as well as state elections.

title: The Folly of Thinking We Know
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif.  WEVE most of us, surely, heard all the figures: Humanity now produces as much data in two days as it did in all of history till the year 2003  and the amount of data is doubling every two years. In the time you take to read this piece, the human race will generate as much data as currently exists in the Library of Congress. For that matter  yes, your inbox and Facebook page would reflect this  10 percent of all the pictures ever taken as of the end of 2011 were taken in 2011. Yet as we think about how an entire Boeing 777 has gone missing for almost two weeks now, were also painfully reminded of how much we cant  and may never  know, even in the Knowledge Economy.

title: Nigerian Army Facing Questions as Death Toll Soars After Prison Attack
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Well over 500 people were killed in Nigeria last week when security forces responded to what the military portrayed as a jailbreak attempt by the Islamist group Boko Haram, making it one of the bloodiest episodes yet in the militarys five-year counterinsurgency campaign, according to officials in the northern town of Maiduguri.

title: Health Care Exchange in Oregon Not Meeting High Hopes
description: SALEM, Ore.  As the federal health care overhaul was rolled out over the last few years, Oregon was invariably the eager overachiever in the first row, waving a hand to volunteer. The governor, John Kitzhaber, a doctor who left the emergency room for politics, made health care his main issue. Fellow Democrats controlling the Legislature went along, embracing ambitious plans to extend insurance coverage and Medicaid to low-income residents.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 20, 2014
description: March 20, 2014

title: The Health Care Laws Checkup
Warily Leading Japans Nuclear Reawakening
description: IKATA, Japan  To power his plans for Japans economic revival, Prime Minister Shinzo Abe could soon return his nation to nuclear power for the first time since the Fukushima accident three years ago. But before he can, he will need the consent of the remote towns like this one that host Japans idled nuclear plants.

title: Debating Fate of Leadership at Minnesota Orchestra
description: The day after the Minnesota Orchestra announced the pending departure of its president, who had become something of a lightning rod during a bruising labor battle with its musicians, many orchestra fans in the Twin Cities wondered on Friday if the move might pave the way for the return of the ensembles former music director, Osmo Vanska.

title: After Fires at Golf Courses, Study Suggests Unusual Culprits: Titanium Clubs
description: Golf courses are covered in hazards  ponds, bunkers, thick rough  but here is another: the golf clubs themselves.

title: A Skatepark to Grind and Fly
description: For the skaters of New York, winter was particularly cruel: Gray snow forming crust on skateable surfaces, railings glazed by ice. And all that wetness just destroys your bearings.

title: 14-Year-Old Kills Rider on Bus in Brooklyn, Police Say
description: A 14-year-old gunman opened fire during a dispute on a New York City bus in Brooklyn on Thursday evening, fatally shooting a 39-year-old passenger in the head, the authorities said.

title: Sly Alchemy From That Lamp
description: If a genie had sprung from my teakettle last week and offered to grant me three wishes, I might impulsively have asked to be spared any more childrens musicals. Since a certain blockbuster feline arrived well over a decade ago, Broadway has been lapped by wave after wave of big, often gloppy songfests adapted from animated movies, mostly from the mother ship, Disney.

title: Learning How to Refine Oils
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  This, in my opinion, was a nice Friday offering. A bit of a wrestle, a little stretching, a few gimmes, and sooner rather than later the puzzle is solved. Also, Brendan Emmett Quigley makes a clean puzzle and fills it with some very interesting stuff.

title: A Day of Honors for Women in the Video Game Industry
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Female video game designers, producers and directors were honored at Microsofts Women in Gaming Awards here on Thursday in an event that has grown substantially in short order.

title: North Carolina Says Utility Pumped Millions of Gallons of Wastewater in River
description: Duke Energy, the electric utility whose massive spill of toxic coal ash into a river six weeks ago is part of a federal investigation, illegally pumped as much as 61 million gallons of coal-ash wastewater into a second river from September to last week, North Carolina regulators charged on Thursday.

title: UConn Extends Its Redemption Tour
description: BUFFALO  The Connecticut Huskies framed their postseason  actually, their entire season  around the fact that last year they watched the N.C.A.A. tournament from home, shut out of the most significant party in college basketball.

title: Hytners Final Season at National Theater to Include New Stoppard Play
description: Nicholas Hytners final season as artistic director of the National Theater in London will include new plays by Tom Stoppard (The Coast of Utopia) and Richard Bean (One Man, Two Guvnors), as well as stars turns by Ralph Fiennes in Shaws Man and Superman and Helen McCrory in Medea, the theater announced on Thursday.

title: Unions, Harlem and Lindsay, Revisited
description: So far  and it has been nearly a half-century since he left office  history has not been very kind to John V. Lindsay. Joseph P. Viteritti seeks to correct that impression in Summer in the City: John Lindsay, New York and the American Dream (Johns Hopkins University Press).

title: Khushwant Singh, Provocative Indian Journalist, Dies at 99
description: Khushwant Singh, an Indian diplomat, author and journalist who was one of his countrys best-known chroniclers of strife and slaughter, died on Thursday at his home in New Delhi.

title: Daytons Win Offers Validation for a Former Buckeye
description: BUFFALO  It took less than two hours for the N.C.A.A. tournament to produce a significant upset:When Daytons Vee Sanford beat Ohio States Aaron Craft off the dribble and scored on a floater with less than four seconds remaining, the 11th-seeded Flyers were on their way to upending sixth-seeded Ohio State, 60-59.

title: Davis, Duda or Plan C? Mets Still Dont Know
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  It has been about three weeks since Ike Davis and Lucas Duda halted their competition for the Mets starting first basemans job. Davis was sidelined with tight calves while Duda had a tight hamstring.

title: Ex-Envoy Sees Assad as Staying in Power
description: WASHINGTON  The former American envoy for Syria said on Thursday that President Bashar al-Assad of Syria was likely to remain in power for the medium term and that a year from now the country would probably still be under the control of competing factions.

title: House Panel to Hear G.M. Chiefs Testimony
description: WASHINGTON  The chief executive of General Motors, Mary T. Barra, will testify before a House subcommittee on April 1, and the head of the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration may also go before the panel as it investigates the response of G.M. and the government to safety problems with the Chevy Cobalt, the subcommittee announced on Thursday.

title: St. Louis Avoids the Upset Bug
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  The St. Louis Billikens were in such a downward spiral that an early exit from the N.C.A.A. tournament seemed imminent. They could not crack North Carolina States man-to-man defense consistently. They trailed nearly the entire game.

title: Spare Times for Children for March 21-27
description: THE CATS VS. DOGS FAMILY SCAVENGER HUNT

title: For One Wolverine, a Sweet Homecoming
description: MILWAUKEE  Glenn Robinson III remembered coming to Bradley Center as a little boy, watching his father, Glenn, star for the Milwaukee Bucks alongside Ray Allen and Sam Cassell. The chance to play for Michigan in the same building Thursday night thrilled Robinson, who scored 14 points in a tougher-than-expected 57-40 victory over Wofford in the second round.

title: Russians Take Over Ukrainian Base
description: At the Nakhimov Naval School in Sevastopol, Ukrainian soldiers conducted an official handover and lowered their flag in a tense ceremony, while Russian soldiers stepped in to raise theirs.

title: Turkish Officials Block Twitter in Leak Inquiry
description: ISTANBUL  The Turkish government blocked Twitter on Thursday night after the social media network had been used to spread recordings of telephone conversations and leaked documents that appeared to implicate high-ranking officials and some of their relatives and associates in a widespread corruption investigation.

title: Charlotte Brooks, a Photographer for Look Magazine, Dies at 95
description: Charlotte Brooks, one of only a handful of women ever hired to work as a full-time staff photographer at Look magazine, the major rival to Life in the heyday of American glossy photojournalism, died on March 15 at her home in Holmes, N.Y. She was 95.

title: Freshman Comes Off Bench to Seal Upset of Sooners
description: SPOKANE, Wash.  North Dakota States best player had fouled out, and visions of the universitys first N.C.A.A. tournament victory might have followed his disheartened ramble to the bench.

title: Spare Times for March 21-27
description: INVISIBLE MIGRATIONS (through Aug. 31) Visual tales of migration and immigration are included in this exhibition of contemporary and late-19th and early-20th-century photographs at the Alice Austen House, 2 Hylan Blvd, at Edgewater Street, Staten Island.

title: Recalling Jacksons Detour to New Jersey
description: Phil Jackson was a television analyst for the New Jersey Nets for one season before he turned to coaching full time.

title: After World Series Win, Red Sox Beards and Memories Are Short
description: FORT MYERS, Fla.  They are still a scruffy bunch, happily hirsute.

title: Times Minute | Will Sanctions Work?
description: Expectations for the latest round of sanctions against Vladimir Putin. Also on the Minute, following the money that built the Barclays Center, and who made that standing desk?

title: In Late-Season Trial, Knicks Have Little Room for Error
description: The Knicks seven-game winning streak has created a chance, small as it may be, that they can catch the Charlotte Bobcats or the Atlanta Hawks by the end of the regular season and sneak into the playoffs.

title: Who Made That Standing Desk?
description: Standing desks are nothing new. Nor is their use as therapeutics. Recent studies may warn that time spent sitting correlates with heart disease and early death, but such worries go back centuries. A sedentary life may be injurious, the Presbyterian minister Job Orton advised in 1797. It must therefore be your resolute care to keep your body as upright as possible when you read and write; never stoop your head nor bend your breast. To prevent this, you should get a standing desk.

title: Beyond the Sea
description: The sun-soaked island of Hydra has long inspired artists and intellectuals from Henry Miller to Leonard Cohen, and even today with the influx of art stars and yachting billionaires, its unspoiled charm remains intact.

title: To Infinity and Beyond
description: This season, fashion looks to the heavens, taking inspiration from both space-age design and the wondrous immensity of the night sky.

title: School Data Finds Pattern of Inequality Along Racial Lines
description: Racial minorities are more likely than white students to be suspended from school, to have less access to rigorous math and science classes, and to be taught by lower-paid teachers with less experience, according to comprehensive data released Friday by the Department of Educations Office for Civil Rights.

title: Ask Well: Exercises to Strengthen Bones
description: Question:

title: Times Minute | Will Sanctions Work?
description: In the Video

title: Word of the Day | annex
description: annex\-neks, a-neks\ noun

title: Idzik Says Jets Seek Sustainable Success, Not Quick Fixes in Free Agency
description: With the arrival of spring, the Jets are already playing defense.

title: Taking a Stars Scholarship Is Creightons Secret
description: There are 13 scholarship players on Creightons basketball team. Its best player, Doug McDermott, is not one of them.

title: Buzzer-Beater Lifts the Longhorns
description: MILWAUKEE  Cameron Ridley, the 6-foot-9 sophomore center for Texas, said he had never made a game-winning shot before Thursday. Now he has, and a great story comes with it.

title: Devils Spoil Parises Return With Wild
description: NEWARK  Zach Parise had waited nearly two years for Thursday night.

title: Chhattisgarh Tests a Green Toilet for Its Poor
description: For just 8 cents a day, the slum dwellers on the outskirts of Raipur, the capital of Chhattisgarh State, are able to indulge in what is a luxury to half of Indias population: a working toilet.

title: Lockout of Officials Ending
description: The union representing Major League Soccers game officials ratified a new collective bargaining agreement Wednesday, ending a lockout that had led the league to use replacement referees and linesmen for the first two weeks of the season. The head of the referees union, Steve Taylor, and the organization that provides M.L.S. with its referees said the agreement would allow the leagues regular officials to return to the field this weekend. Terms of the five-year agreement, the first for the officials, were not announced.

title: Despite Poor Shooting, Villanova Pulls Away
description: BUFFALO  Villanova endured a nightmarish shooting performance but avoided an upset by 15th-seeded Wisconsin-Milwaukee, 73-53, at First Niagara Center on Thursday night.

title: Corrections: March 21, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Nations Start to Collaborate in the Search
description: SYDNEY, Australia  China, Japan and Britain joined the search for the missing Malaysia Airlines jetliner in the southern Indian Ocean on Friday, while Australian search aircraft used human spotters to scan the waters for floating debris that might be wreckage from the plane.

title: Trailing With 5 Minutes to Go, Louisville Rallies to Beat Manhattan
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  It was hard to fathom that the Louisville Cardinals could have opening-game jitters Thursday night. They were the defending national champions, after all, and if a second straight title was not enough motivation, receiving only a No. 4 seed in the Midwest Region should have certainly stoked their fire.

title: Stung by an Upset a Year Ago, the Aztecs Avoid Another
description: SPOKANE, Wash.  San Diego State knew that unsung New Mexico State had upset New Mexico this season. And the Aztecs had spent a year being reminded that they were victims of Florida Gulf Coasts mesmerizing N.C.A.A. tournament run last March.

title: China Cuts Tuberculosis Cases by More Than Half Since 1990
description: China has cut the prevalence of tuberculosis by more than half since 1990 thanks to the widespread implementation of a World Health Organization-backed control strategy, according to a new research paper. The findings, which were published this week in The Lancet medical journal, found that the prevalence of tuberculosis had dropped to 59 cases per 100,000 in 2010 from from 170 cases per 100,000 in 1990.

title: U.N. Investigates Intimidation of Activist at Human Rights Council
description: The United Nations is investigating an act of intimidation against Ti-Anna Wang, the daughter of the imprisoned Chinese democracy advocate Wang Bingzhang, during a meeting of the United Nations Human Rights Council in Geneva this week, a spokesman said.

title: Norwegian Museum to Return Matisse Looted From French Art Dealer by the Nazis
description: A museum in Norway co-founded by the Olympic skating champion Sonja Henie has agreed to return one of its signature works, a portrait by Matisse, to the New York family of a prewar Paris art dealer after determining the painting was stolen by the Nazis.

title: Test Yourself | Editing Practice, March 21, 2014
description: Use the following question for practice or just for fun.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Suitcase Full of Cash Gives a Youth Program New Life
description: In Suitcase Full of Cash Gives a Youth Program New Life, Zach Schonbrun writes about how a television game show ended up helping rising basketball players.

title: Vices Shane Smith: Have We Unleashed a Monster?
description: You recently began something called Vice News. How is it different from what Vice already does? Through YouTube, we learned that our audience wants more news. So news is going to be its own offering. Its a new site with long-form video, short-form video, shows on the environment, economics, conflict.

title: Married, With Camera
description: Please do not call Andi Schreiber maam.

title: What Do You Think Happened to Malaysia Airlines Flight 370?
description: On March 8 a jet carrying 12 crew members and 227 passengers disappeared en route from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, to Beijing. Since then, the world has followed this news story with both horror and suspense, wondering what could have gone wrong.

title: Two Children Die in Mass Poisoning at Chinese Kindergarten
description: Two children have died after more than 30 were poisoned at a kindergarten in the southwestern Chinese province of Yunnan.

title: New York Today: Film City
description: Updated 10:01 a.m.

title: Dont Blame Food Additives for Hives
description: People often blame food additives like dyes, preservatives, emulsifiers and flavor enhancers for chronic hives and other skin eruptions. But a new randomized trial shows that they are almost surely wrong.

title: Asian Tycoon Sells Stake in Sprawling Retail Unit
description: HONG KONG  Li Ka-shing, Asias richest man, has called off plans for a Hong Kong and London listing of his retail business after striking a deal on Friday to sell a stake in the unit to a Singaporean state investment company for nearly $6 billion.

title: The Evil of the Outdoor Cat
description: ONCE upon a time I had a cat named Lucky, and the name fit. She turned up on our doorstep as a stray and stayed with us for 10 years, until her rather gruesome demise. (More about that later.) I liked her because she was a free spirit, and a survivor, going out for two, three, even five days, in all seasons. Shed show up when it suited her, waiting in the dark before dawn till I came downstairs and turned on my desk lamp. Then shed make her presence known by rising up on her hind legs and gently scratching with her forepaws on my window.

title: Even With Ping-Pong, a Formal Meeting in China
description: BEIJING  Michelle Obama, on the first day of a good-will tour to China with her daughters and her mother, tried her hand on Friday at three quintessentially Chinese specialties: calligraphy, table tennis and mathematics.

title: Europe, Stuck in a Rut
description: The European financial crisis may have disappeared from the front pages of American newspapers, but the Continents economic challenges remain worrisome.

title: Hiring Employees on a Trial Basis
description: At the most recent She Owns It business group meeting, Jennifer Blumin talked about how she hired employees for her company, Skylight Group.

title: Thai Court Voids Election, Adding to Turmoil
description: BANGKOK  Thailands Constitutional Court annulled the countrys February general election on Friday, throwing an already murky political situation into further doubt.

title: Why Android Wear Is the Beginning of the Wearable Devices Era
description: Any nascent technology needs a platform in order to be successful. This week, Google gave wearable devices that platform.

title: In Turkey, Twitter Roars After Effort to Block It
description: ISTANBUL  It is a sign of the difficulty of banning Twitter in the age of Twitter that within hours of the Turkish governments attempt to block the social media site, President Abdullah Gul was one of thousands of Turks who protested the ban  using Twitter.

title: Joining the 11-Digit Valuation Club
description: AIRBNB NEARS $10 BILLION VALUATION | The couch-surfing website Airbnb was once selling cereal boxes with presidential candidates faces just to stay afloat. Now, the company is close to joining a rarefied group of start-ups: the 11-digit valuation club, Michael J. de la Merced writes in DealBook.

title: Putin Cool to Idea of Further Retaliation Over Sanctions
description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia on Friday formally completed the annexation of Crimea, signing into law bills passed by Parliament reclaiming the contested province from Ukraine.

title: Sanctions Against Russia
description: The West ponders the dubious impact of sanctions aimed at Putin.

title: Louis C.K. Invites a Friend to His Website
description: A few months ago, the comedian Todd Barry was about to send an email to Netflix, proposing an original stand-up special, when he had a phone conversation with his friend and fellow comic Louis C.K.

title: New York Council Speaker Keeps a Low Profile Everywhere but on Twitter
description: When a gas explosion in her East Harlem district killed eight people and destroyed two buildings, Melissa Mark-Viverito, the speaker of the New York City Council, learned of it  within minutes  the way she does most everything these days: on Twitter.

title: Rainforest Fund to Celebrate Its 25th Anniversary
description: The actress Trudie Styler and her husband, Sting, will be joined by more pop stars  Paul Simon, James Taylor, Dionne Warwick, Ivy Levan  as well as a trumpeter, Chris Botti, and an opera singer, Rene Fleming, in the biennial Rainforest Fund Benefit Concert at Carnegie Hall on April 17.

title: Daily Report: Microsoft Leak Inquiry Raises Privacy Issues
description: Technology companies have spent months denying they know anything about broad government spying on people who use their Internet services.

title: Euro Zones Economy Is Still Ailing, but Improving
description: THE euro zones back-to-back recessions may be over. Most economies are growing, and employment totals have begun to inch upward. New-auto sales, which plunged in 2011 and 2012 as the second recession gathered strength, have risen in Europe in each of the last six months.

title: Mt. Gox Says It Found Missing Bitcoin Worth About $116 Million
description: Updated, 8:04 p.m. | The seemingly miraculous discovery of about $116 million in missing Bitcoin, or 200,000 coins, late Thursday underscored the rickety early infrastructure that the digital currency is still trying to overcome.

title: Silent Comic, Finding His Voice
description: Newcomer Keaton can take a fall and come up swinging for laughs. So The New York Dramatic Mirror observed in reviewing The Butcher Boy, the 1917 Fatty Arbuckle comedy in which Buster Keaton made his screen debut.

title: Enough With Those Nymphets
description: The director and writer Eliza Hittman calls her latest character the anti-Lolita. On the cusp of puberty, her eyes shielded by enormous sunglasses from the summer sun  and things she shouldnt want to see at her age  14-year-old Lila (Gina Piersanti) prowls farthest Brooklyn in search of what in her inexperience seems like romance. Her come-hither gaze is pierced with longing as she targets Sammy (Ronen Rubinstein), older and thuggish. Soon, her sexual anecdotes rival those of her worldlier best friend, Chiara (Giovanna Salimeni). Then suddenly the predator becomes the prey.

title: Crying on a Public Bench
description: Dear Diary:

title: A Farewell to Khushwant Singh, as Well as a Celebration
description: NEW DELHI  Always game for a good joke, the author Khushwant Singh wrote his obituary in 1943, which later appeared in a collection of short stories.

title: Playful to Tender, Shades of Truffaut
description: Franois Truffaut (1932-84) is often regarded as the sentimentalist of the French New Wave, not as politically radical as Jean-Luc Godard nor as intellectually rigorous as Alain Resnais. The label is not entirely fair: His subjects could also include pathological obsession (The Story of Adele H) and dystopia (Fahrenheit 451).Tout Truffaut, at Film Forum fromFridaythrough April 17, provides a complete picture, spanning his 21 features, as well as the documentary Monsieur Truffaut Meets Mr. Hitchcock, about the 1962 conversation that birthed the classic book Hitchcock/Truffaut, and other films linked to him.

title: South Korean and Japanese Leaders to Join Obama at Meeting
description: SEOUL, South Korea  President Park Geun-hye of South Korea and Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan will talk next week after months of tense relations that had blocked them from meeting each other, South Koreas Ministry of Foreign Affairs said on Friday.

title: Inside the List
description: Survivor: Night Broken, the eighth title in Patricia Briggss series of Mercy Thompson fantasies, is new on the hardcover fiction list at No. 2. These books  about a shape-shifting mechanic who consorts with werewolves and vampires  dont receive much academic attention, but that doesnt mean literature professors never read them. Last year, in the peer-reviewed journal Femspec (an interdisciplinary feminist journal dedicated to science fiction, fantasy, magical realism, surrealism, myth, folklore and other supernatural genres), the Abilene Christian University assistant professor Suanna Davis included Mercy in an article about rape survivors in fiction, making the happy observation that rape as an acceptable part of power relations has diminished and concluding that speculative fiction can help to correct societal misunderstandings of rape, particularly when the events are presented from a survivors perspective. Davis isnt alone. Briggss readers have praised her treatment of the topic ever since Mercy was attacked in Iron Kissed, the third book in the series; although she managed to kill her assailant, the psychological and emotional effects still linger.

title: TPG to Buy Warranty Insurance Firm for $1.5 Billion
description: The private equity firm TPG Capital said on Friday that it had agreed to buy the Warranty Group, a warranty insurance company, for about $1.5 billion including debt.

title: In Our Pages: March 22
description: 1914: Overflowing Hotels at Luxor

title: Acquisition by Media General Creates 2nd-Largest Local TV Owner
description: Updated, 8:56 p.m. | Media General said on Friday that it would acquire LIN Media for $1.6 billion in a cash-and-stock deal that will create the second-largest local television broadcasting company.

title: Illusion of Safety at Afghan Haven Is Shattered
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  His handgun drawn,the clean-cut insurgent stood in the restaurant of the Serena Hotel in Kabul, listening to the mother of three as she begged, Take my life, but please dont kill my kids.

title: Afghan Police Patrol Near Hotel Attack
