description: Washington  The Obama administration has selected Karl Remn Thompson, a counselor to Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr., as acting head of the Justice Departments powerful Office of Legal Counsel, the once-obscure agency that has become more prominent amid the highly charged legal policy disputes in the war against Al Qaeda.

title: Write What You Know  Helpful Advice or Idle Clich?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Zo Heller and Mohsin Hamid discuss whether writers should stick to what they know.

title: As New Tappan Zee Bridge Goes Up (Along With Tolls), Funding Questions Remain
description: A new Tappan Zee Bridge is rising over a three-mile stretch of the Hudson River  the first pilings are in, looking like giant tree stumps growing out of the water  but a big question looms: Where will the $3.9 billion come from to pay for it?

title: Missing Flights Last Contact
description: Hishamuddin Hussein, Malaysias defense minister, said satellite data analysis has led officials to concentrate the search for Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 in the southern Indian Ocean.

title: Building a New Bridge
description: This video graphic illustrates how a new cable-stayed bridge across the Hudson River north of New York City will replace the 60-year-old Tappan Zee Bridge between Rockland and Westchester Counties.

title: New HTC One (M8) Impresses With Fancy Camera Tricks
description: For my money, there are really only two features that might make me want to upgrade my smartphone: the camera, and the battery life. The new HTC One (M8) is nailing it in the camera department.

title: A Gadget to Close the Language Gap
description: An intervention program in Providence, R.I., uses a digital word counter to track language use in families, in an effort to close the word gap between children from low-income and affluent families.

title: Trying to Close a Knowledge Gap, Word by Word
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I.  Amid a political push for government-funded preschool for 4-year-olds, a growing number of experts fear that such programs actually start too late for the children most at risk. That is why Deisy Ixcuna-Gonzlez, the 16-month-old daughter of Guatemalan immigrants, is wearing a tiny recorder that captures every word she hears and utters inside her familys cramped apartment one day a week.

title: Taliban Attack Stirs Security Concerns as Afghan Presidential Vote Nears
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  With security concerns already mounting before the Afghan presidential vote next week, a Taliban assault team on Tuesday turned election offices in western Kabul into a scene of carnage, in a new and brutal statement of the groups intent to derail the voting.

title: The Triumphs and Challenges of Logging in PHP (and Really Most Languages Probably)
description: When theres a problem with your site, the system logs are a good place to start troubleshooting. Is there a server error? Check the log! Does the page look garbled and weird? Check the log! While working on the New York Times redesign, we got the chance to develop a lightweight, flexible and useful logger class to be used by the back end PHP framework.

title: Shipping Channel Opens Partially After Huge Oil Spill in Galveston Bay
description: Shipping traffic through the Houston Ship Channel started to resume Tuesday, the Coast Guard said, as crews continued to try to remove oil from a weekend spill along the Texas coast.

title: Siemens to Invest $264 Million in British Wind Turbine Project
description: LONDON  Siemens, the German power and industrial giant, said on Tuesday that it would build facilities for offshore wind turbines on the east coast of England, as Britain rapidly expands into wind power.

title: Philanthropy Is No Substitute for Government Funding
description: There has been an upsurge in philanthropy for scientific research by Americas billionaires. As documented by William J. Broad in a recent report for The Times, the sums are huge; the quests serious; the results impressive.

title: In Performance: Jonatha Brooke
description: The singer and songwriter sings the number Time from her show My Mother Has 4 Noses, at the Duke on 42nd Street.

title: A Bigger Nod to Uncertainty in the Next Climate Panel Report on Global Warming Impacts
description: Scientists and diplomats are meeting in Yokohama, Japan, this week to hash out any final tweaks to the summary of the forthcoming Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change report on current and anticipated impacts of human-driven global warming on people and ecosystems. The final summary will be released on March 31.

title: Signature Theater Season to Spotlight A.R. Gurney and Naomi Wallace
description: Signature Theater, the Off Broadway company that has historically mounted a season of plays by a single playwright, will broaden its 2014-15 season to focus on two writers, A.R. Gurney (Love Letters) and Naomi Wallace (One Flea Spare), the theater announced on Tuesday. Signature will also mount new plays by Athol Fugard and Katori Hall and works by Sam Shepard and Charles Mee.

title: Sidley Austin Hires Senior Lawyer From General Electric
description: Christopher M. Barbuto, one of General Electrics senior mergers and acquisitions lawyers who helped engineer some of the companys largest transactions, has joined the law firm Sidley Austin, the firm announced on Tuesday.

title: In Performance: Jonatha Brooke of My Mother Has 4 Noses
description: This weeks video features a musical number from My Mother Has 4 Noses, a one-woman musical play written and performed by the singer-songwriter Jonatha Brooke. In the show, directed by Jeremy B. Cohen, Ms. Brooke weaves together storytelling and songs about caring for her mother, a Christian Scientist who suffered from dementia and cancer. In this scene she sings the number Time, about being unprepared for her mothers death. She accompanies herself on a kalimba, an African thumb piano. The show continues through May 4 at the Duke on 42nd Street.

title: Today in Small Business: The Failure Fetish
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 79
description: The 2014 World Cup begins on June 12, when Brazil plays Croatia in the opening match. Reporters and editors for The Times will count down to the start of the tournament each day with a short capsule of news and interesting tidbits.

title: Spurred by G.M. Recall, Senators Push for Better Auto Safety Reporting
description: WASHINGTON  Congressional investigators began poring over boxes of internal General Motors documents on Tuesday, seeking to understand the decade-long failure by regulators and the company to act on reports of a defect in Chevrolet Cobalts and other cars. Also, two senators introduced legislation on Tuesday intended to help identify problems earlier.

title: Justices Seem Open to Religious Claims by Companies
description: WASHINGTON  In a long and lively argument that touched on medical science and moral philosophy, the Supreme Court on Tuesday seemed ready to accept that at least some for-profit corporations may advance claims based on religious freedom.

title: British TV Host Wont Be Prosecuted, Police Say
description: LONDON  Jimmy Tarbuck, a British television personality who was arrested last year over allegations of sexual abuse dating from the 1970s, will not be prosecuted, the police said Tuesday. Mr. Tarbuck, 74, an entertainer and quiz show host from the north of England, was never formally named by the police but was widely identified in the British news media after his arrest. In a statement, the North Yorkshire police said that following a detailed investigation, evidence was presented to the Crown Prosecution Service and a decision was made not to proceed with the case. Last year, the police said they had made the arrest acting on information passed on from an investigation into Jimmy Savile, another television host, who died in 2011 and who is now linked to hundreds of cases of sexual abuse.

title: Aam Aadmi Party Leader Declares Candidacy in Varanasi
description: VARANASI, India  It was after sunset on Tuesday when Arvind Kejriwal, the leader of the Aam Aadmi Party in India, asked a field packed with spectators whether he should run for Parliament in the ancient holy city of Varanasi.

title: Tech Tips, and Warnings, for Budget Travelers
description: If youre reading this on any device other than a mobile phone, youre behind the times. If I cant persuade you to post this piece on Facebook, Im doomed to irrelevance. And if you want to tweet a complaint about my bad jokes or ask for a restaurant recommendation in Heathrow, Id better have a round-the-clock team ready to respond.

title: From Puff Daddy to P. Diddy and Back Again. Maybe.
description: Sometimes even a scorecard doesnt help. Sean Combs, the rapper and producer known as Puff Daddy at the start of his career, and as P. Diddy since 2001  with minor variations (just plain Diddy, for example) along the way  has now returned to his original alias, Puff Daddy. At least, thats the message you take away from the 58-second video trailer for Big Homie, which Mr. Combs Big Bad Entertainment production company has posted to Vimeo.

description: At a news conference in The Hague, President Obama spoke on the fatal landslide in Oso, Wash., and the related state of emergency.

title: E-Book Settlement Money Is Going Right Back to the Publishers
description: I woke up this morning to an email from Amazon bearing good news. Thanks to a $166 million antitrust settlement between five book publishers and a group of state attorneys general, Amazon gave me a credit of $10.72 for electronic books I purchased between April 2010 and May 21, 2012. I canuse the moneyto buy print or e-books from Amazon.

title: Obama Dismisses Threat to Russians
description: President Obama said there was no evidence that Russians in Ukraine were being threatened, and he dismissed comparisons of Crimea to Kosovo.

title: A Ranking of Top Executives by Their Employees
description: The chief executives of LinkedIn, Ford Motor Company, Northwestern Mutual, Goldman Sachs and Intuit were among the top scorers this year in Glassdoors ranking of the leaders at 51 big companies. Yahoo and General Electric anchored the bottom of the list.

title: Invitation to a Dialogue: Parents, Chill Out
Googles Bigger, Cheaper Cloud
description: Googles cloud computing business has figured out how its going to come at Amazon Web Services: lower and simpler prices, predictable services and software innovation. Some of the price cuts are as much as 85 percent. Amazon is expected to soon respond with moves of its own.

title: New Novel From Shteyngart Will Be an International Thriller
description: Gary Shteyngart, the author of The Russian Debutantes Handbook and Super Sad True Love Story, is writing an international thriller for Random House, the publisher said on Tuesday.

title: Student Crossword | The Middle Ages
description: Test your knowledge of medieval history by playing our crossword (PDF). You can find the answers here.

title: Image of the Day: March 25
NYT Now: Australian Official on Search
description: The Australian defense minister said the search for crash debris from Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 was suspended due to wild weather.

title: NYT Now: Obama on Russias Actions
description: The president dismissed any notion that Russian intervention in Crimea was justified.

title: A Gondola, Bobbing Toward Japan
description: Another week, another Japanese-Venetian restaurant.

title: Charity Drive Aims to Collect Musical Instruments for New York Students
description: The classical music radio station WQXR 105.9 FM has started a musical instrument drive, with the goal of collecting 1,000 instruments from donors in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut, to be used by public school students. The station said that the drive was inspired by a similar program undertaken by Colorado Public Radio. The stations partners in the program are Sam Ash music stores, which will recondition the used instruments that are collected, and the Mr. Hollands Opus Foundation, which the composer Michael Kamen started in 1996 to distribute instruments to underfunded schools.

title: Dont Blame John Calipari if Kentucky Looks Like a Winner
description: John Calipari is in mea culpa mode, apologizing daily for the coaching blunders he has made with his young Kentucky basketball players. That is usually bad news for the rest of the teams in the N.C.A.A. tournament.

title: The Great, Fishy Massachusetts License Plate Fiasco of 1928
description: Bad license plate designs come and go, but usually, even if one sticks around, as it has with New York States current tags, people resign themselves to it without much furor. But that was not the case in Massachusetts in 1928.

title: Wheres That Aid Package for Ukraine?
description: Since Russia invaded and annexed Crimea, a recurring theme in Washington has been that the United States needs to lead the international response and stand up for Ukraine.

title: Federal Court Rejects Guptas Appeal for New Trial
description: Rajat K. Gupta, who was one of the worlds most admired corporate executives before insider trading charges derailed his career and threatened his freedom, hit another legal setback on Tuesday.

title: Q. and A. | Britains R&B Wunderkind (And This Weekends SNL Guest) Sam Smith
description: At 21, Sam Smith is the new golden boy of the British pop scene. He arrived in 2012 after singing on the buzzy track Latch by the dance duo Disclosure, and his falsetto has since appeared on two other tunes that have shot to the top of the British charts (Naughty Boys La La La and his own Money on My Mind). This year, hes already snagged the Critics Choice Award at the esteemed Brit Awards, been named the BBCs Sound of 2014 and sung a duet onstage with Taylor Swift, who called him her absolute favorite new artist. This weekend, he will be the musical guest on Saturday Night Live, ahead of his upcoming debut album, In the Lonely Hour. Here, Smith talks about sudden success, that time his parents split up in New York and why hed like to be thought of as a male diva.

title: British Government to Sell a Big Stake in Lloyds Banking
description: LONDON  The British government plans to reduce sharply its stake in the Lloyds Banking Group, another sign of the strengthening of the financial sector here.

title: Activists Crash Deal Makers Party
description: Activists are crashing the deal maker party.

title: With Mideast Peace Talks Faltering, Kerry Will See Abbas
description: ROME  Secretary of State John Kerry plans to fly to Amman, Jordan, on Wednesday and will meet with Mahmoud Abbas, the president of the Palestinian Authority, a senior State Department official said Tuesday.

title: I.R.S. Takes a Position on Bitcoin: Its Property
description: Updated, 8:53 p.m. | The Internal Revenue Service may have just taken some of the fun out of Bitcoin. But that may mean that the virtual currency is growing up.

title: Its Art Elsewhere, a Museum Tries to Stay Relevant
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Tourists are asking why this citys Modern art museum is closed. Cabdrivers are wondering when it will reopen. Teachers are lamenting the loss of a valuable destination for school field trips.

title: Unpublished Tennessee Williams Story to Appear
description: Tennessee Williams is known to have had only a few romantic relationships with women in his life. But one of those women, a college sweetheart fleetingly described in his memoirs as a charming girl called Anna Jean, seems to have become the inspiration for a previously unpublished story about campus lust and disappointment that has been unearthed in the Williams archive.

title: Does The Times Take Sides in Venezuela Reporting?
description: Since the round of violent conflicts that began in Venezuela several weeks ago, many readers have written to me to share their views, and many have protested what they see as biased coverage. Most of the complaints say that The Timess reporting seems to favor the antigovernment opposition.

title: A Days Work
description: At a brickmaking factory in Dhaka, the Bangladeshi capital, Mamun Sardar works long hours to pay his familys debts.

title: Home in the Delta
description: Like many of her neighbors, Nasrin Khatun, unrelated to Jahanara Khatun, navigates daily life in a disappearing landscape.

title: Video of World Trade Center BASE Jump
description: As my colleague James McKinley reported, amid growing concerns about security at the new World Trade Center tower, a group of daredevils who parachuted off the skyscraper last year turned themselves in to the police on Monday afternoon.

title: Wheelies: The New Jersey Switch Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Come un bel di di maggio
description: Marcelo lvarez sings Come un bel di di maggio from Andrea Chnier.

title: Candy Crush Maker King Digital Set to Trade at $22.50, a Midpoint
description: The game maker King Digital Entertainment scored a huge hit with Candy Crush Saga. Now the company will test how strongly public investors believe that it can find a new success story.

title: App Smart: Messaging
description: Several apps, including WhatsApp, Kik and Viber, offer alternatives to SMS for communicating with others from your phone.

title: The Gander, a New Restaurant from the Chef of Recette
description: Headliner

title: Messaging Services Bypass the Old SMS Route
description: Kik me! is not a silly note to pin to someones back. Its a request to use the Kik app to chat with someone through mobile instant messaging. Kik is just one of many messaging apps that have arrived recently to rival the humble SMS as a way of rapid text communication from phones. If you havent tried any, you may be missing out.

title: The Gun Report: March 25, 2014
description: On Sunday, Grace Baptist Church in  Lansingburgh, N.Y., raffled off an AR-15-style rifle to a lucky parishioner. The winner was Ron Stafford, 42, an avid hunter and single father of two who drove in fromSchenectady.

title: A New View in Chicago
description: Observation towers have been going through an extreme makeover for the past several years.

title: In Georgia, Carry a Gun, Just Not in the Capitol
description: Theres a lot of concern about new legislation in Georgia that expands how people can buy, carry and use guns. It reduces some licensing requirements and provides Georgians with a stronger Stand Your Ground defense should they feel threatened and decide to open fire. Some critics were calling it the guns everywhere law. Thats so unfair. Georgias lawmakers are not allowing everyones safety to be endangered by gun-slinging people. They are deeply concerned, for example, with their own.

title: Its Home, Malevolent Yet Oddly Captivating
description: I have a weakness for fiction writers who give good interviews, who seem to have so many ideas brewing in their heads that they cant help serving them up, as if they were cocktails, wherever they turn. These arent the only kind of real writers, for sure. But we need our headstrong, talky ones, the ones who live to stir the pot.

title: Judge in Mumbai Rape Case Calls Test on Women Archaic
description: MUMBAI, India  The judge presiding over a gang-rape case here complained in a judgment released Tuesday that outdated practices were still being used in rape investigations, in defiance of reforms imposed last year to make the justice system more sensitive to victims of sexual violence.

title: A New Guide from Patricia Wells, Stout Glasses, Brooklyn Yogurt and More
description: To Consult: Your Guide to Paris Has Updated Her List

title: Loeb Files Suit Against Sothebys, Seeking to Eliminate Its Poison Pill
description: Updated, 8:11 p.m. | The billionaire activist investor Daniel S. Loeb has sued Sothebys to remove a poison pill preventing his hedge fund from buying more of the auction house companys shares.

title: Income Equality: A Search for Consequences
description: There are not many social scientists in the United States who have studied the United States widening income gap longer than Christopher S. Jencks.

title: In Two Settlements, Money for Apple and Amazon Customers
description: Apple and Amazon customers were notified on Tuesday of opportunities to get money back as a result of two legal settlements with the government. Both cases revolved around Apple.

title: A Midtown Landlord Sells a Lifestyle to Lure Creative Tenants
description: A field of wheat doesnt usually stand inside the lobby of a Manhattan office building.

title: Goldens Bridge: Exurb With Room to Exhale
description: Not quite rural but very non-suburban, is how Lisa Arrigo, a resident of Goldens Bridge, describes this 2.6-square-mile hamlet of rolling hills and densely wooded areas in the town of Lewisboro.

title: Apple Invites Parents to Review In-App Purchases
description: Over the weekend, I received a lovely email from my friends at Apple:

title: Ralph Wilson, Founding Owner of the Buffalo Bills, Dies at 95
description: Ralph Wilson, who founded the Buffalo Bills as an original member of the American Football League in 1960 and saw them go to four Super Bowls as the only owner in the teams history, died on Tuesday at his home in Grosse Pointe Shores, Mich. He was 95.

title: Barbara Blair Randall
description: Ms. Randall, 56, is the president of the Garment District Alliance, formerly known as the Fashion Center, one of 69 business improvement districts in New York City. She has led the nonprofit organization, which represents the interests of garment and other businesses in the neighborhood, since its formation in 1995.

title: A Real Treat or Half-Baked?
description: Remember the cake pop?

title: Arguments Against Health Law Subsidies Gain Traction
description: WASHINGTON  Two of the three federal judges hearing a challenge to the Affordable Care Act appeared open on Tuesday to the argument that people buying health insurance in the federal marketplace should not be eligible for tax subsidies, the first indication that the White House could be facing another potentially serious legal challenge to a central part of President Obamas health care law.

title: A Live String Ensemble, With Death on Its Program
description: Death sells, the clich about media hype goes. But was a program devoted to works on that theme what a substantial audience at Alice Tully Hall was buying on Sunday afternoon? Far more likely, it was life that folks were looking for: meaning the continued hale, hearty existence of the Emerson String Quartet, one of the worlds most respected, appreciated and popular chamber music institutions.

title: The Casserole Catches Up
description: Casseroles have an image problem.

title: As Basic Cable Finds Legs, a Veteran Show Jumps Off
description: In the beginning, just a short decade and a half ago, was a void. Then came the first signs of intelligent life: odd animated children, a phobia-laden crime investigator, an angry cop. But for a stretch, it was unclear whether these pioneers were the start of a trend or mere aberrations in the emptiness. It took a second wave of shows to prove that basic cable television was a force to be reckoned with. Lets pause to tip our hats to one of them, Psych, whose final episode is on Wednesday night.

title: A Heretic and Hero Speaks in Many Tongues
description: You can tell that the conversation had being going on for a long time before you arrived at this party. I mean, a really long time  weeks, months, maybe years. Yet the highly animated people in residence at the Chocolate Factory in Long Island City, Queens, show no signs of fatigue. And though youre not quite sure what theyre talking about, its hard not to catch their excitement.

title: Pictures of the Day  Ukraine and Elsewhere
description: Ukraine and More: Pictures of the Day

title: Rescuers Fear More Victims in Mudslide
description: After a mudslide in Washington, the Snohomish County fire chief, Travis Hots, and the countys director of emergency management, John Pennington, gave updates on the search and rescue effort.

title: Something Stately, Preferably in Black
description: As the Secret Service shops for a new presidential limousine, here is a look at some past models.

title: Senate Democrats Drop I.M.F. Reforms From Ukraine Aid
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Democrats, bowing to united House Republican opposition, dropped reforms of International Monetary Fund governance from a Ukraine aid package on Tuesday, handing President Obama an embarrassing defeat as he huddled in Europe with allies who have already ratified the changes.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ukraine and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Ukraine, Afghanistan, Spain and China.

title: Six Decades and Counting: A Dance Troupe Recalculates
description: Currently celebrating its 60th anniversary, the Paul Taylor Dance Company presented a special performance on Sunday at the David H. Koch Theater: a revival of From Sea to Shining Sea (1965), a sourly surreal burlesque of American history, and Esplanade (1975), the most enduringly beloved work in Taylor history.

title: Chasing Kurt Cobain in Washington State
description: Kurt Cobain felt bored and old. Teenage angst had paid off well, as the line in the Nirvana song Serve the Servants put it, but the fame that came with being the frontman of the seminal grunge band that brought punk to the mainstream was taking a toll. Cobain was considered by many to be the voice of his generation, but he was also battling depression and addiction, diseases that led to his suicide at 27.

title: How It Happens | Mudslides
description: A steep slope, made unstable by rain or fire, can give way without warning, creating a destructive torrent of rock and mud.

title: 2 Visions of Bach, Majestic and Wild
description: In past years, the Guggenheim Museums Works & Process series has tried the controlled experiment of assigning the same music to two different choreographers. Sunday featured a new variation: two dances to the same music, but only one choreographer. That was the young, skilled Emery LeCrone. The music was Bachs Partita No. 2 in C minor, lucidly played by Vassily Primikov.

title: The Woman Who Gave Up Sex
description: Spoiler alert: If you are a fan of The Good Wife and havent watched the last episode, please read something else.

title: The Inner Children of Parents-to-Be
description: Times and social mores may change, but the sight and sound of grown-ups mimicking high-pitched children will never not get old. This is the main problem bedeviling Paula Vogels 1984 play, And Baby Makes Seven, which broached the topic of gay parenting a generation ahead of the curve. Ms. Vogels prescience has at times been credited for the plays lack of success; her breakout work, The Baltimore Waltz, wouldnt appear for another eight years. But the revival of  And Baby Makes Seven  at the New Ohio Theater, in partnership with Purpleman Theater, offers another reason: The central conceit is reductive, repetitive and extremely off-putting.

title: How Does a $45 Million Viola Sound?
description: David Aaron Carpenter plays Suite No. 3 in C by Johann Sebastian Bach on a Stradivari viola that will have a starting price of $45 million at auction this spring at Sothebys.

title: Cruises Resume Out of Texas
description: Cruise ships in the Port of Galveston are getting underway again after a barge and bulk carrier ship collided in Galveston Bay on Saturday, creating a major oil spill and preventing ships from passing through the Houston Ship Channel into the Gulf of Mexico.

title: For Sale, Playing a Heady Tune
description: It may well prove to be the most expensive musical instrument in the world  a Stradivari viola, whose asking price will start at $45 million when it is offered for sale this spring  but, just for a moment, it was held up with no hands.

title: Honesty Is Not the Family Policy
description: Carla Chings Fast Company, at the Ensemble Studio Theater, offers a crafty take on the dysfunctional-family tale. The Kwan siblings manipulate, deceive and forsake one another. But its all for the good of the family business. That business? Con artistry.

title: Classic and Contemporary, Explanation Included
description: When a microphone comes out during a concert at Lincoln Center or Carnegie Hall, my heart sinks. If a musician introduces a piece from the stage, the likelihood is that the audience is in for yet another well-intentioned, unilluminating couple of minutes to unwrap cough drops.

title: Swiss Watchmakers Skeptical of Digital Revolution
description: GENEVA  A decade ago, Nick Hayek, chief executive of the Swatch Group, and Bill Gates, co-founder of Microsoft, introduced in New York a new kind of watch called the Paparazzi. It was presented as the pioneer of the so-called smartwatch, giving the wearer access to news, stock quotes and other data via Microsofts MSN service.

title: Video: Nancy Horan Talks About Under the Wide and Starry Sky
description: In The Read Around, a weekly video feature, authors talk about the when, where and how behind their books. Above, Nancy Horan explains her fascination with Robert Louis Stevenson and his wife, Franny, who inspired Ms. Horans novel Under the Wide and Starry Sky.

title: A House and Its Perpetual Spring
description: LONGTIME NEW YORKERS are accustomed to stepping on blobs of chewing gum, leaning up against fresh paint and occasionally getting pelted with pigeon poop. But the sudden shower of pollen that befouled a new blue dress as I attempted to discard a wilted bunch of calla lilies the other day  that was a new one.

title: Facebook in $2 Billion Deal for Virtual Reality Company
description: Facebook sees the future  a 3-D virtual world where you feel as if you are hanging out with your friends rather than staring at their pictures.

description: To the Editor:

title: G.O.P. and Food Stamps
description: To the Editor:

title: The Women on the Sidelines of the Hobby Lobby Case
description: Most of the news coverage of the highly-anticipated contraceptive-mandate cases  which came before the Supreme Court on Tuesday morning  has focused on the idea of religious liberty, and to what degree a for-profit corporation can exercise that liberty like a real human person.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: Going Back, in Therapy
description: To the Editor:

title: Hands Trace the Connections of a Shared Conscious Energy
description: The dancers in Lance Griess If Immanent Field were a laudable bunch.

title: Commercials to Go Live With Show Cast Members
description: IN another back-to-the-future moment on Madison Avenue, the season premieres on Wednesday of two series on TV Land will include, for the first time, live commercials delivered by cast members of the shows.

title: Dealing With Russia Under Putin
description: To the Editor:

title: Drugs for Hepatitis C
description: To the Editor:

title: A Building Boom in Macau
description: Casino operators in intense competition are pouring billions of dollars into new gambling and entertainment resorts in the Chinese territory.

title: Macau Rides High on New Round of Casino Construction
description: MACAU  This city on the southeast coast of China already has its own version of Venice, complete with a Grand Canal and a Rialto Bridge.

title: A Look Back at Burt Glinn
description: Sarah Stacke, who was hired to help Burt Glinn digitize his vast archives, recalls the lessons he taught her about doing things well and with love.

title: Ryan Sees Michael Vick as Motivation for Geno Smith
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Hello, Michael; goodbye, Mark. That was the message Coach Rex Ryan of the Jets shared at the N.F.L.s annual owners meeting.

title: Q&A: A Sociologist on Inequality
description: Is income inequality truly the defining challenge of our time? Should it be the central issue for American liberalism? Lane Kenworthy, a professor of sociology and political science at the University of Arizona, has been thinking about this more deeply than most. Earlier this year, he published Social Democratic America, in which he outlined how a strengthened welfare state could deliver broadly shared prosperity. This year, he is writing another  tentatively entitled Should We Worry About Inequality?  in which he assesses the damage inflicted by Americas widening income gap.

title: ECO 348, The Great Recession: The Euro Crisis
description: Slides here (pdf).

title: What America Isnt, Or Anyway Wasnt
description: I get mail:

title: Prosecution Rests Case in Pistorius Murder Trial
description: JOHANNESBURG  The prosecution rested its case in the Oscar Pistorius murder trial on Tuesday, after three weeks of testimony in which it sought to portray Mr. Pistorius as a spoiled, angry and jealous man whose charming public facade hid a deep and ultimately murderous rage.

title: Text Messages Read at Pistorius Trial
description: Text messages between the track star Oscar Pistorius and Reeva Steenkamp, the girlfriend he is accused of fatally shooting, were presented in a South African court.

title: Terror Case Against Aide to Bin Laden Goes to Jury
description: Jurors weighing the case of Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, a former top adviser to Osama bin Laden who later married his daughter, were sent home on Tuesday after deliberating for half a day without reaching a verdict.

title: American Owners Oversee a Soccer Renaissance in Rome
description: ROME  One day last year, Jim Pallotta was walking through the Sistine Chapel with some friends. As the group admired Michelangelos stunning frescoes, one of Pallottas companions took out a cellphone to take a picture.

title: Why Im Jealous of My Dogs Insurance
description: NELSONS doctors found the bulge in his abdomen on a Monday. An ultrasound and CT scan showed that a mass was crowding out his stomach and kidneys. It was one of the largest the doctors had ever seen. If they didnt do something, hed be dead in a couple of days.

title: Afghan Officials on the Taliban Attack
description: The Interior Ministry spokesman and the head of the Independent Election Commission addressed the deadly Taliban assault on election offices in Kabul.

title: Butter Is Back
description: Julia Child, goddess of fat, is beaming somewhere. Butter is back, and when youre looking for a few chunks of pork for a stew, you can resume searching for the best pieces  the ones with the most fat. Eventually, your friends will stop glaring at you as if youre trying to kill them.

title: Dead Cattle and Greek Fire
description: The American Civil War was a conflict that sat astride two phases in military history: It began with generals on both sides employing timeworn Napoleonic-era strategies and ended with horrific trench warfare and violence against civilian populations that foreshadowed World War I. It was also a crucible in which new combat technologies were tested, among them ironclads, machine guns and submarines. And while scientists had not yet fully grasped the germ theory of disease, it was also one of the first conflicts to see chemical and biological agents tested, and even used, as weapons.

title: Rare Footage of Ruth and Gehrig
description: This clip captures a historic day in Yankee history: Babe Ruths first game since the bellyache heard round the world and Lou Gehrigs first step in playing 2,130 consecutive games.

title: Search for Missing Flights Wreckage Is Hampered by a Sea of Detritus
description: In recent days, the search for the missing Malaysia Airlines jetliner has focused on blurry satellite images and other sightings of objects floating in the desolate reaches of the southern Indian Ocean.

title: Detroit Threatens to Cut Water Service to Delinquent Customers
description: DETROIT  The citys water department is looking to recoup tens of millions of dollars by cutting service each week to as many as 3,000 customers who have failed to pay their bills.

title: Nitroglycerin, a Staple of Emergency Rooms, Is in Short Supply
description: The drug nitroglycerin has long been an emergency room staple, a front-line drug that is often the first thing doctors try when a patient shows up with a heart attack.

title: B.U. or B.C.? Hockey Star Let Brother Pick
description: CHESTNUT HILL, Mass.  The hockey rivalry between Boston College and Boston University has played out on many ice surfaces. Boston University has won more Beanpot championships. Boston College has had better luck lately in the N.C.A.A. tournament, winning four titles in the last 12 years.

title: Pollution Killed 7 Million People Worldwide in 2012, Report Finds
description: BEIJING  From taxi tailpipes in Paris to dung-fired stoves in New Delhi, air pollution claimed seven million lives around the world in 2012, according to figures released Tuesday by the World Health Organization. More than one-third of those deaths, the organization said, occurred in fast-developing nations of Asia, where rates of cardiovascular and pulmonary disease have been soaring.

title: A Casino License Bidder With 4 Irons in the Fire
description: In 1999, David Flaum, a developer, bought a 345-acre parcel on a hilltop in Sullivan County, N.Y., where he hoped to build an Indian casino that would resemble the Catskill resorts of his youth.

title: Giroux Carries Flyers Into Playoff Picture
description: PHILADELPHIA  As Claude Giroux goes, so go the Philadelphia Flyers. And Giroux and the Flyers are going well as the N.H.L. playoffs draw near.

title: Prokhorov Tempers Talk of Nets Becoming Russian
description: The Nets will not become a Russian-based company anytime soon. And on Tuesday, their owner, Mikhail D. Prokhorov, conceded that the unusual changeover may never happen.

title: On Visit to China, Michelle Obama Eases In Some Political Messages
description: CHENGDU, China  Michelle Obamas weeklong trip to China seemed to start as a spring break holiday with her mother and daughters but has turned out to include far more substance  and politics  than the cheerful advocate of fitness and healthful eating she often displays at home.

title: Protesting in Venezuela, With Antipathy Toward Cubas Government
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Enraged as they are by their nations leaders, many of the protesters who have spilled onto Venezuelas streets have their eyes fixed on another government altogether, one they resent perhaps just as bitterly as their own: Cubas.

title: Capturing a Piece of Yankee History
description: The newsreel film from June 1, 1925, animates a historic day for the Yankee franchise: Babe Ruths first game of the season since the illness dubbed the bellyache heard round the world and a pinch-hitting appearance by Lou Gehrig that became the first of his 2,130 consecutive games.

title: Many of Oculuss Early Backers Not Part of Facebook Riches
description: The big winners of Facebooks $2 billion deal to buy Oculus VR, a virtual reality headset maker, include a roster of elite venture capitalists who invested in the company early on.

title: Obama on End of N.S.A. Data Collection
description: President Obama spoke about the overhaul of the National Security Agencys bulk phone records program at a press conference at the Gemeentemuseum in The Hague.

title: Obama Says N.S.A. Curbs Would Address Worries
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Tuesday publicly endorsed a plan that Justice Department and intelligence officials have developed for a sweeping overhaul of the National Security Agencys phone call records program, saying that he believed it would resolve privacy concerns without compromising the programs utility as a counterterrorism tool.

title: U.S. Challenge Now Is to Stop Further Putin Moves
description: WASHINGTON  While President Obama insisted again on Tuesday that the West would not recognize the annexation of Crimea, officials in the United States and Europe have privately concluded that Crimea is lost and that the real challenge is stopping Russia from further destabilizing Ukraine.

title: Cuomo and de Blasio Clash Again, This Time Over Homelessness
description: Faced with a stream of news reports on his conflicts with Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo  over tax increases to pay for prekindergarten, charter schools and raising the minimum wage  Mayor Bill de Blasio often pushes back, arguing that he and Mr. Cuomo agree on more issues than they disagree on.

title: The Certainty of Donald Rumsfeld (Part 1)
description: Read Part 2; Part 3; Part 4.

title: Putin and the Laws of Gravity
description: One thing I learned covering the Middle East for many years is that there is the morning after and there is the morning after the morning after. Never confuse the two.

title: The Verdict, for Now, From France
description: Far-right populist parties feed on discontent, and whenever they draw strong support outside their fringe base its time to pause and ask, whats wrong?

title: Measured Progress on Nuclear Security
description: Although the summit meeting was overshadowed by the crisis in Ukraine, 53 international leaders in The Hague this week made important progress on securing nuclear materials around the world and keeping them out of the hands of terrorist groups like Al Qaeda. There is still a long way to go to address the challenges of a world awash in nuclear materials and weapons, but many countries are taking constructive action.

title: In Second Chance, Pineda Is Named the Yankees Fifth Starter
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Michael Pineda had to pause and collect himself as tears welled in his eyes Tuesday. Yankees Manager Joe Girardi had just told him that he had won the competition to be the Yankees fifth starter, and now reporters were asking Pineda to express his feelings about it.

title: After Years in Minors, a Met Has Tenuous Hope of Making the Cut
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Over the past few weeks, the Mets clubhouse has slowly cleared out as players have been sent down to the minor leagues. They get a handshake, collect their belongings and say their goodbyes. Their lockers are emptied, their nameplates removed. By Tuesday, 23 of the lockers were no longer occupied. And more will be vacant soon as the regular season draws near and the Mets get ready to make their final cuts.

title: Mr. Obamas Limits on Phone Records
description: If President Obama really wants to end the bulk collection of Americans telephone records, he doesnt need to ask the permission of Congress, as he said on Tuesday he would do. He can just end it himself, immediately.

title: Democrats, as Part of Midterm Strategy, to Schedule Votes on Pocketbook Issues
description: WASHINGTON  The White House and congressional Democrats are preparing to step up attacks on Republicans over pocketbook issues like the minimum wage in the most aggressive and coordinated move yet to try to reverse the Republican momentum that threatens their control of the Senate in the final two years of the Obama presidency.

title: Complaint by Fired Correction Officer Adds Details About a Death at Rikers Island
description: For the new correction officer, the trouble began about an hour and a half into his shift at Rikers Island.

title: Representative Apologizes for Criticizing Iowa Senator
description: WASHINGTON  It is a lesson politicians never seem to learn from others mistakes: The microphone is always on.

title: Qaeda Militants Seek Syria Base, U.S. Officials Say
description: WASHINGTON  Dozens of seasoned militant fighters, including some midlevel planners, have traveled to Syria from Pakistan in recent months in what American intelligence and counterterrorism officials fear is an effort to lay the foundation for future strikes against Europe and the United States.

title: At B.Y.U., Taking a Path They Never Imagined
description: LOS ANGELES  Taking a look at the Brigham Young womens basketball team, a question pops to mind.

title: Movie Box Office Figures Largely Flat for 2013
description: LOS ANGELES  Most of the lines in the many graphics included in the Motion Picture Association of Americas annual market report, released on Tuesday, were nearly flat  as usual.

title: Manhattan Is Likely to Lose Coach
description: Steve Masiello, who led Manhattan to its first N.C.A.A. tournament in 10 years, is close to becoming the coach at South Florida, according to a person with knowledge of the negotiations.

title: Orange Is the New Black Set Recalls Century of Movie Lore
description: The set for the Netflix series Orange Is the New Black is dark now, so only shadows and dim shapes hover in its warren of prison cells and other rooms built on the main soundstage at Kaufman Astoria Studio in Queens.

title: Obama Meets With Asian Allies on North Koreas Nuclear Plans
description: President Obama brought together the sometimes squabbling leaders of Japan and South Korea on Tuesday for a closed-door discussion in advance of his visit to both countries next month. The three leaders met on the sideline of a nuclear security summit meeting in The Hague, emerging from the discussion to declare themselves united in the face of North Koreas nuclear ambitions and other issues. The fact that the three leaders offered positive comments was significant, given the tensions between Japan and South Korea. The countries leaders have been feuding almost since each assumed office, over issues dating back to World War II, including so-called comfort women, the girls and women abducted by the Japanese during the war to work in prostitution camps.

title: React to the Reality, Not the Image of It
description: Years ago, a friend came home with a new, top-of-the-line road bike. My first thought: How can he afford that? It seemed like such a big purchase based on what I thought I knew. We lived in the same neighborhood, were close to the same age and both had young families. His life looked a lot like mine  at least I thought it did.

title: Literary City, Bookstore Desert
description: When Sarah McNally, the owner of McNally Jackson bookstore in Lower Manhattan, set out to open a second location, she went to a neighborhood with a sterling literary reputation, the home turf of writers from Edgar Allan Poe to Nora Ephron: the Upper West Side.

title: Corrections: March 26, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Property of the First Part
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  I have no quantitative evidence on this, but I think that I probably get more questions about the crossword puzzle entry ATNO than any other. O.K., maybe questions about why we cant put a tilde on the Spanish word AO in a grid comes close, but ATNO definitely sticks out in my mind as a big one.

title: Judge Imposes 16-Year Term for Manhattan Man in Pipe Bomb Case
description: A Manhattan man who conspired with a police informer to plant pipe bombs as part of a jihad against the United States was sentenced to 16 years in a New York State prison on Tuesday at a hearing with little of the theatrics that had accompanied his arrest.

title: U.S. to Extend Sign-Up Period for Insurance
description: WASHINGTON  With less than a week left for people to sign up for health insurance, the Obama administration said Tuesday that it would allow more time for those who had tried to apply but were blocked by technical problems with the federal exchange.

title: Rhode Island House Elects a Speaker After an Abrupt Resignation
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I.  Nicholas A. Mattiello, who on Tuesday was elected speaker of the state House of Representatives, said he had always wanted to be speaker  he just did not expect it to happen so soon.

title: Plan Would Add 30 Per Ride to Pay for Accessible Taxis
description: The de Blasio administration is proposing a 30-cent surcharge on all yellow and street-hail livery taxi rides as part of a plan to make half of New York Citys taxi fleet wheelchair-accessible by 2020, according to city and taxi officials.

title: White House Protests Saudis Denial of Visa to Journalist
description: WASHINGTON  The White House on Tuesday protested a decision by Saudi Arabia to deny a visa to a Washington-based reporter for an Israeli newspaper who planned to cover President Obamas trip to the Arab kingdom this week.

title: Court Hears Appeal by Son of Scholar on Dead Sea Scrolls
description: The ancient religious texts have much to say about the divine obligations of a son toward his father, but they are silent on the propriety of using computers, blogs, pseudonyms and Internet sock puppets to fulfill them. For this, there is only the law.

title: 2 CNN Producers Are Held in Trespass at World Trade Center
description: Two CNN producers seeking to report on recent breaches of security at the World Trade Center site were arrested on Tuesday as they tried to break into the area, the authorities said.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 25, 2014
description: March 25, 2014

title: North Korea Launches Two Midrange Missiles
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea demonstrated its ballistic missile capabilities by launching two midrange missiles on Wednesday, after the leaders of the United States, Japan and South Korea gathered in the Netherlands to discuss the Norths nuclear threats.

title: Momentum Is Building for Museum on Women
description: WASHINGTON  A once-ailing effort to build a national womens history museum on or near the National Mall has been given new life by a declaration of support from the House majority leader and the ascension of women to key committee posts in the Senate, supporters in both parties said Tuesday.

title: A Start-Up Is Offering an Online Way to Invest in Hollywood
description: Thanks to new securities rules, Hollywood is about to get into the crowdfunding game.

title: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, March 26, 2014
description: In the same way that we say you should feed your child, brush their teeth, you should be stimulating their brain by talking, singing and reading to them.

title: Knicks Are Routed in a Display That Jackson Calls Awful
description: LOS ANGELES  With 8 minutes 54 seconds left in the fourth quarter, Phil Jackson had seen enough. He texted his fiance, Jeanie Buss, and agreed to meet at the loading dock inside Staples Center where their car would be waiting. The Knicks were losing by 26 points.

title: How Strong Will the Anti-Democratic Backlash Be?
description: Why isnt the Republican Party paying a heavy price for its dependence on a shrinking white electorate, its rejection of immigration reform and its just say no legislative strategy?

title: Exercising for Healthier Eyes
description: Age-related vision loss is common and devastating. But new research suggests that physical activity might protect our eyes as we age.

title: Cellphone Bans May Not Prevent Accidents
description: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago. He is the author of The Redistribution Recession: How Labor Market Distortions Contracted the Economy.

title: Word of the Day | testy
description: testy\tes-te\ adjective

title: Times Minute | Michelle Obama in China
description: Michelle Obamas fairly anodyne family trip to China is mixed with soft diplomacy, today on the Minute.

title: Times Minute | Michelle Obama in China
description: In the Video

title: Secret Service Pulls Agents From Detail for Drinking
description: WASHINGTON  The Secret Service has sent home three of its agents who were in the Netherlands to provide security for President Obamas trip there, according to senior law enforcement officials, citing disciplinary reasons in connection with the agents drinking.

title: Rescuers Describe Landslide Destruction
description: Snohomish County officials discussed the continuing rescue operations at a press conference Tuesday, and explained why they dont know how many people are missing.

title: Whats On Wednesday
description: 10 P.M. (Comedy Central) BROAD CITY In this season finale, Abbi (Abbi Jacobson) and Ilana (Ilana Glazer, near right, with Ms. Jacobson) indulge in a fancy dinner at a restaurant to celebrate Abbis 26th birthday. Things quickly go awry, however, when Ilana has an allergic reaction to the food, and their seemingly classy waiter (Seth Morris) shows his dark side in the kitchen and argues with the chef (Amy Poehler).

title: Hopes of Electoral Change Bring Foreigners Back to Indian Markets
description: MUMBAI, India  Just seven months ago, investors shunned the Indian markets, over growing concerns about the economy. The rupee hit a record low. Stocks plummeted.

title: In Rowing, Women Catch Up With the Men
description: LONDON  On the face of it, the recent unveiling of a new trophy for the Womens Boat Race, contested annually by the best crews of eight from Oxford and Cambridge Universities, was unremarkable. A new silver chalice was introduced in front of a group of invited guests in the wood-paneled library at the University Womens Club in Mayfair, and the old trophy  a rather sad-looking wooden plaque  was consigned to the River Rowing Museum in Henley-on-Thames, England.

title: 7 Arrested on Suspicion of Arson in Protesters Death
description: The police in the eastern province of Shandong have arrested seven people in an arson and murder investigation after a fire killed a man who had been trying to block developers from seizing farmland. Geng Fulin, 63, had been sleeping in a tent when it was allegedly set on fire by four of the suspects early Friday. While three others in the tent escaped, Mr. Geng was killed in the blaze, the Shanghai-based Oriental Morning Post reported.

title: Extreme Challenges for Investigators
description: Maps showing some of the difficulties in the search for Flight 370.

title: Houses in the Path of the Washington Mudslide
description: A look at where some of the survivors, deceased and missing from the mudslide near Oso, Wash., had lived before the disaster tore through the area last weekend.

title: Test Yourself | Math, March 26, 2014
description: Our weekly math problems are written by teachers at Math for America.

title: Grandmothers Call for Protection of Children After Kindergartners Are Fed Drugs
description: About two dozen Chinese grandmothers called on Wednesday for the government to protect children, and their families right to demand that protection, as a fourth kindergarten was discovered to be administering drugs to children without their parents knowledge.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Trying to Close a Knowledge Gap, Word by Word
description: In Trying to Close a Knowledge Gap, Word by Word, Motoko Rich writes about various programs across the country trying to improve the long-term academic prospects of young children of poor and immigrant families.

title: A Fight Is Brewing
description: Mikkel Borg Bjergso, a 38-year-old former high-school science teacher who runs the Danish brewery Mikkeller, stuck his face into a bag of hops and inhaled deeply. It was a rainy February afternoon, and Mikkel, who makes some of the worlds most inventive beer, was visiting de Proef, a Belgian brewery in the town of Lochristi. The hops had been processed into unctuous pellets that resembled cat food, and they released a ripe botanical stink heavy on lemon grass and cannabis. Thats nice, Mikkel said, crumbling a few pellets between his fingers and nodding approvingly at the sticky green smear they deposited on his thumb. They were specimens of a strain called Polaris, developed by growers in Germany, which Mikkel had asked de Proefs proprietor, Dirk Naudts, to purchase for use in a new Mikkeller beer. Theyre very fatty, Naudts said.

title: How Comfortable Are You With Lying?
description: In the Times quiz Can You Spot the Liar?, you can view 10 individuals making statements  and decide whether you think they are lying or telling the truth. Go ahead and take it: Spotting the liar is not as easy as you might think.

title: Moroccos Mule Women
description: The women of Morocco who carry large bundles across the border from Spains duty-free Melilla enclave.

title: The Best of Photojournalism 2014
description: The National Press Photographers Associations Best of Photojournalism contest winners were announced Monday. John Tlumacki and Sean Proctor won top honors, and Patrick Smith was named Sports Photographer of the year.

title: New York Today: Weathering It
description: Good Wednesday morning to you.

title: New Satellite Images Said to Be Credible Lead in Malaysia Jet Hunt
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  Satellite sightings of 122 objects floating southwest of Australia are the most credible lead that we have in the search for Flight 370, the Malaysian defense minister said Wednesday evening, adding that his country had asked Australia to try to recover the objects and see if they were debris from the missing jetliner.

title: Obama Renewing U.S. Commitment to NATO Alliance
description: BRUSSELS  President Obama has spent much of his presidency mired in the challenges of a world well outside the borders of Europe  the turmoil of the Middle East, the power struggles in Asia and the terrorist threats percolating in northern Africa, Pakistan and elsewhere.

title: With App and Premium Plan, The Times Expands Online Offerings
description: The New York Times Company announced two new subscription plans on Wednesday, including NYT Now, a lower-priced app edited for a mobile audience, as part of the companys push to expand its digital offerings and increase its revenue.

title: On Eve of M.&A. Conference, Deal Makers Feel Hopeful, but Still Wary of Activists
description: The last two days have certainly given deal makers plenty to discuss at one of the industrys biggest conferences, the Tulane Corporate Law Institute in New Orleans, this week.

title: Early Supporters of Oculus VR Denounce Facebook Buyout
description: Sometimes, the best way to alienate a little companys early backers is a big payday.

title: Q&A: Why the Dollar Remains the Reserve Currency
description: Economists called it the dollar trap.

title: Picking a Bag for a Camera
description: Searching for the right camera is really difficult. Searching for the right camera bag is almost impossible. Some bags are too small, others too big. Some dont have enough padding, others look hideous.

title: Why Employers Will Stop Offering Health Insurance
description: Heres a prediction: By 2025, fewer than 20 percent of workers in the private sector will receive traditional employer-sponsored health insurance. The source of this claim? Dr. Ezekiel J. Emanuel, in his just-published book, Reinventing American Health Care.

title: Daily Report: Facebook to Buy Oculus VR, Maker of Virtual Reality Hardware
description: To fulfill its vision of the future of social media  one where it feels like hanging out with friends, rather than staring at their pictures  Facebook announced on Tuesday that it had reached a $2 billion agreement to buy Oculus VR, the maker of a virtual reality headset. Its a bet that a technology commonly associated with science fiction can help eventually turn social networking into an immersive, 3-D experience, Nick Wingfield and Vindu Goel report.

title: Britain Pares Its Stake in Lloyds Bank, But R.B.S. Remains a Tough Sell
description: LONDON  Now that the British government has successfully sold a second portion of its holdings in the Lloyds Banking Group, the question remains what to do about the Royal Bank of Scotland.

title: Standard Life to Pay About $645 Million for Asset Manager
description: LONDON  The investment arm of insurer Standard Life said on Wednesday that it had agreed to pay 390 million pounds, or about $645 million, for the asset management unit of Phoenix Group Holdings.

title: Alibaba to Make Movies With Crowdfunding Idea
description: Updated, 7:39 p.m. | Hey, brother, have you invested in Zhang Ziyi?

title: Russian Oligarch Was Depressed Before Death, Bodyguard Testifies
description: LONDON  A bodyguard working for Boris A. Berezovsky, a Russian oligarch and fierce adversary of the Kremlin who died a year ago under unexplained circumstances, said at an inquest on Wednesday that Mr. Berezovsky had been very low and depressed in the months leading up to his death following his defeat in a multibillion-dollar court case.

title: Crowdfunding Site CircleUp Raises $14 Million
description: CircleUp, a crowdfunding website, has allowed a number of fledgling companies to raise money over the last two years. Now, CircleUp has attracted some additional money of its own.

title: Britain Fines Santander for Failings in Its Advice to Clients
description: LONDON  The Financial Conduct Authority of Britain fined the Spanish lender Banco Santander 12.4 million pounds on Wednesday for serious failings in the way it offered financial advice to customers.

title: Pope Accepts Resignation of High-Spending German Bishop
description: BERLIN  Pope Francis on Wednesday accepted the resignation of Franz-Peter Tebartz-van Elst, the bishop of Limburg, whose extravagant spending on renovations for his personal residence angered his congregation and ran afoul of the pontiffs message of humility and modesty for the Roman Catholic Church.

title: Putting 2 Sons in Top Posts, Murdoch Guards His Dynasty
description: Two years ago, Rupert Murdoch was in retreat. His media empire was consumed by a phone-hacking scandal in Britain, threatening to engulf his son and heir-apparent, James. Family resentments boiled over into public view  he was distanced from both his son Lachlan and his daughter Elisabeth, and, according to friends, his marriage to Wendi Deng was showing signs of stress. Wall Street had grown impatient with his infatuation with newspapers, as had the leadership of the company he built, News Corporation.

title: Mt. Gox Seeks Advice From Japanese Police
description: TOKYO  Mt. Gox, the Bitcoin exchange based here that filed for bankruptcy protection last month, said on Wednesday that it had asked the Japanese police for advice on Bitcoins worth half a billion dollars that the company claims were stolen by hackers.

title: Activist Investor Calls for Darden to Consider a New C.E.O.
description: Updated, 11:55 a.m. | Darden Restaurants should consider finding a new chief executive and installing an independent chairman, one of the activist investors pressuring the parent company of Olive Garden said on Wednesday.

title: In Our Pages: March 27
description: 1914: Tango Helps the Silk Industry

title: A Screeching Sound From a Martian on the C Train
description: Dear Diary:

title: The Best of Photojournalism 2014
description: Correction appended.

title: Facebooks $2 Billion Deal for Oculus
description: In a surprise move, Facebook announced on Tuesday that it had reached a $2 billion agreement to buy Oculus VR, the maker of a virtual reality headset, in a bet that technology commonly associated with science fiction can help eventually turn social networking into an immersive 3-D experience, Nick Wingfield and Vindu Goel write in The New York Times. The announcement comes just over a month after Facebook made waves by revealing it would buy the mobile messaging app WhatsApp for up to $19 billion.

title: Democrats to Try Long-Shot Tactic for House Immigration Vote
description: WASHINGTON  House Democrats will carry out a long-shot legislative maneuver on Wednesday that is intended to bring a broad immigration bill to the House floor for a vote  or, at the very least, to increase the pressure on Republicans to move forward on some form of overhaul before the end of the year.

title: Start-Up Unveils Bitcoin Payments Product
description: While some restaurants, bars and coffee shops accept the virtual currency Bitcoin, it still exists largely in the province of speculators. One start-up, Circle Internet Financial, is trying to push Bitcoin into mainstream commerce.

title: Kerry in Jordan for Talks With Palestinian Leader
description: AMMAN, Jordan  In an effort to salvage the Middle East peace talks, Secretary of State John Kerry met here on Wednesday evening with Mahmoud Abbas, the president of the Palestinian Authority.

title: China Export Restrictions on Metals Violate Global Trade Law, Panel Finds
description: PARIS  China has broken international trade law by restricting the export of rare earth elements and other metals crucial to modern manufacturing, a World Trade Organization panel said Wednesday. That conclusion opens the possibility that Beijing will face trade sanctions from the United States, which initially brought the case, the European Union and Japan.

title: Graphic: Tech M.&A. Rises to 2000 Level
description: Millennial merger mania may be making a comeback.

title: Obama Pays Tribute at Graves of World War I Soldiers
description: WAREGEM, Belgium  President Obama paid homage Wednesday to the American soldiers who died at Flanders Fields in the battles of World War I, which began 100 years ago and took the lives of hundreds of thousands.

title: Most Anything Is Fair Game in Portugals Quest for Cash, Including the Mirs
description: LISBON  Across much of Continental Europe, the euro crisis did in just a few years what political parties in Britain and the United States had been hacking away at for decades: shrink the size of government. That is true perhaps no more so than here in Portugal. Since the onset of the crisis, the government has shed assets including Portugals airport management company, a highway operator and the national postal service.

title: Malaysia Says New Objects Found in Ocean
description: Hishamuddin Hussein, Malaysias defense minister, said that new satellite images were the most credible lead in the search for the missing Malaysia Airlines Flight 370.

title: Taxes Wont Kill Bitcoin, but Tax Reporting Might
description: Bitcoin is a digital representation of value, not a real currency, according to the latest pronouncement from the Internal Revenue Service.

title: Baritone in a Hurry to Reach Valhalla
description: The powerful German baritone Michael Volle, whose career in Europe has exploded in recent years, was singing  and goofing around a bit with colleagues  at a recent rehearsal at the Metropolitan Opera, preparing for his much-anticipated debut there in Strausss Arabella.

title: Another Preseason, With a New Perspective
description: The only real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.  Marcel Proust

title: Yup, Thats Doogie in Drag
description: If you would have told me in 1998 that Neil Patrick Harris was starring in Hedwig and the Angry Inch on Broadway, Im not sure which part of this news would be more surprising: That the actor from the sitcom Doogie Howser, M.D. was starring in the musical about a rock goddess who endured a botched sex change, or that this show that began at a small theater on Jane Street was on Broadway. Times have changed. For further proof, I recently saw a tweet referring to John Cameron Mitchell, the original Hedwig who also portrayed the role in the movie, simply as the e-book editor on Girls.

title: Citic Group Negotiating a Listing in Hong Kong
description: The Citic Group, one of Chinas biggest state-owned conglomerates, announced on Wednesday that it was negotiating what might amount to a backdoor listing in Hong Kong in a deal worth tens of billions of dollars.

title: App Maker Buckles on 1st Day of Trading
description: Candy Crush Saga has been a smash hit, attracting tens of millions of players and generating spectacular profits for its developer, King Digital Entertainment.

title: Google Revamps Election Portal to Encourage Indians to Vote
description: NEW DELHI  Google India introduced a revamped Google Elections hub on Wednesday in an attempt to encourage first-time voters and the growing number of Internet users in the country to engage more deeply with the political process.

title: Mudslide Rescue Caught on Video
description: Footage from March 22 from the mudslide in Oso, Wash., released Wednesday, shows a helicopter hovering over the ground as the crew rescues a young boy.

title: Nissan Recalls 990,000 Vehicles for Air Bag Malfunction
description: In the fifth huge recall for automakers this year, Nissan is recalling nearly a million vehicles, including 544,000 Altima sedans, because the front passenger-side air bag might not deploy in a crash, the company said  in a report to regulators published on Wednesday.

title: Jurors Convict Abu Ghaith, Bin Laden Son-in-Law, in Terror Case
description: More than a dozen years after the Sept. 11 attacks, a man who came to speak for Osama bin Laden in a series of impassioned videotaped messages that praised the attacks and promised more, was convicted by a federal jury on Wednesday of conspiring to kill Americans and of other terrorism charges.

title: For Those Who Can Afford It, Christies Is Selling Anxiety
description: Loic Gouzer, a 33-year-old contemporary-art expert at Christies, remembers the moment during Novembers big sale when Apocalypse Now, by the American painter Christopher Wool, sold for $26.4 million. It was one of the first times a work from the 1980s sold for more than $20 million, Mr. Gouzer recalled. It broke the ice. Suddenly, that painting became as important as a de Kooning. Were talking about the same price range.

title: Bruce Lee, Tupac Shakur and Kurt Cobain Walk Into a Bar
description: The European sense of humor is a little different, apparently. To advertise its Radler drink  a beer and lemon-lime soda combination (similar to what the British call a shandy)  the Dutch brewer Bavaria has made a TV ad that, taking off on the old Elvis isnt really dead rumors, proposes that Elvis and other pop idols are actually aging gracefully on a tropical island.

title: For Striving Students, a Connection to Money
description: Shortly after he enrolled at the Borough of Manhattan Community College in January, 2012, to study accounting, Jason aged out of the shelter for youths where he was staying. Jason, who asked that only his first name be used, had recently arrived in New York City from the South, where he said he had endured a childhood that shifted him between relatives who abused him and foster care, where he was molested.

title: Britain Gains Renminbi Trading Deal
description: The Bank of England and the Peoples Bank of China reached an agreement on Wednesday to allow the clearing and settlement of renminbi trades in London, the first such arrangement to be struck outside of Asia and another sign of the British governments determination to make London a leading Western hub for Chinese trading.

title: Eye Spy
description: The Berlin-based artist Britta Teckentrup has two new picture books, The Odd One Out: A Spotting Book and Busy Bunny Days: In the Town, on the Farm and at the Port. Both prompt children to look carefully at crowded illustrations. In the case of the first, the challenge is to identify animals that in some way differ from the rest. In the second, children answer questions about specific characters and their doings. Both books are surprisingly challenging, but their different artistic styles make one more successful than the other.

title: Milton Glaser Critiques Modern Beer Art
description: The 84-year-old graphic-design legend who created the Brooklyn Brewery identity weighs in on what craft breweries are doing right and wrong.

title: Facts & Figures: Clueless on the Obamacare Deadline
description: The Obama administration said yesterday that it would treat the March 31 deadline for enrolling in a health plan somewhat flexibly. Consumers who begin to apply by March 31 will have until mid-April to finish.

title: NYT Now: New Objects Found in Ocean
description: The Malaysian defense minister said new satellite images showed 122 objects, some up to 75 feet in length, floating southwest of Australia.

title: Minecraft Maker Wont Work With a Facebook-Owned Oculus VR
description: Some people, it seems, dont want to live in Facebooks virtual world.

title: Dare To Be Silly
description: The title above was one of the four rules for research I laid out many years ago; it seems worth recalling when reading Lars Sylls diatribe against IS-LM. I would respectfully submit that Syll doesnt get what economic modeling is for. And his piece offers an occasion to talk about what it actually is for.

title: Tinariwen Show Brooklyn What Cool Is All About
description: Some things are just too curious to pass up. So when you hear that a band of nomadic North African bluesmen is playing at a hipster bowling alley in Williamsburg, you go. Because why wouldnt you? So there we were Sunday night, under a disco ball and posters of Coney Island freaks, to see Tinariwen for the first of two nights at Brooklyn Bowl.

title: Why Movie Streaming Sites So Fail to Satisfy
description: A team of web designers recently released an astonishingly innovative app for streaming movies online. The program, Popcorn Time, worked a bit like Netflix, except it had one unusual, killer feature. It was full of movies youd want to watch.

title: Happenings | Twin Peaks Celebrates Its (Fictional) 25th Anniversary
description: Timelines are slippery, especially in the afterlife. But at some point after dark on March 26, 1989 (or perhaps in the dawn hours of March 27), a blonde teenager named Laura Palmer whispered to Special Agent Dale Cooper, Ill see you again in 25 years.Laura made this vow from beyond the grave, of course, and the unraveling of her murder was the basis for David Lynchs legendary Twin Peaks, which ran for two seasons in the early 90s (but was set in the late 80s) and spawned a movie, Fire Walk With Me; a host of companion books, faux diaries and audiobooks; two soundtrack albums and a generation of Peakies who can still tell you where they were the first time they saw Killer BOB climb over that couch.

title: Dealing With Online Reviews: You Cant Take This Personally
description: In early 2006, Michael Fertik was in Louisville, Ky., finishing a clerkship at the United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit, when he noticed that people and companies were increasingly being pulled online without their consent, through cyberbullying and theft of personal data. Were supposed to control our experience on the Internet, Mr. Fertik said he thought, but instead weve become the objects of the Internet.

title: Red-Brick Remnant of Manhattans Brewing Past Is Unearthed, Only to Vanish
description: Like a beer drinkers Brigadoon, a red-brick vestige of the enormous Jacob Ruppert & Company brewery in Yorkville emerged for a few hours this week before disappearing, this time forever.

title: How Can Bookstores Stay Alive?
After Facebooks $2 Billion Deal, Some Virtual Unreality in the Stock Market
description: Facebooks $2 billion deal for Oculus VR, a virtual reality headset maker, made a splash in Silicon Valley. It also appears to be sending ripples through obscure corners of the stock market.

title: What Would You Ask Michael Fertik About Your Online Reputation?
description: The Times has just published a conversation with Michael Fertik, who founded Reputation.com, a reputation management company that helps businesses and people play down their negative search results, protect their personal information, gather positive reviews for their businesses, and in general buff their online image. Since its launch in 2006, Reputation.com has raised $67 million in venture capital and attracted more than 1.6 million customers.

title: After Mountains Collapse, Uncertainty and Loss
description: ARLINGTON, Wash.  Pam Sanford was waiting for news about her brother, Joseph Miller, among the missing since Saturday in the Oso landslide, when a police detective called asking for his dental records.

title: The View From Here
description: The Bay Area has a lot of million-dollar views, but even the cheaper ones are pretty nice.

title: Manhattan Coach Is Denied South Florida Job After Rsum Check
description: Talks broke down between Manhattan Coach Steve Masiello and South Florida late Tuesday after South Florida officials discovered an inaccuracy on his rsum, which lists him as having graduated from the University of Kentucky in 2000.

title: Turkish Court Overturns the Governments Ban on Twitter
description: ISTANBUL  A court in Turkey ruled on Wednesday that the government could not ban Twitter, as it sought to do five days ago, and ordered the countrys telecommunications authority to restore access to the service. The action by the government had been met inside and outside the country with an uproar about respect for freedom of expression.

title: Supreme Court Rejects Transfer of Investigation of Uttar Pradesh Riots
description: NEW DELHI  The Supreme Court of India on Wednesday criticized the Uttar Pradesh government for not having done enough to stop the religious violence that erupted in the state nearly seven months ago, but said it saw no need to transfer the inquiry into the riots to an independent agency.

title: In Mississippi, Its G.O.P. vs. Tea Party
description: MOBILE, Ala.  Senator Thad Cochran smiled as placidly as the waters in Mobile Bay behind him, where the Jackson, a $350 million combat ship named in honor of his states capital, bobbed gently, awaiting its christening bottle of Champagne.

title: Suicides Mounting, Golden Gate Looks to Add a Safety Net
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Tourists who lean against the wind as they cross the Golden Gate Bridge may miss the slow-moving woman without a purse or the solo man without a camera or running shoes.

title: A Look at Global Travel Trends
description: During a prolonged and grinding recession, the travel industry was one of the few sectors to bounce back early and help buoy the global economy. Last year, the industry accounted for 9.5 percent of the global economy (nearly $7 trillion) and employed 266 million people  about 9 percent of the global work force.

title: From Airlines to Hotels, a Quest to Help You Sleep
description: At Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts, new beds allow guests to play Goldilocks and choose one of three mattress toppers, from soft to firm, that feels just right.

title: Scene City: Gay Marriage in Lights
description: Broadway Veterans Attend Opening of Terrence McNallys Mothers and Sons.

title: Restaurant Report: Senator Restaurant in Toronto
description: A red neon sign warms the facade of the Senator Restaurant, Torontos oldest restaurant, just as it did in the days when streetwear meant fedoras and overcoats. Inside, with its vinyl booths, shiny wood counter and huge mahogany mirror, it looks much the same as when it opened in 1929. And until recently, so did its menu. Standards like liver and onions, house-made meatloaf and a B.L.T. kept regulars and tourists happily, if predictably, fed.

title: Hotel Review: Laura Ashleys The Manor Hotel in Elstree, England
description: Rates

title: Shigeru Ban, Paper Master
description: Shigeru Ban, who was awarded the Pritzker Prize Monday, is best known for his temporary shelters made from paper. They have housed refugees in Rwanda and earthquake victims in Kobe. It may seem odd to construct emergency housing from something so fragile, but as Ban told Michael Kimmelman in a 2007 magazine profile, paper can be a strangely durable material:

title: What You Get for ...$1,000,000
description: FREDERICKSBURG, TEX.

title: Student Crossword | Stargazing
description: Test your knowledge of astronomy by playing our crossword (PDF). You can find the answers here.

title: Kansas Freshman Center Could Be Top N.B.A. Pick if He Jumps
