description: Joel Embiid expected to play this week. All Kansas had to do was beat Stanford on Sunday and advance in the N.C.A.A. tournament, and Embiid, their gifted freshman center who had been out since early March with a stress fracture in his back, would have returned for the Round of 16.

title: Times Minute | Sale of Miro Paintings Questioned
description: In the Video

title: Obama and E.U. Hold News Conference
description: President Obama and Herman Van Rompuy, the president of the European Council, spoke at a summit meeting in Brussels.

title: Times Minute | Mir Sale Questioned
description: Also on the Minute, a $45 million viola and drink coasters as home fashion accessories.

title: Today in Small Business: Personalized Shopping
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Swiss Financial Regulator Names Former UBS Officer as Chief Executive
description: The Swiss Financial Market Supervisory Authority said on Wednesday that Mark Branson, a former UBS executive who is serving as the authoritys interim chief executive, had been appointed to fill the top post.

title: Madonna Signs to Direct Her Third Movie
description: Having directed two films that proved only modestly successful, Madonna is hoping the third time is the charm: she has signed on to direct Ad: A Love Story, based on Rebecca Walkers debut novel, Deadline reported. The novel touches on several themes that Madonna has been attracted to in the past, including sexuality, religion and race.

title: With Videos, McConnell Finds More Bloopers Than Hits
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Mitch McConnells re-election team is getting very good at making campaign videos that go viral  but for all the wrong reasons.

title: New Giant John Jerry Unlikely to Be Barred for Bullying, Coughlin Says
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  One of the players named in the 144-page report commissioned by the N.F.L. to explore accusations of widespread bullying on the Miami Dolphins is unlikely to be suspended, according to his new boss, Giants Coach Tom Coughlin.

title: Congress Party Releases Manifesto for Elections 2014
description: NEW DELHI  The Indian National Congress party on Wednesday released an election manifesto detailing its achievements in central government over the past ten years as well as its future agenda should it be re-elected in parliamentary elections next month.

title: Data as Slogan, Data as Substance
description: Noah Smith has the definitive piece on whats wrong, so far, with the new FiveThirtyEight. For all the big talk about data-driven analysis,what it actually delivers is sloppy and casual opining with a bit of data used, as the old saying goes, the way a drunkard uses a lamppost  for support, not illumination. Smith:

title: Classical Playlist: Anna Netrebko, Handel, Schoenberg and More
description: ANNA NETREBKO: Sola, perduta, abbandonata from Puccinis Manon LescautLive from Rome Opera, with the conductor Riccardo Muti(Youtube.com)After seeing the soprano Anna Netrebkos role debut as Manon Lescaut at the Rome Opera recently, I found it a pleasure to revisit her climactic aria in this pirated footage on YouTube from one of the performances. Its passionate singing, confident and full of heart, with a dreamy despondency that is nevertheless always clear. The conductor Riccardo Muti has elicited wonderful things from her. (Zachary Woolfe)

title: Facebooks Alternate Financial Reality
description: Mark Zuckerberg is liking a lot of deals.

title: A Call for Haiku About New York City
description: Updated, April 5 | The Haiku Challenge is closed to future submissions. The final selection of haiku appeared here.

title: In Greenland, a Safari-Style Camp
description: With few tourist facilities and an ice cap that takes up about 80 percent of its land mass, Greenland is not an easy place to visit. But Natural Habitat Adventures is building a new safari-style camp on Greenlands east coast, offering a comfortable way to experience the islands remote glaciers, icebergs and mountains.

title: Houston Fire Rescue Caught on Video
description: Bystanders videotaped a construction worker in Houston being rescued from a balcony of a burning building moments before a section of the top floor collapsed.

title: Cocktail Culture | New Spirits with Split Personalities
description: As distilleries get creative in their pursuit of the next best product, a growing cross-pollination of techniques and flavor profiles continues to breed unique, hybrid-like spirits. Here, an array of liquors that may give the impression that your bartender mixed up your order.

title: Taxpayer Subsidies and Too-Big-to-Fail Banks
description: There is less than meets the eye in the too-big-to-fail study released on Tuesday by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

title: Delaware Art Museum Will Sell Works to Pay Off Debt
description: Reeling from bond debt after an expansion and renovation in 2005, the Delaware Art Museum announced Wednesday that it had decided with heavy hearts, but clear minds to sell up to four works from its collection, to right its finances and save the museum from closing.

title: Janine Nabers Wins Yale Drama Series Prize
description: Janine Nabers has won the 2014 Yale Drama Series competition for Serial Black Face, her play about the relationship between a single black mother and her daughter in Atlanta in 1979, at the start of a two-year spree in which more then 20 black children were murdered in the city. The award includes a reading at the Lincoln Center Theaters Claire Tow Theater, publication by Yale University Press and a $10,000 cash prize.

title: Crown Heights, Brooklyn: A Place of Her Own
description: As a native Manhattanite, Jackie Goldstein knew she was lucky when it came to housing.

title: Brazilian Telecommunications Deal Clears Hurdle
description: SAO PAULO  Brazilian securities regulators have ruled that the telecommunications company Oi can proceed with its shareholder meeting scheduled for Thursday in Rio de Janeiro and vote on a capital increase that it says is needed ahead of a planned merger with Portugal Telecom.

title: Figaro Serves a New Master
description: PRINCETON, N.J.  In a theater world that favors aggressive directorial interventions that place Othello on a modern military base and Bellinis La Sonnambula in a SoHo rehearsal room, Stephen Wadsworth has long called a different tune.

title: Image of the Day: March 26
Search for Lost Jet Is Complicated by Geopolitics and Rivalries
description: BEIJING  The frantic hunt for Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 has been, in one way, a nearly miraculous display of international collaboration: 26 nations, many of them rivals, have opened up their territorial waters and airspace or have contributed closely held technology and surveillance data to a search that has riveted the world.

title: Barclays Works Out Deals With A.C.C. and Atlantic 10
description: The Atlantic Coast Conferences decision to move its mens basketball tournament to Barclays Center in Brooklyn in 2017 and 2018, which was widely reported two weeks ago, was made official Wednesday.

title: Outkast and Eminem Top Lollapalooza Festival Lineup
description: Fans of the Lollapalooza Festival in Chicagos Grant Park apparently have enough faith in the festivals track record  and, perhaps, in rumors and leaks about the lineup, which have proven to be extremely accurate  that by the time the festival announced its lineup on Wednesday, both single tickets and three-day passes were just about sold out, with only travel packages and premium passes remaining by Wednesday afternoon. The festival runs Aug. 1 to Aug. 3.

title: Rangers Kreider Will Miss at Least 5 Games
description: Rangers Coach Alain Vigneault said Chris Kreider, the top-line left winger, would not accompany the team on its four-game western trip because of a hand injury.

title: Discovery of Planetoid Hints at Bigger Cousin in Shadows
description: Astronomers have discovered a second icy world orbiting in a slice of the solar system where, according to their best understanding, there should have been none.

title: Citi Bike System Successful, but Wobbly From the Start
description: The hard truth lurked behind the gates of the Brooklyn Navy Yard, where employees of Citi Bike were tasked with testing the program last spring after nearly a year of delays.

title: Facing a War Crimes Inquiry, Sri Lanka Continues to Vex the U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS  What to do with Sri Lanka? The island nation, triumphant after nearly three decades of war against ethnic separatists, has vexed the United Nations.

title: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 78
description: The 2014 World Cup begins on June 12, when Brazil plays Croatia in the opening match. Reporters and editors for The Times will count down to the start of the tournament each day with a short capsule of news and interesting tidbits.

title: Happy and Frozen Hold Atop the Charts; YG Opens at No. 2
description: On the music charts this week, the unstoppable Frozen soundtrack fends off a wave of new albums, and Pharrell Williamss Happy continues its reign as the No. 1 single.

title: Sweeping Ruling on Domestic Violence
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Wednesday issued a broad interpretation of a federal law that makes it a crime for people convicted of domestic violence to possess guns.

title: Wheelies: The Fast and Unfortunate Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Racist Satire of Obamas Hits a Nerve in Belgium
description: PARIS  The satirical images of President Obama and his wife, Michelle, digitally altered to look like apes, have vanished from the website of a Belgian newspaper, which published them days before the presidents visit to Brussels this week.

title: Minnesota Orchestra Conductor Returns ... For Now
description: MINNEAPOLIS  To the last, the Minnesota Orchestra seems bent on confounding expectations.

title: Moscows Garage Art Center to Transform Into Museum
description: The Garage Center for Contemporary Culture, the nonprofit art center opened in Moscow in 2008 by the collector Dasha Zhukova, has decided to transform itself into a museum, a change that will initially involve only its name but that the institution hopes will signal its intention to become a permanent part of Russias rapidly expanding art world.

title: Felicity Jones, Star of the Dark Romantic Drama Breathe In
description: The beguiling British actress Felicity Jones, who still looks like she belongs on the Oxford campus she once roamed as an English major, recently turned 30. She claims shes not bummed out by it. I feel like you burn through your 20s, and then suddenly, particularly when you turn 30, your priorities change, she says. There is so much pressure in your 20s  you dont know who you are, youre trying all these things out, and youre running around probably trying to be someone youre not.

title: Abu Ghaiths Lawyer on Conviction
description: Stanley L. Cohen, a lawyer for Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, Osama bin Ladens son-in-law, spoke after his client was found guilty in a terrorism trial in a federal courthouse in Manhattan.

title: In Hindsight, Is Stay-at-Home Parenting Something Youd Recommend?
description: Last week, when we asked readers for advice for people returning to work after a family-related career break, one reader posted a question that jumped out at me:

title: From France to Midtown, a Rift Rocks La Grenouille
description: For most of the last four decades, Charles Masson Jr. has suavely presided over the old-school French restaurant La Grenouille, training the staff, designing the menus and even arranging the flowers as it became the last of Midtowns legendary Gallic clubhouses for the well-off and well-known  the likes of La Caravelle, Lutce and La Cte Basque.

title: House Oversight Leader Accuses I.R.S. Commissioner of Stonewalling Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON  The chairman of the House Oversight Committee on Wednesday accused the head of the Internal Revenue Service of stonewalling the panels investigation into the I.R.S.s treatment of conservative groups.

title: General Who Led Takeover of Egypt to Run for President
description: CAIRO  Abdul-Fattah el-Sisi, the defense minister and military officerwho led last summers takeoverof the elected government in Egypt, formally announced on Wednesday that he was resigning from the army and running for president as he moved to consolidate his power.

title: Poetry Profiles: Alice James Books
description: The latest in a series of occasional profiles of poetry publishers. These questions were answered by Carey Salerno, executive director of Alice James Books.

title: Grading the Curve in Consumer Electronics
description: SUBTLE improvements, overstated innovations and marketing sleights of hand come fast and furious from the makers of consumer electronics. From 3-D TV to every possible permutation of wearable device to Bluetooth toothbrushes, its sometimes hard to keep track of what is innovative and what is just money-grubbing.

title: Curved Screens: Worth It?
description: Molly Wood decides whether curved screens on new smartphones and TVs are worth the hype  and the money.

title: The Gun Report: March 26, 2014
description: More women are carrying concealed weapons than ever before. A quarter of the one million permits issued in Florida are held by women, many of whom are flooding concealed permit classes.

title: The Wrong Way to Protect Elephants
description: THE year was 1862. Abraham Lincoln was in the White House. Taps was first sounded as a lights-out bugle call. And Steinway & Sons was building its first upright pianos in New York.

title: College Players Granted Right to Form Union
description: CHICAGO  A regional director of the National Labor Relations Board ruled Wednesday that a group of Northwestern football players were employees of the university and have the right to form a union and bargain collectively.

title: Heavenly Voices Proclaim a Faith That Swings
description: Duke Ellington, a Christian, once said that hed be afraid to sit in a house with people who dont believe, adding that hed be afraid that the house would fall down. But his Sacred Concerts  three large-scale works he wrote between 1965 and 1973  were nondenominational, fusing elements of jazz, classical, blues, gospel and dance.

title: House Hunting in ... London
description: A THREE-BEDROOM APARTMENT IN A ST. JOHNS WOOD TOWNHOUSE

title: Citigroup Fails Federal Reserves Stress Test for 2nd Time in 3 Years
description: The Federal Reserve dealt an embarrassing blow to Citigroup on Wednesday, attacking the banks financial projections for its sprawling operations and denying the banks plan to increase dividends and repurchase stock.

title: T.S.A. Calls for Armed Guards at Airport Checkpoints
description: WASHINGTON  The Transportation Security Administration is recommending that armed personnel be present at airport checkpoints during peak hours of passenger traffic, though airports would be able to tailor the security to their specific needs, according to a report released on Wednesday.

title: Europe Begins to Rethink Cuts to Military Spending
description: LONDON  President Obama spent Wednesday in Brussels talking up the importance of the security relationship between Europe and the United States, but it is considered unlikely that Russias seizure of Crimea will prompt increased European military spending at a time of economic anemia and budget cuts.

title: With Spring Fashion, Its All About Wearing Your Slogan on Your Sleeve
description: If you would text it, wear it. With ever-more-micro communiqus being sent by text, Snapchat and WhatsApp, no wonder words and pithy turns of phrase are breaking through the smartphone screen and landing in the wardrobe. With the latest batch of slogan sweaters and tees, next to nothing is left unsaid. And based on the recent fashion shows, there is more to come. Phillip Lim accessorized his fall collection with leather paper-bag totes embossed with Amaze and Cash. Jeremy Scott, at his Moschino debut, sent out a fur coat that read Fur Real on the back. Off the runway, the glamour-puss editor Giovanna Battaglia wore an Im a Mess sweater from Mr. Scotts namesake collection. Sounds like a weekend pre-brunch message to us.

title: Official Gets Emotional About Landslide
description: John Pennington, the Snohomish County emergency management director, teared up as he talked about the deadly landslide in the region.

title: Antarctica, by Boot and by Board
description: Before embarking on an expedition, Jeremy Jones and Xavier de Le Rue tend to have a clear mission. For their trip to Antarctica, however, they simply aimed to explore new terrain.

title: Video: Antarctica, by Boot and by Board
description: Throughout the past six years, Jeremy Jones has collaborated with Teton Gravity Research to create a trilogy of films: Deeper, Further and now Higher. These films document his efforts to explore and snowboard mountains under his own power. In this companion piece to its Higher Unplugged series, Teton Gravity Research provides a glimpse into Deeper.

title: More Dreaded Chores Outsourced to Robots (They Do Windows)
description: THE dream: a robot servant to pick up around the house, do laundry, cook dinner and perhaps even go on errands. The reality: cadres of little devices, buzzing like bees as they clean dirt and debris from every imaginable two-dimensional surface.

title: Pontiff and President Seek Common Cause Amid Prickly Issues
description: VATICAN CITY  They are an unlikely pair with seemingly much in common: an Argentine pope and an American president who each burst onto the global scene as a history-making change agent, each promising to promote a new post-partisan ethos, each having made the cover of Rolling Stone.

title: Newly Released Books
description: This month, three books  two heavily autobiographical  tell the stories of thoughtful, sometimes troubled women; a short-story writer explores a corner of Chicago; a literary cohort goes in search of an enigmatic author; and a Buick brings two people together.

title: Above It All Until Her World Turns Upside Down
description: As You Should Have Known unfolds, its heroine keeps discovering secret after gob-smacking secret. This is quite the comeuppance for the ordinarily smug, superior Grace Reinhart Sachs, who considers herself so much smarter than other people that she has even written a scoldy book that bestows her wisdom on them.

title: Obama Gives Speech in Brussels
description: At the Palais des Beaux-Arts in Brussels, the president appealed to Europeans to stand behind the ideals of freedom and human dignity, and deplored Russias brute force in Ukraine.

title: Shouldnt Every Vote Count?
description: Americans elect their president and vice president using a bizarre and antiquated contraption called the Electoral College.Created two centuries ago, this system gives each state the same number of votes as it has senators and representatives. That formula is regressive and, in effect, robs many people of their ability to have a say in who runs the country.The College warpsthe presidential race so badly that is possible for a candidate to get the most votes and still lose the election. (As happened in 2000.)

title: Carter Says He Would Think About Pardoning Snowden
description: WASHINGTON  Former President Jimmy Carter, on a swing through the nations capital to promote a new book, said Wednesday that he would consider a pardon for Edward J. Snowden, the former contractor who leaked classified information about the National Security Agency. But Mr. Carter said that he was not certain he would grant one.

title: While in Albany, Lawmakers Squeeze Their Stipends
description: GLENMONT, N.Y.  A Duck Dynasty marathon provided the soundtrack at Pub 23, a dimly lit tavern off the lobby of the Comfort Inn. A group of electricians doing highway roadwork had just ordered a round of whiskey shots when State Senator Rubn Daz Sr., clad in a black cowboy hat, sidled up to the bar.

title: A Bit of Beethoven in a Mix of Modern
description: Next to Carnegie Hall, perhaps, there might be no finer public space in which to hear a piano recital in New York than Spectrum. A modest Ludlow Street loft that seats fewer than 50 people on sofas and cozy armchairs, Spectrum has recently emerged as a hotbed of new-music activity, showcasing local artists and distinguished visitors. For the pianophile, it provides an uncommon chance to hear a fastidiously maintained Steinway grand in a room selected and designed to suit it.

title: U.S. in Odd Spot in Case on Protester Rights
description: WASHINGTON  A government lawyer who seemed poised to win his case by a lopsided margin at a Supreme Court argument on Wednesday found himself in an odd position. He was repeatedly attacked for making halfhearted arguments when bolder ones were available.

title: Fissures in Chinas Ethnic Policy
description: The Chinese man spying on the daughter of a prominent political prisoner at the United Nations in Geneva last week probably didnt expect to be expelled from the international body.

title: Danish Zoo, Reviled in the Death of a Giraffe, Kills 4 Lions
description: Denmark, the land of enchanting fairy tales and liberal social values, is becoming known as the land of dead zoo animals.

title: Young Designers Reimagine Jewelry
description: Its not just about Tiffany, Cartier or Harry Winston anymore. Some of the most covetable baubles these days are made by a new generation of jewelry designers who are shaking up the old craft.

title: Excerpt: Surviving Jack
description: Christopher Meloni is a gruff father in this new Fox sitcom.

title: Break a Leg, but Spare Those Eggs
description: Before the start of Knee Deep, a contemporary circus show now playing at the New Victory Theater, several cartons of eggs wait on the stage. Since Knee Deep is by Casus, an Australian troupe of acrobats, those eggs might be in trouble. And, in fact, when the first acrobat (Emma Serjeant) enters, the first thing she does is walk on them. Not a one gets broken.

title: One Free Spirit Amid the Fog and the Frenzy
description: The moment the curtain rises on Andonis Foniadakiss Glory, you have some idea of the melodrama youre in for: The stage is a swirl of fog.

title: Isabel Toledo and Lane Bryant See a Plus in Collaboration
description: New York Fashion Week has come and gone, but on a mild evening last week, editors from Vogue, Glamour and People StyleWatch were sitting in the front row for another fashion show. Lane Bryant, the plus-size retailer, was presenting a collection designed by Isabel Toledo, a designer probably best known for the lemon-grass wool lace dress and matching coat Michelle Obama wore on the cold morning of the 2009 inauguration. As waiters circulated with trays of Champagne, the editors gathered at the Seagram Building were conspicuously curious about the show.

title: Big Cash and a Few Cheap Thrills
description: How far would you go for money? For the characters in the new film Cheap Thrills (opening Friday in New York), the answer is: much further than they may have dreamed. The movie, directed by E.L. Katz, follows a family man (Pat Healy) who is strapped for cash and an old friend (Ethan Embry) he encounters in a bar. They meet a couple who offers them easy money to complete a series of dares, slowly raising the payoff and the challenge. How bad does it get? Lets just say the characters risk life and limb for a chance at big money. Its a theme oft explored at the movies: the potential for riches at the risk of moral bankruptcy or even death.

title: Richard Phillips on New York City, Johan Lindeberg and the Worlds Best Chocolate
description: Richard Phillips has reached the upper echelons of the art world, in part, by trawling lowbrow culture. His Most Wanted series of recent videos and paintings of TMZ favorites such as Lindsay Lohan, the Brazilian supermodel Adriana Lima and the self-styled intellectual porn star Sasha Grey speak fluently to the visual aesthetics of desire. Next month, he will donate art and curate music for a benefit auction of work by Damien Hirst, JR and Julian Schnabel (among others) at Dallas Contemporary, benefiting MTVs Staying Alive Foundation, which supports research to find a cure for H.I.V. and AIDS. He took a break from his work in the studio to put together a well-considered (and very New York) list of his own favorite things.

title: On Opening Night, Relishing a Label Debate
description: What do you call the same-sex significant other in your life? Husband or wife? Lover? Partner? The actor Victor Garber said it still leads to awkwardness.

title: Iraq and Crimea
description: In his speech in Brussels today, President Obama struck a principled and forceful stand against Russian machinations in Crimea and Ukraine. He spoke eloquently about the history of Europe and European independence movements, and about the role of what we used to call the West in opposing Soviet dictatorship, domination and expansion.

title: Police Scandals Reach Crisis Stage for Irish Government
description: DUBLIN  A series of scandals embroiling Irelands police force in recent months has developed into a full-blown political and legal crisis for the Irish government.

title: A Charleston Hotel With an Interest in Building
description: When Belmond Charleston Place invites its guests to get plastered, theyre not talking about hitting the bar.

title: Titles Decided at Spring North American Championships
description: DALLAS  The three-day Norman Kay Platinum Pairs was the third national title decided at the Spring North American Championships here. Richard Coren of Delray Beach, Fla., and Bobby Levin of Henderson, Nev., had two strong sessions on the last day, Sunday, to win by nearly three boards from Thomas Bessis and Cedric Lorenzini of France. Third were Kent Mignocchi and Joel Wooldridge of New York City.

title: Bank of America to Pay $6.3 Billion to Settle Mortgage Securities Suit
description: Updated, 7:51 p.m. | Bank of America is paying $6.3 billion to settle a lawsuit arising out of troubled mortgage-backed securities it cobbled together and sold to Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac in the run-up to the financial crisis.

title: Fashion in Harlem: A Place of Style and Confidence
description: On a recent afternoon, in the neighborhood where Eleanora Fagan became Billie Holiday and where Dapper Dans boutique brought designer logos to the streets, Tru Osborne, a longtime Harlem resident, was on his way home from work. Clad in bright layers and even brighter blue Patrick Ewing sneakers easily visible from two blocks away, Mr. Osborne said he was regularly inspired by the legacy of the Harlem Renaissance and by style icons like ASAP Rocky and Pharrell Williams.

title: Mammy Revealed, and Not Just Her Red Petticoat
description: Mammy, the faithful slave in Gone With the Wind, may finally get her due  and a proper name.

title: Of Sojourns Past and Future
description: WHETHER OR NOT there are second acts in American lives, it appears there are second acts in American magazines. Holiday, the great midcentury travel magazine, is set to begin publishing once again. Its first home: Philadelphia. Its new home: Paris, where it debuts next week with an installation at the megastore Colette.

title: When We Were Young, and Dads Were Men
description: There is a search on for the non-nurturing father.

title: Two Women of Style
description: Michelle Obama has spent the last week in China, where she has taken her daughters and her mother on a cultural tour, with time saved for a few impassioned addresses on freedom of speech and minority rights.

title: Huffington Post Editor Named Director of U.S.C.s Journalism School
description: LOS ANGELES  Willow Bay, a Huffington Post editor and veteran TV news anchor, was named director of the University of Southern Californias journalism school on Wednesday.

title: Planet Albany
description: The hotel lifestyle of Assemblyman Harvey Weisenberg, who, like many state legislators, commutes weekly to Albany.

title: Etsy, the Makeup Counterculture
description: When Tara Graff was searching for makeup that would not irritate her sensitive skin, she did not head to Sephora, Macys or the cosmetics counter at Bloomingdales. Instead, she turned to Etsy.com.

title: Prosecutors Hear Evidence in Songs
description: Across the country, police and prosecutors are introducing defendants rap lyrics as evidence against them in criminal proceedings. A selection of cases.

title: More Movers to Play With Force
description: David Dorfman Dance finished this years Harkness Dance Festival at the 92nd Street Y by performing the same two works that Mr. Dorfman brought to the festival a decade ago. Or almost the same. This time, there were different dancers, and more of them, and a lot more talking.

title: Pictures of the Day: Belgium and More
description: Photos from Belgium, Australia, Kosovo and Egypt.

title: Killing of Afghan Journalist and Family Members Stuns Media Peers
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Sardar Ahmad, a warmly admired stalwart of the Afghan journalistic community here, loved to post bits of wisdom from his young daughter, Nelofar, on Facebook.

title: Seeking an Image, but First, a Dress
description: Most New Yorkers dream of having a little more closet space. If they are dreaming in Technicolor, they might envision the Albright Fashion Library, a 7,000-square-foot space in NoHo that houses some 1,500 gowns among more than 23,000 pieces and has supplied television series like The Carrie Diaries, Sex and the City and Gossip Girl and films such as The Bling Ring and The Devil Wears Prada with clothes, accessories and jewelry.

title: A Tortured Policy Toward Russia
description: THE United States has once again twisted itself into a rhetorical pretzel. As when it threatened military action against Syria if a red line was crossed, the Obama administrations rhetoric about Russia and Ukraine goes far beyond what it will be willing and able to enforce.

title: Crimea and Punishment
description: The president is trying to walk a tightrope  thin as a thread and dangling over danger  on the Russian invasion and annexation of Crimea.

title: Sexual Abuse of Girls
description: To the Editor:

title: In a Book Group? Share Your Story
An E.P.A. Rule on Water
description: To the Editor:

title: In Need of a Jewish Divorce
description: To the Editor:

title: Children and E-Cigarettes
description: To the Editor:

title: Arresting the Homeless
description: To the Editor:

title: Dressed for Spring, in Denial of Winter
description: A sampling of spring looks on the streets of Manhattan.

title: The Accidental Wanderer
description: James McMullan has painted 80 posters for Lincoln Center Theater, won a New York Times best illustrated book award for I Stink! written by his wife, Kate McMullan, and has just written and illustrated a memoir, Leaving China: An Artist Paints His World War II Childhood (Algonquin, $19.95). Born in 1934 in Tsingtao (now Qingdao), China, he was 3 when his family moved to the coastal city of Cheefoo (now Yantai). In 1941, three years after the Japanese invaded Cheefoo, Mr. McMullan and his mother took off for San Francisco, while his father joined the British Army.

title: Pakistanis Said to Meet With Taliban to Lay Groundwork for More Talks
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  A Pakistani government delegation met face-to-face on Wednesday with representatives of the Pakistani Taliban for the first time since efforts to open talks were derailed in February, officials said.

title: Making It Fun to Turn on the Lamp
description: Fab.coms new Tri Light is more flexible and fanciful than first impressions suggest. You can turn it on simply by lifting the LED rod  a little light magic. The mechanism gives the product character and hopefully a bit of joy for the user, said its designer, Aaron Leahy, 24, of Perth, Australia.

title: Decanters to Pop Your Cork Over
description: Laura Maniec hardly looks old enough to drink legally, let alone hold forth on how to decant wine. Yet she is 34, a master sommelier and co-founder of Corkbuzz Wine Studio, a restaurant in the West Village (a second one will open in Chelsea Market in June) that also offers wine classes.

title: A Wealth of Ideas
description: Late last year, at a party at the Crosby Street Hotel in SoHo to celebrate a documentary about childhood obesity called Fed Up, the tech and night-life mogul Michael Walrath, one of the films producers, spoke briefly to the 60 or so people gathered in the hotels Prince Room.

title: One Singular Sensation
description: For years, Sudhir Gupta and Cynthia Wong and their two cats all lived together in Mr. Guptas 550-square-foot, one-bedroom Gramercy Park apartment. And they couldnt help coveting the apartment next door, a light-filled space with generous exposures on two sides and an owner who spent most of his time somewhere else.

title: The Ring Cycle: Coasters Star Turn
description: Brian Dubois is a Detroit-area designer whose surname means of the wood, and it fits. At the Architectural Digest Home Show in New York last weekend, he showed tables of solid walnut with cork embedded in the tops.

title: An American Makeover for a Classic Chair
description: To celebrate the 100th birthday of Hans Wegner, a founding father of Danish Modern who died in 2007, Carl Hansen, the Danish furniture company that produces much of his work, teamed up with the American textile manufacturer Maharam to create a fresh interpretation of a handful of classics.

title: Dashes of Sweetness at Kartell
description: The luxurious plastic for which the Italian furniture company Kartell is famous has assumed a new purpose  and an old one. Next month the company will introduce tableware by the designers Patricia Urquiola, Jean-Marie Massaud and Philippe Starck and the Italian chefs Davide Oldani, Carlo Cracco and Andrea Barton.

title: Sales at DwellStudio, Iittala, Viyet and Evanson
description: DwellStudio is discounting its Finn dresser by 30 percent, through March 31, or while supplies last (originally $2,850, it is now about $1,995); 877-993-9355, dwellstudio.com.

title: If the Paper Could Talk About Itself
description: For Viktor & Rolfs 2013 fall and winter show in Paris, Studio Job created a striking backdrop of withered grayish flowers  a William Morris canvas gone dark. That design and several other graphics created by the Dutch/Belgian design team of Job Smeets and Nynke Tynagel over the years, are being reimagined as wallpaper by the firm NLXL.

title: Law Firms Are Pressed on Security for Data
description: A growing number of big corporate clients are demanding that their law firms take more steps to guard against online intrusions that could compromise sensitive information as global concerns about hacker threats mount.

title: Legal Debate on Using Boastful Rap Lyrics as a Smoking Gun
description: NEWPORT NEWS, Va.  The case had gone cold.

title: Shopping Openings and Events for the Week of March 26
description: Openings and Events

title: Bringing 3-D Power to the People
description: The first thing Duann Scott does when he arrives at the Shapeways factory in Long Island City, Queens, is check the bins. They are yellow and stacked in an all-white room that resembles the interior of a spaceship, and they contain the latest prints to come out of the machines, which can really stack up.

title: Reshaping Design With 3-D Printing
description: Industrial 3-D printing facilities, like Shapeways in Long Island City, are revolutionizing product design and manufacture.

title: Mayor Quits in Charlotte After Arrest Over Bribes
description: The mayor of Charlotte, N.C., resigned on Wednesday after he was arrested on public corruption charges, as federal law enforcement officials alleged that he accepted a trip to Las Vegas, use of a luxury apartment and more than $48,000 in cash in exchange for helping smooth out municipal obstacles for undercover agents posing as investors.

title: Infections at Hospitals Are Falling, C.D.C. Says
description: The number of infections Americans acquire during hospital stays every year has declined substantially over the last decade, federal health officials said in a report on Wednesday, as hospitals have worked to improve their practices and nursing homes role in medical care has grown.

title: Pitfalls of Reverse Mortgages May Pass to Borrowers Heirs
description: The only solace for Isabel Santos as she spends her evenings huddled over stacks of yellowed foreclosure notices is that her parents are not alive to watch their ranch-style house in Pleasant Hill, Calif., slipping away.

title: The Certainty of Donald Rumsfeld (Part 2)
description: Read Part 1; Part 3; Part 4.

title: F.D.A. Unveils Deal to Limit Antibiotic Use in Animal Feed
description: The Food and Drug Administration said on Wednesday that nearly all drug companies that make antibiotics for use in animal feed had agreed to go along with its proposal to phase out the use of the drugs to make animals grow faster. The agency said that 25 of the 26 companies that make the drugs for animal feed said they would remove the words growth-promotion from their labels, effectively making it illegal for farmers and ranchers to use the drugs for that purpose. Some public health experts are skeptical that much will change, saying the industry will use the drugs in the same way but contend that the purpose is to prevent disease.

title: Court Weighs Delay of Strict Limits to Drug-Induced Abortions in Arizona
description: TUCSON  A federal judge here heard arguments on Wednesday over a law set to go into effect next Tuesday that would impose the strictest rules in the country over the use of medication to induce abortions during the early stages of pregnancy, forbidding the drugs to be used after the first seven weeks.

title: A TV App From Disney Lets Travelers Browse Its Vacation Offerings
description: A SMART TV app being introduced by Walt Disney Parks and Resorts on Thursday will let potential travelers use their remote controls to research vacations at theme parks and hotels and on cruise ships and packaged tours.

title: Target Had Chance to Stop Breach, Senators Say
description: WASHINGTON  Two Democratic senators on Wednesday criticized Targets management for not stopping a huge data breach of its systems, citing several missed opportunities to thwart the attack and protect customer data.

title: Oklahoma Told It Cant Shield Suppliers of Execution Drugs
description: An Oklahoma judge ruled on Wednesday that the state could not keep secret the identities of the suppliers of lethal-injection drugs, raising doubts about the executions of two prisoners next month and fueling a growing legal battle in several states over secrecy in methods of execution.

title: Proposed Housing Bill Would Create a Co-op of Mortgage Lenders
description: Yet another proposal for winding down Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac and overhauling the nations housing finance system will be put before Congress on Thursday, this one by Representative Maxine Waters of California, the ranking Democratic member of the Financial Services Committee.

title: Amnesty International Study Finds Executions Rose in 2013
description: Despite a long-term decline in the number of countries practicing capital punishment, publicly disclosed executions jumped nearly 15 percent in 2013 compared with a year earlier, largely because of virtual killing sprees carried out by the authorities in Iran and Iraq, Amnesty International said in its annual report on death-penalty trends.

title: Guinea: Government Bans Bat Soup to Halt Ebola Outbreak
description: To help quell its first Ebola outbreak, the West African nation of Guinea has banned bat soup. Bats are believed to be the natural reservoirs of the filovirus that causes Ebola, and fruit bats are a popular food in West Africa, usually cooked in a peppery soup or smoked over a fire. While boiled bat meat is presumably safe, smoked meat could be dangerous, and butchering bats for the table certainly is. The current outbreak in Guinea has killed 63 people, but the appearance of new cases has slowed significantly, the countrys health ministry said. Most outbreaks are thought to start when jungle hunters eat the flesh of apes that died of Ebola, presumably after eating fruit contaminated by bat feces or saliva. But where bats are in the diet  as they are in parts of Africa, Asia and the Pacific  no intermediary host is needed.

title: Virginia: Victim in Naval Base Shooting Is Identified
description: The Navy on Wednesday identified the sailor killed this week in a shooting at a Norfolk, Va., naval base as Petty Officer Second Class Mark A. Mayo, a member of the bases security force. Petty Officer Mayo, 24, of Hagerstown, Md., was killed Monday by a civilian who had disarmed a sailor during a struggle aboard a destroyer docked at Naval Station Norfolk, the worlds largest naval base. Petty Officer Mayo had put himself between the sailor and the civilian when he was fatally shot. Security personnel then killed the suspect, whose name has not been released.

title: The Value of a Life, Though Toxic and Tiny
description: DALLAS  I waited in the car outside of the school, knowing it was The Day, The Very Momentous Day. She appeared on the sidewalk, holding the box in both hands. Look what I have.

title: A Nation of Takers?
description: In the debate about poverty, critics argue that government assistance saps initiative and is unaffordable. After exploring the issue, I must concede that the critics have a point. Here are five public welfare programs that are wasteful and turning us into a nation of takers.

title: Jonathan Schell, 70, Author on War in Vietnam and Nuclear Age, Dies
description: Jonathan Schell, a best-selling nonfiction author whose books explored warfare in its myriad 20th-century incarnations, from a scathing indictment of United States policy in Vietnam to a sobering portrait of the world in the aftermath of a nuclear holocaust, died on Tuesday at his home in Brooklyn. He was 70.

title: Settlement Bars Misleading Health Claims by Tanning Salons in New York State
description: New Yorks attorney general, Eric T. Schneiderman, will announce a settlement on Thursday that bars Hollywood Tans NYC, an indoor tanning salon in Chelsea, from making misleading health claims, such as sunlight prevents skin cancer and the American Cancer Society doesnt want you to know the truth about tanning beds.

title: From Field to Video Room: How Baseballs Replay Review Will Work
description: The heart of Major League Baseballs new instant replay review system is a low-lit operations center, decorated in muted grays, at the Chelsea Market headquarters of MLB Advanced Media.

title: Deadly Mix of Loose Sediments and Heavy Rain in Washington
description: The flow of mud, boulders and trees that overran part of the community of Oso on Saturday was the most lethal slide in Washington in years, but the state is prone to the destructive events.

title: The Future of Virtual Reality
description: In a video for the Founders Fund, a venture capital firm, Palmer Luckey, a founder of Oculus VR, imagined the impact virtual reality could have beyond the world of gaming.

title: M.L.B. and Players Union Close In on Tougher Drug Penalties
description: DUNEDIN, Fla.  With less than a week to go before the baseball season begins in full, Major League Baseball and the players union are working toward an agreement that would again increase penalties for the use of performance-enhancing substances.

title: The Season of the Twitch
description: Some of you appear to be very, very worried about which party is going to win control of the Senate in November. Really, you should stop for a while. Take a break. No fretting about undecided voters until theres at least a minimal chance that the undecided voters know whos running.

title: Car Dealers Tilting at Tesla
description: Car dealers in New York, New Jersey and several other states are waging legal, legislative and regulatory campaigns to stop Tesla, the fast-growing electric-car company, from selling its vehicles directly to consumers. These moves are little more than attempts to protect an old retail model by limiting consumer choices.

title: Creator of a Virtual Reality Sensation
description: Palmer Luckey, a baby-faced 21-year-old college dropout, figured out how to build a virtual reality headset so exciting that it became a sensation on Kickstarter, the crowdfunding site, raising a staggering $2.4 million in 30 days.

title: Crowdfunders of the Maker of Oculus Rift Denounce a Facebook Buyout
description: SAN FRANCISCO  For many of Oculus VRs early backers, news that the virtual reality start-up was selling to Facebook for $2 billion was a little like watching Bob Dylan star in a Super Bowl Chrysler commercial.

title: U.S. Announces Further Exemptions for Insurance Enrollment Deadline
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration on Wednesday expanded the list of people who could sign up for health insurance after the deadline, announcing special enrollment periods for legal immigrants, victims of domestic violence and tens of thousands of people who experienced various problems trying to complete their applications for coverage.

title: Mr. McConnells Latest Mischief
description: Senator Mitch McConnell, the Kentucky Republican and minority leader, is up for re-election, and he is under pressure to show fealty to his states powerful coal interests. To that end, he introduced a resolution earlier this year to block a proposal by the Environmental Protection Agency that would set limits on greenhouse gas emissions from new power plants. As written, the proposal would effectively stop construction of most new coal-fired plants.

title: Indonesia Candidate Tied to Human Rights Abuses Stirs Unease
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Prabowo Subianto, a former special forces commander, kicked off his partys campaign for legislative elections with a rally last weekend that the local news media characterized as military style. He rode into a Jakarta stadium in a jeep to greet the party faithful, mounted a horse to circle the grounds and paraded before uniformed party cadres standing at attention.

title: Updated Warnings for Generic Drugs
description: Late last year, the Food and Drug Administration proposed sensible regulations that would authorize the makers of generic drugs to update safety labels independently, without waiting for F.D.A. approval, to warn of newly discovered risks. The change is strongly opposed by the makers of generics out of fear of being held liable for damages to patients harmed by their products. But the change is needed, both to give patients and doctors more timely warning of emerging risks and to enable patients to sue.

title: Evening news in pictures 26 March
description: Evening news in pictures 26 March

title: Giving Up on 4-Year-Olds
description: A new report released by the Department of Educations Office for Civil Rights, examining the disciplinary practices of the countrys 97,000 public schools, shows that excessively punitive policies are being used at every level of the public school system  even against 4-year-olds in preschool. This should shame the nation and force it to re-evaluate the destructive measures that schools are using against their most vulnerable children.

title: Military Cuts Render NATO Less Formidable as Deterrent to Russia
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama and European leaders pledged Wednesday to bolster the NATO alliance and vowed that Russia would not be allowed to run roughshod over its neighbors. But the military reality on the ground in Europe tells a different story.

title: German Man to Return Nazi-Looted Art
description: BERLIN  Cornelius Gurlitt, the octogenarian hoarder of art plundered by the Nazis, will return paintings in the trove his family kept secret for decades to their original Jewish owners or those owners descendants, starting with a well-known Matisse, his lawyers said on Wednesday.

title: Amid New Rules and Scrutiny, Secret Service Confronts Agents Conduct
description: WASHINGTON  In the days leading up to President Obamas trip to Europe, the director of the Secret Service, Julia A. Pierson, sat down with the agencys senior officials to reiterate a message she had focused on during her first year in the job.

title: Hanging Stockings, but Expecting Budget Coal
description: There is to state budget time in Albany a delightful sense of anticipation, like that of a child awaiting Christmas morn.

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, March 27, 2014
description: Russias leadership is challenging truths that only a few weeks ago seemed self-evident. That in the 21st century, the borders of Europe cannot be redrawn with force; that international law matters; and that people and nations can make their own decisions about their future.

title: A 25-Game Skid, but All Is Not Lost for the Sixers
description: SAN ANTONIO  The visitors locker room. Where was it? Brett Brown had been inside the AT&T Center hundreds of times over a dozen years as director of player development and assistant coach for the Spurs. But now Brown was head coach of the Philadelphia 76ers, walking an unfamiliar corridor. He had lost his way, not unlike his team, which had been adrift for two months.

title: Governor Wants to Keep Tax Increase, Setting Terms for Re-Election in Illinois
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill.  Gov. Pat Quinn of Illinois on Wednesday announced his plan to make permanent an unpopular temporary tax increase, stoking a debate that is becoming central to his bid for re-election.

title: Heckling From Egyptian Activists as Military Leader Declares Presidential Ambition
description: As my colleague David Kirkpatrick reports from Cairo, the defense minister who led last summers takeover of the elected government in Egypt, Abdul-Fattah el-Sisi, announced on Wednesday that he was resigning from the army and running for president.

title: Corrections: March 27, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Diving To Great Depths For a Pal
description: For a three-headed hellhound with menacing fangs and green-glowing eyes, Cerberus can be surprisingly accommodating.

title: A Literary Catfight, With Context by Cavett
description: Its a little odd playing yourself, Dick Cavett says, after doing so quite convincingly in the new play Hellman v. McCarthy, an Abingdon Theater Company production that opened on Wednesday at the June Havoc Theater. Mr. Cavett then jokes, The funny thing is I was the second choice for the role.

title: Back to the Beginning
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLES  There is a reason why I dont write Numberplay, the weekly math puzzle blog, but when the math concepts infiltrate my crossword puzzles, I am forced to bite the bullet and do the research. Its not like I remember these concepts from school. Fortunately, I really liked this puzzle by Jean OConor, rebuses and all, so it was well worth my time.

title: CBS Works to Minimize the Drama After a Dramatic Departure on The Good Wife
description: This post may contain spoilers.

title: European Banks Feel Effects of Crimea Crisis, With Austria Bearing Brunt
description: FRANKFURT  After the Cold War ended in the early 1990s, Viennese banks pushed aggressively into the newly open markets of Eastern Europe, as if rebuilding the old Hapsburg Empire one A.T.M. at a time.

title: Now on Track 30 for a 2-Hour Listening Tour, Metro-Norths New President
description: It is an archetype that seems as old as the hub itself: The aggrieved Grand Central Terminal commuter, muttering about the indignities of the rails to anyone who will listen.

title: U.C.L.A. Link Stays Intact Over Decades
description: LOS ANGELES  When Kyle Anderson was in middle school in New Jersey, he watched U.C.L.A.s basketball team, with players like Kevin Love and Russell Westbrook, who helped the Bruins reach the Final Four, catching his eye.

title: Environmental Poisoning of Iraq Is Claimed
description: WASHINGTON  An advocacy group representing American military veterans and Iraqi civilians arrived here on Wednesday armed with a message for the United States government: Washington must do something for the thousands of people suffering from what the group called the environmental poisoning of Iraq during the war.

title: Ex-Development Official to Direct Hurricane Sandy Recovery
description: A former development official who runs an organization that helps place women in blue-collar jobs will be named to lead New York Citys efforts to recover from Hurricane Sandy.

title: For Connecticut, New York Has Provided a Foundation
description: STORRS, Conn.  Four years ago, during one of the first practices of the season at Connecticut, Coach Geno Auriemma told the freshmen Bria Hartley, of Long Island, and Stefanie Dolson, of Port Jervis, that he hated players from New York.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for March 26, 2014
description: March 26, 2014

title: Bobcats Take Another Step Forward and Hand the Nets a Setback
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Its late March, and the Charlotte Bobcats still matter in the N.B.A. playoff picture. Who would have figured that from a team that set a record for the worst winning percentage in league history just two years ago?

title: The Americans Recap: Philip, the Platinum Spy
description: Theres something about Elizabeths nonspy character that complements her spy character. Shes calculated. That shes always prepared for violence shows in her expression and walk. Elizabeth is a taut puma (with great hair), ever ready to pounce. Philip is more of an affable house cat. Theres a lot less surface tension, so its sometimes a little hard to remember that on some level, he is a seriously cold bastard, and this weeks episode, The Deal, was all about reminding us of that.

title: Leaky Defense Leaves Knicks Spirits Sinking
description: SACRAMENTO  The Knicks have had a knack this season for putting up numbers. Bad numbers.

title: Oswald Morris, Artful Cinematographer, Is Dead at 98
description: Oswald Morris, a British cinematographer who helped redefine the color in Technicolor with filters, fog machines and makeshift devices like the brown silk stocking he stretched over a lens for the life-in-amber look of Fiddler on the Roof, died on March 17 at his home in Fontmell Magna, England. He was 98.

title: Overcoming Latest Adversity, Rangers Win a Possible Playoff Preview
description: As long as Ryan McDonagh, Henrik Lundqvist and the fourth line continue to work wonders in their respective roles, it almost does not matter what misfortune befalls the Rangers.

title: Zbigniew Romaszewski, Physicist Who Resisted Polands Communists, Dies at 74
description: In the anxious months after Polands Communist government declared martial law in December 1981, leaders of Solidarity, the workers movement that the government was seeking to silence, were forced into hiding. Even as they eluded arrest, they did not want to lose contact with the movements millions of supporters across the country.

title: A Victory for Athletes as University Employees
description: In a groundbreaking decision that acknowledges the special status of the college scholarship athlete, a regional director of the National Labor Relations Board confirmed Wednesday what many of us already know: Athletes running and jumping across our television screens are university employees.

title: In Astoria Arts District, a Once-Gritty Pocket Will Embody Culture
description: New York City neighborhoods can wax and wane in popularity like a boy band: hot one minute, not the next, and maybe hot again. On Friday, a once-gritty pocket of Astoria, Queens, where a steady stream of cultural and artistic institutions have sprung up over the years and ratcheted up the cool factor, will be designated an official artistic district by the city. The move will codify the cooland, it is hoped, keep the arts mavens and the businesses that cater to them flocking.

title: Back From Injury, Tampa Bays Stamkos Adjusts and Thrives
description: When the Tampa Bay Lightning star Steven Stamkos returned to the lineup March 6 after missing 45 games with a broken leg, it was as if his whirlwind season were only beginning.

title: LAFCO Goes Liquid
description: Feu de Bois. Marine. Moonglow Apricot. These and five more of the most popular LAFCO New York fragrances are now available in liquid hand soap, arguably a departure for the beauty brand with a cultlike following. The look is aligned with the rest of LAFCOs House & Home product line  its signature grosgrain ribbon has been silk-screened onto the bottles, which were designed to mimic the brands hand-blown diffusers  but the embrace of a liquid formula is a first for the house. Made with natural olive oil, the delicate stuff fits right in at the companys retail locations, which feel like stepping into an Italian farmacia. Paired with the new Reparative Hand Cream in the same scents, its a welcome addition to the most well-appointed bathrooms.

title: Chinas Shadow Banking Malaise
description: Peter Boone is chairman of the charity Effective Intervention and a research associate at the Center for Economic Performance at the London School of Economics. He is also a nonresident senior fellow at the Peterson Institute for International Economics. Simon Johnson is a professor at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and former chief economist at the International Monetary Fund.

title: The Workout: A Ref Keeps Up With March Madness
description: As the big college basketball tournaments get underway, many eyes will be on the players scrambling up and down the courts in pursuit of a national championship.

title: Word of the Day | besiege
description: besiege\bi-sej, be-\ verb

title: Population Growth in New York City Is Reversing Decades-Old Trend, Estimates Show
description: New York City may be an expensive place to live. Jobs are not easy to find, even as the city rebounds from the recession. And the public transit system is not always reliable or comfortable.

title: In Florida-U.C.L.A. Matchup, a Clash of Tempo
description: The U.C.L.A. mens team embraces an open-gym culture, playing fast and loose, with few rules. Sometimes the first pass is the last pass, and the pace contributes to U.C.L.A.s robust scoring average of 81.5 points a game.

title: Mets Face Outfield Decision: Eric Young or Juan Lagares?
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  At the Mets first full-team meeting of spring training, Eric Young Jr. was presented a shiny championship belt, the kind a wrestler might win, as a trophy for leading the National League in steals last season. His feat had been a bright spot for the Mets in a bad season. He tried the belt on, and the room erupted in cheers.

title: Whats on Thursday
description: 8 P.M. (Encore) UNFORGIVEN (1992) Clint Eastwood returned to the Old West for what has been, so far, his final time, to star in and direct this drama. He plays William Munny, a notorious gunslinger and outlaw who is dragged out of retirement to earn money from a bounty in Big Whiskey, Wyo., despite vowing that he would never kill again. Hes joined by his old riding partner Ned Logan (Morgan Freeman) and the Schofield Kid (Jaimz Woolvett). But Big Whiskeys sheriff, Little Bill Daggett (Gene Hackman), does not take kindly to bounty hunters. The center of attention, from the moment he rises up out of a hog pen until the darkest fade-out in western movie history, is Mr. Eastwood, Vincent Canby wrote in The New York Times. This is his richest, most satisfying performance since the underrated, politically lunatic Heartbreak Ridge. Theres no one like him. The film received four Academy Awards, including best picture and best director.

title: J.R. Smith, With Nine 3-Pointers, Keeps Knicks in Playoff Race
description: SACRAMENTO  One day removed from a blowout loss, the Knicks made their way to Sleep Train Arena on Wednesday night for a bit of therapy. That was the plan, anyway. The Kings, a woebegone outfit with zero plans for the postseason, looked to be more punchless than usual without their injured point guard, Isaiah Thomas.

title: Airline Buckles to Pressure From PETA on Monkey Cargo
description: After years of protests by animal rights crusaders, a Chinese airline has said it will no longer transport monkeys and other primates used for laboratory experiments.

title: Tribal Activist Candidate Poses a Problem for Aam Aadmi
description: NEW DELHI  In many ways, Soni Sori, a tribal rights activist from Chhattisgarh, is a natural fit with the Aam Aadmi Party, which recently named her as one of its three candidates for Parliament in the central Indian state.

title: Times Minute | A Legal Roundup
description: Today on the Minute, an analysis of the Abu Ghaith case, a major ruling for college football and rap lyrics used in court.
